title: Quiet in the chaos
text: Library Hotel is a lovely oasis in the midst of city life. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Our room was comfortable/clean and had everything we needed … including complimentary water. Second floor provides snacks and coffee/beverages at all hours. The rooftop bar served up nice cocktails and small bites in a pretty setting. And so many books!! Wonderful weekend … we will certainly return

title: Civilized Charm Next to GST
text:
The Library Hotel provided our best hotel experience in years. Super close to Grand Central Terminal, the location can't be beat for train travelers. We loved the decor and the actual few dozen books in our room (in the Social Sciences section). My travelling partner enjoyed one during a rainy spell. And morning coffee in the quiet lounge was perfect to allow solo puzzle time for me while letting my partner sleep in.  Thankfully, no Keurig!

We'll definitely stay here again.  While it suited our preferences to a "T," the small rooms (very European sized, but more functional) are an acquired taste.  And it's not cheap.

title: Roomy & amenity rich stay in Manhattan
text: We had a wonderful experience at the library hotel. The Junior suite with the pull out sofa was perfect for our family of 3. The room is a great size, especially for NYC. The mini-fridge and second floor lounge with coffee, tea, water, and snacks was also so nice to have — as well as all of the books. Loved having a few live plants in the room, that makes it feel so much more homey. The view from the lounge & our room looking down library way towards the NYPL was amazing. It’s a great location — walking distance to many attractions & the theater district, as well as close to grand central station and Bryant Park subway stop that can get you to most other destinations. We also enjoyed the rooftop bar & terrace! The service was excellent there as well as at Madison & Vine the downstairs restaurant. We will definitely stay here again in return trips to NYC!

title: Nice hotel in New York City center
text: Nice attention to detail. Great staff. The facilities were neat and in good condition. The room was OK. There were snacks and coffee available 24 hours. It also has a rooftop bar and a restaurant called Madison & Vine with nice food and good service

title: Had high hopes that didn't play out
text:
1) No signage outside the hotel / Scaffolds blocking the front - taxi driver could not find hotel name or address. Staff member had to come out to find us 1/2 way down the block. 
2) No doorman, no one to assist us with luggage. 
3) In room thermostat did not function correctly.

title: NYC trip
text:
Very happy with the our 5 night stay at the Library Hotel. It was a relaxing and quiet oasis in the midst of NYC madness. We had a king room on the 9th floor and the traffic noise was bearable overnight. The windows could use proper curtains as the light comes round the edges on the blinds but in March this wasn’t a problem for us. The Bookmark lounge was a nice space to relax in and the coffee was great. The snacks were ok but not much variety. Protein bars and fruit were the only choices but you could buy out and bring bagels back in as some people did. 
The proximity to all the sights of the city was key. We could pop out for a walk or for dinner and we used the buses to travel any further. Central Park is a good 30 minute walk away but 5 minutes takes you to Grand Central Station (Shakeshack burgers are awesome here) so plenty of choices to walk or not to.
The only downside was the price of drinks in the rooftop bar. We like a glass of wine after dinner but ( as everywhere in NYC) the cost is astronomical so we never used the bar and it’s such a shame as it looked beautiful. 
Overall we would definitely recommend the Library and the staff were really nice and helpful.

title: A literary gem in the heart of Manhatten..
text: A little gem in a great location with lots of literary charm.. No fancy lobby but charming reading room, clean and ample sleeping rooms and lovely service.. And on top of all of that, competitive pricing.  I plan to make this my hotel of first choice when in Manhatten.  MSL

title: Best Hotel in NYC!! Worth the $!
text:
We literally just created a TripAdvisor account in order to write this 5-star review. We got married in NYC ten years ago, and stayed at The Library Hotel for our "book-themed" wedding. We recently returned for our ten year anniversary and had the most magical stay over the course of four days. The space is SO beautiful, the staff is SO friendly, and they really go above and beyond to make sure that you are well taken care of. Location could not be more ideal.

We especially want to shout out Justin Scimeme, who helped us organize some family photos and went the extra mile to make this anniversary trip extra special for us.

Yes, the price is higher than you would normally pay for a hotel room if you're just a "regular person" like the two of us are, but we cannot overemphasize how much it is HASHTAG WORTH IT.  See you again in five more years and long may this hotel reign!

title: Cute theme hotel, great location
text: This hotel is small and charming. Desk staff were very friendly and helpful and I love the way the hotel is organized by the Dewey Decimal system. Room was comfortable, only complaint is that the window is covered by blinds that don't fully cover the window and don't close very tightly, so the room was always too bright at night. I think all hotel rooms should have blackout curtains, especially in the middle of a city full of lights. Other than that I enjoyed my stay and would probably stay there again (with a sleep mask) because it's really close to main train and subway lines and walking distance to a lot of things I enjoy.

title: Superb stay!
text: We have long wanted to try a stay at the NY Library Hotel and it didn’t disappoint. From the minute we arrived to the minute we departed we were treated with unfailing friendliness and courtesy. We were there to celebrate a 70th birthday and the staff ensured it was noted. Two other couples joined us, both vowed they would only stay at the Library Hotel on subsequent visits to NY, as did we. Everyone was impressed. The Reading Room is a plus, and of course being around all the books is unique in a hotel. All in all a wonderful stay. No complaints whatsoever! The location is also a big plus. One tip: a lower floor seems preferable so as to not have to take the elevator so much.

title: My new hotel for NY trips
text: This hotel was a great find.  Excellent location, five star service and cute decoration that not only book lovers will enjoy.  The second floor lounge is wonderful, with coffee, snacks and beverages available 24 hs. I will definitely stay here next time I go to NY

title: Cozy Academia Heaven
text: Great midtown location without the midtown chaos. Loved the proximity to both the NYPL and the Morgan, great for research as well as relaxation. Loved the common area full of books and snacks where we could silently commune with other book lovers - like a bar but with books instead of booze. And when we did want something stronger, the rooftop bar was a delight. From the restaurant to the lobby to the bar, the service was friendly and efficient. Our room was very comfortable, good layout and well appointed. Can't wait to come back!

title: Will stay there again
text: Nice staff, pleasant reading room with coffee and fruit, nice rooftop bar, great location. We enjoyed the books theme, and all the books everywhere. Do kids know what the Dewey Decimal system is? Take them with you to the Library Hotel and they will!

title: Library theme is cosy and fun
text: A lovely boutique hotel.  Floors and rooms are themed which i love.  Free gently used books were offered at concierge.  second floor has complimentary snacks and non alcoholic drinks! Maison and vine restaurant attached but a bit pricey.   great central location love this hotel will return

title: Perfect midtown stay.
text: I loved the midtown location of this small, comfy hotel. Close to the Library, Grand Central Station. Walkable to MOMA and transit to everywhere. The room was compact but well thought through. Good lighting. Excellent daily cleaning. Staff were friendly and responsive. Lounge was bright and spacious. Rooftop bar is buzzy. Enjoyed breakfast daily in main floor Madison and Vine. Will definitely return.

title: Room for improvement
text:
We booked The Library for a very special joint birthday week and after reading many favourable reviews on TripAdvisor and elsewhere. Overall, our stay was pleasant but there is definitely room for improvement - especially at this price point. 

Unfortunately like so many buildings in New York, The Library is covered in scaffolding, so it’s not possible to see how truly beautiful it is. But its location in midtown New York and  right next to Grand Central Station is pretty much perfect, and well served by subway connections. 

After around 18 hours of Transatlantic travel, check in was efficient if not overly welcoming. Weary after our travels, it would have been nice to have been offered assistance with our cases to our 7th floor room, but we were left to our own devices without so much as an offer of help, as we were when three of us checked out with two cases each.

Our bedroom was pleasant enough with plenty of space for storage and a comfortable bed, but the bathroom was extremely small, in need of updating, with a rather sad shower over a very shallow bathtub. Strangely, taking up even more space in a small bathroom, was a tired, rusty and completely unnecessary stool. 

The second floor Reading Room was useful to grab a coffee and a snack, but otherwise, completely underutilised. We’ve read in earlier reviews that this used to be used for breakfast and for a nightly happy hour - neither of which are part of the current offer. Every mention of these on TripAdvisor has been countered by hotel management for reasons around post-COVID business remodelling, and that they were no longer sustainable. At the prices the hotel charges, I am somewhat doubtful that these excuses still hold water. Even a nominal charge to cover either would make for a much improved experience. Certainly, the current meagre offerings hardly justify a $25 daily “Resort Fee”.

Sure, breakfast is available at the hotel’s neighbouring restaurant, but for around $33 for an orange juice that wasn’t fresh, a cup of tea that wouldn’t fill half of my tea mug at home and some berries and granola, this hardly represents good value for money. As a result, we chose better and cheaper local options every day.

Conversely, the rooftop bar was a pleasant space to spend a couple of hours, and the staff were friendly and helpful. 

So, sadly, I doubt we’ll return. There are other options available in similar price bands which offer much, much more in terms of welcome, facilities and overall hospitality. Never at The Library did we feel like welcome guests (paying a considerable amount of money for our stay).

I imagine this review will be met with the typical responses by the hotel management, rather than seeing it as constructive criticism and a genuine opportunity to improve.

title: Covered all Chapters
text: Best stay in NYC ever!  I have tried a couple different hotels in NYC and stumbled across the Library Hotel in my search. It doesn't help that I am a Librarian, thus added to the need to stay. I was thrilled with the location and how close it was to Grand Central Station and the Coach USA bus stop. Which allows fast travel to airports. Check in was fast and friendly and the front desk staff answered my questions easily. My room was very comfortable and it was perfect to curl up in after a long day. Bookends bar upstairs was the perfect spot to hide in a nook and enjoy a break. And Maison and Vine was a great place to start the day. I really couldn't have asked for a better hotel to stay at. Will definitely make it my go to spot when in town.

title: Great stay!
text: Everyone at the Library Hotel was very friendly and helpful.  The hotel was clean, comfortable, and in a great location for us.  We enjoyed the lovely Reading Room for coffee, tea, and snacks, and the Bookmark Lounge rooftop bar for drinks and cheeseboard with a pretty view.

title: Great location for a New York visit
text: Comfortable, low key, excellent staff and well located. Enjoyed the lounge with its beverages and snacks.  The adjacent Madison and Vine restaurant was superb.  Definitely would stay again.  One slight negative.. low water pressure in the shower.

title: Birthday Visit
text:
The library hotel was simply superb, we booked the trip for our joint birthday’s and we were not disappointed from start to finish.
The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the room, view, location, hotel restaurant and bar excellent.
The location is perfect for attractions within walking distance to Grand Central for venturing further afield, we could not fault the hotel and would recommend to anyone wishing to stay in New York, simply superb and we can’t wait to return some time in the future with the Library being our hotel of choice!
Thank you.

title: Relaxing and special hotel!
text:
What a wonderful and unique hotel! We loved the different themed rooms. The second-floor "Reading Room" is comfy and full of various coffees, drinks, snacks, and fruit. It's all a very nice touch.
The location was terrific and we would definitely stay there again!!

title: A Mid-Town Gem
text: The room was New York small but very clean, modern and well-appointed.  The front desk staff was efficient, helpful and friendly.  I appreciated the seating areas in the lobby, dedicated coffee spot on the second floor and the 14th floor bar and lounge with great seating areas for our group of 10.  With a central mid-town location Library Hotel was a great find.

title: This terrific hotel has lost a lot of service after the pandemic.
text:
This location is unbeatable, but I am disappointed that after the pandemic so many good features have been eliminated. I enjoyed for years the evening wine hour and the morning continental breakfast on the second floor,  and I find it interesting that the resort fee was added when these services were eliminated. Also this last recent trip I realized that there is no longer a turn-down service with a chocolate on the pillow and the weather forrcast for the next day.

I must add that there still are coffee, tea, and soft drinks and fruit on the second floor library room.

title: Such an oasis of chill vibe in the middle of NYC.
text:
What a gem of a eclectic hotel in the middle of it all. I shared the library theme with my wife and daughters knowing that they would love this place. 

The staff was very friendly.

The 14th floor rooftop bar/dining was very enjoyable.

Absolutely know where to stay next time I am Manhattan!

title: Manhattan Gem
text: Loved this hotel! Clean and comfortable, feels newly renovated and like a modern luxury accommodation. Great little touches all over the hotel, like snacks and drinks for free on the 2nd floor. Location is great in a less busy part of midtown - easy access to theaters and upper and lower east side. We can't wait to return and stay in a different room to explore more books!

title: a noteworthy stay in midtown Manhattan
text: We had a delightful stay at Library Hotel. Comfortable and personalized accommodations, friendly staff, fun atmosphere, nice little complementary perks that make this hotel stand out from the cookie cutter hotels that nickel and dime you. We have recommended it to at least 5 other couples and truly hope to stay here again. Also, great location - close to Bryant Park and super yummy bagels. Thank you Library Hotel team!!

title: Excellent. Exactly what I hoped it would be.
text: The hotel is beautifully appointed, the selection of books (what I went for) is excellent. If you do have a preference of genre, I recommend calling the hotel for your reservation, so you can get what you want. The bar is lovely even in the winter with its (fake) fire. And if you’re a guest and order two drinks, you get a lovely cheese platter. I am looking forward to returning.

title: Good not great hotel - amazing location
text:
We stayed at the Library Hotel 18 years ago pre kids, and were super excited to take our children when we went back. We got a great rate booking direct for two rooms and they made sure we were side by side (was a little bit disappointed not to be upgraded to co-joined rooms as we were staying for 10 nights). The good things - the location is amazing, the staff lovely and the rooms are quiet and a good size by NY standards. The hotel is looking a bit dated and tired, and the beds were not great. Bathrooms are OK - most newer hotels ditch the silly shower over bath arrangement now though. No exhaust fan (a gripe for most USA hotels - bizarre, must ruin their bathrooms). The library rooms and the small selection of included snacks and drinks was lovely. There is a restaurant on site but only average - we usually walked up to Jo and the Juice for a better option. They were good about accepting some small packages (had another hotel charge me to do so - what the actual?). Rooms were too warm - and staff advised only option to cool them was to turn off aircon all together (and open a window which we did).

Some extra NY tips - make sure you get the 7 day subway pass not just a 10 trip one (live and learn, not easy to navigate purchasing options on machines and not many staff to help - I travel a lot and use public transport a lot, NY could improve this). We used the free NY greeter service - lovely older lady showed us around for about 5 hours - great service for getting comfortable with directions on the first day (we just paid for her lunch). Winners for our teenagers were: natural history museum, Harry Potter on Broadway, eating at lots of cool restaurants, the Library and the High Line walk. They were not so keen on Guggenheim.

NY is still my favourite place to visit :)

title: Favorite hotel in America
text: Excellent service and spaces! The Reading Room is especially beneficial as a perfect place to think, read, and write. Perfectly located within walking distance of all the spots we needed to be in midtown.

title: Another lovely stay at The Library
text:
My wife and I have now been here twice, and we’re definitely going back later this year for our third time.

Manhattan hotels can be a mixed bag, frequently big on promises and non-existent on delivery, though The Library delivers. I’m writing this from the 2nd room library, enjoying some coffee and a snack whilst admiring the amalgamation of various midtown architecture, in a quiet reprieve. We asked this time for a higher room, and they gave us the highest non-penthouse floor (12). We also enjoyed the 14th floor Bookmarks bar for late night drinks, also taking advantage of the free cheese board for guests which was a nice touch. The staff here is quite friendly, also not the norm for the city after my several years of coming up here. Connected to Madison and Vine, you can also get nice drinks there most of the day. It’s a short 10-15 minute walk from the heart of Times Square, 20 mins from the Theatre District, and also close to Zucker’s on Lex which is always a staple for us insofar as a bagel breakfast is concerned. If I had to pick some negligible thing I wish were rectified, and this isn’t major, it’s that their agreement with a local gym (as the hotel doesn’t have one), is always closed on Sunday which is a bummer, particularly for weekend guests. The agreement is apparently for only one Blink fitness as alas, the other one we called didn’t have an agreement. Again, not a major problem of course, though working off some of the tasty city food would have been a pleasant option, particularly as there is a $25 resort fee per night to my knowledge. 

All that to say, we thoroughly enjoyed the property as usual, and as people who are loyal, repeat customers to establishments we prefer, we’ll likely be back in the late fall/early winter for our third time.

title: Book a Book Room
text: This is small uniquely themed hotel where each floor is a different book category and each room is a specific subject.  We stayed on the “Arts Floor” a/k/a 7th floor in the “Music Room.”  The walls of the lobby, halls and individual rooms have bookshelves filled with books.  The rooms are perfectly fine and the staff (“librarians”) are very  pleasant and helpful.  The location is ideal:  one block from the beautiful New York Public Library and easy to get to places on both the east or west side.  Recognizing this is New York, the price is very good.  So go to your favorite hotel circulation desk and check this one out.

title: Fantastic Experience
text: After looking at at least 15 hotels, we landed on The Library Hotel. The reviews from others sold me, tbh! The location is perfect. The beds and pillows are so comfortable and honestly, the room and bathroom is extremely spacious for NYC! We will definitely book The Library Hotel again. If I HAD to give a negative review on something it would be the bathroom shower curtain is too flimsy and blew into the shower making it difficult to shower and the bathroom sink didn’t drain properly. That is literally the only two {negative} comments I have. The second floor coffee with different milk options was a HUGE perk and the espresso machine, too. This is a great hotel. Period.

title: Perfect service and location.
text: From the moment we arrived, the service was top notch - helped us with luggage as soon as they saw us pull in; very welcoming and accommodating. The coffee and snacks made available to guests 24/7 was a nice touch. The location is perfect for exploring Manhattan - you are a short walk from Times Square, a little longer to Central Park. Rooms were very spacious, comfortable, and clean.

title: Perfect romantic getaway!
text: Such a unique and fantastic hotel to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary! The staff was great and the location is perfect. The 2nd story reading room with latte maker was a welcoming place to enjoy time. The rooftop bar was a relaxing and expansive. Great stay!

title: Terrific experience!
text: Love the location and the staff! It rained during our stay and staff was always happy to hand out umbrellas. Very accommodating with good advice on making reservations at Madison & Vine as well as Bookmarks, the fabulous roof top bar.

title: Excellent accommodations!
text: We really enjoyed our visit to the Library hotel. It was quiet and located in a great location near Bryant Park. The hotel was very clean, spacious, quiet, and felt like home. I look forward to our next visit and we would like to try one of their other properties too!

title: Holiday Bliss
text: Perfect midtown location. Quiet place to sleep. Clean room. The Jr Suite well appointed with eight windows. Friendly & professional staff.  The upstairs bar was cozy with a great bar staff. Check in & check out easy. Holiday Bliss.

title: Perfect midtown location, a small oasis of calm
text: The Library Hotel is a perfectly located boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan, easy walk to Broadway theaters, museums, Bryant park, Rockefeller Center, and its namesake, the main branch of the New York Public Library.  Also super close to Grand Central Station and other subway locations. I'm a repeat visitor to this hotel; 2nd stay with my children and grandchildren during the Xmas season. Comfortable, inviting rooms. All by the way stocked with books - my room's theme was architecture.  We all make good use of the lounge and the small attached restaurant. The lounge is tastefully furnished, light and airy, generously stocked with snacks and beverages, and of course with good books.This is a great hotel for people who prefer a small hotel, small scale, but big on welcome and hospitality.

title: lovely boutique hotel
text: Lovely boutique hotel near Grand Central Station. Wonderful staff. Excellent service. Charming second floor lounge and super cool roof top bar. Perfect for New Year’s Eve in Time Square or any time of year!

title: Meh experience for the price and the reviews
text:
I am giving this hotel a 3 rating, which is the average between my wife's 2.5 and my 3.5. I decided to book this hotel for end of year because of its great location and raving Tripadvisor reviews. We travel to NYC often, so we know what to expect from hotels in the city. We were not impressed by the Library Hotel and won't be going back.

There are positives for the hotel though, the first one being the aforementioned location. If you visit New York during holidays, you want to be in Midtown, close to where it all happens, but not in the middle of it (although we have stayed close to Times Square in some occasions). The area around Bryant Park, which is lovely during holidays, is our favorite.

The hotel also has a beautiful library theme, which goes well with its location in Library Way, just a few steps from the NYC Library. Every room has a topic and books that go with it. Plus, there is a great common room with lots of books, coffee and refreshments 24/7.  This is by far the highlight of the hotel, which also has a reasonable rooftop bar (which I am sure is more charming in the summertime).

So far so good, so, what did we miss?

First off, we missed the quality of service we would expect for a hotel where we paid over $500 a night. The service was so non-existent that they didn't even help us in with our luggage when they saw we were struggling with our suitcases as we were coming back from a long international flight. They didn't help us on our way out either. Overall, it felt like the service was minimal and very impersonal.

Secondly, the rooms, and the hotel as a whole, are pretty dated. Everything, from the bathroom installations to the TV or the elevators are what you would expect from a decades old hotel that has not been renovated at all. But, it is not that charming-old that we have seen in other hotels in NY. It is just plain old. I get that the library theme goes well with "old", but this is a bit of a stretch.

Again, not a horrible experience, but you can definitely do better for that price range in the city by either going to a more modern hotel or a classic but charming one.

title: Hidden Bibliophiles dream hotel! Best hotel in NYC!
text:
This was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in NYC. The rooms are incredible. I chose the Museum book room on the tenth floor. It was filled with such a variety of books. The bed was so comfortable and they have a great housekeeping staff. 
I loved that they have a 24 reading room full of snacks, fruits and drinks for you. After a long day of walking and sightseeing, it was nice to stop in and relax and grab a book.
Most everything was a 15-20 min walk tops so you are central to just about everything. 
As for the front desk, they were so kind and treated you like you were the only one in the hotel. Ever so accommodating and even got me a taxi and walked my luggage out on the day of departure. This is a bibliophiles dream.
I don’t think I will ever stay anywhere else again when I visit NYC. Thank you to this wonderful hotel for a magnificent stay during the holidays!

title: No longer the Library Hotel we fell in love with
text: We fell in love with the Library Hotel about 7 years ago and were eager to share this hidden gem with friends that would travel with us over the years.  We come to NY for an extended holiday weekend every year, same week, same agenda.  I understand much will never be the same after COVID; however the hotel has changed and not for the good.  Most to note is the cleanliness.  The hotel used to be one of the cleanest we've stayed at in NY but it is no longer.  Old tattered carpet, that wasn't vacuumed and is past the prime of shampooing, unknown mess on the lampshades  the bathroom needs a DEEP clean, remove the old leather bathroom stool--it's filthy and unsanitary, the mirror that comes out the wall is disgusting. the carpet is coming up along the wall.  The bedsheets were clean but had stains--we went out and bought some new ones so we would be comfortable.  Sigh.  The front desk staff are kind.  We're currently planning our annual trip to NY for 24 and sadly, we have to move on from our beloved Library Hotel.

title: It's a Winner!
text: The Library Hotel is my "go to" in NYC. Staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. The rooms are book-themed and comfortable. The 24/7 "lounge" is great - coffee/tea/seltzers and snacks available all the time. Just what you need! The location is perfect for us - a stone's throw from Grand Central and a quick walk to Broadway shows.  Why go anywhere else?

title: its not what it used to be
text:
we have stayed at this hotel 9 times since 2011. gone is the fabulous 2nd floor that provided a  complimentary choice of breakfasts with rolls, danish, selections of cheeses etc. Gone is the complimentary 4-6 daily happy hour where choices of proseco, white wine, small apps were provided by servers. The 2nd floor was always packed, now a ghost town. Housekeeping repeatedly failed to replenish soap, shampoo, and our room had one bathrobe and one pair of slippers. Having been married for 45 years, i graciously let me wife use them. The 14th floor was constantly booked with outside parties with no consideration for allowing guests to use this wonderful venue until after 10:00 or 10:30, and then sharing it with 80 or 90 people who had been drinking for 6 hours. There was no doorman as in the past and the concierge staff left much to be desired. The second floor now has bags of nuts and packaged protein bars that taste like tree bark. The library Hotel is a good mid-town location, but there are several like hotels with that same location that offer far more reasonable rates with much better amenities. Adois, its been nice.
.

title: Excellent Walkable Location
text:
Excellent location. Easy walk to Bryant Park, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center & Macy's. 

Staff was friendly & accommodating. 

Second floor amenities were a nice bonus. Free Coffee, Tea & Snacks.

title: The expectation was greater than the reality. The hotel is older than the photos on the website show
text: When booking, the message was a lot of receptivity and care to make the stay experience as pleasant as possible. We mentioned that the only need would be Late Checkout, including paid, if necessary. The need was not met.

title: Great experience
text: Great experience which made us feel like we were going back in time. It is an old hotel with lots of character. The rooms are small with little space for lots of luggage and the bathroom was small but again we loved the experience. The staff were extremely helpful and communicative before and during our stay. The rooftop bar has a great vibe and view.  We stayed here for 2 days so we could attend the thanksgiving day parade - which did not disappoint. Highly recommended hotel in great location.

title: Rooms OK,  but not was it was
text:
OK, but no breakfast in the lounge any longer, no doorman to hail cabs, and for the second time on a visit no access to the bar as it’s booked out for a private party. 
So what exactly is the “ Resort Fee” for? Most of the discretionary services appear to have disappeared post-Covid.

title: Perfect place for a short break in New York
text: Great location in midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of so many brilliant attractions, but also easy access to public transport; friendly staff, really prompt response to broken light; room was clean and comfortable. Would definitely go back.

title: Location great/bring back amenities
text: We’ve stayed at the Library a number of times. It’s a great location to everything Midtown and Central Park. We were disappointed that the complimentary breakfast along with the wine and cheese evening event have been discontinued.  Snacks and drinks are provided on the 2nd floor lounge but it’s not the same.  The hotel is starting to show some signs of wear and a refresh would be a positive step.

title: Great hotel in a fantastic location
text:
We stayed for a week at the Library hotel in November celebrating our Wedding Anniversary. After going round in circles with much searching for the ideal room/location/cost combination we finally landed on booking a Junior Suite at the Library Hotel. And what a fantastic decision it turned out to be. 

The Junior Suites must have some of the best views of any hotel we have stayed at. I mean, how many rooms anywhere have triple aspects each with great views. The room itself was a great size, particularly for Manhattan. The room clean and bed very comfortable.  The use of the library room and great coffee on the 2nd floor also a great addition. 

Location wise you can’t beat it if you want to be in midtown. Minutes from Grand Central and Bryant Park. 

Can’t recommend enough.

title: Wonderful in so many ways !
text: A lovely warm reception and had acted on my email request. The room was perfect size and lovely themed. The bed was very comfy and all the fixtures and fittings were lovely. I particularly liked the residents club lounge which felt very exclusive. The 14 th floor bar and sitting area was nicely set out and with a nice outdoor space. I don't normally bother with reviews, but this hotel deserves praise. A quiet gem in the heart of the city.

title: The Library, a Small Boutique Hotel with a Big Heart
text: Safe, comfortable, convenient location, exceptional service, personable (actual human beings on site answer the phone), unique flavor with a library theme, great amenities, a VERY civilized checkout time of 1pm ( you can spend your morning doing New York things rather than rushing to make a  typical 11am checkout), great terrace bar at the top floor, superb restaurant on the first floor that also caters to room service, a lovely second floor lounge complete with free books, snacks, drinks, a view and a grand piano available 24/7. You have a choice of room sizes, including the lovely junior suite…all comfortable and beautifully appointed.  Because this is a small boutique hotel the staff has the time to see to each guest’s needs in a friendly and timely manner. And speaking of the staff, they are the best I have ever encountered…anywhere!  I stay here on the average of three times a year, solo or with friends and have recommended it to anyone I know who is visiting NYC. Book a stay and see for yourself.  I won’t stay anywhere else!

title: Favorite Place to Stay in NYC
text: The Library is a slice of heaven.  The rooms are great.  The food is tasty.  The staff is helpful.  The location is convenient.  We even had our son sleep on a pullout that was comfortable.  Book it for yourself!

title: Home from home
text: Lovely hotel with great staff and the perfect location. The bottles of water left in our fridge every day were much appreciated after a long day walking around.  Coffee, tea etc available 24 hours as part of the deal, along with healthy snacks and fruit. We are already looking into returning next year.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: My friend booked us here for six nights and I loved the hotel. Very clean,super service , quiet close to everything. Taxis are easily available. Madison and vine and the bookend bar are attached to the hotel with great food and vibes. The lounge is fantastic. There’s tea, coffee and soft drinks available 24 hours fruit and some snacks. Nice thing is you can bring your food eat it every thing is cleaned up. Better than having to make your own tea and coffee.. would also like to add the ladies at the reception were esp nice Julia and can’t recall the names as were most  the men again can’t recall the names. Will call a cab help with luggage. The manager and the concierges too.

title: One of my favorites in NYC
text: Just as everyone else here has said - a beautiful, charming and quiet little hotel. My daughter and I try to stay at a different hotel each time we’re in NYC and I would say this has been one of our all time favorites (she’s a Literature and Library Science major so you can imagine how thrilled she was). It’s got way more character than any of the larger chains but still has everything you need. I’ll re-emphasize what’s already been said because it’s true. Staff is very helpful and super friendly. Shower was nice and hot with strong pressure. Rooftop bar was chill and relaxing with free cheese board. Lounge was perfect for caffeine, drinks and snacks. Elevator was a bit rickety for my liking but it’s expected. Only wish there were a few more outlets or USB ports to charge (despite the library theme, we are in a modern age that requires charging!). Overall love the calm vibe and also the perfect location. You’re one block away from Bryant Park and the NYPL (which has an amazing exhibit you should go see). Winter market was happening so tons of food and shopping in less than 5 min. Absolutely loved our stay.

title: cozy property at great location
text: This is a lovey property at great location, very cozy with many books to read... The 2nd floor lounge for coffee / tea & fruits & sneak worked out great for big coffee/ tea drinkers like us.  the staffs are attentive & welcoming.  the hotel is very cozy and full of books one can grab and room.  the room size is on the smaller side but the lounge was quiet and cozy so it worked out fine.

title: Love this hotel
text: Love this hotel. Beautiful old building but with modern amenities. Gorgeous room, comfortable bed. Pressure in the shower was perfect and the water was nice and hot. Staff is warm and helpful. Enjoyed dinner at the adjoining restaurant - especially the crispy Brussel sprouts. Love the coffee / water / fruit / snacks area open 24/7. My only regret is that I didn't visit the rooftop bar - I'll be sure to do that on my next visit.

title: My Favorite Hotel
text: The Library Hotel is charming.  The staff is welcoming and helpful and our rooms were immaculate and well appointed.  There is a concierge floor open to all guests and a roof top bar and lounge,  I will definitely stay there, again.

title: So Much To LOVE!
text:
Oh, how I love the Library Hotel! There are so many reasons:
*relaxed vibe with super nice people who work there
* books everywhere!
* very clean
* quiet
* elevator
* super beautiful lounge area with terrific snacks and coffee, plus fresh fruit and fresh flowers -- just fabulous!
* excellent location right near everything including Grand Central, the NYPL and Broadway shows
Oh, how I love this hotel!

title: Very pleasant stay...
text: The room had everything I needed: bathrobes, a safe, a small refrigerator filled with several bottles of water, a built-in desk, and crisp high-end sheets. Staff helpful and eager.  No room service, alas, but Madison and Vine, the connecting bistro served an excellent breakfast.  If I had any wishes, very minor really, it would be for the somewhat dim bedside lights to be brighter, and for the bathroom mirror to be lit from the sides as opposed to the top.  Very pleasant stay!

title: The Balcony
text: Amazing location!   2nd floor library lounge was fantastic!  Restaurant on 1st floor (Madison and vine) was excellent, love the truffle fries.  The Balcony made it feel like we were a part of, not just visitors to, the amazing city that is New York!

title: A quiet oasis in Midtown Manhattan
text: This hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan. Perfect for all the main attractions, Broadway theatres and shops. Our Queen room was very clean and more spacious than we expected. The Reading Room is well equipped with a coffee machine that also provides hot water for tea. Soft drinks are available in a fridge and there were bottles of water. Bananas, Satsuma oranges, apples and some health bars were also provided. We did not use the roof top bar or the restaurant, although these looked very nice.

title: Great boutique hotel, the library concept is a creative way to differentiate
text:
Very nice room, spotlessly clean and comfortable.  My particular room was law themed, and looked up and down Madison Ave. out of the windows.  

Second floor common area reading room is a nice touch.

I did use the attached Madison and Vine restaurant for breakfast, and lunch in one instance, and was quite pleased with the menu and service.

title: Wonderful staff and location
text: We are repeat customers of The Library Hotel and always look forward to the gracious and welcoming staff, the perfect location and fun literary theme.  Normally we would give our stay a 5 star rating but this time we found the mattress in our room less than satisfactory. It was sagging in the middle and very unsupportive.  Since we stayed only one night this time it was too late to switch rooms. I did mention it to one of the hotel receptionists and was told it would be shared with a manager. While it was a less expensive, smaller room we didn't expect the bed to be any less comfortable than the others we've experienced at the Library Hotel in the past.

title: Lovely boutique hotel, perfect Midtown location
text:
Library Hotel is conveniently located between Bryant Park and Grand Central Station (both are just a few minutes walk away), and thus close to two subway stations as well as two of the three Coach USA bus stations connecting Manhattan with Newark Airport. It‘s a long, narrow historic building with a total of 13 stories, and a beautiful facade with art deco elements. Despite the great location in Midtown, the hotel was conveniently quiet - we stayed on the 12th floor, lower floor levels might be more impacted by traffic noise. 

The hotel is themed around books and libraries, also the hotel rooms (ours contained books on Asian religions). On the 1st floor, the reception is on the right and the restaurant on the left. On the 2nd floor, a lovely reading room can be used as guest lobby. Coffee, tea, soft drinks, granola bars and fresh fruit are available free of charge 24/7, which is a very nice touch. On the top floor (which is actually the 13th floor yet labeled as 14th floor as 13 is an unlucky number), a rooftop bar provides stunning views of the nearby buildings - drinks are served from 4pm, but the rooftop terrace is accessible 24/7. 

Our deluxe room was on the 12th floor and came with a comfy queen-sized bed, an en-suite bathroom with a bathtub that also served as a shower, toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion) in small bottles (that were refilled daily), and bathrobes. The window could be opened, which we appreciated, but the room also had an A/C. Despite the window, the room was rather dark, which we did not mind at all. 

Apart from the convenient location, we liked the reading room and rooftop bar most. The hotel has many nice little touches, staff was very friendly, and our room well kept.

title: Fabulous hotel that’s just a bit different
text:
We loved our 9 night stay at The Library Hotel. Our corner  room (4.006) was spacious by NYC standards and had a fantastic view right across E41st Street to the Public Library on 5th Avenue. 
The Reading Room on level 2 was a wonderful bonus for all hotel guests offering free tea, coffee, soft drinks and snacks and a place to sit and read. We had a late flight out and loved that we were able to use The Reading Room for the rest of the day post check out. 
Great location. Their inhouse restaurant Madison and Vine and 14th floor rooftop bar were great. Every single staff member we interacted with was lovely and helpful. 
Definitely recommend

title: jewel in the midst of ho-hum hotels in Manhatten
text: Such a charming place, with a richly appointed lounge for guests and a really nice place on the top floors with a c=bar where you can schmooze with friends.  Rooms are very comfortable with nice amenities, staff very fun and supportive.

title: Beautiful property near Bryant Park
text: This beautiful property near Bryant Park is close to shops and Broadway but feels secluded away from Times Square.  Lovely, comfortable, book-themed rooms with a rooftop bar and a guest lounge with snacks made for a convenient and comfortable stay.

title: Great location
text: A comfortable room - if on the small side. Very comfortable bed. Great location, nice staff and a very welcome guest lounge providing 24 hour hot drinks and snacks. We did have some issues ( the hotel didn’t ask for any feedback on checkout nor since except for this link to TA). The bathroom handbasin was badly cracked and the door to the bathroom very difficult to open and close properly. Plus the carpet was stained and there was hardly anywhere to place a suitcase. The restaurant serves nice food, but don’t go there if you want conversion as the “ background “ music is very loud.

title: Hidden Gem
text: This has been our favorite New York hotel by far.  The location is perfect and convenient to so many of the places you want to visit when you come to NY.  There were lots of good places to eat near by and an excellent coffee shop right down the street.  The Hotel is older, but it is very well kept and comfortable.  The room we reserved was the "Love" room which has a balcony on Madison Ave.  I highly recommend this room, the views are great and the room is very spacious.  The second floor lounge is awesome and you can grab a latte, water, soda, or a snack anytime if the day or night.  We also tried the bar on the roof, bookmarks, and the waitress was great and the drinks were good.  The staff were all super polite.  We will definitely stay here again next time we come to NY.

title: Old hotel…Needs updates
text: Very old hotel and it shows. Carpet was dirty and elevator was barely working, and also dirty. Location was great and the check in check out and employees at front desk were very friendly and helpful.

title: Loving the Library Hotel
text: The staff is friendly, and very helpful. We love the location, and the rooms, and beds, are comfortable. We always stay here when we’re in the city. The rooftop bar, and restaurant are an added plus……..

title: Amazing!!
text: Front desk team was the best. They were very helpful with checking in. I arrived early and was impressed that my luggage was already in my room when I returned. The room is very comfortable. 24 hour 2nd floor lounge was perfect. Housekeeping staff was very friendly.

title: Fab hotel
text: This is such a lovely hotel in a really nice street near everything - Grand Central, Fifth Avenue, Broadway.  My room was lovely and I particularly liked the reading room where coffee/tea/water and snacks are left out for guests. Everyone on reception was always helpful and I loved New York. If I come back to New York then I'd stay here again.

title: NYC Hotel Gem
text: This was my fourth visit to the Library Hotel and it won’t be my last. It is a refuge from the bustling streets of NYC. The midtown location is a convenient walk away from everything the city has to offer. Love the rooftop bar and lounge. The staff is friendly as well as accommodating. One of New York’s hotel gems!

title: Too good to share the secret!
text: The Library is one of those rare finds that deliver high service standards at a reasonable price. It's almost too good to share the secret! In addition to the service standards, there is the stunning mid-town location near Grand Central. I arrived in New York on Queen Mary 2 very early in the morning and of course, my room was not ready. However, the front desk staff made a real effort to try to find me a room and I was able to check in and enjoy the day in NY. I had a queen (second size up) on the 10th floor and it was very comfortable. The second-floor reading room was also an excellent facility for coffee and all-day snacks. The restaurant works well for casual food and drinks. It would be hard to improve on The Library and this has now become my favourite hotel in NYC.

title: Love The Library
text: Lovely hotel with wonderful location, love it here.  We especially love the area on the second floor where we can meet with our friends and enjoy a beverage. The staff is always friendly and accommodating.

title: 50th bday trip made special by staying here
text: Beautiful, charming, and quaint hotel. Amazing location, close to 2 great subway stations. As well as the NYC public library. Hotel is very clean and quiet. The reading room on the 2nd floor is a great space. Went above and beyond. Would highly recommend!

title: Book Lover's Dream
text: This hotel is the book lovers' dream! My daughter and I had the best time staying here. The location is great for going to the NY Public Library, JP Morgan Library and Museum, the Met and a Broadway show! All are within walking distance.  And if you just want to cozy up with a book, there's no need to leave the hotel or even your room! This is the ideal location for a writing or reading retreat!

title: Checks All The Boxes
text:
Hubbie and I wanted a convenient but special hotel in NYC that wouldn't cost a zillion dollars to celebrate our 30 year Anniversary. I chose the Library Hotel because it was close to Grand Ctrl and seemed to be our type of boutique hotel - So glad we did. I'll run down the most important aspects first:

Extremely comfortable bed and bed linens-Best of any hotel we've ever stayed at including two flatter pillows which are hard to come by.
Shower pressure and temp perfect
Cute little vanity area with seat in bathroom a plus
Staff was extremely friendly - Needed a bulb changed and they came within a minute to do so.

Extra great stuff:
Decor is adorable - Loved the book theme
Checkout is at 1pm instead of 11am like most hotels
Location Location Location just a walk from Grand Ctl
Amazing rooftop bar cozy and trendy
Fabulous breakfast at Madison & Vine
Customer service was excellent - Picked up phone within seconds when I called for anything prior to our stay and during.

I am positive we will stay at this property the next time we are needing to stay in NYC.

title: Almost don't want to spread the word about this place
text: Tempted to keep this to myself! It's such a joy to find a hotel in NYC that is beautiful, beautifully run, amusing, relatively small, and relatively affordable. I like everything about this place -- the gorgeous breakfast room on the second floor that offers cappuccinos and lattes 24/7, the amazing roof bar, the view of the NY Public Library from my room, the view down onto the constant spectacle of traffic on Madison, the proximity to Grand Central, the bottles of cold water in the fridge, the friendly front staff,  the lovely room cleaner, Millie, who was so much fun to talk with.

title: Great hotel for a NYC trip!
text: Great location in NYC. Easy access to local restaurants and very easy walk to Grand Central .  Only a 20 / 30 minutes walk to Times Square and Broadway.  Comfortable rooms and spaces for relaxing.  Rooftop Bar and the 2nd Floor lounge were excellent.  Wish the shower drained a little better but not too bad.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: Loved the location - the reading room was a wonderful space to meet up with those we were traveling with to discuss the day’s plans or eat a take out breakfast or lunch. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms was clean and comfortable. Got a kick out of the library books on the shelf. I wonder what is shelved in the “exotica” room?

title: A book lover’s dream!
text: Books, great service, and NYC … what an amazing combination! We had a wonderful time at the Library Hotel and would come back in a heartbeat. The service was amazing (a huge shout-out to André at the Bookmark Lounge), the room was comfortable, and the location cannot be beat! We highly recommend this property and can’t wait to come back.

title: Favorite place to stay in NYC
text: Third stay at this great, unique hotel. Love the themed floors and rooms. We were on “social sciences” floor and “money” room (so all books and decor in the room was money related. Great rooftop terrace. Wish they would bring back the terrific breakfast that we really enjoyed pre-Covid.

title: Excellent location for Midtown and cute hotel
text:
We stayed at the Library Hotel for 4 nights to explore NYC and attend the US Open Tennis. The best part of the hotel was location!!! 5 min walk to Grand Central station where you can catch the subway or train to pretty much anywhere in Manhattan and all the boroughs of NYC. We also walked a ton - 30 min to Central Park, 30 min to Hudson Yards, 8 min to Bryant Park, 10 to Times Square/Broadway shows etc.. It really is perfect for Midtown and also a little bit quieter since it’s off Madison and not 5th or Broadway. 

The hotel is nicely done. We stated in a Deluxe King room. For NYC hotel rooms, pretty spacious. Bed super comfortable, nice sheets, good desk area, a safe, and a decent size mini fridge which was stocked with water each day. The TV is pretty small and limited channels, but we didn’t watch it much anyway. There are darkening shades too to keep it dark to sleep if you need. Nicely decorated with books for the theme of your room. The bathroom has nice products to use, but the towels are super scratchy and rough. Not sure if they are just old or cheap, but that could be improved. As well as the shower curtain for the shower/tub. It was too short so hard to keep in the tub when showering and not have water all over the floor. You definitely hear street noise, but that is NYC!

There is a restaurant in hotel, Madison and Vine, that will provide room service and also has breakfast, lunch and dinner. We only did breakfast there one day and it was good. There is a cute rooftop bar on the 14th floor that from 2pm on serves drinks and if you order 2 drinks, a free nice cheese plater. Small, but quaint little area. The 2nd floor has all day access to coffee, tea, sodas, water, fruit and a few other things. We were here when it was in the 90s with humidity so HOT so we loved being able to grab as much water as we needed. 

Overall would definitely recommend staying here and would stay again. Only other mention was one night we got back at like 1 am and there is no doorman or lock or key access to walk in the hotel; felt a little unsafe, but there were no issues. There was someone at desk so they would see, but seemed kind of easy for someone to just walk in and go right up the elevator no matter who they were! Staff very nice and the concept of the hotel makes it feel boutique and personal versus some high rise big chain hotel.

title: Hôtel très bien placé mais pas parfait
text: Hôtel très bien placé et très calme. Dommage qu’il n’y ait pas de buffet petit déjeuner et qu’il faille aller au restaurant à côté qui est d’ailleurs très cher. La demande d’autorisation de 4000 dollars sur la carte bancaire a bloqué mon plafond, pas très cool…

title: Not the St. Regis or Ritz Carlton, better than Hilton or Sheraton
text:
One of the nicer hotel experiences I've had, with some caveats.  I was traveling with my adult daughter.  Finding rooms with two beds in Manhattan is extremely difficult and we also needed to be a short distance from Grand Central Station, coming in on the Metro North line and daughter departing the same way.  Room was billed as a "junior suite" with a rollaway bed in a sofa.  I expected a second room with the sofa, silly me. The extra space was a niche the size of a wide closet, perhaps 4 feet deep.  

Oh well.  The design conceit is fun:  every room has a selection of books, a different theme of books to every room.  The selection in our room would have been worth browsing/reading if we weren't running non-stop.  The irony is that the hotel is about a block from the NY Public Library, which we could see down the 41st St. from our room.

A bit of a walk to the theatre district but tolerable, a trade-off we made for the proximity to Grand Central.  A short walk to the Bryant Park and Times Square/42nd St. subway stations, which we took advantage of.

I didn't discover the second floor lounge until the last day, when I went to print out my boarding pass.   Comfy room, filled with books, offering water, sodas, light snacks.

My biggest annoyance:   we were told up check-in that the Bookmarks Lounge, a rooftop area, offered a cheese board if you ordered two drinks, soft drinks included.   We went up there after theatre and discovered that the kitchen closes at 10pm, making it absolutely useless as a post-theatre place.  When I went to down to note a complaint, I heard the lounge being mentioned to another couple checking in, with no mention of the 10pm cut-off.  When I complained, I was told that we were told about the hours upon  check-in.  I denied this and pointed out that the couple who had just checked in hadn't been told either.  My only ding on the staff, which otherwise were quite pleasant and helpful.   

Room service is via the Madison & Vine restaurant in the same building, right off the hotel lobby.  Alas, it closes at 11pm so, again, if you want something post-theatre, make other plans.  Even the Algonquin closes earlier than I would like though I could get a drink and a dessert if I didn't dally.

I'll strongly think about reserving at The Library Collection again whenever I'm in the City.

title: A Well-Booked Stay
text: We booked the Library Hotel in NYC for a book club trip. We LOVED it! From the friendly and helpful staff, to the cozy and very clean rooms, from the well-appointed reading lounge complete with coffee, drinks and snacks, to the excellent location an easy walk to most anything in Manhattan, we were very impressed. Staying at this hotel put our bookish trip right over the top! I will definitely return to the Library Hotel for all future trips to NYC.

title: Delightful experience, well appointed rooms, very clean and felt safe here as a solo traveler
text: This is a gem, perfect location, steps to Grand Central.  The room was very clean, and the Writer’s Den and Poetry Garden were great spots to decompress after busy days in the city.  I loved the theming, and the “Librarians” were all welcoming and helpful.  I would stay here again, highly recommend.

title: A charming, warm hotel!
text: I absolutely love this charming hotel and would definitely come again.  It makes the most of the “book” theme — with books on a given topic in each room and the room numbers indicated with the Dewey Decimal System! The rooms are small but well appointed, and the lounge with complementary coffee/tea/snacks/fruit as well as the roof top bar provide much comfort. The staff are unfailingly courteous, warm, and helpful.  I highly recommend this boutique hotel.

title: Disappointing versus previous stays
text:
We had stayed at the library Hotel on two previous occasions pre covid and were looking forward to another visit. But it wasn’t the same as before. We got the impression they were trying to claw back whatever losses they made over the pandemic. When we arrived there was initially no one to help us with our bags. On checking in even though we had pre booked with a credit card they took another swipe. It turned out that this reserved amount, over $3,000 stayed on our credit card for 30 days long after we had paid the bill for a similar amount in full. Despite e mailing the hotel twice the reserved amount stayed on my credit card account effectively reducing my available credit. The rooms were fine and the hotel was well located. But the service and value which previously made the hotel special were gone. We were a party of 6, my wife and I, my son and daughter in law and their two kids aged 7 &9. When we booked they told us two rooms would meet our needs with two children being able to sleep on a pull out bed (a sofa bed). However the hotel described the pull out as only sufficient for one child. As a result we were persuaded to book an additional room which we subsequently didn’t use as the pull out bed comfortably catered for the two kids. Despite requesting a refund or even a reduction for the unnecessary room the hotel wouldn’t entertain the idea.
Previously the hotel provided an excellent complimentary continental breakfast in the library room, although they still offer tea/coffee, fruit and snacks a breakfast is now provided in the Madison and Vine restaurant. I would strongly recommend hotel guests eat elsewhere as the standard of service and value for money at this restaurant was very poor. We struggled to get the staff to serve us even though it was not busy. The portions were small and the tea and coffee required several refills as the cups were small with each refill charged for. We ate the next morning at the Brooklyn diner which although having a reputation of being expensive was around the same price but with significantly better food and larger portions. In summary we won’t be back as the Library Hotel we knew now only exists in our memories and there is better service and better value elsewhere in New York

title: Charming Midtown Hotel in Manhattan
text: The Library Hotel in Manhattan is charming. Conveniently located on the corner of Madison and 41st, it's within walking distance - but not too close - to Times Square, the legendary theatre district, Grand Central and the famous 5th and Park Avenues. Its discreet entrance is next door to its on site restaurant and bar Madison and Vine. The hotel has a groovy rooftop bar and a great private guest lounge. The staff are excellent. And the bed is comfy!

title: Perfect Hotel
text: Excellent Hotel. Staff is friendly. Rooms are beautiful and CLEAN.  Bed is comfortable. Petit room perfect size for a single person. Appointed beautifully. Rooftop bar enjoyable. Love love love the reading room. Coffee, water, snacks. Location convenient to Grand Central, Public Library and Bryant Park. Would definitely stay again.

title: I Loved This Place
text: I absolutely loved this hotel. The reading room on the second floor was so lovely and allowed me to work while I waited to check in, as well as later in the evening. The theme of the hotel was charming, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and the staff was so welcoming and kind. I will definitely be back!

title: Ideally located boutique hotel
text: Very lovely boutique hotel.  At the time of writing, the outside is covered in scaffolding but the inside was comfortable, the second floor library has water and coffee and snacks and is a great place to spend time if you get there after a red eye and your room isn't ready yet.  The rooms are small but comfortable, some noises creep in from the street and pipes but it was quite comfortable.  The location was ideal, so convenient to Grand Central and Bryant Park, and even Hudson Yards is a mere few stops way!  All this from a former New Yorker!  Would stay again.

title: Adequate, but would be great with new mattress.
text:
Centrally located boutique hotel. 
The good: Friendly staff, very clean room and bathroom, free bottles of water and snacks on second floor.
The bad: bed was uncomfortable - old mattress that lacked support. Restaurant charges for coffee refill.

title: Find peace at the library
text: In a bustling city, the Library Hotel is a true gem!  We were welcomed with smiling faces and when we had an issue with the toilet, it was fixed asap! It was a true comfort to find such a a peaceful experience from beginning to end.  We’ll definitely be back!

title: I would go back!
text: Our short stay at the Library Hotel was wonderful.  From the friendly, helpful front desk staff, to the comfortable rooms, rooftop bar and the "lounge" where you could relax and get a snack - we loved it!  Very clean and walkable to many areas including Bryant Park, Broadway, the Morgan Library.  Would recommend!

title: The Library Hotel: As memorable as a great book!
text: I absolutely loved my stay at the Library Hotel. The staff were wonderful, the room was lovely and the atmosphere was perfect! Even the stairways had beautiful paintings on the walls. We enjoyed the lounge on the 14th floor and the amenities on the 2nd floor were much appreciated. I look forward to going back.

title: My favorite Midtown hotel.
text: I always find this literary themed hotel to be personable and charming.  The staff are warm, friendly and helpful.  The rooms are themed with books from a particular section of the Dewey decimal system and the lounge provides a perfect place for a snack, coffee, and respite before the day's work, between meetings, and at the end of the day.  It is my favorite Midtown hotel.

title: Manhattan oasis - a true hidden gem
text:
This was a sanctuary in the midst of the loud, noisy energy of New York. In the heart of midtown south there was easy walking access to a plethora of touristy landmarks - Time Square, Broadway, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, New York Public Library (gasp!).... 
Staff were exceptionally helpful & friendly, going above and beyond to make my stay comfortable, while never being intrusive. I stayed in a petite room (double bed) and it was perfect for 1. Two people would be a squeeze so if you are travelling as a couple maybe go for one of the larger rooms.
Library themed throughout there are books that you can borrow everywhere you look - in your room, in the complimentary all-day breakfast/snack lounge (there's a baby grand piano there you can play too!), in the rooftop bar that, as a guest, you can access any time of the day as a lounge/reading room. Absolutely stunning - cannot recommend this place highly enough!

title: A Midtown Manhattan gem! Your welcoming home away from home while in New York City.
text:
I chose for my wife and I to stay here based on consistent quality reviews, the location being close to Radio City Music Hall, a two minute walk from Grand Central Terminal (we traveled to and from 100% via train from Pennsylvania) and its unique 110 year old building/boutique hotel charm. All of which played out to perfection in reality. 
   We had many things to do during our 2-night/2 day stay but we were very happy to have enjoyed a few cocktails and light fare up on the lovely rooftop Friday night and our breakfast the following morning at Madison & Vine was fantastic! Mmmmmmm the best Eggs Shakshuka for me! 
   My wife was grateful for the healthy snacks, coffee and refreshing drinks/bottled water on the 2nd floor. Stop there first before heading out on your adventures or for a peaceful space to read to your heart's content.
   To top it all off all of the employees we encountered were genuine, kind, helpful and a real pleasure to interact with. Best front desk staff I have dealt with in years! We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Very good - 5 stars if you love books 📚❤️
text:
We stayed for almost two weeks in June 2023.

Communication with the hotels if effective and helpful. (Before during and after). They arranged a chauffeur service to and from the airport which was comfortable. As it was our anniversary, they had arranged for a chilled bottle of wine in our room upon arrival, with a cute card attached. We appreciated this gesture. 

The hotel is in a good looking building, it’s not to tall and there are few rooms. This leads to a relaxed feeling as it’s not bustling with people and there was never any noise between rooms.

Location is super central, one block from Grand Central and you should be able to see New York Public Library out most windows. Follow the lovely New York Library   way going there as it is on the steps of the hotel entrance.  Bryant park lies behind the library and has loads of free and fun activities. The Morgan Library is also very close by. 

The room we had (delux) was a bit dated, but larger than we expected from the pictures. Room was clean and the wardrobe big. (Please note we are not American so our view on size might differ). Robes and slippers were included. The toiletries did not smell super masculine, which is a plus. 

There is a nice room you can grab some snacks and drinks from 24/7. This is handy, but in our opinion the selection was disappointing and most people will need to go out to grab breakfast elsewhere. There is a restaurant on the fist floor of the hotel but would not recommended this as service is bad and prices step. Much better and cheaper options right by. 

There is a cute rooftop bar called bookmark. Only letdown is that it’s frequently booked for events, so if your are in town for a short time you might not be able to access it.  

In regards to book lovers, (adding to the location) there’s books in most rooms which you can lend. Details like cushions and Wi-Fi passwords have a book theme. The receptionists even signs their emails with “The librarians”. Just love it.

We were without a doubt extremely happy with the hotel, and we will return if staying in New York again.

title: Great experience
text: We really loved and enjoyed staying at this hotel. From the moment you walk in, you get a warm greeting from the attentive staff. Expect this throughout your stay. Great rooftop bar. You even get a complimentary delicious cheeseboard. I will say, the bed could be a little more comfortable but it didn’t take away from the rest of the experience. We will be staying here again for certain!

title: Highly recommend this perfectly located boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan.
text: We spent a wonderful weekend at the centrally-located and beautifully appointed Library Hotel during a recent trip to NYC. The hotel staff was amazing--from the helpful pair manning the front desk to the attentive waitstaff at the beautiful and relaxing roof-top Bookmarks Bar--all of whom made us feel welcome and personally cared for. The second floor guest lounge, which offers gratis beverages and snacks, was an excellent additional perk. We'll undoubtedly stay again in future.

title: Charming Hotel, Excellent Location
text: We loved our stay at the Library Hotel. We found the hotel to be charming and the staff to be friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic - we were able to walk to Central Park (approx. 30-40 minutes to walk to Central Park - note that we walk a lot in general and walk at a fast pace), and also walked to our Broadway show, and to shopping on Fifth Avenue.  Grand Station is two blocks away so great proximity to the subway. We loved that complimentary bottled water and snacks were available 24/7.  We also enjoyed a drink on the roof top patio, which was lovely.

title: Perfect. In every way. Quiet. Clean. Cool design.. Terrific staff throughout. Loved the rooftop . Loved the library..
text:
Really liked this place. 

Loved this place. Great everything. The care the staff shows is remarkable. I definitely will stay here again and also recommend to others. Rooftop bar truly special place and library also quite welcoming.

title: Lovely, peaceful hotel!
text: Did an overnight stay here for my partner's birthday, and we had an incredible time! Friendly staff, clean room, and lovely amenities. We came on a weeknight and basically had the whole place to ourselves. The rooftop was our favorite part.

title: Best place
text: Warm and friendly staff, always helpful, great place to met friends. Easy access to city and sightseeing. Easy access to airport connections, great breakfast and happy hour. Look forward to staying again

title: June 23
text: Wonderful bed and next to the Monkey Bar is a real plus.  Location is also great.  Staff is very professional and it is a hotel that can easily reach most important locations in the City like MOMA, The Met, etc.

title: Great location, friendly staff, well-designed rooms
text: The Library Hotel at 299 Madison Avenue has a marvelous location for walkers right in the middle of everything. Two-mile walk to the Met, 20 minutes to Broadway theaters, half an hour to, oh, so many things. The room we had was intelligently designed; the public rooftop bar will, we hope, remain a bit of a secret hideaway for hotel guests; the second-floor guest lounge is attractive and well-stocked. This is our new home away from home in New York City.

title: A second stay.
text:
This is our second stay at the Library Hotel/University of Chicago and it was even better than our first.  The staff was once again professional, friendly, and helpful.  (They provided us very quickly with ice and a much-needed bottle opener.) The campus-facing room on a high floor provided a spectacular view right over to Rockefeller Chapel.  The room was well-appointed and the bed very comfortable.  We had breakfast in the restaurant which was very good.  Totally satisfied and looking forward to our next stay and to hearing about a possible loyalty program.  Stay there - You won't regret.
Drs. J & S. Coyne

title: Sweet Boutique Hotel
text: Lovely hotel, great set up, excellent restaurant (Madison and Vine) and fun rooftop bar (Bookmarks)! Ideal location yet out of the busy/crowded pathway of 5th Avenue. Looking forward to our next visit.

title: Bucket list item, for sure!
text: So great; unique, beautiful space. It was our first time there and we’d go again in a heartbeat! Getting the gift stack of books was a great extra - the selections were quirky and perfect! Staff was terrific - attentive without being pushy.

title: A dream
text: This hotel is a dream for book lovers. There’s a lovely restaurant, Madison & Vine, right next to the lobby too. The reading room has water, coffee, fruit, & snacks and of course, books you can take back to your room to read! I love how each floor has its own Dewey Decimal book theme. I stayed on the social sciences floor and had political science books in my room. The location of this place can’t be beat-1 block from the fifth avenue NYPL, three blocks from the Morgan Library, and 1 block from Grand Central. Such a quiet oasis in Midtown Manhattan right on Library Way! The parking garage was nearby and also very, very reasonable for our three night stay. The staff was super friendly too. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: A perfect NYC small, comfortable, friendly, perfectly located hotel
text:
Great location. Rooftop bar is perfect. Second floor tearoom is great spot to uwind , plan your day, take a breather with tea, seltzer, coffee, and snacks.
Did I mention the staff? Could not be more helpful and cheerful. LOVE!

title: Book Lover’s Dream!
text: The Library Hotel is paradise for a book lover! I stayed in the poetry room, where I discovered a volume of poetry by Diane Ackerman that I hadn’t read before ( “I Praise My Destroyer”) - what a delightful surprise! I loved the rooftop bar, the lounge, and the comfy room. In fact, I loved it so much that I wound up happily staying in the hotel for much of my NYC visit. All the staff were personable and genuinely interested in insuring that guests enjoyed their stay. I loved every moment and will most certainly stay here when visiting NYC.

title: We will be back!
text: Perfect location close to Grand Central Station, the New York Public Library, and the theater district. Loved the bookish theme throughout, the very comfortable bed in a larger than average room, and nice amenities like water, sodas and energy bars.

title: Excellent, welcoming hotel
text: My fiancée and I had a lovely time at this hotel. Everyone was so welcoming and accommodating. They were very LGBTQ friendly and welcoming. The lounge had amazing drinks (both alcoholic and mocktails). I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Clean, comfortable hotel in a great location
text:
The Library Hotel is very clean and the bed was the most comfortable I've slept in. The shower was great, too!

The staff are polite and friendly. The free snacks and drinks i  the gotel's Reading Room are a lovely touch.

It's in a great location for all the mid-town sights and the shops of Fifth Avenue. 

I would highly recommend.mend this hotel for anyone planning a visit to NYC.

title: Nettes Boutique Hotel mit Abstrichen
text:
Wir hatten vor über einem halben Jahr dieses Hotel für unseren einwöchigen Familientrip nach New York gebucht. Der Mailverkehr klappte reibungslos und wir checkten zu fünft und drei Zimmern ein. Leider wurde unser Wunsch nach einem Zimmer in den oberen Etagen nicht erfüllt obwohl vorab in Aussicht gestellt. Kein guter Start aber ok. Auch war der Empfang recht kurz, sachlich und nüchtern. 
Im Zimmer (Juniorsuite) selbst fanden wir das vor was wir gebucht hatten. Eine schöne Ausstattung, gutes Bett, schönes Ambiente. Leider viel zu wenig Staufläche für Kleidung etc. Schade aber dass es keinerlei kleines „Welcome“ gab wie häufig in Hotels solcher Kategorie üblich. 
Als es ab der zweiten Nacht Bauarbeiten vor dem Hotel gab war es vorbei mit der Nachtruhe. Auf Nachfrage an der Rezeption hieß es um 2.30 Uhr man könne nichts dafür, es ist schließlich außerhalb. Basta. Es gab weder Ohrstöpsel, das Angebot eines Zimmerwechsels noch ein einziges Wort des Bedauerns. Nur den Hinweis, dass wir nicht die ersten Gäste sind die sich beschwerten und die Zusicherung dass sich das Management am nächsten Tag per Mail melden würde. Das geschah leider auch nicht. Nach zwei Nächten war der Lärm vorbei. Beim Checkout für die drei Zimmer gab es auch keinerlei Nachfrage ob wir zufrieden waren. Sehr schade, dass der Service am Gast hier so klein geschrieben wird. Sonst wären aufgrund der Lage und der Ausstattung sowie der kleinen netten Rooftopbar mindestens vier Sterne angebracht gewesen. Daher leider keine Empfehlung, da es auch nicht wirklich günstig war.

title: un livre de poesie dans grand livre d images
text:
Hôtel plein de charme remarquablement située beaucoup de prévenance  du personnel a l'écoute pour les problèmes journalier remarquable pour une urgence médicale   grave
proche des moyens de  transports et de beaucoup de centres d'intérêt grande library cinquième avenue empire state building gare centrale

title: Library
text: It is a beautiful building near many other attractions.   It had a great gift shop with many unique gift items. We loved the water features and the statues out front. It is close to Bryant Park and a short walk to the subway.

title: As a repeat guest, I'm afraid I will not be going back again.
text: I have long utilized the Library Hotel collection, especially the flagship hotel on Madison Avenue. I have stayed with him for business and personal reasons at least a dozen times over the past 15 years. Unfortunately they shut the entire hotel collection down during Covid, and clearly that has caused long-term ramifications. This is simply not the same hotel by any means. There is no longer anyone to open the door or even offer to assist with bags. There is no longer any afternoon tea and cookies on the second floor, there is no longer any breakfast provided. It appears there is no longer any list of DVDs by which a guest can select any of 100 or 200 movies to view. The carpet in our room was stained, a lightbulb was out and the bathtub was clogged. Three days after complaining, the lightbulb was still out and the bathtub was still clogged. While the staff continues to be very nice, they seem to be very young and not very professional. This is simply no longer a competitive luxury hotel.

title: A hotel with a difference.
text:
A centrally located hotel that provides a great personal service.
The availability of tea, coffee and a few nibbles in the library 24 hours a day was appreciated and a complimentary cheeseboard if you brought 2 drinks in the rooftop bar was an unexpected and welcome bonus.
Rooms were clean, neat and tidy and provided adequate space for our 2 large suitcases even though it was classed as one of the smallest rooms available.
Loved wandering round the library and we were always met with a friendly greeting when coming and going from the hotel.
