title: 5 Star rating.
text: This will be my go to hotel when I visit family in Manhattan. Great location. Wonderful staff at front desk. So helpful. Will recommend to others. Really nice place. Fun!  Enjoyed it so much. Highly recommend to any person visiting NYC. Great experience.

title: Delightful hotel in great location
text: Wonderful hotel for service, location and convience.  We stayed in a junior suite with ample room for sofa and sitting area. A few blocks from Grand Central Terminal for the subway and great restaurants. Walkable to tourist areas. Excellent staff assistance. Hotel has a notable local restaurant and a rooftop bar. Reading room has snacks, coffee, sodas, etc 24 hours. Would certainly recommend to anyone. We truly loved this hotel designed on libraries.

title: Great stay! Bad food
text: This hotel was super cute and the staff was wonderful. The room was small, but clean with a great view. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat. Their restaurant’s food was subpar. Do not eat there! I had late night appetizer and breakfast and they were borderline inedible and cold. The cocktails were amazing though. I would go to the restaurant again, but only for drinks.

title: Wonderful Relaxing Visit
text: Just a wonderful staff at the front desk. Kind, friendly, polite, helpful. Comfortable rooms that are well appointed (and a tub!)  The Second floor coffee and gathering place was calm and terrific. Great coffee, fruit, water, some snacks for free. 24 hours. And!  Great location. (The restaurant was lovely. Good breakfast and also a very nice and excellent staff. we were in a hurry one morning and they were very responsive and got our breakfast quickly, all with wonderful attitudes. Highly recommend. This was our third stay and it did not disappoint! THANK YOU LIBRARY STAFF.

title: Dirty, Bugs, Disappointing
text:
We had a very negative experience with this hotel. Our bed pillows had no protectors on them and had ONE case. When we requested more pillows and linens- the understaffed front desk employee brought up 4 pillows. Two that were USED , FILTHY and had hair and makeup on it. One of the pillows had dirty tape stuck to it.
The worst part of our stay was having to purchase bug spray because our 3rd floor tiny  room ( with windows closed ) was a haven for mosquitoes. We were bitten to the point that we had to wear bug repellent on our faces to bed. 
We spoke to the manager and with the exception of cleaning the room ( we didn’t want room service because we knew we would risk getting dirty linens again ) they offered nothing. No comps no discount.
This was a let down. Pay the 100-200 more and just stay at Lotte.

title: I LOVE THE LIBRARY HOTEL...PUT THE OWNERS PROPERTY IN BUDAPEST ON MY WISH LIST
text:
Love this place!  The location is ideal.  It's near the heart of the city yet it's quiet and peaceful for sleeping.  The incredible New York City Library is only a few blocks away.  The library is absolutely worth visiting.  We don't build buildings like this that I'm aware of anywhere in the world today.

The books and library theme are exceptionally well done.  I love the Dewey Decimal System coding for the room numbers.  The room was spotless, clean, and comfortable.  I was in the Poetry room.  The upstairs bar and reading rooms are fantastic.  A large piano and comfortable chairs adorn these areas.

The restaurant is delightful and the service was excellent - even while it was very busy for breakfast.

Everyone on staff during my staff was great and they answered all of my questions about the history of the hotel.  Apparently the owner of this hotel owns a Top Rated TripAdvisor property in Budapest.  I've put it on my wish list for a future stay.

THIS IS AN EXCEPTIONAL HOTEL AND I WILL BE BRINGING MY FAMILY BACK TO STAY HERE.

title: Simply Wonderful!
text: Wonderful service, wonderful staff, wonderful stay! Perfect for book lovers and librarians, just a block away from NYPL and all its treasures. My friend and I got separate little rooms next to each other which was perfect for private sleeping. Will definitely be back for a visit again!

title: Perfect choice!
text: Perfect location clean and very comfortable wonderfully friendly and helpful staff lovely restaurant and roof top bar but be aware the roof top bar requires reservation during busy times even if you are a resident as open to non-residents although sadly this information does not appear as an advisory in any hotel litreature.

title: Comfortable. Convenient. Friendly. Delicious.
text: Great location. Quiet rooms and comfy beds. Good bar and restaurant. Helpful and friendly staff who helped us daily and REALLY went out of their way to help us with a last-minute "escapade" right before we were due to leave for the airport. You were recommended by a friend and now we will keep spreading the good word. Thanks.

title: Unique and Wonderful!
text: My wife and I stayed on a Wednesday night.  We showed up before check-in, and they held our bags while we attended a Broadway show.  When we came back from the show we checked in.  The staff was very polite.  The place was clean and organized.  We even managed an upgrade to the "Love" suite on the 11th floor (Philosophy).  Every room in the hotel has a subject on the door according the the Dewey Decimal System used in libraries.  All of the room's tags are also displayed in a great wall mural on the second floor near the reading room.  With all of the books available, both downstairs in the reading room, and upstairs in our room, it was tempting to just stay at the hotel and read all day.  There's the rooftop patio, the solarium near the bar, the reading room downstairs.  The restaurant seemed kind of  upscale, but we didn't eat there.  The bar for the rooftop was well appointed, and again, the staff was efficient and friendly.  The air conditioning was more than adequate, and the room was always comfortable.  Because we were on the eleventh floor, outside noise wasn't an issue.  It was a nice touch to have the light-blocking curtains available to cover the blinds in the room, so that we could sleep past sunrise.  It was well worth the price, and we will be staying there again when we return to NYC.

title: Lovely
text: We always book this hotel because all staff are so kind and friendly. We have been expressed welcoming at the reception.Furthermore thanks to them we can stay here, we feel comfortable and relax like our house every time.The atmosphere of many books around every room makes me so happy. I bet this hotel is number one in the United States! Thank you very much!

title: Wonderful experience!!
text: Outstanding experience at the Library Hotel.   The staff was extremely courteous and helpful, and check-in/check-out was an easy process.   Our room was excellent--clean, well laid out, and comfortable.   Breakfast at Madison & Vine was perfect, and the lounge floors in the hotel were a wonderful amenity for coffee and snacks.    Overall a fantastic experience prompting a desire to return soon.   And the locatin in midtown was exceptional for getting around NYC.

title: Couldn't ask for anything better.
text: Book lovers paradise with Location, themed rooms, plus all the amenities. This was everything we needed for a little get away. Definitely would recommend and would go back when we return to New York.

title: Wonderful charming hotel and staff!
text:
Beautiful boutique hotel, perfectly situated blocks from the NYC Library and the Pierpoint Morgan. We had a family suite (305/306) with a stunning view of the Library: rooms were immaculately clean, very comfortable king beds and pillows.  

Staff were friendly and helpful at every turn, we’re especially grateful for helping us extend our stay for an additional day when the hotel was quite full.

title: Clean, Comfortable, Convenient & Character-filled
text: Very comfortable accommodations and friendly and helpful staff.  Loved the reading room.  The free 24-hour coffee & snacks available was a small but amazing detail-  possibly the only NY hotel I have stayed in that has this.  Great location- 5 min to bryant park/library, Morgan Library, and Grand Central.

title: A gem in New York!
text: The Library is a gem!  It feels hidden away but is in fact slap bang in the centre of Manhattan a stone's throw from the bustle of  Grand Central and peace of Bryant Park. The rooms are just lovely (no coffee/tea facilities was the only downside although you can get beverages on the 2nd floor), the restaurant is really good as is the room service, really helpful and friendly staff and the rooftop is stunning; even if you are not going to bar it is great just to sit and chill. So pleased I found this hotel - I will be back!

title: Hidden retreat steps from Grand Central
text: Pleasant environment with comfortable accommodations. Staff couldn't be more helpful. Wonderful lounge and roof top bar. Enjoyable retreat within midtown - easy to get almost anywhere from here. Will be back!

title: Cozy and quiet - a reading dream!
text:
We stayed in the Mythology Room and really enjoyed our time! The room was spacious and clean, with a nice view of the library (corner room with windows on both walls). 

The location was perfect, too. Short walk to restaurants, NYPL, and Grand Central, and about a 10-minute walk from Rockefeller Plaza and all that. Summit One is right next to the hotel and was a fun evening activity with spectacular city views. 

The hallways were very quiet, and the reading room was comfortable. Love the snack offerings and beverages for guests. The Bookmarks Bar was also a great spot to relax! Madison & Vine had great food and service - I recommend eating there, too. Overall we loved our stay and will be back for sure!

title: NYC's best-kept secret!
text: This was our second visit to the Library Hotel, and we were just as impressed this time, as we were the first! The staff and accommodations are 5 star. They truly make you feel like family here. We loved the boutique hotel feeling and the fact that the hotel is within walking distance of the great museums of NYC, as well as a subway station a block away, should you wish to venture a bit further without paying for taxis. The cost in relation to the accommodations and location is a definite plus. Our only disappointment was that they no longer offer the complimentary in-hotel breakfast - that was something we looked forward to. We purchased the "Green Eggs and Ham" package, however, the Madison & Vine restaurant was obviously short staffed and service was extremely slow (almost had to beg for coffee refills and it took a 1/2 hour just to get a glass of orange juice). There were only two servers working the entire restaurant and they were doing the best they could, so this seems to be a management issue. Other than that, our stay was wonderful and we will be back!

title: Cozy Hotel for NY visit
text:
Positives - quaint hotel, exceptional staff, convenient location, nice amenities room

Negatives - small room, no late night food in hotel

Overall, I would recommend The Library hotel. I knew the room would be on the small side, which was perfectly fine for my husband and me.

title: Another 5 star stay
text: There is a reason I always stay at the Library Hotel when I go to NY. The hotel is absolutely lovely and the staff is exceptionally kind and helpful. The location is wonderful, the food is divine, and the accomodations are exceptional. I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

title: This hotel has gone downhill
text: I’ve stayed at this hotel twice before and had great experiences both times. I was expecting the same experience on my third stay, but was very disappointed. Perhaps the hotel is under new management. The room was about the size of a walk-in closet and should have been half the price of the others I’ve stayed in. The HVAV system, the hallway activity, and the street noise kept me awake. The bed did not seem freshly made and the linens were of poor quality. The hair dryer didn’t work and I had to search for a housekeeper to get another one. The restaurant on the first floor does not begin serving until 11:00 am, so there’s no chance of getting an early breakfast without leaving the hotel. I would not stay here again. There are too many better options for a lot less money.

title: Fab midtown NYC hotel
text: More than just a great value - great location, fabulous staff, and amazing facilities from the rooms to the roof top bar. With hotel prices soaring in NYC, the Library Hotel is a great value find just two blocks from Grand Central Station. The staff couldn’t be more accommodating from our arrival through check-out.

title: Outstanding Experience!
text: My friend and I chose the Library Hotel due to its proximity to an event we were in town for. We liked the size of the hotel, and as book lovers, we knew a library theme would hit home! From the moment we arrived to the second we left, we encountered kind team members from all departments. The ambience is great, the amenities were wonderful, and the location is fantastic. We can't wait until next year, when we return!

title: Value and Warmth in Midtown
text: The location was perfect. The staff was exceptional. I am grateful for a pleasant stay. The Library is an excellent value in midtown. The 2nd floor lounge is terrific for snacks and coffee. The Penthouse bar is charming and I had a tasty breakfast in the restaurant. It was all pretty effortless

title: Awesome place!
text: Incredible hospitality, clean and comfortable rooms, great ambiance, great location! We walked everywhere! There is a wonderful roof top seating area and a free cheese board when you order two drinks! Did I mention the 1:00pm check out? Great place!

title: Wonderful place to stay!
text: The Library hotel is a lovely boutique hotel with nicely decorated rooms and bathrooms. It is centrally located and an easy walk from so many things.  There is a lovely reading room on the second floor which is open all day and a wonderful place to visit with friends.  The staff was kind and helpful.

title: Delightful ambiance, elegant without being pretentious
text: The hotel was one of the most accommodating and hospitable I've ever experienced. We arrived in the morning, and because our room was ready, we were able to check in early. The hotel is replete with thoughtful design with its library-themed rooms and decor, and the 2nd floor lounge is relaxing and stocked with coffee and snacks. The rooftop deck is quaint and comfortable. Take advantage of happy hour which included a cheese plate for us. We enjoyed their restaurant for breakfast, and the restaurant is conveniently located for transit and sightseeing.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: The Library Hotel is the perfect place to stay in Midtown Manhattan. It provides comfortable, clean rooms, excellent staff, great views, nice lounge and lovely rooftop bar.  The coffee is delicious, the beds are inviting and clean and the elevators work well. The decor is lovely and there is a book for everyone. It's a block from the main library with some of the best architecture in the city. What's not to love?

title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
text: We loved returning to this clean, quiet hotel centrally located and within walking distance of many NYC attractions. The staff is friendly and the rooms are comfortable and well-equipped. The second floor lounge with refreshments was especially welcome.

title: Central location with themed rooms
text: The hotel was ideally located for all the major attractions. On the corner of Madison and 41st it was just around the corner from Grand Central Station and about a 20 minute walk from the Empire State and Rockefeller. Plenty of restaurants nearby too.

title: Expensive, but great experience,  needs more food options
text: Expensive, but worth it for the location, the clean hotel room, the adorable library theme, and the great staff. Don't love that the restaurant and bar are limited, especially for timing, wish there was a bit more flexibility for a hotel in the City That Never Sleeps. My flight was delayed so had to Uber Eats food in since the restaurant was closed. Room service was also limited. Otherwise, a great stay. Loved the hand written welcome note!

title: would highly recommend
text: The staff was friendly, professional and , helpful. The rooms were well tended - they even put our shoes in a row against the wall. The hotel is very convenient to Times Square Broadway, and so much more. It truly was a pleasure staying there.

title: A great spot to enjoy the sights of Manhattan.
text: A quiet comfortable place in a fantastic location. We were impressed by the friendly staff, and enjoyed the quirky and thoroughly executed library theme. The second floor reading room is a lovely touch and we took advantage of it several times.

title: Our Favorite NYC Hotel
text: We love the Library Hotel for so many reasons.  It is a delightful boutique style establishment with extremely comfortable rooms each with a literary theme.  The furnishings and beds are comfortable and the rooms are generously sized for NYC.  It is in a convenient, central location near Grand Central, the NY Public Library and Bryant Park, and is a short walk to theater, restaurants and shopping.  There is a wonderful rooftop bar, a quiet reading room with refreshments and an attached restaurant.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.

title: A hotel experience I will never forget in NYC
text: The Library Hotel is one of a kind! From the unique decor, to the first class service and staff to the themed books in every room, this hotel is a must stay during a NYC visit. I was blown away by how intricate the property was and loved how centrally located the property was as well. The included gym access and 24/7 waters, coffee machine and snacks are a nice touch as well. Will definitely be back soon!

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text: Very nice hotel in a great location.  Staff is excellent.  The room was clean and appointed well.  I didn't hear any noise.  I guess the only complaint I could come up with is that the heat worked too well.  I guess you need to open the windows to let some cool air in.

title: Wonderful Location
text:
We are just back from a 6 night stay in the hotel.  We had a junior corner suite on the 6th floor.  Beautiful spacious room, very clean, incredibly comfortable large king bed, robes, slippers and plenty of clean towels.  From one of our windows we had a view of the New York Library.  The 2nd floor was a great pit stop for refreshments after returning from our sightseeing every day.  The rooftop bar had a lovely ambiance and was very cosy in the evening.  With it being a corner room however there was quite a lot of street noise that went on all night.
We had a breakfast inclusive package and had breakfast each morning in Madison and Vine.  I am not sure if this is connected or separately run to the hotel, but compared to anyone we encountered in the hotel, the staff here were unfriendly and rude.  The food however was excellent.

title: Very pleasant stay!
text: There were three very welcoming young women staffing the front desk both on the mornings of 3-10 and 3-11. This hotel has such gracious staff in every location.  The rooms have such nice lighting, great linens, robes/slippers, and a frig with cold bottled water.  Every morning there is fresh coffee, tea, fruit, and granola bars

title: Best Place to Stay in NYC (with a few recommendations :)
text:
The absolute best place to stay at in NYC. Great staff - great rooms - great experience! My wife and I have stayed there many times and will continue to do so.
However, a few suggestions to bring the hotel back to its pre-covid glory:
1. Please bring back the breakfast - even if it is prepackaged cereal, small cartons of juice, and individually wrapped pastries.
2. Please bring back the turn down service with the nifty chocolates  wrapped in witty foil literary gems.
3. Please bring back the afternoon wine :) 
4. Please update the televisions with new larger screens.

title: Super pleasant hotel in Midtown.
text: My husband and I just stayed at The Library Hotel. What a great experience! The hotel location is in a really nice part of Manhattan. Very convenient to Grand Central Station. The hotel is small with a very nice ambiance, actually like a library. Books everywhere. Our room was spotless clean! We slept peacefully because it was very quiet, a rarity in NYC. We didn't eat at the restaurant but we would have if we had more time. We did take advantage of the free coffee and fruit one morning on the second floor.  We did have drinks at the Roof Top venue and that too was very enjoyable. My husband said many times that the next time we go back to NYC, we will definitely stay here again. Highly recommend!

title: Adorable little place in heart of mid-town
text:
You can't ask for a better location if you're a tourist or doing business in mid-town. A block from Grand Central, which is where I needed to be to catch the Metro North to Fordham, so this was really convenient. Walkable to tons of restaurants and attractions, etc. as well as an easy walk from Penn Station, where I arrived by train. 

Property itself is small and adorable. Boutique hotel in the true sense of the word. Do read carefully and visualize the room when you book. They are transparent about the square footage. I got a petite suite for just me and yes, it was tiny - a double bed just fit - but that was fine. The bathroom area was plenty spacious, there were two large windows letting in plenty of light, and it did not feel cramped. It's not a room you hang out in, but who wants to do that anyway in NYC? And when I did have some downtime, there is a lovely "reading room" on the second floor for guests only that is bright (lots of windows), couches and tables, and complimentary beverages and snacks 24 hours a day. It was the perfect place to have a cup of tea and relax between outings, and made up for the small room. 

There is a cool rooftop bar/lounge and attached restaurant. Everything was clean and in working order. Staff was friendly. No complaints.

title: excellent hotel
text:
excellent mysteries room
resort fee $25 each night but then free coffee soft drinks fruit and snacks in reading room
close to all main sights
reception staff helpful although shortage of umbrellas as it was rainy two days

title: Needs work
text: Hotel was run down.  Dirty Elevator was off-putting. The room was clean, but toilet ran and made strange noises all night. TV reception was spotty and TV was small and old. No room service, but free coffee, tea, soda and snacks in the lounge. Staff was super-nice.

title: Relaxing hotel near Grand Central
text:
We travelled with family , a mix of ages from 20s to 50s and we all loved the hotel
Would thoroughly recommend it
Great location
An oasis in the middle of Manhattan 
Lovely reading room on the 2nd floor with plenty of refreshments 
Fabulous bar on 14 th floor too

title: Great Spot
text:
Our first time staying at the Library Hotel.  Its in a great spot, very close to the train, quick walk to Times Square.  The room was very small but it was very nice, clean, updated and comfortable.
The roof top bar area is very nice and the lounge is great too.

title: Great stay
text: We had a wonderful time. Housekeeping was great and they were able to accommodate last minute extension. Room was cozy. Restaurant food was good. Only issue we had was trying to order room service, but Restaurant on maim floor was helpful.

title: Wow!
text: Die Reise war ein Geschenk für meine lesesüchtige Tochter: es war einfach nur der Hit. Sehr zentral gelegenes Hotel, nette Angestellte, schöne Zimmer, und vor allem einfach TOP: der Reading Room. Jeden Morgen war meine Tochter mindestens eine Stunde am Lesen in diesem zauberhaften Raum.

title: Cozy hotel with perfect location
text: Spectacular hotel for my husband and I to spend a few days in New York. The location couldn’t have been better, it was so easy to find, the staff were very accommodating, the room was charming, cozy, clean. They have a rooftop bar with stunning views. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to all travelers!

title: nice accomodations, good value relative to NYC
text: I was in town for a tech event -- on my own dime.  Someone at the hosting company suggested a nearby hotel that was $500+ a night, that was a non-starter.  The Library was on the same block, and at a fraction the cost was a no brainer.  Everything was clean, and the pervasive library theme was cute but not overwhelming.  The room was small as is typical in NYC, but plenty for what I needed.  The bed was more comfortable than the usual rock-hard hotel experience.  Staff were comfortable, the "club level" lounge had fruit and several vegan snack choices, especially important since as usual the captive restaurant menu is pretty much all meat.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: My husband and I stayed in a queen room on the third floor of the hotel for two nights. The room was what can be expected size-wise for New York City and the bed was a little softer than we like, but for two nights it was fine. The bathroom was nicely appointed, with great water pressure and toiletries.  The room was very clean and decorated in a cozy-library vibe with books displayed. Our favorite part of the hotel was the reading room located on the second floor, which provided 24/7 coffee, lattes/cappuccinos, canned drinks, fruit and snacks. The staff was quick to replenish things as they were consumed. We also enjoyed our drinks at Madison and Vine next door. We also loved this location-- close to Broadway, but away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. We will definitely plan to return on our next trip to the city.

title: Great Night at the Library Hotel!!
text: I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  Great location, wonderful staff and excellent common spaces.  Booked a queen for one night with my son as we were going into NY last minute to see a play.  Room had great high ceilings which make it feel so spacious.  Walking distance to Theater District and Times Square with Grand Central, Summit One Vanderbilt and NY Library within one block.  The second floor of the hotel has a wonderful lounge area with coffee, espresso and snacks all day.  We ate at the rooftop bar, which was just an amazing experience. We sat by the fireplace and had delicious appetizers.  I am looking forward to going back to this hotel as soon as I can.

title: The best common spaces
text: The Library Hotel has a unique set of common spaces. I love that the reading room (with tables and snacks) is on the second floor so there's a bit of privacy from the street. They play jazz recordings which are perfect (not too loud) for quiet conversations. The bar on the top floor has so many great seating arrangements for hanging out. I went up there Sunday morning to read and it was empty, but there was a sweet fire in the fireplace. It was cozy! Most of all, the staff is incredible. Every single person I met (at the desk, housekeeping, room service) was kind and helpful. It feels like a special kind of luxury to stay there.

title: Excellent
text: A lovely clean pleasant hotel. The staff were very welcoming, the Queen room was small but very clean with a nice size bathroom, great water pressure, comfortable bed and pillows. Easy ,close access to subways.

title: Loved it!
text: Loved it! The library on the second floor and the lounge on the 14th were fantastic. The hotel has so much character. I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was given the location and that the rooms were updated. Great place.

title: Very%20impressed%20by%20the%20personnel%2C%20the%20room%20and%20the%20food!!!!
text: The Library is a lovely boutique style hotel in a great location .  We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly especially Billy, Jessica (restaurant ) and the young man at the rooftop bar, Unvick (?)  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a true NYC experience.

title: Our "Go To" choice for a Manhattan hotel
text:
This was our third stay at the Library Hotel.  Our initial choice to stay here was based on reviews from multiple travel sites including TA.  We make multiple trips a year to NYC and our preferred place to stay got converted to residences so we were looking for a "second home" kinda place where we were comfortable.

All of the previous reviews highlighted many of the features we find appealing as well including location (2 minute walk to Grand Central), nice rooms with very comfortable beds and great service.  We typically select the Junior Suite and it is very spacious and a great place to spend time.

The 24-hour lounge is AWESOME.  Coffee, tea, hot water, soft drinks and snacks are always available and the lounge itself is a great space to spend time (i.e. our morning routine is to walk out and grab breakfast nearby - breakfast burrito or egg bagel - bring it back to the lounge to enjoy.

Summarizing, all of the previous accolades are well-deserved and the Library Hotel continues to deliver making it our preferred lodging whenever we visit the Big Apple.

title: I shall definitely plan on a return visit.
text:
The staff was welcoming and very helpful and engaging.
It was nice to have the "reading room" where tea and coffee were always available.
The location was good for getting around the City.
Only suggestion is for a bit of better lighting for reading.

title: Favorite Manhattan hotel
text: This was my third stay at this comfortable, welcoming hotel. As a solo traveler, the location feels safe, and the hotel secure. The amenities are great, especially the "Reading Room" where coffee, tea, water, and snacks are always available.

title: Lovely Library
text: This quaint and clever hotel is super clean, in a great location, and provides the amenities most needed.  Staff are very kind and helpful. Note that the rooms are small but perfect if you are out and about the city most of the day!

title: Great experience
text: Wonderful location. I loved that there was a room with coffee and tea and access to the NYTimes for the morning and a rooftop bar for the evening before and/or after we met friends. The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Nice Experience
text: Very cute and quaint. Love the library feeling, being surrounded by books. Has an older feel but everything was very clean. It was our anniversary. When we walked into the hotel room, we noticed a chilled wine bottle with two wine glasses. Alongside a card saying “happy anniversary”. It was a nice touch.

title: Love it!
text: Loved Library Hotel.   Staff was so nice - before arrival and once I got there.  Loved shelves full of books in the room.   Bed very comfortable.   Actually talked to total strangers in the elevator about how much we liked the hotel and how we all plan to return!

title: Library Hotel is a Special Find!!!!
text: The Library Hotel is a real find!!! Beautifully located, the hotel is charming and so comfortable.  While the rooms are on the small side (hey, it's NYC!), they are beautifully appointed, very comfortable bed, and a lovely bathroom.  A huge plus is the second floor guest lounge, with comfortable seating and work tables and an open compliment of coffees, teas, sodas, Kind Bars, nuts and fruit - - a great place to visit quietly over coffee or look at emails.  I had a wonderful, early small-plates dinner in the 14th floor Bar before walking out to the theater.  Beautiful spaces in the bar, with outdoor rooftop seating for the warmer months!!  I'll go back!!!

title: Wonderful hotel!!
text: I loved everything about this hotel. Comfortable room, excellent location, rooftop bar, and 24 hour access to coffee (lattes!), sparkling water and snacks in the reading room. I wanted for nothing :)!

title: Loved this unique hotel
text: I loved everything about this hotel-the little details related to the books, the staff was so kind and helpful, and the bed was very comfortable. It was also in a great location super close to Bryant Park and the NY Public Library.

title: Lovely hotel
text: This was our first stay at Library Hotel (we’ve stayed at Hotel Giraffe, also part of the Library Hotel Collection, several times). The hotel was clean and quiet, with a great location and friendly staff. The on-site restaurant, Madison & Vine, was delicious with generous portions. We enjoyed our stay and appreciated that the standard check-out time of 1pm is later than most hotels - allows you to enjoy your final morning without having to rush to check out! The second floor lounge is a great space to relax and grab a snack, and the rooftop bar was the perfect spot to gather with friends before heading out to dinner. The price for the location and amenities is great. The rooms are small but no smaller than you’d expect from any Manhattan hotel, and we didn’t travel to NYC to just stay in our room all day!

title: Excellent!!
text: Rooms are very nice, lounge area with amenities is a great bonus, rooftop bar was lovely, what really made the stay special was the staff, who were so friendly and helpful. Even the noise from the street was not too intrusive, and the blackout shades were great.

title: Love this place
text: Thoughtfulhamenities, great pricing, fantastic location. THe 24-hour lounge is a huge bonus and room service was good and very reasonable compared to most hotels. The association with a very good local gym is fabulous; had a great workout. Coffee and water 24/7.

title: Fine but dated
text: I stayed here because of the reviews and the high rating and was a bit disappointed.  There was not anything wrong, but the hotel and the room did not feel like one of the best in NYC.  The bathtub and showerhead were old.  There was no hand-held shower.  The lighting in the room was insufficient - with a couple of sconces and a desk lamp - so the room was always somewhat dark.  The elevator felt old, too, and did not have any keycard access control (like I have seen in many other hotels), so anyone could just walk in off the street and take the elevator.  That being said, the bed was comfortable, the staff were pleasant, and the room was clean.   My room, a "deluxe king" was small, but the hotel is quite transparent (on their website) about the size and layout of the rooms.

title: So this is Manhattan.
text:
Nice, pleasant & comfortable.
I wish my grad school library was like this.
The 2nd Floor lounge was perfect.
Breakfast was a real treat.
I have walking past this location for almost 40 years and finally opened my eyes to this location. I have been dinning in the for 4 years and finally decided to stay, smart choice.

title: Warm, comfortable, great location too
text: The king bed was great and the sofa bed also was quite nice.  The room was a great size for a Manhattan hotel.  I loved the lounge area and the coffee /snacks / waters / sodas.  I used to live in Midtown and have stayed in many Midtown hotels since, and this was definitely my favorite so far.

title: Solid 4 stars
text:
Charming and understated, not to mention the superb location! My husband and I booked the junior suite with 1 king bed - the room is spacious and the bed is comfortable (6 pillows!) and there is ample closet space. However, the bathroom is cramped, with awkwardly low furnishings (the sink, tub, and toilet all appear to be fitted for ppl under 5ft), and the ventilation is terrible. Also, while the staff is warm and welcoming, the housekeeping quality is inconsistent (forgot to replenish toiletries and didn't wipe down mirrors). 

Aside from the room, we enjoyed the 24HR lounge (clean, cozy, and well-stocked) and the rooftop bar (Bookmarks), where the drinks are good (highly recommend Gone with the Gin) and hotel guests get a complimentary cheese plate. Overall it's a good bang for your buck and a very positive boutique hotel experience!

title: Great hotel!
text:
Quiet little respite in the heart of the busy city.
Loved this hotel!
Friendly helpful staff.
Comfy beds. 
Warm cozy rooms.
Cappuccino on the 2nd floor!
Can’t beat the location. A few doors down from Grand Central Ststion

title: Disappointed.
text: We went there after reading some reviews. It was difficult to find the place. The address leads you to Maddison, but the entrance is not there. And it is covered by contruction work. They are clearly understaffed. The room was small and definetely needed renovations. Little options for breakfast. Decent wi-fi.

title: Great hotel, though struggles with unseasonably warm weather in the winter
text: The Library Hotel and its sister, the Giraffe Hotel, are the ONLY places I stay when I travel to NYC. Both have great locations, and both make it easy to grab a coffee and snack in the morning. The only reason I downgraded this visit from excellent to very good is that there was really no way to cool the room other than opening the windows. I know it was unseasonably warm in January the days we were there, but there should still be a way to cool the room without opening windows that let in even more noise. Maybe this is an issue with the building overall and not necessarily the hotel. Otherwise, the same fantastic service, staff, and room were the same as before.

title: Excelente
text:
Todo excelente; la ubicación, la habitación, la limpieza , todo muy bien. 
Esta cerca de de Time Square, la estación central. 

La habitación está en perfectas condiciones; en general todo en el hotel está Perfecto

title: Convenient location for exploring
text: Convenient location (1 block from bryant park and literally steps away from grand central station). 24 hr snack bar secretly topped up to ensure snacks, coffees, water, sodas were in abundance (included with your stay). Friendly staff. Hotel felt safe. Bags were kept even after check out as we went exploring on foot.

title: Fantastic hotel in a perfect location
text: We loved our stay in the Library Hotel. We had a junior suite which was clean, spacious and tastefully decorated with a huge comfy bed. The reading room on floor two was a wonderfully tranquil space to relax and have a drink. The staff were friendly and efficient. The location was fabulous, Grand central a 5 minute walk and a Zuckers bagel shop just round the corner where we had breakfast each day. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Stunning
text:
Everything was amazing. This is a boutique hotel with so much books and history!!
It is a unique experience stay at the Library Hotel.
All very clean, comfortable and luxurious.
A few minutes away from Bryant Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue, but very calm and ideal to relax.
It has a beautiful rooftop.

title: Rund um gelungener Aufenthalt
text: Sehr schönes und ruhiges Hotel in zentraler Lage. Fenster zwar etwas hellhörig, aber für New York eher typisch. Der Aufenthaltsraum (The Library Room) war wunderbar für eine kurze Pause von der Großstadt. Wir haben in New York geheiratet und das komplette Personal war sehr zuvorkommend und hilfsbereit und vor allem sehr nett. Nicht so unpersönlich wie große Hotels.

title: Intimate gem of a hotel in the heart of midtown
text: Perfectly located hotel within easy walk of some of midtown's best attractions.  Delightfully cozy with great amenities, the inviting lounge always well stocked with snacks and drinks, comfortable, well appointed rooms, good restaurant with a cheerful vibe, and super views from the rooftop bar.  The staff is a great combination of professional and welcoming.  If you like a small, intimate, well managed hotel you can't do better than the Library Hotel and its sister hotel, The Casablanca.  I've been staying at one or the other of these hotels for years and I wouldn't stay any where else.

title: Lovely hotel and such friendly staff.
text:
Lovely little hotel and in a great location (2 mins from Bryant Park). 
The rooms are nice and quiet, with one of the most comfortable beds in a hotel I’ve ever slept in. 
The library is a great facility. Being able to grab hot and cold drinks, snacks and fruit whenever you need them is such a bonus. 
The staff are lovely, can’t do enough for you. 

Downsides: rooms are a little dark, could do with another light in middle of room. 
A coat stand would be handy, especially in winter months where coats, hats and gloves are needed.

title: Definitely recommend
text: An absolute 10/10. Highly recommend. This is a hidden gem. The room was clean. The staff, from the front desk to the lounge, was excellent. Definitely consider the Library Hotel if you’re in the Manhattan area.

title: Great hotel fantastic location
text:
Great hotel comfortable beds and cozy room. Breakfast was super and the rooftop fantastic nice bar and good restaurant very pleasant stay all over.
Location absolutely spot on for our sightseeing plans

title: The Perfect Boutique Manhattan Hotel
text:
I have stayed at many different hotels in NYC, but the Library Hotel is by far the best of them. We stayed for five nights. It's 3-4 blocks east of Times Square so you can avoid those crowds if you want to. It's half a block from Grand Central Station so you can get anywhere in the city easily.
The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The 2nd floor club room is spacious/comfortable and well stocked with drinks and snacks. They serve good coffee instead of the garbage you get at most hotels. They have a full bar on the 14th floor named  Bookmarks that has excellent cocktails and we never had any difficulty finding seating. 
The rooms are extremely comfy and they did an excellent job of putting lots of storage space in. Think good size closet and plenty of drawers so you can actually unpack. The bathroom has plenty of space of and the hot water is immediate and it has strong water pressure. This is not a huge hotel which means that you won't find yourself waiting 10 minutes for the elevator, and yes, that is a common problem in many NYC hotels. They also have an extremely convenient luggage storage system in place after you check out and you still have access to the 2nd floor club room that day. As a result, even though our flight home was at 7:30PM, we were able to fully enjoy our last day in the city. This hotel understands that just because you have to be out of your room, it doesn't mean your trip has to end that minute.
This is absolutely going to be my primary hotel in Manhattan going forward. With their combination of location, service, and comfort I have nothing bad to say about it. Five stars in every category.

title: Wonderful experience!
text: My room was as pictured and had everything I needed. The staff was wonderful and went above and beyond to make me feel like a valued guest. The amenities are terrific, especially the lounge with coffee, water and snacks on the 2nd floor, which make the resort fee worthwhile. The location is great!

title: Great hotel
text: Very nice hotel in a great location, staff really nice and helpful. Easy to get around with central station around the corner and rooftop bar great. We stayed in petite room for a week and was fine for two people and great shower. Cheeseboard at bookmarks lovely

title: Worth every penny
text: this is one of the only hotels that were as advertised. We travel on average 4 vacations per year and this hotel was spot on. Breakfast was very good, staff was ready to help in every way and there was a buss to the city at the front door. Great place to be.

title: Charming hotel
text: A well located, very charming and with a very friendly staff hotel.  I am aready looking forward to another stay, as soon as possíble. I highly recomend anyone to try the reservation directly through their website..

title: A Hotel Gem
text:
A beautiful, classy, comfortable, friendly, accommodating hotel. 

Spotlessly clean throughout.

Our room was cosy and comfortable with daily house keeping bringing fresh towels, cleaning the bathroom, hoovering and bed making.

On the second floor there is a relaxed lounge with fresh coffee, tea, cold drinks, fruit and snacks available 24/7. 

On the 14th floor there is a relaxed, bouji little roof top bar with access to a cute roof terrace.

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
This is my favorite hotel in NYC. The library  concept is witty and fun. The rooms are numbered on the Dewey decimal system. Each room has a theme, tied to the books available inside. The second-floor lounge is a pleasant place to hang out, drink an expresso, and eat a banana. The rooms are small, but well-appointed. I wish breakfast were included, but it's available just downstairs at Madison and Vine.
Thank you!

title: Dream stop.
text: I looked forward to visiting the Library Hotel again since my visit in 2017, and I wasn't disappointed by the staff or the room. I did miss the wine and cheese get together and the breakfast, but the cheese platter I got with the two beverages on the roof was substantial. I will be back.

title: Beautiful Home Away from Home
text: Wonderful 2 night stay at this cozy home away from home. Very clean and staff was wonderful! Room service was delicious and delivered fast. Roof top bar and lounge was a very relaxing spot to wind down after long office days.

title: Cozy and well-appointed hotel
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Library Hotel. There were lots of personal touches like books in every room and a lovely lounge on the second floor that provided a quiet place to work, read, and enjoy a cup of coffee and snack. I also loved the restaurant on the first floor, Madison and Vine. Great food and atmosphere!

title: Relaxing, cozy, quaint and creative.
text: I stayed at the Library hotel for 6 nights. I used the left over credit from my family who was going to get married there, however, it didn't happen due to the pandemic. I had a wonderful time, and I'm glad their credit did not go to waste!

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Best location, just far enough and yet close enough to Times Square. Close to Bryant park and Grand Central Station.  Hotel is very clean and service is impeccable.  Restaurant offers excellent breakfast, lunch and dinner options.

title: Great location, cool theme and great service.
text: Extremely well situated, just minutes from the Grand Central Terminal and a fifteen minute walk to Times Square.  Modest size but well appointed room.  Cool library theme throughout the hotel including the stair well.  We stayed in the Logic themed room.  Rather pricey roof top bar, is the only modest complaint.  We would not hesitate to return.

title: Life-saving Espresso Machine
text: Great location and quiet by New York standards. We stayed in the Junior Suite with two people which I highly recommend because we had plenty of room. The second floor lounge was the best. We were always stocked with coke, coffee/espresso and snacks. Perfect stay!

title: Comfy, Cozy, Clean, Convenient, Courteous
text: What could be better? Seriously, not a gimmick. From check in to check out, all was perfect. First off, everything is spotless, & I'm a clean freak so that's number one. Second, Comfort. I'm pretty high maintenance and our king bed was dreamy. Even breakfast at Vine & Madison, below the hotel was scrumptious & service sweet. Great location, nothing untoward in this part of Gotham. Perfect on all counts and we will definitely stay at the Library Hotel again. (Added plus, walking distance to Le Parisien on 33rd, a personal fave).

title: You will never stay anywhere else
text: Absolutely the most perfect location with the most amazing amenities! Having access to snacks and water around the clock really made the trip easier, especially after a long walk around the city. Plus the beds are ridiculously comfortable. Do yourself a favor and stay here. A block from the library and bryant park one way and grand central tge other. And if you have a chance make sure to give the restaurant a chance (especially breakfast). All in all perfect.

title: A Charming Spot
text: A sweet hotel  in a great location. The rooftop bar and lounge was very cool. The staff was helpful and capable. The room was small but cute. Bryant Park was just around the corner with lots of food vendors and handmade items.

title: On my bucket list...
text:
A friend in my book group mentioned to us that she had stayed at the Library Hotel on a visit to NYC. She described how special it was to stay there. Since hearing her praises, it's been on my bucket list to visit. When fortune allowed my husband and I to meet our son's family in NYC, I knew exactly where I would be booking.
All of us enjoyed our stay at the Library Hotel. Definitely not a cookie cutter chain. Delightfully decorated with books throughout, it offered a cozy inviting atmosphere. Our rooms (a king next to a junior suite) were thoughtfully arranged and private. The bed was comfortable and storage was adequate. We especially enjoyed the rooftop bar. We were fortunate to enjoy the warm weather outdoors with our delicious cocktails. Kudos to the bartender and staff. 
We started our morning on the second floor with complimentary coffee, energy bars, and fruit. We even learned how to operate the expresso machine. It was lovely setting in which to relax before hitting the sidewalks and subways.
The front desk employees were friendly and helpful from getting us quickly checked in, to holding luggage after check out until we could leave for our flight, and efficiently ordering us a cab.
Our family highly recommends the Library Hotel and hopes all visitors will enjoy it as much as we did!

title: A great boutique hotel!
text: The Library Hotel has a great location and wonderful staff. The hotel’s amenities, like the 24hr. reading room and attached restaurant, are terrific for a small hotel. The rooms are a good size and are well appointed. We had a great stay and will be back-we loved the book theme!

title: A lovely Stay
text:
The entire staff was welcoming and helpful. The hotel interior is lovely, my room was small but cozy and impeccably clean. The area (close to Grand Central Station) is a great location. l also appreciated the 1:00pm check-out time which allowed me to have a leisurely lunch (while reading my book) before departure to the airport. 
Would definitely recommend!

title: I love the Library Hotel
text: Great hotel in a good location and it was easy to get access hotel and get around. The room was quiet,  clean and I felt very welcome at the hotel. I enjoyed the lounges and the bed was very comfortable.  Would definitey stay again!!

title: Great place to stay in New York
text: Pleasant staff. Comfortable room. Wonderful lounge to relax.Great location near Bryant Park. Very unique hotel with rooms which have a theme. Books everywhere including the room which add to the ambulance.

title: New Zealand to New York!
text: My daughter and I travelled to NYC primarily as a birthday celebration.  She turned 17 while we were there and I had turned a much older age in August.  For me, NYC was one of my ultimate destinations and for daugher?  Well, she is lucky to tick off such an awesome city without having to wait as long as I did...  We travelled 15+ hours on a direct flight.  And how happy we were to have booked two nights at the Library Hotel before moving into an AirBNB in Greenwich Village.  The hotel suited us down to the ground.  It was a safe haven in the middle of the city.  It's location is so close to 1 Vanderbilt and Grand Central Station.  We travelled from Grand Central on our second day out to the Yankees ball game (they lost!) and we visited 1 Vanderbilt on our third day.  On our first evening, we had a cheese board/drinks in the roof top bar (ask about the in-house guest cheese board special) and then we wandered down to Times Square...  Wonderful!  The staff are helpful, friendly and professional.  The room was large for the two of us (we selected carefully) and very clean.  The location is so central.  And we were able to use the second floor lounge when we came back to pick up our bags at the end of day three.  We highly recommend the hotel and look forward to returning in the near future!  Thank you all so much for such a memorable and special holiday!

title: Great location
text: Great little hotel. Perfect location. Lovely and helpful staff. Roof top bar is worth a visit. Rooms small but very functional. All you need.  The resort fee included bottled and canned beverages, fruit and coffee which was great. Highly recommend

title: Bibliophile alert!
text: What a fabulous location and lovely decor! Staff were friendly and attentive. Room was comfortable and entertaining (with books galore!) Strong recommendation for a bibliophile traveler to NYC! Loved the bookwalk outside its doors as well!

title: Amazing Hotel
text: This hotel was amazing! The staff was wonderful and helpful and the room was the perfect size for my mom and me to share. The rooftop bar is lovely with an amazing view of the New York Library. The second-floor lounge was the perfect place to grab a cup of coffee and sit for a little while between activities. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York.

title: Almost like home
text: I came to New York a day early on a business trip for some rejuvenation time. The Library Hotel provided a cozy, friendly, warm atmosphere to relax and read with a good glass of wine. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the location is great for walking and seeing major cultural institutions like the renowned Morgan Library. I will come back every chance I have!

title: Charming space and excellent staff
text: We've traveled a bit since summer 2021 and have had fun stays in various hotels, but this felt like our first "real" hotel experience that matched our expectations at this price point based on our pre-pandemic experiences. Attention to detail, genuinely caring staff, and the whole vibe of the place was relaxing and comfortable. We had been wanting to stay here for a long time, ever since we heard about the cute concept back in the early 2000s, so our expectations were high. Location was perfect for us and we loved having the peaceful lounge with 24 hour access to a nice espresso machine, plus the charm of the curated books in the room. I would stay here again.

title: An Overall Wonderful Stay
text: This is a quaint NYC hotel that makes you feel like you have a peaceful respite in the midst of the crowded city.  While the hotel offers no breakfast we did find fruits and granola type bars and a variety of teas and coffees in the snack lounge.  A breakfast would have been nicer but since the pandemic many places have discontinued that.  There is a great place across the street called Essen where you can get hot breakfasts to go and lunches and fruits and snacks and it is super fresh and they are so accommodating and helpful.  We did that and ate in the snack lounge on the second floor.  The bathroom was clean and had a tub/shower combo and we had counter space by the sink and a long glass shelf for our toiletries plus a glass ledge behind the door for our flat iron and hair products....plenty of room.  We had a super large desk in the room to eat on or put makeup on and a small but adequate tv.  The one glaring negative was the bed.....the worst and most uncomfortable bed.  The bed was extremely sunken in and was like both of us were sleeping in a hole....it was obvious the springs were shot on it.  The one biggest positive is the extremely helpful attitude of all the staff - they will do virtually anything to accommodate you and make your stay a pleasant one.  For example - this neighborhood is in the business district and as such it is very crowded mornings and late afternoons as people get to and leave work.  It is impossible to get a taxi on your own and the apps are sketchy.   If you go to the main desk they will get a cab for you within a few minutes and if they are not busy they will run outside and flag down the cab and open the door for you.   We cannot speak highly enough about the entire staff.  Due to the horrible, extremely uncomfortable bed we cannot give the hotel five stars but rather only four.

title: Delightful
text: The library hotel was just perfect for the weekend.  The rooms are small but well appointed - excellent beds/bedding, robe, etc.  and it was so nice to be in a hotel that managed to have a theme without being silly.  Somehow, it was perfectly quiet and yet also in the middle of it all. We loved walking to the library and seeing the quotes on the sidewalk, it was around the corner from a number of great coffee shops, restaurants, green spaces, and subway stations and the rooftop garden was delightful.  The staff was also very pleasant  and helpful.  Simply put, it was a great find and I will definitely return.

title: What a gem of a hotel!
text:
We had a credit at this hotel from before COVID and over 2 1/2 years, the Library hotel preserved our credit and reminded us not to forget it. Finally in the Fall of 2022, we were able to go to NY and use it. And because of this hotel, we had a splendid time! It was close to all the things we wanted to walk to (Broadway shows, Morgan Library, NY Public Library and Bryant Park.) The book themed rooms were comfortable and bathrooms modern. And the 24 hour eating sitting room was so convenient when we came back from an expedition! 
Thank you to the wonderful staff for their kindness!

title: Quaint Hotel
text: Lovely small hotel!  Loved the coffee bar and snacks readily available.  Very quiet, very clean!  Enjoyed my stay! Very close to Times Square and all amenities.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect location
text: Perfect location, within walking distance to Grand Central, Empire State Building, Bryant Park, Times Square and the theatre district.  Quiet, on a charming street dubbed Library Way.  Loved the whole experience! Would definitely go back!

title: Comfortable, relaxing, with the best staff in NYC.
text: We have stayed at the Library Hotel many times, always enjoying the comfortable bed, well-designed rooms, welcoming reading room and top-floor bar, and gracious front-desk staff. The staff outdid themselves on our last visit, however: We got a call after we'd left that the cleaning people had found a ring in one of the rooms we'd occupied. It was my 93-year-old mother's engagement ring which had somehow slipped off her finger after seven decades! We are so grateful to have been able to retrieve it. This act of honesty and kindness has won the hotel our lifelong loyalty. Thank you, Library Hotel.

title: Elegant, yet intimate facility with excellent service and very convenient location
text: The clever conjunction of the Library's theme with the nearby New York Public Library (a magnificent work of architecture) is emphasized by attractive and well-appointed rooms - each with a distinct literary theme that is matched by the many books displayed therein. Perusing the latter is a most enjoyable bonus.

title: Great customer service
text: We had a corporate offsite in the executive boardroom. The Library Hotel staff were very responsive and helpful throughout our events. The team sincerely enjoyed their stay. We also had a great event at the Bookmarks bar. Special thanks to Justin S. at the hotel for great service.

title: A real treasure at the center of midtown
text: Not only did this hotel excel at the core points of any travel experience (i.e. location, price, room size, bath, supplementary snacks and water), it was perfect to the tiniest details. As book lovers we enjoyed the library as much as the beautiful decorated room and rooftop bar. The bathroom are generous in size as well as in the supplementary accessoires. Helpful and charming staff to the last second. A real delightful stay! We will be back for sure!

title: Little gem of an hotel, centrally located.
text: A brilliant little hotel only 14 storeys high! Beautifully decorated to a high standard.  Rooms were superb.  Had a free lounge on 2 fresh coffee 24/7 fruit and snacks. Staff were friendly and efficient.  Centrally located great value for money. Had its own wine bar where you could get breakfast or dinner. The roof garden was brilliant great for drinks and cocktails

title: Loud AC noise woke us up throughout night.
text: My Husband and I travelled to New York for the US open and selected this hotel based on the close proximity to the subway station so we could quickly travel to the Tennis Center and also based on the trip advisor reviews. We were in room 400.006 and the air conditioner made an extremely loud noise that woke us up throughout the night every time the AC went on. If we did not run the AC the room was hot. The hotel staff advised that there are certain hotel rooms that have this issue issue and they would let us cancel our remaining days with no charge. We paid over $500 per night for the hotel room and could not find any other available options that were not significantly higher. In addition, it would have been very inconvenient to change hotels given we had tennis tickets for matches. Do not stay in this room.

title: Good but not fantastic
text:
Great staff and superb location close to Bryant Park. We had executive rooms which were really nice, so why only 4 stars.
1) AC that went of every 10-15 minutes and made a lot of noise
2) The hotel was a bit dated and in need of refurbishment

Otherwise this was an exellent stay. We fell in love with Bryant Park and the hotel surroundings. We visited both Central Station and Vanderbilt One in the immediate proximity and strolled down to Broadway to see a show and to Times Square for the vibe.
The second floor lounge was also visited frequently and the Bookmarks Lounge on the rooftop was small, intimate and simply beautiful.
The air in the room and the matress were very nice. We did not have breakfast.
The staff helped with every need we had and could not do enough for us.

title: Shhhhh - Don't Tell
text:
I'm reluctant to write this review -- because it felt like we found a secret hotel and well, don't want the secret to get out.

A frequent visitor to NYC -- I usually stayed further north and east - nearer to where my father lived.  This was to be our first visit since he passed, and we decided to branch out a bit.  After perusing hotels online for quite a while, we decided on the Library Hotel - loved the theme of the books.

I arrived on a Wednesday - entered a lobby full of books - and went to check in.  (Admittedly had trouble getting in the two doors - no doorman around.) The staff was particularly friendly and accommodating - not something I'm used to in NYC.  We all wanted a little more room -- so we booked two Junior Suites -- a bit higher priced -- but with a fabulous view of the NY Public Library - lots of space - and a lot of light.  The bathroom was larger than most I've encountered in the city.  The bed was super comfortable - my aching back appreciated it - and the room had a sitting area that was inviting.  I was in the Fashion Design room -- and had a blast looking primarily at the picture books!

My son arrived with his girlfriend on Thursday.  They were given the Astronomy room - another suite, virtual duplicate of mine, with the same views and light.

The Madison & Vine restaurant downstairs serves a decent breakfast, lunch, and dinner -- I think we had at least one of each meal.  The convenience of an eatery in the building was much appreciated.

The 2nd floor reading room was available 24 hours, with water, coffee, fruit and snacks.  Available to all.

We went to Bookmarks, the rooftop bar, on two occasions -- I loved the "Gone with the Gin" cocktail, my son preferred the 'Gatsby' and his girlfriend tried a bunch of different things.  I was told that if you're staying in the hotel (Bookmarks gets a lot of business that is not staying there) - you receive a complimentary cheese tray if you order two drinks.  We were thrilled with the quality of the cheese tray.

Every employee with whom we engaged  was friendly and helpful.  

We loved the location, easy walk to theater district, and to many other sites.  FYI, it's well worth it to sign up for the free tour of the Library!

When, in the morning,  we reported a problem with a slow draining tub -- voila - it was fixed.

We will definitely be back -- IF they have room!  It's a small hotel and my son tried to book a return trip in October -- alas, no availability.

title: Bibliophile's dream
text:
I loved this hotel & would go back in a heartbeat.  Great location, friendly staff.  My room was on the smaller side but worked well for me as a solo traveller.
Two blocks from the New York Public Library, not much farther to the Morgan Library, easy walk to subway, plenty of restaurants (I didn't eat at the hotel itself but it was popular).  Good choice for bibliophiles.

title: A bibliophile’s dream
text:
We are so happy that we choose Library Hotel for our 3-day stay. The welcoming staff at reception, the pleasant bar tenders, and the ever-cheerful door man were top notch. Our room was extremely comfortable, and I appreciated that bathtub after a day of walking. Location is perfect; it was a short walk to Grand Central Terminal, to New York Public Library, and an easy ramble to MoMA. 

The Reading Room, with its many books and round-the-clock snacks, was a bonus.  It also had faster wifi than our room, so an extra latte was enjoyed while sending emails. 

When we return to NYC, this will be our hotel of choice, and would happily stay in Room 1, 8th floor again.  Thanks to Henry and team for making our stay an enjoyable one.

title: Wonderfully unique hotel
text: This wonderfully unique hotel is in a great location close to the theater district and Times Square, shopping, restaurants and much more. Thoughtful amenities are included like a rooftop garden on the 14th floor and 24 hour library with complimentary beverages, fruit and snacks.

title: Generous and Friendly
text: Friendly and helpful staff. Great amenities for a business trip - various work areas, generous snacks, waters, coffee, and access to restaurants. Rooms are cozy and well maintained. Strong Wi-Fi and mostly adult professionals and couples.

title: Just Perfect!
text:
I visited with my husband as part of a trip celebrating our silver wedding anniversary- thanks to the Library for honouring the price from 2 years ago when we originally booked our holiday! 
It was so lovely to be greeted at the front desk with a cheery “welcome back Mrs Murray!” (I’d stayed before 9 years ago with our daughter.)  
All of the essentials are top notch- location, staff, cleanliness, amenities. Absolutely no standards have slipped from our previous visit. It says a lot that on a trip where we stayed in 4 excellent hotels, the Library was our favourite! I can’t recommend this gorgeous hotel enough- don’t hesitate to book, you won’t be disappointed! 
Librarians; we are already saving up for our next trip!

title: An amazing couple nights at the Library Hotel
text: The place is beautiful and clean, with a lounge with complementary drinks and snacks. The rooftop bar was awesome as well as the restaurant downstairs. The guest services were excellent! We will be coming back for sure!

title: Great stay
text: The staff is super friendly and willing to help. Location was pretty good - close to the office I was visiting and also close to several attractions. It was a bit challenging to find the entrance at first, but once I did, the whole experience was great. Hotel offers an amazing guest lounge, opened 24x7. Will definitely return.

title: My Petit Room Was Perfect
text: The Petit Room was on the small side, but it was so perfectly laid out that it felt spacious. It was just right for one person. The library theme is charming, and I liked having a selection of books right in the room. Excellent location, a lovely rooftop lounge, and a good restaurant on the ground floor. The Library Hotel has it all.

title: Family vacation
text: Wonderful experience, as always.  Great location and friendly staff.  Super quiet room.  Snacks are a plus.  Bryant Park is great to sit and people watch.  Love the closeness to the library.  Will stay here again.

title: Location, amenities, comfort- will be back!
text:
Just book it and don't look back, this hotel is a gem and WORTH EVERY PENNY 

My husband and I stayed here for four night during our most recent stay to NY. We LOVED it! Here are some of the highlights for us: 
-Luggage storage for early arrivals 
-2nd floor library open 24/7 that is fully stocked with waters, coffee machine, LaCroix, soft drinks, snacks and a million books
-Room had all of the amenities you would need (and if it did not include something, they would bring it to you- we frequently called for more coffee). 
-Rooftop bar with great views, breeze and happy hour specials each night 
-Great location walking distance to all the sites and great restaurants! 

10/10 will do it again!

title: Another Visit to the Library Hotel
text: Another enjoyable stay at the Library Hotel! Attentive staff. Rooms clean, comfortable and cozy. Rooftop bar is a must see. Restaurant Madison and Vine is next door, a great spot for brunch, lunch or dinner. Hotel is conveniently located on the East Side near shopping, restaurants and cafes. Bryant Park a block away. Looking forward to our next visit!

title: Literary oasis in midtown
text: Really enjoyed the stay, great location, clean, well thought out room. Hosts were friendly and helpful. Lovely to have the restaurant, roof bar and nice lounge making you feel like the whole hotel is the executive floor. Cost is expensive, but comparable or less than similar properties.  Mild issues were somewhat soft mattress; not my favorite style and that the AC system is fairly noisy, making it harder to sleep. Shame as the room was nice and quiet otherwise.

title: Charming and well appointed.
text: Charming hotel. Felt welcome the moment we stepped in. From the front desk to the roof top bar, all those caring for us were hospitable and gracious. Room was well appointed. Would recommend being on a top floor. Be sure to check out the roof top bar.  We had yummy drinks and a wonderful server.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Most comfortable hotel bed ever, plush towels, friendly staff, great roof bar, well-stocked “reading room,” convenient location.  Don’t miss the free weekend summer concerts in the evenings down the street at Bryant Park.

title: Recomendable (pero fíjate en el tamaño de la cama)
text:
Muy buena experiencia, salvo por un tema que cuento más adelante. Hotel no muy grande, limpio, agradable, bonito (como se ve en las fotos, prácticamente), con libros en todas las habitaciones, y MUY bien situado.
Estuvimos muy cómodos.
No tiene restaurante como tal, pero en la segunda planta ofrecen algo de fruta, algún snack y puedes servirte un café americano o un refresco. Incluido en el precio de la habitación.
Y junto al hotel, hay un restaurante donde se come/desayuna bien.
En nuestra habitación, había una radio/despertador de Apple que permitía cargar el IPhone, lo cual nos vino muy bien.
*** Habíamos reservado una habitación con cama Queen size que, salvo error, es de 150 cm.
Nos dieron una de 135 cm indicando que las medidas de EE.UU. son diferentes a las de Europa. No quisimos discutir.
Cambiamos a una King size pagando un plus de 35$/día.
El personal, a excepción de la que nos dio la habitación (que fue correcta pero inevitablemente nos dejó mal sabor de boca), encantador.

title: A Gem in NYC!
text: Incredibly welcoming and friendly staff. Rooms are clean. There is a lounge on the second floor stocked with free water, beverages and a real espresso machine! Plus snacks and fresh fruit. The rooftop lounge is lovely! The hotel also has a 1:00pm checkout! Who does that these days?!! What a gem of a hotel! Best place we have stayed in NYC.

title: We love the library hotel!
text: This was our second stay at the The Library Hotel.  The staff are amazing and so helpful!  Rooms are comfy and clean.   Relaxing roof top bar!  The library theme is so fun!  Restaurant attached (Madison and Vine) has great food!

title: Good...but be aware!
text:
Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July - Junior Suite.

The good - beautiful hotel (property) and room.  Well located.  Staff were friendly in general.

The bad - A/C unit in our room was VERY loud.  I could not sleep the first night and had to permanently leave just the fan on during the night to make sure it would not cycle on and off.  The drains (bathtub and sink) would drain very slowly at times.  I raised both of these issues to the front desk - they said they would look into but did not follow-up with me and nothing changed.  Overall, they did not seem to care too much about it was the impression I got.  Its an older building so I suppose it comes with the territory.

title: Unique Boutique Hotel
text: Great hotel in the heart of the city. It was clean, the bed was comfortable and I loved the uniqueness of the books in every room with a couple of free books to take home. Lovely front desk staff and centrally located for our business trip. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed in the Love Room with private balcony where we enjoyed our morning coffees and also wine from lounge with complimentary cheese board. Our 3rd stay here- lovely ambiance and great amenities. Classic NYC

title: Beautiful, clean, spacious hotel. Highly recommend!
text: Absolutely loved our stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful; the hotel was well kept and clean. Our room was spacious and had a great lay out. Was happy to have an in-room refrigerator. Elevators were quick and our room was quiet. The lounge was a nice, calming space to come to at the end of a long day in the city. I found the hotel centrally located with a 15 minute walk in any direction of where I wanted to go. I would highly recommend staying at the Library Hotel.

title: Lovely Hotel in an Ideal Location!
text: My husband and I absolutely loved The Library Hotel in NYC! The hotel location was perfect and the hotel staff was on point.  Friendly and helpful and very presentable. Loved the library theme of the hotel and our room (Junior Suite on 10th floor) was top-notch! Great views of the city including direct view to the NYC Public Library! One of the most comfortable hotel beds we have ever slept on, which made us very happy since we stayed for 5 nights! Wonderful night's sleep EVERY night! Rooftop lounge was wonderful and specialty cocktails were delicious. We also loved the 2nd floor library sitting/coffee room; that room was a great amenity for our stay! For our next visit to NYC, we will definitely be booking and staying at The Library Hotel again! Highly recommend!

title: Nice hotel with wonderful staff.
text: Very good hotel. Clean and unique. Scaffold was up so took a little away from the ambience. Great staff. Room was very small but laid out well. Pillows could be softer but everything was clean. Wonderful coffee and snacks on the second floor all day!

title: Great Place To Stay!
text: We truly enjoyed staying at the Library Hotel.  The themed rooms are unique and cozy.  The second floor lounge is a great place to hang out and grab coffee, drinks and snacks.  The location is perfect - walking distance to great restaurants, shows and museums.  Highly recommend.

title: We will absolutely be back.
text: We absolutely LOVED our stay at Library Hotel in NYC.  It was comfortable, convenient and the Library tea room was fantastic and a great place to plan each days adventures and to regroup at the end of the day.

title: luxury in the city
text: Excellent service clean beautiful rooms Second floor felt like home Love the roof top bar beds are very comfortable location is perfect water in shower is hot Bathrobes in rooms are absorbant and warm fit for kings  and queens

title: Reading room for a break before check-in
text:
Great location, the surroundings were bright and lively even at 10pm, safe for solo female traveler’s, its a stone’s throw away from Grand Central station as well.
Loved the Reading room where I could rest before check-in time. 
Staff were friendly and helpful.
Price was rather expensive though and wished there was breakfast provided because it’s hard to eat out alone when food portions are that huge. I had to live off the snack and fruit bar the whole time.

title: Discover NYC
text:
Ideal location to take off for Sight Seeing, Shopping and Culture.
Cosy and very personal hotel with style and love for books and literature. 
The second floor is a marvelous area to either recharge for  or recover from New York City.
Roof top feeling before bed time completed the day.
Thanks a lot to friendly team and stuff.  We will remember this stay in NYC.
Lisa and Martha

title: Loved our stay
text: The hotel was very clean, quiet, and cozy. The reading room with the coffee bar was a nice surprise. We enjoyed some espresso and cappuccino during our stay. The roof top bar was lovely and quiet. The only issue we had was that the front desk told us (twice) that 2 drinks and a cheeseboard were included in our stay. They were wrong. The bar told us it was a complimentary cheese board for hotel guests with a purchase of 2 drinks. They did give us the drinks for free since we were not told the correct information and we were not the only ones who were told this. However, we were not able to get the cheese board because the kitchen closed at 1030 pm and we did not get there until 11pm. The bar is open until midnight. Otherwise we loved our stay.

title: Great hotel in mid-Manhattan
text: Rooms are immaculate , quiet, and tastefully decorated,  Location is perfect for walking to theaters, restaurants, shopping, and museums.  Best of all, the hotel staff exceeded our expectations....we'll be back!

title: Polite staff that does everything they can to make you feel like you're their only guest
text:
Exceptionally friendly staff and a great location. The ambiance is 2nd to none. Great rooftop bar too!
It's a romantic and cute hotel. The breakfast was tasty. I would be happy to go back there and will probably stay there during my future travels to the city.

title: Love books?
text: Small, lovely hotel on Madison Ave. staff very accommodating..check out the literary quotes embedded in the sidewalk leading up to the NY Public library. Close to grand Central Terminal and subway.  Good restaurants are close by..theaters easily walkable.  Will stay there again definitely

title: Great Guest Services
text: My initial room had HVAC and sink issues. The HVAC was leaking and the sink did not work. Guest services was very prompt in assigning me a new room. They were also flexible with extending my stay during a peak travel weekend.

title: A wonderful stay at the Library Hotel.
text: A small boutique hotel close to many sites. It is one block from Bryant Park, very pleasant place to sit and have coffee. We walked too many places, including the theater district, highline and museums. The staff was friendly and helpful. The lounge on the second floor is a very pleasant place to sit relax and have coffee.

title: For all book lovers in a great licstion
text: Great location and I loved the 2nd floor lounge with its amazing espresso machine and great snacks. The room was comfortable and the quietest hotel room I’ve ever had. I also enjoyed reading one of the books in our room. I didn’t need to bring one with me. Every staff person was helpful and friendly.

title: A perfect location
