text: A perfect location to explore Manhattan, the cosy rooftop bar is a must. Rooms are a bit tight, but perfectly suited to accommodate your needs. The service is friendly and you can sense the family spirit. We‘ll be back 😊

title: A Perfect Choice
text: The Library is the perfect hotel for a NYC trip. The accommodations are lovely, and the hotel is located just around the corner from Grand Central Station. Our daughter attended Fordham University, and we chose The Library when rooms were available on our visits. The college was just a 20 minute train ride.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: Comfortable, clean rooms with a fridge and free waters, a great lounge/library  with free snacks and beverages (an oasis when you are tired) and a lovely rooftop terrace with a bar.  The hotel staff were very helpful and kind.  Liked the Madison and Vine restaurant too for breakfast and the overall location.  Would love to stay again.

title: Guest service
text: Complimentry wine and cheese from the rooftop bar was impossible. So  many non guests filled the space so no service. Front desk could not get rooftop bar to answer phone for guest assistance.   Resort fee covers coffee and breakfast bars  Long time fan of this hotel but times have changed

title: Charmant et pour l'amour des livres
text:
Charmant hôtel idéalement situé dans Midtown, à deux pas de la Bibliothèque, de Grand Central et du Chrysler Building. Comme son nom l'indique, cet hôtel thématique est dédié aux livres. On en trouve partout, dans le joli salon de lecture et dans toutes les chambres, celles-ci étant baptisées en fonction du genre de littérature qu'on y trouve. Déco très cosy, très soignée. Nous avions la "love room", au 11e étage, qui est la seule à disposer d'une mini-terrasse au-dessus de Madison Av... Toute la magie de New York! L'accueil est très sympathique, le confort douillet, idéal pour faire un break en fin de journée avant de repartir en vadrouille.
Seul bémol: à près de 500 dollars la nuit, nous aurions apprécié un petit déjeuner continental (il n'y a que du café ou du thé, des bananes et quelques barres de céréales!), ainsi qu'un petit buffet "wine and cheese" en fin de journée comme cela se pratique fréquemment dans ce type d'hôtel. Lorsque nous avions réservé (juste avant le covid) cela était d'ailleurs mentionné comme disponible. Mais la réception nous a expliqué que cela avait été supprimé avec la pandémie. Dommage que cela n'ait pas été rétabli car le prix des chambres, lui, n'a pas baissé (et New York a retrouvé une vie normale!) 
Mais une adresse à conseiller vivement malgré cela...

title: Highly recommended
text: This boutique hotel is in a great location for all your business, shopping, and travel needs.  I found the staff to be extremely helpful from providing an Apple Watch charger to sending me something valuable I forgot in the safe.  I highly recommend the Library Hotel in NYC.

title: Lovely weekend stay
text: It was our first stay at the Library Hotel and I would be happy to return. Classic small NYC rooms, but well appointed. We loved the location with easy access to Grand Central, Bryant Park, and, of course, the main branch of the NYC Public Library. The theme was carried out well throughout the hotel with my favorite being the classy painting of library stacks inside the staircase (often a neglected area). Having snacks, fruit, water, and other drinks available at all times in the reading room was lovely. My only complaint was that I had been in touch with the concierge prior to our stay and mentioned that it was our wedding anniversary and that was not acknowledged in any way by staff. Even a welcome note in the room referencing the special occasion would have helped make our stay more personal

title: Love this place!
text: Fourth stay here.  It is charming and comfortable.  Clean and decorated in such a classy way.  We love the book theme.  The location absolutely cannot be beat for Manhattan.  Staff is efficient, friendly, and helpful.

title: Friendly boutique hotel
text: Stayed here at short notice when the hotel I had booked turned out to have construction work outside. Friendly boutique hotel well situated in mid town NYC. The room was tiny but staff were pleasant and helpful and the second floor lounge area was a pleasant haven.  Definitely recommended.

title: Very pleased first-timer
text: A warm and welcoming staff, always available, friendly, helpful and unpretentious. Wonderful spaces to read (second floor reading room, 14th floor space and terrace). Good food in the first floor associated restaurant. Great location - 1 block from Bryant Park and 1 block from Grand Central.

title: Top notch
text: A great experience - a gorgeous room, a great location and an excellent breakfast. The club room arrangement shone mainly because we were invited to use it during the day after we'd checked out. Lovely to come back to pick up your bags and be able to sit down for a coffee. Next time in New York, we'll come back.

title: Lovely hotel - will definitely return
text: We spent 6 nights at the Library Hotel at the beginning of March and had a great time.  The room was lovely, with fab views up and down Madison Avenue.  Facilities were good, staff were charming and the location is excellent.

title: Lovely boutique hotel with a fantastic location!
text: Friendly and helpful front desk staff. Quick and easy check in. We loved the common room with drinks and snacks! The hotel stored my bag and gave me access to the common area even though I had checked out earlier in the day. Fantastic location!

title: friendly, clean, convenient
text: Friendly staff, clean room, great location.  We have stayed in many different Manhattan hotels over the past few decades.  This was our second visit in the past year and we'll plan to return again in the future.  Please keep up the great work!

title: Back to NYC
text: This was our first stay at The Library but definitely not our last-will be back!!  We were graciously greeted as soon as we entered the door.  The staff was friendly and willing to assist.  Felt like we were longtime guests!  The location of the hotel is perfect-walking distance to everything (5th Avenue, MOMA, Theatre District, NYC Library, St. Patrick's and a nice walk to Central Park and the Met).  This has become our favorite hotel to stay in NYC.  Will definitely recommend to friends!!

title: Library Hotel: An Urban Oasis
text: We had a wonderful stay at Library Hotel. The hotel is located convenient to many key landmarks and attractions such as Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, The New York Public Library as well as numerous subway stations. Yet, it is relatively peaceful and quiet. They have a lounge that’s open to hotel guests 24/7 and is well-supplied with coffee, tea, water, fruits and snacks. This calm spot is useful for taking breaks after a long day exploring the city, or to recharge before heading out to a night on the town. We will definitely be back!

title: Excellent service and restful ambiance
text: Lovely staff, accommodations and great location!  Allowed for a very early check in after a long red-eye flight. This was our first getaway from the kids the early check in saved our sanity and allowed for for a great first evening in NYC. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. The love room lived up to expectations. 😘

title: A perfectionist’s dream hotel!
text: Perfection. I’d give it ten stars if I could! I’m one of those weirdo people that will inspect every inch of a hotel room and I can tell you, there is not a fault to be found here. So clean and well maintained, I could quite happily live in this hotel. The lounge offering soda/coffee/snacks was such a nice touch.  The rooftop bar is amazing. I can’t wait to come back!

title: Excellent stay. You will not be disappointed.
text: An excellent experience. My wife and I have been to the Library Hotel before and loved it. We were pleasantly greeted upon walking in. Check in was fast and easy. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are well appointed and "themed" with books ( poetry, classics, etc.) . It is an easy walk from Grand Central Station. There is a large Reading Room on the second floor with coffee, tea, and snacks 24/7. Every evening there is a gathering on the 14th floor terrace with food and cocktails available.  If you are looking for something special above the chain hotels, this is the place for you.

title: Great place to stay!
text: We stayed for 4 days and really enjoyed our stay. The bed was comfortable, which is a big one for me. It’s in a great location, close to transportation and good restaurants. Upon checking in staff were super friendly. Only set back was the only luggage cart was being used so we had to wait for help with our luggage. No parking on site, but was 2 blocks away which was fine. 2nd floor is great for 24 hr snacks and drinks. The roof top bar was nice,  limited alcohol options for some reason. Overall I highly recommend!

title: Nice hotel Midtown
text: We stay here every trip to Manhattan.  The rooms are comfortable, staff friendly,The hotel is centrally located  to Central park, museum mile, and downtown.  The Broadway theaters are mostly a 15 minute walk which makes it easy to be sure to be on time without being right in the midst of the Times Square hubbub.

title: Perfect in every way!
text: The Library Hotel is a perfect place to stay while visiting NYC.  For it’s location, to the boutique style of the hotel, the great staff, restaurant/bar, you will not be disappointed. We  know where we will be staying on our next visit!!

title: A delight
text: The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room, while small was charming, comfortable and met all our needs. The common areas were a delight. We couldn’t have been more comfortable in our own home.

title: Great service!
text: The staff was very friendly from beginning to end.  The lounge on the 2nd floor was great. We spent a lot of time there and used it as our meeting place throughout our stay.  The hotel was impeccably clean.  I enjoyed the room's themes. Will stay there again.

title: Great place to stay!
text: Friendly and courteous. Great location next to Grand Central. Amenities exceeded expectations. Comfortable room. I will visit again for sure. Staff were helpful with transportation questions and clearly wanted to make my trip the best it could be.

title: Home, Sweet Home.
text:
Haven’t been to NY since January 2019.
It felt like coming home to familiar surroundings and welcoming familiar faces. The room, bath, and restaurant have been kept up and felt fresh.
The location is perfect for reaching business and personal appointments quickly.

title: Great boutique hotel in Manhattan
text: Wonderful accommodation, great location, and excellent staff. Rooms are comfortable and well maintained. Lounge on second floor offers a pleasant place for conversation as well as tea coffee and snacks.

title: perfect for book lovers
text: Friendly staff. Fun concept. Fabulous lounge area with books, piano, hot drinks, cool drinks, snacks and room for quiet conversation. Close to the library. The sidewalk is paved with bronze plates engraved with literary quotes. It felt personal and special.

title: An incredible stay!
text: The Library Hotel is a book/art lovers dream. It is in the perfect location in NYC but still maintains a quiet and peaceful charm. The staff is awesome and incredibly friendly. You will not be disappointed if you choose this place for your next Big Apple adventure!

title: We’ll be back
text: Always a great experience at this hotel. We keep coming back and the staff never fails to exceed our expectations. Everyone seems to be friendly, engaging, and accommodating whenever possible. Coffee and excellent travel snacks available 24/7 with bars bookending the building top and bottom. Best!

title: A book lovers dream vacation
text: My husband & I stayed here for our book-tour honeymoon & it was a wonderful experience! It is THE perfect place for two bookish people to start their tour of the libraries and bookstores in the area. It was central to so many of the places we wanted to visit - putting everything right within walking distance. We stayed in the Love Room, it was perfectly spacious enough for a long term stay & had a gorgeous balcony view of the city. We absolutely loved that we had a great view of the NYC Public Library right down the street from the hotel. The staff were perfectly pleasant & the rooms and common areas were always very neat. We particularly loved spending our nights at the Bookmarks bar with their fun book theme drinks. And we had a morning routine of reading a few chapters in the morning while eating a light breakfast in the reading room before heading out to do our exploring. They have a lot of great add-ons that you can purchase to personalize your stay. We got the Guilty Pleasure package which included two tickets to the Morgan Library & Museum, two complimentary drinks at the Bookmarks Bar, and a foot of books their in-house librarian puts together based on your reading tastes. We're so glad we choose the add-ons we were interested in, it just made the experience all the better. We've been home for a week now and still can't get over what a dreamy experience we had there. We really do hope to visit again sometime in the near future.

title: Charming & Inviting
text: This was my second stay at this hotel and it did not disappoint.  It is charming, lovely and warm.  Duke at the front desk is an absolute gem and made my daughter's first trip to New York so special.  Our room was well appointed and the 24/7 snacks in the common area were certainly appreciated.  The location is really excellent for getting around town.  In a city like New York that can feel overwhelming with all of its activity, it is nice to return to a quiet room at the end of the day.

title: My New Favorite Hotel!
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. As a book lover, I found the library theme delightful. The room was very comfortable, the 2nd & 14th floor lounges great, breakfast wonderful, & staff friendly & helpful.

title: Fantastic!
text: We love the Library Hotel.  The location is great and the staff is wonderful. I love the second floor with unlimited coffee, water, snacks and fruit.  This was our second time staying there and we will go back.

title: Beautiful, cozy, great service, great location
text: Perfect spot, close to everything you'd like to visit in NY if your business meetings allow.  Beautiful, cozy, the staff is super nice, great facilities to hang around. Loved the pillows and the comfort of the bed.  I also loved the second floor "coffee room". Amenities greatly appreciated, make guest lives easier.  The 14th floor deck is also quite an enjoyable place if you need to chill after a busy NY day.

title: Nice surprise, great short stay
text:
I traveled to NYC with my son for three days. My wife stayed at the Library hotel before for business and raved about it, so I was excited to stay there. I was not disappointed. The front desk start were all very helpful, cheery and kind. The location is really good, we walked from Penn Station; maybe a 10-15 minute stroll. It’s one block from Grand Central station and the Library (natch). We ate at the restaurant one evening (Madison and Vine) and the food was delicious. The top floor bar has an outdoor patio that was full the night we were there, and has some of the hardest working staff I’ve ever seen - great service!

The rooms were small but comfortable and well organized. One great thing is that each floor and  room has a theme. We stayed in the math and science floor (the 5th floor) and I had the Geology room. The room had about 100 different books on geology inside, and it was fun to read through some of the books on my down time. There is also a lounge with snacks and coffee 24/7 - nice touch.

title: Outstanding staff and property
text: From the welcome at the front desk to checkout when we had assistance in getting a cab in the snow—the attentiveness of the staff was outstanding!  We also enjoyed the amenities in the lounge and the rooftop bar was a delight! The room was comfortable and clean!

title: Lovely 60 room hotel that was perfect!
text: A lovely 60 room intimate hotel that is perfectly located.  We stayed in the Mythology room and had a perfect view of the main Library 📚…a real gem!  The restaurant below called Madison & Vine was excellent as well as the roof top bar.  We can’t wait to return!!

title: Fantastic staff , perfect location and super comfortable
text: It was so good to be back at this hotel , great staff, it’s both professional and friendly . Plus a roof top bar . Plenty of other places to work if you need to. Rooms well equipped and particularly if you like to read . Free tea and coffee plus snacks available all day .

title: Truly Wonderful Experience!
text: The Library Hotel is such a midtown gem. Not enough is "advertised" about the wonderful history and charm of this hotel. It likely takes its name from its proximity to the New York Public Library just down the street. Each floor of the hotel is characterized by a different genre of books (e.g. the third floor is Social Sciences and the 5th floor is Math & Science) and hosts a library of books—from 25 to 100 volumes--relating to that floor’s theme.  The "Reading Room" is a beautifully appointed common area to relax and enjoy an espresso or light snack available to guests and the 14th floor features a very cool bar. But perhaps the BEST feature of this hotel is the service. We were there to celebrate my husband's retirement; there were a lot of moving parts and Arman, the manager, went out of his way to make sure everything was a success. We will definitely be back!

title: THE hotel for book lovers!
text:
My stay at the Library Hotel was amazing--from speaking to the staff beforehand to decide what room to request, to leaving my bags before checking in, to the room itself, to the checkout--every single moment the excellent service of all the staff made the experience easy and pleasurable.  I chose the Library Hotel ONLY for the whole Dewey Decimal System concept for organizing the rooms/floors.  And I was not disappointed.  But what I was not told about in advance was the stellar service of the front desk staff--Oscar was particularly excellent, but every person at the front desk during my stay was great.  The restaurant and the 14th floor bar/lounge was lovely as well.
I'd suggest a room dedicated to cooking, but other than that, there's nothing that could have been better.  Except of course, if I were leading the team there, I'd suggest some literary/book-related programming to attract tourists visiting the Central branch of the NYPL, and to do more with the brand identity.

title: Great place to stay for a couple
text:
Stay three nights for a long weekend to visit friends and see a show. One of the best coffee areas I've seen is available in the reading room on the 2nd floor - so nicely maintained and stocked with fruit and Nice bars. Not to mention the self-serve full-on commercial-grade espresso machine.

We made use of the Bookmarks bar on the 14th floor for a nightcap. We came in winter so it was indoor seating for us. Very cozy atmosphere.

title: Great Experience
text: The staff were very professional and  they  were also kind  and gracious.  Although our room was small it was artfully arranged and overall the accommodations were nice and the hotel’s location was perfect.  The Hospitality Room on 2nd floor was top rate with a good view of the street below.  It was delightful to relax there with a cup of tea and an energy  bar.  The Restaurant served a delicious breakfast and their fresh fruit was especially good.

title: Another wonderful visit
text: Another wonderful stay at the Library Hotel. The staff is so welcoming and wanting to be sure people are comfortable. The rooms were well appointed and we always love the ambiance of the books and subject themes. All COVID precautions were taken, and we felt safe.

title: Exceptionally Gracious
text: We just spent four nights at The Library Hotel. From the first phone call to check-out, our experience was wonderful.  While there is some city noise (it's NYC!), the hotel itself is very quiet and the other guests were respectful.  The front desk staff is exceptional - always friendly and welcoming.  Special appreciations go to Arman, Oscar, Duke and John for being especially helpful.  Our guest rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The 2nd floor lounge, with coffee/tea and fruit/snacks, provides a great respite from a busy day.  We enjoyed one dinner and one brunch at the attached restaurant - hearty salads and quality breakfast choices.  The roof terrace is a gem. The neighborhood is very walkable - Grand Central, NY Public Library, Bryant Park, Whole Foods and countless cafe/restaurant choices.  Theatres are an easy 15-20 minute walk.  We also walked down to the High Line (1.5 miles) and up to Central Park. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Characterful
text: Great ambience with real character. Good location near key NYC locations. Helpful and attentive staff. Bedrooms compact but comfortable and well appointed. The lounge is a nice touch and the rooftop bar, although not very high up,  is excellent.

title: Daughter’s 16th birthday
text: A fantastic hotel.  This is probably our fifth visit.  Brought our daughter this time and got the connecting junior suite and deluxe room.  Would highly recommend.  Just all around perfect for our visit.

title: Absolutely wonderful
text: We had an absolutely wonderful stay at the Library Hotel! This little gem is a quiet oasis in the middle of the city, wonderfully located right near the main New York Public Library branch, Bryant Park, Grand Central, and many other attractions, but nestled away enough to feel like a quiet getaway. We absolutely loved it here. From the wonderfully appointed rooms with plush bedding (and a hilariously old-school TV, because #libraryhotel, but it was perfectly sufficient for our needs), to the excellent Madison & Vine restaurant connected to the hotel downtown that provides room service at NYC-restaurant quality, to the super cute library lounge on the 2nd floor and rooftop bar, we loved it. The staff were incredibly kind and helpful and made our stay feel like a personal experience in the midst of the big city. Thank you, Library Hotel! We would love to come stay here again!

title: The Library Hotel Missing a Few Books
text: My beloved Library Hotel has suffered under Covid. So many gracious touches were missing. Without all but essential housekeeping we had no little chocolates in the evening. On arrival in the room I knew something was missing. No decorative pillow “Book Lovers Never Go To Bed Alone”. And the 2nd floor. Reduction in staff meant that coffee in the carafes was cold by 2pm. Cappuccino Machine at times was not maintained regularly. While I understand Covid restrictions with food stuff, there could have been breakfast pastries and bagels individually wrapped.

title: Another exceptional stay!!
text: The December visit to NYC was the second stay at the Library Hotel, the first in September.  This visit was just as wonderful as my previous one!  The staff is exceptional.   I look forward to many visits in the future when I return to visit my first grandchild who will be born this March!

title: Outstanding Property
text: I had wanted to stay at the Library Hotel for many years, having been a professional librarian and loving the concept from the first time I'd walked by the property a decade ago. My husband and I recently stayed five nights to celebrate our anniversary. Our Junior Suite room was beautiful furnished and situated so we had a stunning view of the NY Public Library and Madison Ave. which delighted us both. The bed was comfortable, the towels were perfect and there was plenty of hot water. The heating system was quite loud for our January visit but space heaters are available. We thoroughly enjoyed the snacks and beverages in the hospitality room several times a day. The fresh fruit, drinks and protein bars are perfect for a light breakfast, saving us one meal a day out.  The location could not be better.....within a block of subway, taxi stand at Grand Central, across the street from the uptown bus, one block from crosstown bus....just perfection. Loads of restaurants in walking distance and it was manageable walking to and from Times Square.

title: Booklover's Paradise
text: I have been wanting to stay here for a very long time, as my favorite places to visit are libraries and book stores!  Our "fairy tale" themed king bedroom was clean and comfortable and stocked with fairy tale books, of course!  Each room has a different theme based on the Dewey Decimal System.  The staff was very accommodating and my husband and I appreciated them arranging for our transportation to/from JFK. (And, when we had a problem with our bathroom plumbing, it was fixed promptly.)  Fruit, healthy snacks, and beverages were always available in the spacious Reading Room. One day we bought lunch from a food truck and ate it in there.  When you walk out the front door, you can see the stately public library at the end of the street. Don't miss the (free!) TREASURES exhibition on the main floor of the library, as well as the delightful gift shop.  The hotel is within a short walk of a couple of subway stations.  I can't wait to return to this oasis in the middle of Manhattan!

title: A great stay for a great price
text:
Such a lovely stay! The staff is amazingly helpful and efficient. Professional and problem solving attitude all the way.
It is very close to the slope and a shuttle bus is available whenever you wish.
The breakfast and dinner options are also  rich.

title: Outstanding.
text:
I just wanted to give a huge thank you to your staff for their outstanding communication, warm sense of engagement and commitment to a guests experience at your hotel. Well done. My girls were treated so well on their visit, It was a hard pandemic for them both, and they had planned a trip to Europe for NYE which was cancelled due to omicron adding more disappointment to their new year. Your hotel was generous enough to hold a credit for me for a cancelled conference in 2020 which allowed me to give them one night in the Love suite and experience NYC for the first time as young adults. Having stayed with you in the past, I knew they would have beautiful accommodations, but they have been sending me messages the entire time raving about how wonderful and kind everyone working in the hotel is as well as how gorgeous the amenities and their room is. 
I just wanted to thank you, and remind all of your staff that this is the kind of thing that makes a customer for life- they are already planning to come back and stay for a long a weekend when the weather is a little warmer.  Well done and I cannot thank you enough. 

Hoping we all get through this pandemic and wishing you continued success.

title: A Book Nook Boutique Hotel
text: From making the reservation to arriving at the Library Hotel the staff was great help.  Be sure to notice the plaques with poets' inscriptions on the ground as you walk down Library Way for the short walk from Grand Central Station to the hotel.  After check in we were able to grab a cappuccino and small snack in the Reading Room before heading to see a Broadway Show.  Upon returning to the hotel, we relaxed sitting by the fireplace in the Writer's Den, chatting and sipping cocktails while enjoying the complimentary cheese board. The Poetry Garden & Terraces are charming.  Dining at Madison & Vine provided a good tasting meal with ordinary waitstaff.  Our lodging room was a nice size with plenty of books and complete with cozy robes.  The only disappointment I had was not being able to have the room I desired; the fairy tale room.  The Library Hotel was one we will return to!!

title: Great old Dame!
text: Old, but clean and updated and very well situated for visiting the Upper East Side, the Theater District and Midtown. Well appointed public rooms, especially the second floor lounge which has snacks all day.

title: Disappointing Stay.
text:
Will start with the good stuff:

Nice and friendly reception staff
Good location for midtown NYC

Turning to the negative aspects, one big one and one minor one:

I forgot a brand new t-shirt in the room prior to checking out, and only realised once I had left NYC. Called the hotel a few times to check if they’d found it, but no luck. It was 100% taken by someone else, which is a real shame because I’d have expected better from a good quality hotel in NYC. 

They also didn’t tidy up the room on one of the days. For the price you’re paying, daily housekeeping should be provided, and it shouldn’t be my job to chase their staff on this. 

All in all, a disappointing experience.

title: Excellent place to stay
text: The staff was kind and courteous. The room was very nice. Location is perfect to be able to walk to Grand Central or Times Square. The staff even helped me by shipping something we left. Above and beyond. Can’t wait to come back.

title: Great hotel
text: The staff was friend and accommodating. The common areas of the hotel we beautifully appointed. The rooms were clean. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.  The location was perfect. Our daughter is a book lover and your hotel was perfect

title: Wonderful and unique
text: Wonderful hotel with real character.  Every single room has a different literary theme and set of books to peruse.  Super friendly and helpful staff.  Everyone in the hotel has access to then”club floor” with snacks and drinks all day long.  Centrally located.

title: Second Visit Disappointing
text: We stayed at the library hotel in 2014 and this visit was disappointing.  The room was extremely small despite paying $600/night.  They no longer offer wine and cheese in the library which we had enjoyed in the past.  We had reservations at Bookmarks and essentially invisible to the staff.  We place our drink orders three times before they arrived.  Nobody checked in on us.  The greeter when we got off the elevator was not friendly and actually seemed to dislike his job.  We asked for the check twice, and finally went to the bar to pay and our order had never been entered into the system to produce a check.  There were very few patrons so the place was not busy despite the manager's comments.  Overall, we were not satisfied and will not stay again at the Library Hotel.

title: Wonderful staff
text:
The staff at the Library Hotel could not be more professional, acommodating and helpful.  The rooms are small, but very nice.  My only complaints are that the rooms are very hot - even with heat turned completely off.  The rooms are also dark, with no good overhead lighting.  More light would be nice.  
The reading room offers water, coffee and a few snacks, which is wonderful.

title: Still a High-Quality Hotel, Depsite
text: It's difficult to rate a hotel in the context of COVID. That being said, appreciating the limitations The Library has at this time - i.e. limited daily room service [as needed], the hotel and its staff continue to offer a high-quality experience. Fabulous location. We've stayed at The Library in the past; we will again.

title: Great stay in all ways!
text: How great was our stay?  Let me count the ways.  The desk were staff unbelievably friendly and accomodating.  All staff, all days. The charming petite room that perfectly fit the two of us.  The books throughout giving just the right touch and message.  The third floor lounge, again filled with books and a piano, coffee, fruit, snacks and jazz in the air. It was a soothing retreat when we returned throughout the day.  Loved the rooftop bar with its multiple seating choices, its charcuterie, and happy hour spritz.  The New York Public Library, Fifth Avenue, Bryant Park, and Grand Central (with Oyster Bar) within easy walking distance,  Rockefeller Center, Central Park, the Morgan Library within walking reach. Holiday travel with a friend could not have been better.  My second visit to the Library Hotel, and I will be back!

title: Small but lovely
text: We attended a Anniversary celebration on the rooftop restaurant and thought it would just be easier to stay at hotel. The staff were all very nice and friendly. The room was small but very clean. The staff at the celebration on the rooftop were excellent too. The stay exceeded by expectation!

title: December at the Library Hotel NYC
text: This was the 4th time staying at this wonderful hotel. There were some noticeable changes on this occasion , largely due to the Covid situation. As usual,  the staff, rooms and location are excellent , everyone is friendly , but very noticeably less staff and less services offered. If there was a disappointment , it was the offer of breakfast and evening canapés & fizz,  which is the foundation of the Library Hotel Group offering. I thought breakfast boxes could have been delivered to room in replacement of the full offering in the reading room. Discounts could have been offered for breakfast and dinner at Madison & Vine to counter the closure of the morning and evening fizz by the hotel , maybe even put 1 bottle of fizz in room as a gesture as the wine & cheese offering was stopped. Maybe even a discount in the rooftop bar for residents that paid for the benefits , but we're not able to have them. This will not stop me staying in the future when I hope things are better for the hotel and staff. The room we were upgraded to was wonderful , the views splendid , but as I said earlier the ethos of the Library Hotel Group was those additional touches which were reflected in the price. Please don't let this hotel slip into the many standard hotels that New York has. Lastly , your employees can make or break a business , and your staff are friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and are always smiling

title: studious boutique hotel in midtown
text: great location, lots of books, snacks in the reading room (something librarian's wouldn't permit!), attentive staff.  The Library Hotel was a perfect little base for a tour of NYC and a REAL library is just a few blocks away.

title: Very nice
text: Just right. Clean, fresh, nice. Clever idea done well. Close to GCT and Morgan Library. Let's keep it a secret, OK? Not too big, not too small, not too short, not too tall, view of the city, quiet in the hall.

title: Always a Pleasure
text: We have stayed at this hotel and others in the Library collection and have never been disappointed!  We will be back.  The hotel is well situated within walking distance to the theater district and all the other points of interest in the midtown area!

title: Library Hotel
text: Hotel location was excellent; room slightly small but comfortable and clean; Staff was fantastic - very friendly and helpful. What's up with the "resort fee" on the charges? Another way to hide costs. Not happy with this.

title: Great Holiday Getaway!
text: Just returned from a four night stay at The Library Hotel and it was wonderful! The location of this hotel is perfect, so close to many NYC attractions. Grand Central Terminal, New York Public Library, Bryant Park, Chrysler Building. Drug store right across the street, Whole Foods a block away, several subway stations close by, and great shopping.   It is also in a very safe area.  We felt comfortable walking in the area after dark. The streets and sidewalks were clean.  Our room was good, a junior suite on the 4th floor.  Great bed and pillows.  We had no issues with street noise.  The second floor lounge was very nice, open 24hrs, with fresh coffee, water, sodas, cappuccino machine, snacks and fruit.  It is also a very beautiful and peaceful place to enjoy and morning cup of coffee.  The rooftop lounge was also nice.  Went there twice for drinks.  Very cozy area.  Madison and Vine is the restaurant on the first floor.  We did not eat there this trip, but we have in the past. It was packed every time we walked by.  There are so many restaurants in NYC, we like to try different ones.  I would certainly stay at The Library Hotel again.

title: They did it again!
text: Once again, I was pleased with my stay at the Library Hotel. The location, staff, and size make for a relaxing visit in an exciting town. Madison and Vine restaurant is located beside the lobby. This arrangement is great when grabbing a bite of dinner before a musical or play.

title: A well spent anniversary celebration
text: My husband and I spent one night at The Library Hotel for our wedding anniversary. Overall, we were very pleased with the room, the cleanliness, and the hospitality. We also enjoyed the personal touch of the wine and card for our celebration that was there upon our arrival. Overall, we were disappointed by the carry-through of the overall theme. While our room had plenty of books to choose from, we felt the Reader's Lounge could use some more book options. The website boasts over 6,000 books in the hotel, and we found that what hotel guests truly have access to, is a bit more limited than that. The refreshments were quite lovely however, and well appreciated. We absolutely adored the Bookmarks Lounge, the drinks were delicious, as well as the complimentary cheese board. We were not overly thrilled with Madison & Vine however. They claimed that Sunday evenings & Monday mornings were times that they suffered food shortages. For example, Sunday we were given one out of four options for dessert. Monday morning, anything with mixed berries, became blueberries. Also, we were given the impression that we had paid for 2 vochers for a breakfast buffet, only to be informed that this was discontinued by the restaurant some time ago. (We figure due to Covid-19). Someone may want to update this in your system to prevent future confusion and disappointment. While our meals were enjoyable, they were nothing to write home about. Overall, we are happy for the experience, but would not make this an annual anniversary stay. It was a lovely getaway.

title: NIce Boutique Hotel in the heart of Midtown
text: This hotel has a nice character with its Library theme, it is very comfortable and has good service. The rooms are on the smaller size, but they are adequate and the bathroom is not too cramped. Anyway, who wants to spend time in a hotel room in NYC?

title: Very good stay
text:
I’ve not been in NYC for 2 years and after a fail in a hotel for 2 nights I decided to go to the Library. They welcomed me very kindly and with a really good service I used to have in NYC !
Very good bar and roof top (try the cocktails) and such a good breakfast at the restaurant.
Special thanks to Duke !
I will come back as soon as I could, definitely my new place to stay

title: Father and Daughter trip
text: The staff was a real highlight, super helpful and friendly. The building and facility itself has history and character but is still up to date. My favorites were the roof top bar and open areas and the second floor lounge with a a genuine expresso machine which I made good use of. Also the Library Hotel is very centrally located and minutes walk to the central library, grand central station and other major sites.

title: Weekend in NYC with Friends
text: The Library is a haven among the hustle bustle of NYC - quiet and friendly with a beautiful coffee lounge on the second floor where friends can meet to relax and talk.  Many even hang out there solo relaxing and reading.  The rooftop bar is incredible - a great way to end the evening after being out on the town.

title: Cozy but zero security.
text: So a cozy tucked-away in GCT area boutique hotel.  Lovely 2nd floor lounge, cool roof top bar. Room was comfortable by midtown NYC standards. Staff couldn't be more professional and friendly, even by Southern standards (and I'm as jaded as NY'ers come).  BUT there is no security for this hotel.  My guests walked in off the street as late as midnight and onto the elevator (which is opposite the entry doors to the hotel) without any security or notice at all.  Security cameras?  Perhaps.  Dial-a-prayer when someone's holding you at gun/knife point?  You decide.  Again, lovely place but this is an obvious oversight.  Solutions could be even a bell-operated lock at the entrance, magnetic keypad with key fobs for guests, but do SOMETHING!  Otherwise, I would return.

title: Love this hotel but too many cutbacks to justify "resort fee".
text: We still love staying here but question the daily costly 'resort' fee since they have not brought back the nice breakfast, 5 p..m. happy hour, and nightly turndown with pillow candy and room freshening that used to justify it.  And if it is to justify 'free' wifi, that service needs upgrading since we could not watch basic Netflix at certain times.  Also the room was too hot and the thermostat did not seem to correct this unless turned completely off and the window opened.  Otherwise still our favorite although the 'petit' rooms are tiny and the  daily rates fluctuate hugely and crazily from day to day, making date selection tricky to avoid the days when rates can be nearly double other dates nearby.

title: Perfect Location
text: If you're looking for the perfect location for getting around New York, this is the place.  Grand Central Station is a block away and bus stops just outside the door.  The New York City Library which has a lovely small museum is a block away.  Pera Mediterranean Restaurant which I highly recommend, is just around the corner.  The staff are ever so helpful.  There's a beautiful and spacious sitting room with coffee, tea, expresso machine and snack bars on the second floor open 24 hours a day and a cocktail lounge on the 14th floor.  The rooms are newly remodeled and handsomely appointed.  We will definitely rebook our next stay there.

title: Another amazing stay
text: Even under pandemic circumstances, the staff continue to be friendly and ultra-accomodating. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the hotel is always quiet. The Library Hotel will continue to be my hotel of choice in NYC.

title: Pretty Good
text: Hotel is a nice , great staff, very helpful and friendly. The 2nd floor breakfast/gathering area is excellent, grab and go breakfast of fruit, granola, water and coffee was a big bonus. The room, while small, was super clean and nicely decorated/renovated. Only issue I had was the bed was way too soft and the feather pillows were too small. On the other hand the foam pillows were too big. Pillow issue is on me, I should have asked for a pillow swap out but the bed was a disappointment.

title: Very good location and design
text: Fabulous location if you want to stay in midtown . Kind staff, they took care of all my needs. The bar and lounge are excellent, decorated very well. Our room was bigger than what what we expect. Very comfy and quite too.

title: Charming hotel with excellent service
text: The hotel staff were always pleasant and responsive. The coffee and snack bar amenities on the second floor were first rate.  The only downside to the location was the street noise, so bring ear plugs to get a good night's sleep. Otherwise, the location was ideal and walking distance to the places where I needed to be.  I plan to stay at The Library Hotel again and will recommend it to others. .

title: Book lover paradise
text: I absolutely LOVED the Library Hotel! As a book lover, I had wanted to stay here and check it out. The theme is so well thought out--love the Dewey decimal system rooms and books that match in the room. The room size was perfect and the beds and pillows were super comfy. Loved the snacks/coffee/tea on the second floor. The location is really good and the hotel staff are all very kind, friendly, and courteous. This is my new favorite hotel and I will be back for sure!

title: Perfect Stay
text: As a librarian, I have long wanted to stay at this hotel.  For our first major post-pandemic trip we did.  It was wonderful, clean, lovely staff, great location, view of NYPL.  Not cheap, but worth every penny. Perfect!

title: MOST ENJOYABLE HOTEL
text: Stayed in Dr, Ruth"s room. Loved the balcony, Comfy bed, Enjoyed the second floor lounge,Flipped over the card catalogue  backdrop at the front desk. Speaking of front desk  Duke was helpful and delightful..Royalty indeed . most definitely will return, SOmany books so little time' Pavement brasses were a big surprise. Thank you

title: Top Shelf
text: We chose Library since our former go-to hotel is "no more", but we were more than happy with the results of finding new digs.  Granted that we splurged a bit for a special anniversary celebration, but it was well worth it: the floor space in our king room lent a large degree of relaxatIon, the view over Madison Avenue was terrific, and the room itself was clean and comfortable.  The Library's location is superb, an easy walk to Grand Central Terminal, Park Avenue, Fifth Avenue, and most major attractions in Midtown.  The second floor has a small pantry with tea, coffee, and light snacks available 24/7.

title: Simply Lovely
text: What can I say that others have not already?  It is a beautiful boutique hotel with kind and attentive staff, well decorated rooms, and wonderful amenities.  I love the lounge with tons of books, relaxing music, free coffee, drinks, and good snacks, and really enjoyed the rooftop bar.  It is not huge (I mean, it is midtown), and some of the rooms could perhaps use a bit of a spruce-up, but I have no complaints at all.  This was the best hotel experience I have ever had in Manhattan, and I will absolutely be back.

title: Great Staff
text:
Employees were very friendly and attentive but the building is in need of new fabrics and lighting.  It doesn’t look like any money has been spent on the building in 10 years.
Location is convenient to arts and shopping and we felt very safe.

title: An exceptional oasis of refinement
text: During these times when hotel service has drastically gone downhill,  here we find an extraordinary boutique hotel where every single staff person takes their job seriously.  Service is impeccable as are the rooms and public spaces.  Great location as well.  No question, I have found a new home in NYC.

title: What a gem!
text: Fabulous location, amazing service (Duke is a doll!) and…tiny but elegant room. The library theme is beautifully done and the second-floor reading room is delightful (and has marvelous coffee!). Love!

title: A perfect place to stay in NYC
text:
My wife and I visit the city every few years.  This was our first stay at the Library Hotel, having stayed in different places in Manhattan during our other visits.  The location is quite central to just about anything you wish to do; you're a block from Grand Central which means you can easily connect to the subway headed downtown to the Village, Soho, and on into Brooklyn.  You can take the same lines uptown to the Bronx or to Museum Mile.  You can also take the shuttle to Times Square.  

The hotel is relatively small and that's a great thing.  I'm a big fan of small boutique hotels, and this is one of the best ones we've ever stayed in.  The service is very warm and friendly from the moment you enter.  Every one we interacted with was professional, friendly, and genuinely interested in making our stay as pleasant as possible.

For a book fiend, this place is awesome.  Books everywhere.  Each floor is devoted to a subject area and each room devoted to a subject within the floor area.  For instance, the Arts floor had rooms devoted to music, photography, etc.  The room will have numerous books based upon the name of the room.  On the second floor is a lounge area where you can serve yourself some coffee, tea, or soft drinks.  Lots of books in that room, also!  Every evening when we'd return from dinner we'd hit the lounge for some tea to wind down for the night.  The rooftop lounge is fabulous; great view of Madison Avenue.

We had a wonderful stay here, and we look forward to returning to NYC and staying here once again.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection was the perfect place to stay! It's very conveniently located and competitively priced.  The hotel is beautiful inside and the library theme is perfectly exacted down to the themed rooms with many books all around the hotel.  The rooftop bar is very nice and their happy hour special is a great value for those staying at the hotel.  Everyone who I spoke to while making reservations, asking questions leading up to my stay, and while I was at the hotel went above and beyond for customer service.  I would always stay here in the future!

title: Anniversary getaway
text: No need to take a flight to get away and enjoy some romance with your partner. The Library Hotel is then perfect escape. The ambiance along with the feeling that you are the only guests in the hotel with books everywhere make it a must stay, especially if your a lover of books! The free snacks, tea, coffee, fruit and carbonated sodas is a plus. The ability to enjoy great food at the restaurant on property, Madison Vines is even better!

title: Comfortable, civilized, literary
text: I had been to events at this hotel when I lived in New York, and had always wanted to stay there. I got my opportunity on a business trip, and loved it. Everything was perfect—how often does one get to say that of a hotel? I enjoyed browsing through the books (in my case, all about the performing arts) in my room, too. I hope to come back soon!

title: Perfect place in NYC!
text:
Much needed birthday weekend away and the Library Hotel could not have been more perfect!  This was our 2nd stay at the Library and it’s probably the only one we will ever stay at in Manhattan!  It’s the quiet, perfect location, close to everything!  

My husband set up birthday prosecco upon arrival and it came with balloons and the most perfect personal note from the staff!! 

If you go- take a trip to the Morgan Library!  it’s kind of amazing.

title: Unexpected Delight
text: The Library Hotel exceeded expectations. While I stayed in a small room, it was well appointed. The 2nd floor lounge and rooftop spaces were a welcome respite after sightseeing and fruit and snacks were much appreciated. Great location close to Grand Central.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: We stay at the Library Hotel each time we go to NYC.  It is a beautiful, boutique hotel that has great customer service.  It has a great location near Grand Central and walking distance to everything else. HIGHLY recommend!!!  We LOVE the Library Hotel!

title: Exceptional
text:
Selected this hotel for an anniversary trip and have never been more satisfied with a decision. Even before the trip, the booking team went out of their way to answer any questions and try to fulfill some requests (requested certain themes as a choice of rooms). I also let them know it was our anniversary. Not only did they remember and grant my first choice of room (mysteries!) but we also arrived to a lovely card from the staff and a bottle of wine on ice. 

The room (a suite) was super large, very clean, had amazing views of Madison Avenue and the 5th Avenue library (all suites do since they are all along the same side of the building) and was beautifully appointed. The room was mystery themed so all of the books were mysteries and the art was mystery themed as well. The bed was super comfy, the air conditioning was great, and the bathroom was lovely. I was surprised at the low level of noise we experienced despite our corner room facing Madison Avenue.

The staff was lovely and despite covid taking away their normally complimentary breakfast (this was back in August of 2021), there were two spaces in the hotel for guests that were great. The rooftop is absolutely gorgeous and you can enjoy a drink inside or outside (they gave us a certificate for a complimentary cheese plate with the purchase of one of the rooftop lounge's library themed drinks). There is also a lovely library lounge full of books, with a piano, and an endless supply of water, snacks, fruit, as well as a coffee machine which made espresso drinks (cappuccino, espresso, latte, etc) which is available for guests 24/7 which is awesome. 

My only gripe would be that the bathtub was very slow to drain (like 20 minutes to drain fully from full) but honestly, that is to be expected since the building is historic and the pipes are probably old like most older buildings in NYC. But really, this was all inconsequential because the pros made up for this one very minor con.

It's a splurge, the suite there, but so entirely worth it.

title: We always go for a drink in the Terrace Bar for a drink whenever we visit Manhattan
text:
Superb calm ambience and welcoming hosts.Excellent choice of drinks and beers.
Beers were served super chilled and the appetizers were tantalizing and freshly made.Facilty was there to shift guests from the terrace to indoors when it started raining.

title: Really Nice
text: The Library has a really excellent location. The hotel has endless amounts of charm and style. The rooms are clean, thoughtfully designed, and has everything you need. But the reason I came here to write the review, is everyone was so nice!! Other hotels are nice but the people can be cold. This hotel the staff is genuinely just lovely people, and I felt I was lucky to stay there. Whether its the restaurant server who greeted me with such care and kindness. Or the front desk folks who let me check in super early, I was just amazed at the level of kindness. Thanks Library!

title: Clean and good location
text: We were pleased with the hotel.  Room is small, but clean and the bed was comfortable.  The location is excellent and service was good.  The library theme provides a good ambience and the second floor suite for breakfast and snacks is convenient.  Price is a bit high but we thought this was a better value than the super high end hotels.  If you are looking for a pleasant alternative to the super high end hotels, this is a good alternative.

title: Library Hotel
text: Good location and cute idea for my daughter who loves books.  The hotel is old and feels very small, cramped and expensive.  The floor plan layout wastes space on unnecessary hallways and even in the suite it felt cramped for two people.  People were nice and it was clean but felt very overpriced for the product provided.

title: Excellent hotel
text: This is a beautiful hotel centrally located, good room size and very clean. We enjoyed the rooftop every night we were there. Every room has a different theme with its own books for us to enjoy. We were not thrilled with the restaurant but I will not take points out of our hotel experience.

title: Beautiful Library Hotel
text: Our stay this past weekend was wonderful.  The staff was very attentive, the location was amazing and it felt very COVID safe.  We can’t wait to stay here again.  My favorite thing was the Bookmark bar and the Pulitzer drink.

title: Can’t wait to come back!
text: Concept was A+ for my bookworm of a husband.  The staff was great, rooms were super clean. Location was close enough to walk to Times Square/mass transportation, but far enough to be peaceful and quiet!

title: Great location, amenities, very clean & professional staff
text: Yes rooms are small, but that’s all nyc hotels. Very clean. Loved the restaurant downstairs. Staff professional; very helpful and accommodating. Especially enjoyed the 2nd floor coffee/tea/snacks bar open 24/7. Nice to have. Would definitely recommend staying here if need a hotel midtown

title: Slightly Disappointed
text: We always stay at The Library when in NYC. However, when you spend $600/night you expect breakfast and the afternoon wine. Without the things that make the Library special, I might as well stay at a $300 hotel.

title: Incredible hotel
text: The staff at The Library Hotel is beyond amazing!  Emails were sent before my arrival detailing their Covid policy, inquiring about my stay and how they could enhance my trip to NY.  To my total surprise, the general manager and staff left a complementary chilled bottle of wine to help me celebrate my birthday! I have already reserved my room for my December trip and am looking forward to my return!

title: Prodigious Pleasantries!!
text: Having admired The Library over the course of many years, it brought me immense contentedness staying with them during the 20th anniversary of 9/11. The staff are even more wonderful when you become an overnight guest. Whatever your purpose, every sense of perception is attuned to your experience. Enjoy and treasure this special place. Me and my son most certainly absorbed every moment of their care.

title: The Library Collection is Unparalleled
text: Excellent location, superb service, perfect room. We enjoyed a few days in NYC in late August after moving our daughter into college. We stayed in the Mythology room and we highly recommend it for its superb view and size. Also notable was the comfort of the bed and the quality throughout the room and the hotel. Bookmarks- the rooftop bar is an excellent pre or post dinner stop. Staff was amazing. This stay committed us to the Library brand of boutique hotels for all of our future visits.

title: 5 Star Service and Location
text: This was my first hotel experience in Manhattan and it was terrific! The ambiance of the hotel is very unique and the staff were amazing. The location is so convenient for dining and shopping. I will definitely stay there again!

title: Great unique classy place to stay
text: This was our 2nd time staying. The staff is excellent especially Duke. I do miss the free happy hour they used to have with beer and wine. Great location with with secluded rooftop bar perfect for winding down in the evenings and I enjoyed the lobster down at the restaurant.

title: Best location!
text: Although the room was smaller than I expected, the queen size bed was amazing with the most soft and pleasant beddings. Hotel staff was extraordinarily friendly. It was incredibly comfortable, excellent air-condition. It was nice to start the day with coffee in the 2nd floor lounge. It was a great stay.

title: Very convenient!
text: I'm new to the boutique hotel experience, but I'm sold now. Very well appointed and loved the small, less crowded environment. Had the lounge to ourselves most days and the rooftop bar is awesome! We ate twice at the restaurant and it was excellent as well. Not to mention the library novelty was fun! Would definitely stay again!

title: Great stay!
text: My husband and I were traveling to NYU Langone for some medical tests. The location of the hotel was perfect! We were close to the hotel but also walked to Rockefeller Plaza, Grand Central Terminal, etc. the hotel was super clean and staff was so friendly. The all day snacks on the 2nd floor were convenient and we loved the rooftop bar. We even got our breakfast in the mornings and took up to the roof top to eat. I hadn’t been to NYC in 25 years and will be returning due to such a great experience.

title: Great room and friendly staff
text: The hotel was very clean . We had heard New York rooms were small but we felt that was not the case at this hotel . We had plenty of room. The staff was friendly and helpful . Duke helped us before and during our stay with recommendations to restaurants, attractions and best mode of transportation . Loved him ! The hospitality room filled with water, coffee, soda and snacks was wonderful. Great location and fun to read all the plaques on the sidewalk from the hotel to the beautiful public library .

title: Best hotel I've experienced in NYC
text:
Very reasonable price and over-delivered. Staff communicated well before my wife and I arrived, and kept up the great service throughout our stay. They do a lot of little things well that adds up to a great experience; they pay attention to details.

Second-floor area is always open and has fruit, nuts, premium snacks, coffee, tea and other drinks. Nice, quiet place.

Great location so close to Grand Central.

The book theme is very interesting, and I found one that I particularly liked.

Subpar experience in the restaurant connected to the hotel, but I don't know that the hotel owns and/or manages the hotel.

title: Great place to stay near Grand Central Station
text: Great place to stay near Grand Central Station. Love the rooftop bar/lounge. Armand, Duke and all the staff were friendly and professional. This is the 2nd time my shusband and I have stayed at Library Hotel in New York City (299 Madison Avenue). First time was 10 years ago for my 50th birthday. We returned this year for my husband's 57th birthday. I hope it will not be another 10 years before we return.

title: Best kept secret in NYC
text: This hotel is awesome!! Great location, near the NYC public library and around the corner from Grand Central Station. But it wasn't about all the books in my room or all the books you can read while you're in the city. It was the people that work there that made my stay awesome!! I hurt my ankle four days before I left and every evening when I got back, somebody would come upstairs to my room with a new bucket of ice, so I can ice my ankle!! Then the people who work at the little bar on the 14th floor were just awesome!! I got to talk to some of them and what a great team this hotel has. I loved it so much, my husband and I already booked our room for our trip back to NYC!!

title: Compared to Casablanca
text: I may have expected too much after my prior stay at sister hotel Casablanca. This hotel was nice overall. A few issues….Our sink was clogged and took over 5 min to drain.  I did not report it because I figured they knew already and didn’t want to deal w maintenance. The top floor had private events each night of our stay so it was not accessible to guests. Would have been nice to have more of a selection of snacks and food for the $25 per day resort fee. Staff did not initiate conversation with us the whole trip. Maybe they were not catering to us because we were a mother daughter pair.  It wld be a nice place for those who get catered to more by staff or who had access to the private events.

title: Great hotel!
text: Loved this hotel. The staff was amazing. Loved them. The hotel was clean. They have a roof top bar (drinks were just okay) but they had a little area with drinks (water, coffee, soda) and fruit which was great! Location of the hotel was awesome!

title: Great location, good amenities
text: This was our first stay at the Library Hotel and it wont' be our last.  Our room and bathroom were good sized for a NY hotel and we loved the rooftop bar and the second floor library lounge.  We are scientists and ended up on the science floor and had a room filled with math books.  great fun.

title: Excellent NYC hotel
text: My family and I were thoroughly impressed by this hotel. The vibe is upscale boutique with a sophisticated air.  There’s a great reading room lounge with all-day coffee/snacks/fruit.  The rooftop lounge has an open-air space with nice views of the surrounding area.  We didn’t try the on-site restaurant but it seemed to be busy every evening.  My only criticism: the bathroom needs an exhaust fan to clear the shower moisture.

title: Lovely, friendly hotel. Will return.
text:
We stayed here once because it's near the NY Public Library where I had some meetings to go to. We came back the second time because we enjoyed the first time so much. It's well-located, clean, a little quirky, and very hospitable. The lounge on the second floor is a pleasant place to take a break, sit, have some coffee or coffee. The rooms are small but comfortable.

The next time we go to NYC, we're likely to stay there again.

title: Excellent little hotel
text: Library Hotel is a cozy, classy little inn smack in the middle of bustling midtown Manhattan. We could not have been happier. Our room was small but well laid out and perfectly charming. As you'd expect in Manhattan, parking is a problem, but it was so easy to get a cab or the subway, that it didn't matter.  The staff, especially Arman, was outstandingly helpful and kind. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

title: Couldn't have been any better!
text:
Wonderful help from the front desk. Terrific public rooms. Sparkling clean. great location!  Did I mention how great the folks at the front desk were?
And loved the snacks in the reading room - great coffee and nice fruit!

title: Perfect property as Manhattan base!
text:
The Library Hotel is the perfect base from which to explore Manhattan (and even other boroughs). The service is excellent, the cleanliness top-notch and the location superb. 

Our family recently stayed in three separate rooms My son loved the "Petite Suite" option, very comfortable and everything one person needs. The various room options, each with a literary theme,  would suit most needs while the lounge and upstairs bar are appreciated at the end of the day or for a nice afternoon break. 

From the Library Hotel we made  walking or easy Uber trips to Chelsea, Battery Park, SoHo, Greenwich Village, Central Park and Citi Field for a Mets game. The NY Public Library (obviously) and Bryant Park are a stone's throw away.  (Bryant Park is a favorite for a nice lunch, afternoon cocktails, and even free Kubb and putting if you are in a sporty mood.)

The hotel staff was very accommodating by arranging airport transportation as well as having good food waiting for us at our late arrival. Every request was met with courteous and efficient service. The "Librarians" were so friendly and welcoming, greatly reducing the stress generated by our cross-country travel day. I highly recommend the Library Hotel, it is a perfect choice to meet the needs of business or pleasure travelers. if I could give it a "10," I would!

title: So good to return to my favorite NYC hotel
text: I have stayed at the Library Hotel before COVID, and wanted to return last year. Alas, that could not happen, but I went back last week now that things are more open in NYC. Though the hotel no longer provides breakfast, it does its best to keep steady access to coffee, tea, and fruit. The rooftop happy hour continues, too. Room service is by request rather than automatic. Otherwise, nothing else has changed. I love this place. Its location is perfect for touring Manhattan, and you can get to Brooklyn via a 30-minute subway ride from the Bryant Park station, which is only a few blocks away. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Finally, if you are a book lover, this is the hotel for you. We stayed in the astronomy room this time and got immersed in books we might never pick up otherwise. So good to be back!

title: Great midtown small hotel.
text: A comfortable and sophisticated small hotel.  Conveniently located; enjoyed our stay; clean and well appointed.  Quiet with good public spaces;  restaurant is good and front staff helpful.   Needs grab bars in the tub.

title: Perfect oasis in the city
text: For us, the Library Hotel was the perfect place to stay during our weekend getaway. The staff was incredibly helpful and cheerful, the second floor hospitality room was a welcome respite and our room was immaculate. We’ve already booked another stay there in a couple of months.

title: Wonderful little hotel
text: Clean, well-kept, whimsical, centrally located. Great hotel restaurant and roof top bar. The staff were super friendly and helpful too. We really loved our stay here and even left with a complimentary book from the hotel!

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC
text: Welcoming boutique hotel in a great location. Duke at the front desk provided a warm welcome, and the rest of the staff also provided excellent service during our stay. Our junior suite was comfortable, immaculate and tastefully decorated. My kids loved the 2nd floor lounge with the bountiful snacks. I look forward to staying here again.

title: Great Midtown hotel
text: Excellent fairly small hotel with a great location and wonderful staff. Very nice and comfortable room. Great amenities like water, fruit, snacks and coffee available at all time. Rooftop bar with a great view. Highly recommended.

title: Library Hotel is our "Cup of Tea"!!!
text: If PBS British dramas or PBS in general is your "cup of tea", the Library Hotel is the New York City hotel for you! Firstly, it is a "Boutique Hotel" with the warm and cosy ambience this title implies (and with very comfortable beds, too.).Then the location is ideal, especially for the first-time NYC visitor! The charming Bryant Park, featuring the Bryant Park Grill at which we dined almost daily, is just a block or two away with the beautiful NYC Library on the same block as the park and the historical Grand Central Station down the street from it. Also, from the Library Hotel's inviting little patio enclaves are majestic views of the Empire State Building and the beautiful Chrysler Building both of which are close walking distance. As an added bonus, adjacent to the hotel is the delightful Madison and Vine restaurant for easy, delicious and relaxing dining. Rob, the hotel manager, handled us with kindness and grace and the other hotel personnel were all professional, kind and helpful. I might add that during our NYC visit we stayed at two other hotels, the Refinery Hotel, which was a huge disappointment for us and that I recommend for the young only with their very popular though extremely loud, crowded rooftop bar also showcasing amazing views. And the other one being the high-quality, beautiful and equally comfortable to Library Hotel though very expensive in comparison, ! Hotel Central Park, in which we had a wondrous park view. My husband and I were most satisfied and content with the quaint and cozy Library Hotel and will be returning to NYC sooner rather than later because of this wonderful find! Thank you, Rob, for your kind and attentive service!

title: Older hotel with personality
text:
As (pre-COVID) frequent visitors to NYC, we have had our eye on the Library Hotel for a long time. The rates are usually pretty high, so we weren't able to check it out until recently, when we spotted a rate we could manage for a few nights.  

We enjoyed our stay at this well-located hotel with lovely public spaces (a well furnished 2nd floor lounge as well as a rooftop terrace) and thoughtful amenities (the lounge is stocked with bottled water, soft drinks, an espresso machine, snacks, etc), covered by a nightly fee in addition to the room rate (not called a resort fee, but similar).  

Our room was mythology-themed, which was quirky and pleasant, and we had a swell view of the Public Library.  The room was not otherwise too special.  The TV options were limited, but we took advantage of the hotel's DVD library and watched a movie. Staff were friendly, though not always too knowledgeable (we arrived late, after the hotel bar had closed--when I asked if there were a bar nearby that would be open, I was told no--not in midtown.  This was false.  Google found me a few open bars within blocks, including a really lovely one on the next street).  

The bar upstairs--when open--is a great destination also--terrific views and atmosphere.

Because of COVID, room cleaning service was only by request; we did request service once and it was well done.  

We are really glad we had the opportunity to check this place out.

title: Great Service...and BOOKS
text:
Loved this little gem.  The service was fantastic;  they even gave us an umbrella to take, as it was pouring rain as we left for airport.  
Lots of free amenities;  water bottles in room fridge, 2nd floor for coffee/cappuccino/snacks/iced tea...and of course thousands of books everywhere to read. Very quiet; never heard another guest. Rooftop bar.

title: New Favorite NY Hotel.
text: This is my new favorite hotel in NY.  Great location, beautiful rooms, every single person we interacted with was amazingly nice and helpful and books everywhere!  (A whole new meaning to the phrase,  so many books, so little time).  And they were so understanding and helpful when we had to keep changing our reservations due to Covid and  a rescheduled friend's wedding.  And  I almost never eat in hotel resturants but this one was very good and not overpriced (for the area). All in all we had a wonderful weekend there.

title: Graduation Stay
text: Continue to love this property.  Always exceeds our expectations and Madison & Vine restaurant also doing a great job!  We were in town for a Fordham graduation and the access to Grand Central as well as spots in Manhatten is perfect!

title: First time stay
text: This hotel was recommended by our son who lives in Manhattan. Both he and his wife are avid readers and writers and know of past authors who have stayed with you. The four of us enjoyed the Reading Room immensely. Quiet ambiance for reading and tea. Service was excellent. And we appreciated adherence to the COVID guidelines in the hotel, Madison & Vine and the roof deck  We enjoyed a delicious dinner and then cocktails with your complimentary cheese board on the roof deck.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: The Library Hotel is perfectly located for a New York City getaway. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and the attached Madison & Vine restaurant is a great choice for brunch or lunch.  The rooms are small but well appointed, and the bed very comfortable.

title: Quick weekend trip to NYC
text: Gave it the high rating because of the convenient mid-town location and the extremely courteous and helpful desk staff. Small rooftop bar was fun. Rooms/Elevator a little outdated but 2nd floor lounge was nice for coffee/tea/snacks.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Excellent time at the Library Hotel just as NYC was reopening.
Rooms clean and bright,  all themed on different book categories, which is fun and on the large side for NYC. Staff very helpful. Great location, good coffee in the “reading room”
 and rooftop bar was delightful. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely hotel in perfect location
text: Lovely small room. Perfectly designed. Great location. Only thing is I would suggest getting rid of the resort fee.  No pool etc.....just snacks. The staff was great and made us feel at home. We will be back.

title: A book nerd's paradise
text: Title says it all. Spacious room. Friendly staff. And if you love books, the Dewey decimal system and library themed rooms then this place is definitely for you. Each room comes packed with books that match the theme of your room. There's also an entire sitting room with hundreds more if you somehow get bored of what's in your room. Rooftop lounge was pretty cool, too.

title: Amazing
text: Boutique hotel, nice, clean with fantastic location and a great roof top bar, where you can sit and relax, or read one of the six thousand books available to you. Stepping out and looking to your right, you'll see the majestic NY Library itself. Love it!

title: Fantastic find!
text: Wish I would have found this hotel 4 years ago when our daughter started college in NY.  It’s a perfect location to everything with themed rooms, comfortable beds, a lovely rooftop patio and bar and a wonderful library lounge with complimentary coffee, drinks snd snacks.  Gracious service.  Really makes you feel you’ve found a special place of your own in the city.

title: Loves this place!
text: The Library Hotel was a gem!  I would be thrilled to stay here again. The rooftop bar is cozy and quaint.  The staff is friendly and professional. Overall an amazing place in an ideal location- in midtown!

title: Delightful
text: Cozy and clean and fantastic service. 24 hour access to snack, coffee and tea and water. Comfortable beds. Great view of the public library. Perfect location in midtown- near grand central, and walk to practically anywhere. Highly recommend.

title: Very nice stay with my mom
text:
Beautiful hotel. Great location. Excellent staff. Having a restaurant right there was perfect and the rooftop bar and green space was such an added plus as was the reading room for breakfast. Missing a few modern amenities, but it didn’t matter because everything else was so amazing. 
It was loud at night but that’s beyond the hotel’s control...a sleeping aid helped as it does on any vacay. I’ll stay here again.

title: Wonderful experience!
text: Love the charm of this hotel, clean and cozy rooms with nice roof top bar and terrace, where you can enjoy the view, or simply relax and read one of the 6 thousand books available to you. Stepping out from the hotel and looking right, you see the great New York Library itself. I will always return to this unique and beautiful hotel!

title: Would not return
text:
Library Hotel has been on my radar for years but never stayed as the price point was always a little higher than I have wanted to pay. Reopening post-pandemic gave the opportunity but the stay was disappointing because of poor sleep quality.
On reservation I did request a quiet room, which was accommodated by housing us on a high floor.  Unfortunately this is a very narrow building and all of the rooms are street-facing, and the height was no match for trucks backing up, stupid loud motorcycle revving, etc. on a Saturday night.
Ear plugs of course worked for that but the mattress here was another challenge to contend with.  I am picky when it comes to mattresses, but even on mattresses I don’t like I can generally sleep. The Library mattress was in a class by itself and I never achieved a comfortable position over two very long nights. (BTW, I am a slim-average male, mid-50’s.)
I hate to be so negative as I have a fondness for older hotels. The building is beautiful, the location is super nice and the staff were welcoming.  I’m surprised that this property didn’t take advantage of the closure to do some updating, especially those mattresses.
Note that this hotel charges a “resort fee” (~$22).

title: A Boutique Hotel for the Literati
text:
Imagine arriving after a long trip, into a sedate and refined lobby, to find a warm welcome and reprieve from the bustle of Midtown Manhattan just outside.  Inside this pocket of tranquility and hospitality, up you go to your room - mine was on the 11th floor - to discover the perfect nest to perch within for your trip to the city.    Filled with books (my room theme was Paranormal), high-end toiletries, pillows, and bathrobes, it's tempting to stay inside instead of exploring the magic of the city! Add to that DVDs to be checked out in the lobby, a Reading Room filled with snacks, fruits, hot and cold beverages, and best yet, a rooftop lounge for a private perch in the daytime, only to be transformed to a cocktail lounge, Bookmarks, at 4pm for literary cocktails and charcuterie boards.   Ah ... you've arrived!

Covid protocols being what they are, the daily wine and cheese reception is not running nor is daily housekeeping (by request only), but the hotel is making up for that by offering 20% off daily rates and a very generous cancellation policy.

Take advantage of this chance to experience The Library Hotel, on Library Way no less, just off Madison Avenue,one block from the NYC Public Library, beautiful Bryant Park, and Grand Central Station.  Because that's what this boutique hotel offers you - an experience - not just a place to stay.  

Special mention to Billy, who made me feel welcomed from the moment I arrived.  The team here believes in impeccable service and I was made to feel not just like literati, but luminati.  

*This review is librarian-certified*

title: A gem in midtown!
text:
