We loved this hotel!  My husband and I stayed here as we were in NYC without our kids for the first time in over a year and were looking for fun and quirky hotels.  We both love books so thought this would be a great experience, and it was!  

We were able to put in requests for rooms, and got one of our top choices, Music.  The theme was not overdone, but there were a few shelves of books themed for all types of music through the ages, and there were some tasteful pictures on the wall of jazz clubs. The room was large by NYC standards and very comfortable.  As we were celebrating my husband's birthday, they left us a bottle of wine that we took to the roof deck and enjoyed.

We also really enjoyed the second floor library.  There was coffee and there were snacks, and a lot of different books to enjoy.

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looked for a nice hotel in NYC but wants something a bit different than the usual!

title: Would love to talk about the experience...
text:
We haven't had the opportunity to stay. We booked our room on July 9, 2019 for a March, 2020 arrival, but as we all know, New York was shutting down due to Covid 19.  Yes, this was a pre-paid reservation with a no cancellation policy. However, given the worldwide pandemic situation we did hope the hotel would be kind enough to refund our money. Instead they offered a credit. We requested a refund a second time in Oct, 2020 when the pandemic was surging again. We were refused and offered an extension on the credit. We repeated the fact we had no intention of travelling to NY or anywhere for quite some time and that a refund would be appreciated.

I must say, this booking was part of a multi-country vacation we had to regrettably cancel. Without exception every single luxury hotel, international flight, tour company (2 multi-day trips) and theatre FULLY REFUNDED our monies.  Except The Library Hotel. Customer service is so important in travel and for us this hotel gets low marks for their business practices.

title: A Bibliophile's Delight
text:
It's a hotel.  It's a library.  It's the Library Hotel, on Library Way, a block away from the iconic 42nd Street Public Library.  

This clean and efficiently-run establishment on 41st Street, just east of Madison Avenue, is a refuge from the noise and bustle of Midtown Manhattan.  Each room is a bibliophile's delight, well stocked with dozens of books for reading during your stay.  My wife counted 94 in the bookcases of our room, 905.  That number is significant because in the Dewey Decimal System the low 900s is the Geography section.  And sure enough, books on travel abounded, featuring classics like Mark Twain's "Life On The Mississippi", Paul Theroux's "The Great Railway Bazaar", Frances Mayes' "Under The Tuscan Sun" and Christopher Wren's delightful "The Cat That Covered The World."

If geography is not to your taste, try the varied collection in the spacious, comfortable 14th Floor lounge.  Sit and read indoors or, weather permitting, outdoors, surrounded by Manhattan office buildings and you won't miss the spire of the Empire State Building, a few blocks to the south and west, poking out from among them. 

The staff was uniformly courteous and helpful and I want to thank them by name, Arman, Duke, Naomi and Billy.

They were affable and kind to us strangers from "overseas" ---from across the East River in Queens--- out for a celebratory weekend in the busy city.  For my wife and me this was a birthday to remember, helped along by a well chilled bottle of Mondavi Chardonnay, courtesy of the hotel staff.

So, thank you Library Hotel.  You will see us again and hopefully in happier and less restrictive times.

title: Delightful Experience
text: Great location, comfortable clean rooms and attentive security. The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating!  Wouldn't hesitate for a return visit!  The hotel restaurant is also very nice - great atmosphere and food!

title: Safe Stay During Pandemic
text: I have stayed many times at other NYC hotels in the Library Collection, but at the time of this trip only the Library Hotel was open. It lived up to my expectations of excellent service and, most importantly, safety during the pandemic. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The room was spacious, comfortable, and scrupulously clean. Amenities such as breakfast and use of the guest lounge were understandably unavailable; accordingly, the resort fee was waived. It was great to be back in NYC and to stay at this lovely property. I highly recommend the Library Hotel and look forward to returning. Thank you for the warm welcome and peace of mind during this visit!

title: no one cleaned the room. Also, the staff were unfriendly and dismissive. I was very unhappy after my stay.
text: no one cleaned the room...I understand the situation of covid but I was not hsppy about the service. Also, the staff were unfriendly and dismissive when I would ask questions. I was very unhappy after my stay.

title: Fantastic Stay!
text: I adore the literary theming of this boutique hotel, which is very close to the NY Library flagship location. The staff was very professional and attentive, and the rooms are well-appointed. Our trip was Broadway-focused, and the hotel is well-located for shows. Highly recommend!

title: NYC During COVID-19
text: We returned yesterday from four days in New York City and a wonderful stay at the Library Hotel. We watched confirmed cases of the coronavirus in NYC tick up each day on the news and were amazed at the calm, cool, helpful presence the staff of the Library Hotel were the entire time we were there. Everything was clean - and being clean constantly; they provided abundant options at breakfast and during 'happy hour' even though they could have scaled down since they didn't have as many guests as usual; they responded promptly and with a smile to any request we had and offered to make reservations, restaurant suggestions, even provide transportation when we needed it. The location is perfect and the service - even in the midst of an international pandemic! - was above and beyond. The staff was there each day, with a smile, opening doors when we left and welcoming us back when we returned. This was our first trip to NYC and they exceeded all of our expectations about our time there. We were glad we could support the tourism industry in this wonderful, resilient city during such a difficult time, and we look forward to staying there again on our next trip. A marvelous hotel with a wonderful staff - can't wait to go back!

title: Love the concept!
text: The Library Hotel has a great location. The concept is unique and there is a fun patio bar up top. Our room was tiny, but that was expected. We loved the out of the ordinary amenities that were offered, including nightly wine and cheese. We would recommend it, especially for book lovers!

title: Wonderful hotel with excellent customer service!
text: Second visit to this lovely library themed hotel where customers are number one, especially librarians and library lovers. We received a surprise complimentary upgrade to a king sized room with a great city view. Super comfortable beds and complimentary wine and cheese and continental breakfast. My husband and I will be back again for our annual Winter getaway. Really restful, great location, and staff super nice.

title: Good hotel, clean and good location
text:
Our experience here was very good. The location is perfect, very close to all the relevant subway lines.
Hotel rooms are very nice and clean and staff was very friendly.
Only thing to improve is the choices in breakfast. For an hotel in this price range you would expect some fresh meat/cheeses/salmon and/or scrambled eggs with bacon as breakfast.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: This was my second stay at the Library Hotel. It's a phenomenal hotel with great amenities. Everyone is so friendly and accommodating. If you're looking for a special place, this hotel is for you. It was another wonderful stay - can't wait to go back.

title: First time I found a hotel in NYC amazing enough to return to...
text: I choose the smallest room and it was still quite roomy-yet-cozy. Price was exceptional for what you get. Rooms spotless, functional, and charming. Staff was amazing and accommodating. Already using this for my next business trip.

title: Lovely hotel and great cheese!
text:
Lovely hotel with super helpful and friendly staff. Good location to easily walk to Times Square and Fifth Avenue for shopping galore!

Small but comfy rooms that are really clean and well decorated. The cheese and wine evenings are brilliant too, Great way to start your evening! Good breakfast and handy to have snacks available all day.

Thanks for a great stay !

title: Perfect for book lovers, still great for everyone else
text:
The Mythology room is on the corner so one window had a decent view towards the NYPL.  The second-floor hospitality was well-stocked all day.  The staff was perfect during our stay, and before & after check-in/out as well.  Excellent location.  Definitely will stay there next time.

Not quite worth lowering the review for, but the only negative was that there's no vent fan in the bathroom.

title: Great hotel In great location
text: We loved this hotel. The accommodation was gracious and comfortable and the ethos of the hotel was generous with complementary breakfast, evening drinks and spaces for guests to enjoy conversation and snacks. We will certainly recommend it to friends and would choose it again in New York. Jo and Ralph, Sydney

title: The Library Review by DennisK
text: Awesome, awesome, awesome. Every employee is superb and attentive beyond. The facility is beautiful. Loved the breakfast every morning. The restaurant and 14th floor bar were also superb. Definitely worth 10 stars!

title: Wonderful
text: Great place to stay. I'll definitely go back. The hospitality was exceptional. Free happy hour and breakfast were both outstanding. The hotel made sure I was able to follow my gluten free diet. Thank you for everything.

title: Deserves more than 5 stars!
text: Excellent hotel! We were warmly welcomed, our room was ready early and we were offered breakfast upon arrival. The room was small, but not cramped. Bathroom was a good size. Rooms were nicely decorated and room numbers were associated with the Dewey decimal system with books to match! The reading room was beautiful, comfortable. Breakfast was very nice, wine and cheese reception was very well done. Throughout the day one could get coffee, tea and some treats. Good espresso machine! We had some tv issues which we brought to their attention and they promptly replaced the tv. Great location! Just down the street from the library and Bryant Park, close to subways. Prices were very attractive in February. Excellent service.

title: Great small hotel!
text: This is a great concept-every room is a different dewey decimal number & there are books of that subject for you to read! It's a good hotel in mid town, they have a nice breakfast gratis, a wine/cheese snack time late afternoon & very good service. I stayed for 5 days & they couldn't have been nicer. They even brought me prosecco up to my room when I got back from a play.

title: Love Staying at the Library Hotel!
text: I've stayed at the Library Hotel twice and both times was greeted by friendly helpful staff like none other I've experience in the city. The hotel is very comfortable and I love the breakfast room - so homey.  The afternoon wine and cheese is a real treat too!  Have recommended to my friends.

title: Nice option
text: This was a great location for our visit.  Staff was very attentive.  More than adequate breakfast and having hot offerings was a plus.  Room was very clean and well appointed.  Room was a small but had adequate space for the both of us.

title: MGH Visit
text: Fabulous hotel. Great staff. Very well run. Restaurants and lounge within the hotel, no need to leave. Walking distance to other restaurants. Definitely a 5 star. We have been back here on many occasions. Love It !!!

title: Loved our visit!
text: We’ve been staying at the Library for 20+ Years.  The staff has consistently maintained a high level of quality service.  We enjoy breakfast in the morning and drinks in the afternoon. The adjacent restaurant is also terrific.  This is a convenient location to walk to Times Square and Broadway.

title: Wonderful stay...
text: Almostt seemed like a private hotel, no big sign outside.  Just go to the door and a nice doorman will open for you with a warm greeting.  Same treatment at the desk, and they are veryhelpful to help with any reservations needed.  The whole library theme of the hotel is so fun!  Each floor is a different Dewey catalog classification.  Rooms are on the small side, but it's NY!!  We did opt for the middle size room and were glad we did.  Lovely Belgium chocolates greeted us upon arrival.  And we definitely enjoyed the Happy Hour in the lounge as well as the snacks available at all times.  Location is excellent, short walk to Grand Central Station and really very walkable to many places to visit.  Make sure you go to the Main NY LIbrary nearby and be sure to read all the placques in the front sidewalk.

title: We loved it
text: We enjoyed a week's stay at the library Hotel. Location is perfect, near Bryant Park and Grand Central Station. Reception was friendly, and tje concierges amazing. The room was nicely decorated and jazz was playing on the radio when we entered. There was a (tasty) bittle if wine waiting for us and every day chocolates and water. The room was sparkling clean every day. Breakfast was good, the cheese and wine perfect. We'll be back

title: Perfect wedding
text: We just got married a couple of weeks ago in January and were lucky enough to find the Library Hotel in our venue search. Our wedding had 25 guests and was the most wonderful intimate wedding on their enclosed rooftop 14th floor area. The Poetry Garden was the perfect ceremony location with beautiful outdoor views and gorgeous lighting, while the Writer's Den was wonderful for our reception, right on the same floor with a long single table set up, enough room to dance, and was a beautiful space to begin with so we didn't need to do much to decorate. Margo was a dream to work with, always communicative and so helpful on the day of. No need to hire a DOC here -- Margo went above and beyond to help us set up, handle delivery with vendors, pass on our tips, coordinate our music timing, etc. The waitstaff and bar team were absolutely amazing, and the lead bartender was very knowledgeable, friendly and approachable. The rooms at the hotel were gorgeous and the staff left us presents in the form of chocolate and champagne on our wedding day. The outdoor patio was available for us to take pictures in the middle of the winter while it was snowing and you can see the New York Public Library from there. I highly recommend this space for anyone looking for an intimate wedding venue with catering and bar provided in-house. We visited a few other venues and none compared.

title: Love this hotel
text: I made reservations for this hotel based on a recommendation from a friend. I'm used to staying at big name hotels, so this was a leap of faith for me. When I first saw the hotel I was hesitant because from the outside it looked very narrow. It literally was 3 windows wide from Madison street. We were met by a doorman as soon as the taxi pulled up to the hotel. We didnt get that when we were at the Hilton. Check-in was personable & fast. Duke was awesome. Our Love room was clean & nicely decorated according to the theme. It was quaint, yet larger than expected. We even had a balcony facing Madison and the public library. 2nd floor serves breakfast, snacks & drinks throughout the day and wine & cheese in the evening. All included in your hotel costs. We enjoyed the 2nd floor throughout our stay. I love the fact that the hotel location is away from the hustle & bustle of Time Square & close to Grand Central Station. Every employee that we came in contact with, were super friendly. I will definitely be coming back to The Library.

title: Thumbs up for NYC Library Hotel
text:
Small, cozy, and everything close at hand.
Staff unusually helpful and friendly.
By NYC standard, rooms are spacious.
A quiet oasis in Manhattan Midtown..
Our thanks to the staff for a great weekend in NYC!

title: Wonderful, Well Located, Boutique Hotel on Madison Avenue
text:
My husband and I spent 3 enjoyable nights at this hotel.  We especially liked its 24-hour Reading Room food and beverage amenities.  The room was small, but comfortable, with good room darkening and sound absorbing features.  The staff was pleasant and attentive.

The only negative was that the printer in the small office area was out of toner during our visit and never was fixed.  We were told that we could email things to the front desk to print but this is not the same as having immediate convenient access to a printer.  It seems inconceivable that an outside service would be needed to recity replacement of a toner cartridge.

title: Excellent Service in a Charming Hotel
text: The Library Hotel is quiet, charming, and very well located - just a quick walk to most of the places I planned to visit.  The service is personal and the staff made me feel very welcome and comfortable.  They even offer you your choice of the pre-release books they keep at the front desk to take home with you.  I look forward to staying there again!

title: Second time around, as good as the first
text: This was my second time staying at the Library Hotel, it's my home away from home. I can't recommend this place enough. The food is delicious, the staff is always courteous and I was surrounded by books, a true gem! Can't wait to visit in the summer to enjoy everything the rooftop bar has to offer.

title: Never Disappoints
text:
This is our third time in 3 years staying at the Library Hotel. We stayed on the 4th floor in a queen, Romance room, with books relating to ‘Romance Languages’ i.e. Spanish, French etc. Room and bathroom were spotless as always. Staff was always helpful and very nice doormen who offer to help before you need to ask. 

We love the location. After a day filled with the hustle of the NY streets, it’s nice to come ‘home’ to the Library Hotel. An easy walk to Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Empire State Bldg., Times Square and our favorite Whole Foods across from Bryant Park. Morning continental breakfast in the reading room has a nice assortment and offers more than enough to kick start your day. I always appreciate their nightly bed turn down and a menu card left with the weather forecast for the next day. 

The 14th floor offers a place to relax, to enjoy the outdoors/
inside during inclement weather. 

I look forward to my next trip to NY and without a doubt stay at the Library Hotel again.

title: Perfect for an anniversary
text:
We stayed at The Library Hotel for our anniversary. It was absolutely perfect. The location was convenient to most everything we wanted to see in NYC. 
Our room was quiet, well appointed, and comfortable. 
The continental breakfast, wine and cheese reception, and 24 hour snacks and drinks were a lovely perk.

title: NYC WINTER FLING
text: Trip was fantastic, made even better by the wonderful Library Hotel. Staff is amazing and the room was sparkling clean. There was always someone available to help and I was called by name by every staff person I encountered. A truly amazing place!

title: During the Christmas Holiday
text:
This is a lovely hotel with impeccable service.  Rooms a good size and very clean. Staff is wonderful. Very close to Grand Central Station.  Again, staff was always there and very helpful. Breakfast and wine/cheese in the afternoon were a plus.

Thank you!

title: albergo molto rumoroso e camere molto fredde!!
text:
nessuno dice che le carattteristiche principali di questo hotel sono :
camere molto rumorose perche gli infissi sono vecchi 
riscaldamento ad aria molto vecchio e rumoroso per dormire bisogna staccarlo....
ma se si stacca il riscaldamento fa un freddo cane... non siamo alle maldive 
ma a New york se vi lamentate del riscaldamento vi portano una stufetta elettrica!!!
ma se dovevo scaldarmi con una stufetta elettrica andavo in un albergaccio di periferia dove non si pagano queste cifre. 
insomma un hotel sopravallutato, molto pompato dagli articoli e dalla comunicazione...
ma tanto fumo e poco arrosto una struttura datata che andrebbe ristrutturata.

title: Excellence
text:
Best deal in NYC. Friendly and a superb ambience. Floor two lounge is a literary home from home. Will return whenever in the city.. all the qualities of a
 Top hotel plus a family feeling wife and I  ..just love it

title: Fantastic Stay!!
text:
Thank you to all of the wonderful staff who made our stay lovely. Great hospitality, friendly faces and approachable. 
The hotel is in a great location, 2 mins from Grand Central station, 10 min walk into Times Square and round the corner from the shops on 5th Avenue. We will definitely be returning. 
Thank you all.

title: Fantastic Stay!!
text: Thank you to all the hardworking staff. We had a wonderful stay, all staff were very friendly and helpful! Recommended good restaurants for us in the area. Will definitely return to this fantastic hotel and wonderful city.

title: Charming cozy vibe
text:
Even though I'd seen ads for The Library Hotel, this was my first time actually booking a room.
I love books so I really loved being surrounded by books in the every room of the hotel.
My friend and I arrived in time to enjoy the breakfast; it was so much fun to sit in the lovely dining room, look out of the window and enjoy a chat. And I must add a nod to the employees who were warm and efficient in their service.

title: Overall excellent
text:
I stayed at the Madison Ave hotel and was so pleasantly surprised. Quiet, surrounded by NYC's art decor buidings, close to all of the attractions of MidTown.
The entire staff was friendly, courteous, and polite.  It was infectious.
Other guests were quiet, friendly, respectful.  Perhaps it had something to do with a shared love of books, reading.  
Each room was marked by a subject along the dewey decimal system.  That was unique.  That each room had relevant books was just perfect.
It was also my daughter's birthday weekend and the items that were left in the room, marking her birthday, were also a very nice touch.
The second floor reading room had 24-7 espresso, et al., which was - to me - a must have since I tend to wake early and love to read before the sun comes up.
I highly recommend this hotel for an enjoyable day or so in the city and, as a weekend getaway it is my new favorite hotel!
Thanks for making it a pleasant experience and to the staff for being so nice to me and my daughter.

title: wonderful hotel!
text: Visited NYC for a Broadway show weekend with friends.  Library hotel was perfectly located, super clean and fun!  happy hour & rooftop bar awesome as well.  Will look to stay here for all future trips!  *****

title: Always consistently good
text:
This property is always reliable and consistent. 
I stayed just an overnite-- friendly reception upon entering, knew I was booked in the future again and asked to reconfirm, room was clean, comfortable, no surprises. 
I was and have not been disappointed

title: Quick weekend away
text: We loved this hotel. Whenever we come to NYC we try to stay in smaller boutique hotels. Well we have found our home away from home! It is convenient to Broadway without a lot of street noise. We loved the themed rooms and the lounge was such a nice place to relax. It was kept clean and well stocked at all hours. The staff was friendly and helpful. We definitely plan to return!

title: Love this hotel
text: Second time at the library hotel. This time for two weeks over Christmas. Location, perfect, in the middle of all the action. Hotel staff very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast inclusion and evening drinks a great way to meet others. Great roof top bar with open fire that was great this time of the year. Rooms quaint and comfortable. Will definitely stay here next time I visit NYC.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
Well located friendly people the concept with breakfast and happy hour is cool. Noisy like New York is. 
A bit renovation and bath tube for adult instead dwarf would be great :) you can’t close the curtains in a mn appropriate way so early in the morning the room is illuminated this shall be changed

title: Centrally Located Boutique Hotel
text:
Lovely small boutique hotel just around the corner from Grand Central Station and Bryant Park
Location is in a quieter part of midtown away from Times Square bright lights
Hotel room was spotless and bed was the comfiest largest bed
Breakfast was simple but just right
The evening cheese and wine was perfect after a long day walking the city
The rooftop bar was a lovely escape
Would definately stay in this hotel again - just lovely
Thanks to all the staff that make it so special

title: Wicked Awesome
text:
Friends of ours told us the Library Hotel was their "go to" hotel in NY. So we had to try it out. We were not disappointed. 
From the moment we arrived the staff were super attentive, friendly and helpful. The ambiance of the Library theme was evident everywhere and was so neat. Quite places to go and relax, rooms numbered in the Dewey Decimal system. 
We were able to walk everywhere from our hotel. Museums on The Library Way (41st Street), Times Square, the Theater district and Penn Station. 
A truly wicked awesome experience for us. We'll be back!

title: Icing on the Cake!!
text:
My husband and I were in NYC celebrating our 39th anniversary, which was certainly special.   The staff and the Library Hotel made it even better.  Everyone has been super friendly and nice.   
The walk from Grand Central was so short!!  Made getting to the subway very easy and convenient.  The breakfast and the wine & cheese every day added even more value.  And can’t forget the 24 hour a day coffee and pastries.  😊😊. If you are looking for some place to stay in NYC, you won’t go wrong staying here!!  
Thanks to all the staff for making out celebration even better!!  It was the icing on the cake.

title: Gem near Grand Central
text: The Library is a gem near grand central. Small, intimate, clean, comfortable, with great service and extras. Great cocktail hour and roof bar. We use it every time we come to NYC. We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Pleasant surprise, clean & quiet
text: Refreshments on 2nd floor was excellent. Great Italian style coffee machine, Danish pastries, and fresh juice and fruits. just what you need, when you need it :) Location is great for business around Madison and Park, but missed prior closeness  to Central Park

title: The quietest restful place
text: This is a wonderful restful place to stay in busy New york. It is a small hotel and all the staff greet you by name and are very knowledgeable about New york. So quiet to relax in, and just chill out as well as having many wonderful books to choose from to read.  Very suitable if you are a  single traveller. No coffee making facilities in your room, but unlimited variety of teas and fresh coffee available in the dinning area. The rooftop lounge is peaceful to sit and relax, but  at night it has a wonderful ambiance for drinks and chat, by the fire, in winter, or the open air.

title: Happy Holidays....
text:
We stayed over Christmas for 8 nights and had a lovely time.
Fortunately we had stayed here back in May 16, so knew it was the only place for us to come back to for our special Christmas break.

This time, there were no night roadworks outside the Hotel, so we had a peaceful nights sleep.

Without exception this Hotel delivers an oasis of calm from busy NY.

Situated in a great location making it easy to navigate on foot, but likewise with Grand Central just around the corner it’s very convenient for all.
If you are planning already for next year, then consider also the location in proximity to Bryant park where they have the most wonderful Christmas market, ice rink & lots of eating options.
Being so close made it easy to enjoy the park early in the morning, it’s a magical time to see it.

The Hotel was busy, but still delivered on all important factors, such as cleanliness, professionalism and overall service.
The rooms are spotless and comfortable.
Sure, some technology could do with updating, but what this Hotel offers in other aspects allows you to overlook this.

Of course, this Hotel is known for its 5pm -8pm wine and cheese reception and we were pleased to see this remained exactly as it was a few years back.
The 2nd floor is a tranquil space throughout the day too for a quick coffee.
Breakfast is welcome before the busy day ahead and in my opinion well catered for and thoughtfully provided up until 11am at weekends.

During our stay we felt safe, welcomed and staff at the front of house were always on hand with suggestions and a welcome smile at the end of a long day.

We will not hesitate to return to our home from home on our next visit to NY, it really is a special place.

title: parfait
text:
nous confirmons tout ce qui a déjà été écrit sur cet hôtel, à savoir un bel endroit qui conviendra aux Français les plus exigeants. Vous pouvez séjournez sans risque, vous ne serez pas déçu.
Juste un petit bémol, au petit déjeuner, il n'y a pas de charcuterie et d'oeufs brouillés ou omelette . Sinon, le reste est parfait. Et le café est excellent, pour les USA, c'est assez rare pour le souligner.
C'est le genre d'hôtel où l'on revient quand on séjourne à NYC tellement il y a des points de satisfaction.
L'esprit qui règne est une ambiance familiale, feutrée, cultivée et reposante.

title: My home away from home in Manhattan
text: This is my favorite place to stay if I can't be in my.own beautiful.home with my darling dogs. The square footage in the rooms is not generous, but commodious enough to move around comfortably and not feel hemmed in.  The decor is the best - books!  I love the big lumbar pillow embroidered with "Book Lovers Never Go To Bed Alone".  The 2nd floor lounge is wonderful at all hours and the treats on offer there most appealing.  The roof garden is a treat in fair weather. The staff is lovely.  The location is fabulous.  What's not to love  .

title: Library Luxury
text: A fantastic place to stay. Friendly staff, all essential amenities and close to everything. Breakfast was great. Wine and cheese every evening included. The themed rooms are a brilliant idea. Highly recommended.

title: Fantastic hotel!
text:
A beautiful hotel with amazing librarians who go out of their way to make you feel welcome and go over and above to make your trip memorable.  
We had a junior suite and a connecting double room which was perfect as a family.  
I would most definitely recommend the hotel and would hope to return one day to New York and also try one of the other hotels in the collection.

title: Christmas Visit
text: We absolutely loved the place. We came into the city the day after Christmas for a feww days and stayed at the Library Hotel. The hotel staff is fabulous and the second floor food lounge was terrific. We also took advantage of the rooftop lounge. Duke, Steven and the entire staff were so helpful and friendly, I wish I could remember the names of the other staff but they were all so good. Thank you so much, you made our visit wonderful.

title: A Great Hotel
text: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel during a Christmas visit to NYC. I can’t say enough good things about this hotel. It was an oasis away from the craziness, and every employee we encountered was very kind and professional. We arrived very early and knew our room would not be available; but the call to us to let us know it was ready (early) was a nice touch. The room was very clean, and the bed comfy. We loved the library theme and really everything about this special place! I highly recommend this hotel for all of the above, but the location is very walkable too! We’ll be back once the memories of Santa Con (terrible) and the crowds fade.

title: Incredible stay
text: We recently stayed at the Library Hotel and found the staff to be congenial and helpful.  The accommodations were perfect. The library atmosphere was so fun and the Simon and Schuster books at check-in were a pleasant surprise. We would highly recommend staying at the Library Hotel.

title: My favorite hotel in NYC!
text: It is a friendly, comfortable, pleasant place for a visit to New York - truly a refuge from the bustling city.  There is no opulence, but it is totally up to date with every amenity. The Reading Room is a treasure!

title: Still my favorite place to stay!
text: This was my third visit to the Library Hotel and they always exceed my already-high expectations. You don't experience hospitality like this anywhere else. My favorite hotel! A must-see for the book lover. The attention to detail is so appreciated and makes all the difference.

title: Back  again!!
text: We returned for our Christmas  stay at the Library.  We first stayed here in 2005 and return every year.   The staff is wonderful.   We couldn't  ask for a more relaxing time.   Already booked for next year and can't wait.

title: Fantastic experience!
text: Great service, location and most importantly, the dedicated librarians! It was our wedding anniversary trip and we had wine in our room when we arrived. The library hotel really mean it when they tell you they will do their best to make your stay enjoyable. Thank you!

title: Homecoming
text: We love staying at The Library Hotel when we come to NYC.  It's like coming home for us.  Who doesn't love a great "homecoming"?  Thank you, Library Hotel and staff.  And...thank you Madison and Vine restaurant.  Our favorite place to eat in NYC.  See you again soon.

title: Super Time at the Library Hotel
text:
Another fabulous stay at the Library Hotel.  Our first visit in the winter.  We were in New York for the Christmas season and the hotel was central to all the activities and restaurants that we wanted to see and was within easy walking distance to buses and subway.
The staff were polite and helpful as always.  Had a great dinner at the Madison and Vine restaurant on the first floor.  Made frequent use of the 2nd Floor lounge.

title: Great hotel with a great location.
text: Beautiful,understated decor, great location, great breakfast and wine and cheese hour, friendly staff, and comfortable beds and bathrooms make the hotel truly outstanding. The staff gave great dining recommendations.

title: NY long weekend!
text: Amazing staff all across the board. Great location. We had a blast. Thanks so much for a great stay. The room was great and the amenities were great. We hit all major NY attractions. The hotel was either located nearby or super close to grand central station for the subway.

title: Excellent Stay
text: The Library Hotel is well situated in midtown, a perfect launching off point to the immediate area, uptown, and downtown.  Lovely and comfortable accommodations.  Simple but fresh and delicious breakfast offerings.  Excellent service and staff who are very helpful.  Nice communal areas to relax outside of your room.

title: Still agood place to stay
text: This is one of my favorite hotels. I review from the standpoint of a solo traveler  who buys the smallest room. Last year I was especially high on the Library for not charging a resort fee. Unfortunately, it has now succumbed to that temptation. Nevertheless, at present its add on does not make the cost unreasonable. The main negative is  subpar TV reception  - it's android and blurry in the rooms I've had. All in all tho, going for it and the hotel has a lot going for it and you will probably enjoy your stay here.

title: Love It!
text:
We have stayed here several times and highly recommend it. The location is excellent , the staff is fantastic, and the place is cozy. We loved our room although there was some street noise from Madison Avenue.
We love this place!

title: Fantastic relaxing hotel .
text: It was like coming home at the end of a busy day of exploring NewYork. Lovely comfortable room. Great continental breakfast . Wine and cheese in the evening kept us going until we went for late dinner. Loved everything about it.

title: Very convenient
text: The Library Hotel is very homey and situated close to Grand Central Station so getting around the city by subway is convenient.  The Continental Breakfast is ample with local newspapers also provided.  In the evening wine and cheese are offered before setting out for the evening to see a play.  We have stayed there three to four times and have always been happy with the experience.

title: Birthday at the library
text: My family and I (husband & teenage daughter) stayed at the library for 7 nights. It was a wonderful place to enjoy New York City from and it felt like a home away from home. Staff were always helpful, the rooms clean and perfect size, the breakfast room a delight and a great start to the day. The hotel location near the New York public library and grand central station position you well to embark on your daily adventures. This is a hotel we rank as a special treat for special occasions.

title: Fantastic stay in New York!!
text: From the time we arrived at this beautiful little hotel, and the doors were opened to welcome my husband and me, we immediately knew we had chosen well. Our room, a junior suite, was large, well appointed, with lovely large windows giving us a great view both up and down Madison Avenue!  The bed was supremely comfortable, the breakfast was delightful, and our stay was something we would definitely repeat!!

title: Charming!
text: This hotel is in an amazing spot - close to so much, like Rockefeller Center and Times Square! Additionally it was the cutest hotel - it had a library theme but it wasn’t cheesy! So cute and charming!!

title: Delightful
text:
The library theme is brilliantly realized — we got a room devoted to anthropology one of my passions. Several books I wanted to read — but food, service and the great location made for too many other pleasures.

A delight.

title: Superb ambience.Quiet and warm atmosphere
text: Had drinks and dinner in the terrace restaurant.Got Good and comfortable seating opposite the fireplace.Hibiki on the rocks was a delight.Always visit this place when visiting Manhatten and am close to the Library Hotel

title: We loved our stay and wished we had booked two nights.
text: I happened to be in the painting room.  I just lucked out.  It was filled with art books that I poured over.  I loved it.  My daughters loved their room as well.  The complimentary treats and Prosecco at 5:00 was delightful as was the breakfast which stay open until 11:00 am.  Great for late sleepers!

title: Reliable and Friendly
text: I've stayed at this hotel many times. The staff is always warm and welcoming, and the rooms are always clean. I love the turn-down service in the evenings and chatting about books when I'm checking in.

title: "Small"
text: If you're looking for a hotel with small rooms, small beds, small sunken baths, small TV and even small bed slippers this is the place for you.  Added attractions include dark wood rooms (in need of an update), quiet rooms, which is unusual in mid town, and a nice bar.  Inclusive breakfast, while basis, was OK. Pleasant and helpful staff on the whole.

title: Thanksgiving holiday
text: Our review of the quaint little hotel is marvelous! From the people at the front desk to the people who helped in the breakfast/snack area everyone was super helpful and very pleasant. We will definitely be staying here again!

title: Excellent hotel.
text: We spent five nights at The Library, having looked for a smaller, boutique establishment rather than a big chain hotel. From our initial warm welcome to the friendly farewell we were blown away by the care and attention paid to us by the hotel staff. We took one of the junior suites and were delighted by the comfort, decor and facilities it provided. The included breakfast was very good and the evening wine receptions were a great way to relax and thaw out after a day touring the city. We would definitely come back to the Library when visiting New York again. Highly recommended.

title: New York, New York
text:
Great small hotel that cares for all your needs.
Great location with Grand Central Station a couple of minutes away.
Very nice rooftop bar.
All in all a wonderful place to stay.
 Very good continental breakfast included, quiet rooms, nice and relaxing.
I can’t fault this hotel

title: A great Thanksgiving experience
text: So lovely to return to The Library Hotel and find it just as good as my last visit seventeen years ago. It is no surprise that all the reviews are so good and so positive, from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave the experience is fabulous. All the staff are lovely and so helpful. Special mention of Duke who is an absolute star and made our holiday! We were celebrating our marriage after fifteen years together and booked The Love Room, the only room with its own balcony with stunning views across to the Library and down Madison Avenue. A celebratory bottle of bubbles was waiting for us on arrival and a lovely card such a kind thought. The room is lovely and the bed super comfy with great linens. En-Suite well appointed but a little cold underfloor heating would have solved this problem. The Cheese & Wine and Breakfast options are great and the availability of drinks and snacks throughout the day is a great plus too. The only tiny criticism is that our room was ready for a bit of re-decoration, one of the blinds was badly frayed at the edges and needed replacing. This did not deflect from our experience, we love the Library Hotel, it is without doubt the best kept secret in New York.

title: Great as always!
text: Staying at The Library Hotel feels like catching up with old friends. The staff are terrific.  Sure the rooms are great, super clean and comfortable, but it is the staff that really makes this place.  If you stayed here once, they welcome you back. If they don't actually remember you, they definitely go the extra step to remind themselves and recognize that you are a repeat guest.  It is a really wonderful gesture in a world of so many anonymous hotels.  I really love this place.

title: INCREDIBLE Hotel and staff!!
text: Just finished a two night stay at The Library Hotel!  Absolutely incredible and would recommend and will be staying here again! Staff was phenomenal, clean, quiet, and just wonderful!!  We will definitely be staying here again!

title: Superb Hotel and Staff
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Library Hotel for 5 nights over Thanksgiving. The staff were superb and we stayed in 2 different rooms ( that was our choice) both rooms were excellent 
Thank you all at the Library, we will be back again

Paul and Diane

title: Amazing find!
text:
We had an amazing stay at this hotel! The location, right next to Bryant Park and a short walk from most central landmarks, was perfect! The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the amenities provided were over the top. The roof top area is wonderful to relax in, the lounge was quiet and peaceful, always full of refreshments. Our room was better than we could have asked for! It was large, comfortable and clean. 
I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone vacationing in New York and couples - absolutely splurge on the love room to enjoy the romantic balcony and literature!

title: Favorite Hotel
text: I love the Library Hotel.  The service is outstanding.  The location is great and the rooms are lovely.  The reading room is a great place to relax and it is so great that I can get a cup of tea before bedtime.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend.

title: Great Atmosphere, Wonderful Staff!
text: I experienced an awesome weekend getaway with my friends at the NYC Library Hotel, and they treated us like kings with great friendly service, delicious 24/7 coffee/tea/snacks, wine & cheese happy hour, and a nice buffet breakfast. The location is perfect, within walking distance of many major attractions. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a NYC visit.

title: Lovely Boutique Midtown Hotel
text: Welcoming and well appointed hotel, with a strong focus on service.  Complimentary continental breakfast, cheese and wine and great roof-top bar add to the pleasures of staying here.  Easy access to theatre-land and for business meetings.

title: Well-located and fab service
text: Apart from its outstanding location, what I really liked about the Library Hotel was the service. I really appreciated the prompt and friendly responses to my requests, whether I was asking for an in-room kettle or the front desk to forward packages to me. The hotel is nice and quiet and you don't run into other guests much, expect at breakfast.

title: great value
text: very helpful and friendly staff .Small but clean rooms with everything you need. No kettle but there is access to the 24 hour  informal eating area. The resort fee of $25 per room is well worth it. Good breakfast and the drink and nibbles are great in the evening. Good location

title: Great dining experience
text: We had a great dinner at Madison and Vine restaurant at The Library Hotel.  The organic roasted chicken was fantastic.  Wonderful ambiance.  Roman and staff made our dining experience very memorable!  Not to be missed!!

title: Warmth and kindness infuse this hotel!
text:
We had heard great things about the Library Hotel on 41st and Madison in NYC. My husband surprised me with a much-needed NYC getaway and chose this hotel. We stayed only one night but we will definitely return! 

We were welcomed to this spotless and sparkly hotel by warm, gracious, and professional staff. The front desk staff, the bellman, the reading room attendant obviously took great pride in their hotel and were genuinely invested in providing us with a memorable experience. The elevator brought us to our room in the 900s, (perfect for history buffs!) The hallway was quiet and peaceful with low, serene booklamps leading the way to our room. The room was spacious, clean, fresh-smelling, and elegant. Thick, thirsty towels, cozy, comforting bedding, the most luxurious bathrobes I've every experienced, and beautiful architectural touches made for an uplifting and memorable stay. Hundreds of great book titles provided us with a lovely wind-down to a great day in the city. 

We enjoyed the wine and cheese reception in the afternoon, the rooftop bar and lounge in the evening, and the lovely breakfast spread in the morning. We hated to check out!!  I would love to live in the Library Hotel like Eloise in the Plaza, but alas, it is not to be.  We shall most definitely return to the cleanest, friendliest, most comfortable and unique hotels I have experienced in NYC!!  Thank you, to all who worked in front of and behind the scenes to make our stay so special AND to the organization that clearly states that KINDNESS and GRACIOUSNESS are part of their company values.  A mission statement we appreciate, embrace, and need.

title: Great location
text:
Fantastic location and staff. Rooms very small. But didn't impact the enjoyment  of our short stay in NYC.
They have a complimentary continental breakfast and evening drinks in the same room.
You can go up there anytime for coffee which is great when you come back from a long day out.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel in superb location
text: Stayed at this hotel in adjoining room arrangement with family for 4 days, one king room and a suite.  Everyone was very comfortable and loved the hotel.  Billy was especially helpful booking us dinner reservations - much appreciated!  We all enjoyed the daily wine and cheese at 5, and the continental breakfast everyday.  We tried to eat at the adjoining (unsure of affiliation) restaurant, Madison & Vine, for breakfast/brunch, but it never worked out as they don’t serve brunch on the weekends and have “flexible” breakfast hours.  We made reservations for 7:30 am and when we showed-up, they weren’t yet open.  Will definitely stay again when in NYC!

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Just returned from a trip to New York and my husband chose this hotel as a surprise for my 50th birthday due to its quirky nature and due to me being a lover of books! It did not disappoint! 

The location is excellent, just across the street from Bryant Park and is in walking distance from Grand Central Station, The New York Library and Times Square.

We stayed in a Queen room and had breakfast included which was a continental one and had everything you could want. There was also a cheese & wine evening each night which also included fruit and sweet treats, very welcome after being out each day.

Tea, coffee, sweet treats, fruit and cookies were also available 24 hours a day on the 2nd floor which was a fantastic space to meet up with people or just simply enjoy the peaceful location.

The hotel also has a rooftop bar on the 14th floor which is set out beautifully and has great views of the surrounding area.

The staff were very friendly and very helpful. Their knowledge of New York and some tips they gave us was second to none.

Thank you for making our first trip to New York so special, especially with it being my birthday and we will definately return to see you when we're back.

title: Anniversary trip to new york
text: What a fantastic hotel. Rooms are quite small but that’s the only negative. Staff went beyond what I would expect, going out in the rain to get us a cab for example! The evening cheese and wine session which was free was fantastic just right when you have been out all day and want a bite to eat and drink before going out on the town. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting for a short stay it really helped to make the trip one to remember.

title: great NYC boutique hotel
text:
Centrally located, nice continental breakfast and great 5 to 8pm lounge area snacks and drinks. We enjoyed the staff who were always smiling and friendly. The front desk was willing to make reservations
whenever asked.

title: cozy friendly and relaxing hotel
text:
My stay at the Library Hotel last September and October was excellent. I loved the cozy reading room where breakfast and snacks are offered. The room was small but had all necessary facilities, although more lamps would give the room a better ambiance.  The staff was extremely friendly and attentive to all requests.
If you are a book lover this is the hotel for you, for me it was perfect.

title: Best place to stay in New York
text:
My wife and I have stayed in New York many times mainly staying at The Sofitel but wanted a change, we are so glad we did. This hotel is not only the best we have stayed in in NY but probably anywhere.
From booking on line to leaving everything was perfect. We wanted to add an extra day and on sending an email asking if we could this was agreed and sorted out in a couple of hours.
On arriving all of the staff without exception were friendly and helpful, our room was spotlessly clean and tidy and housekeeping did a great job every day.
The lounge where you had breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese was a great and an real benefit.
The best thing by far is the rooftop bar which is a gem with first class service and drinks.
Going forward when we visit NY this will be the only place we stay
Thanks to everyone at Library Hotel

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
text:
My husband and I visited NYC for three days, two nights, and chose to stay at Library Hotel. 
We are so glad we did- the service, room quality and location was fantastic. This is a hotel that thinks about the details and cares about their clients. I would stay again and or recommend to others.

title: Great boutique hotel with great staff!
text: Love this hotel. The staff was so friendly and helpful! Breakfast was lovely...loved the cappuccino/latte machine. We had a suite with king bed with sofa bed. It was just perfect for my husband, daughter and myself...not too small. Great location. We kept fan on and never heard street noise. Definitely the place to stay if you are a book lover. I would stay here again and highly recommend this hotel!

title: Disappointing after the Giraffe
text:
The promised suite was just a big room with a pullout, but both beds comfortable. Library theme is unique. Wish I had time to read all the books. Not even time for one. Breakfast are served well but room is uncomfortably got. Television in room is poorly locate and old fashioned with poor picture quality. Housekeeping sloppy. Kleenex left empty and room poorly cleaned.
Can find much better for the price. Try The Giraffe!

title: It's always amazing
text:
Location can't be better.
You live immersed in books and you may enjoy reading some of them while in your room. Amazing!
I love second floor in the hotel, where I can read or work, while having a cup of tea or coffee. It's funny to hear people talking almost softly, as if they were in a real library reading room.

title: Book Lover's Paradise
text: I only chose this hotel because I loved the name. So, I really didn't know what to expect. But it was literally delightful from start to finish. Each modern, yet charming, room has a theme. There are books everywhere and you immediately feel at home. There is a lovely wine & cheese reception every night which is a lovely way to wind down after a busy day before you head back out for the evening festivities. And every single one of "The Librarians" was warm, welcoming and friendly. My only regret is that I couldn't stay longer. I would return to stay without hesitation.

title: Worth the price!
text: Is it overpriced? Yes but so is everything in    New York! The room was clean and updated but small. But what do you expect in New York when space is at a premium. We appreciated the breakfast and wine & cheese social hour. The best part is the service and how we were greeted every time we walked through the lobby. The offered to help us with anything! We would stay here again.

title: The fotos published on travel platforms are not showing reality
text:
we thought we had booked a nice and special place according to the fotos we saw in the internet. But we found a stuffy place, bathroom and room old and not clean. My room so small that I could not put a luggage rag and had to climb over my luggage to get into my bed.
The price is not matching the perfomance. The breakfast is poor and the so called wine tasting in the afternoon is obviously eye laundry.

title: Wonderful accessories, clean, and a great theme!
text: We stayed 6 nights in September 2019.  The rooms were very clean and usually cleaned by the time we returned.  Once we had to call and get the  room serviced and it was nearly 4 pm.  The breakfasts and the cheese/wine are not to be missed.  Great way to start the day and wind down at the end of a busy day. Wonderfully themed to books and the NYC Library just up the street. The rooms [we had 2] were very small.  You could sit in the bed, watch a very small tv, read but there was really no place to sit other than a desk chair.  The location was great and people were nice.  Would I stay there again?  No.  I would go to a hotel with more room space.  It's okay for a weekend, but for a week?  Too little space...even if you are out all day touring about. People are nice but we had very little interaction with anyone all week.  Clean, convenient, and nice amenities with the breakfast and the wine/cheese evenings.

title: Loved the Library Hotel!!
text:
From the moment we stepped into the foyer, our stay at the Library Hotel was perfect.  Yes, our petite double room was small but perfectly appointed. All areas of the property were sparkling clean.  The shower was the best I've ever had in a hotel. We enjoyed the nightly turn down service with chocolates.  The continental breakfast was very nice and the 24 hr. coffee machine divine!  We loved the cheese and wine social and shared some terrific conversation with other lodgers.  The Library Hotel is perfectly situated between Grand Central Terminal and the 42nd Street Station making city navigation very easy.  
Henceforth, we will always make the The Library Hotel our NYC Headquarters and you should too!

title: Loved it!
text: The Library Hotel has a homely vibe because of its unique library theme with selection of books available in your room based on the theme of your floor. There is a dedicated reading room and a roof top terrace.

title: Wonderful staff but Noisy
text: The Library Hotel has wonderful service and the staff, all the ones I've encountered during two different stays, are lovely. But I just don't get why this hotel is SO popular.It has very nice rooms are that comfortable, at least the ones I stayed in. They're stylish although a bit dark with the with the wooden book cases and cupboards. Strangely, the back of the entry door ( the side facing inside the room) is quite ugly. It's not really so much industrial chic but institutional looking and clashes with the rest of the decor. My main concern, though, is the noise. I'm not talking about street noise because this is New York and that's a given. I'm talking about the loud air conditioning and heating equipment and the noise of the plumbing when used by those in rooms above or beside. It's quite dramatic and it was an issue both times I stayed. It's an older building that's been resigned but I had to wear earplugs to sleep. No big deal but at a fairly pricey hotel that's always a disappointment. The location is amazing - steps from Grand Central Terminal. I'd like to stay there again but doubt that I will due to all the noise in the buildings mechanics!

title: Small wedding at Library Hotel.
text:
I felt so lucky to have gotten married at Library hotel as the location/service/food/staff were top notch and exceptional. I couldn’t be happier with how the day turned out. 
Margo was such a pleasant person to work with. She will do her best to make your day perfect and flawless. She answered all of my million questions with detailed explanations/photos for better understanding. Never a “no” or “I don’t know”. Always came back with an answer for me which reassured me that it was the best decision to have chosen Library Hotel for our small wedding. 
Since it was a small wedding, I didn’t have a wedding planner to plan out the day nor coordinator of the day. But Margo played such an important role as a coordinator that day from the beginning to the end, made sure everyone was happy. 
I highly recommend Library Hotel for anyone looking to have a small/ intimate wedding as this place can only accommodate guests <50. (We rented the entire 14th floor with rooftop, such a cute romantic place!!!!)

title: Nice Choice in Manhatten
text: Nice quiet location yet within walking distance to many attractions. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is fairly limited, but sufficient. Daily wine reception was a nice treat every day. Nice rooftop bar also, but drinks are pretty pricey. My only minor issue is the room used for breakfast and the reception is fairly small and can get pretty crowded leaving minimal seating. Overall though, a wonderful stay.

title: Could this be heaven?
text: If you are a book lover this is the place for you! Very welcoming place with touches that are much appreciated. Like fresh flowers in the room and snacks available all day.  It was very convenient for visits to museums and the UN.  A special treat were the literary themed drinks on the roof.  I had the Catcher in the Rye.

title: Colin and Lorna Dickson
text: Really enjoyed our trip to New York. The Library hotel was ideally situated for exploring your city. I found all the staff all very friendly and helpful. The room was what we expected and was clean and maintained very well. The only criticism I would have is that there was not enough visible power points to charge phones and laptops. USB connector would be good on your power points.

title: a Literary Refuge
text: Quiet, peaceful accomodations in mid-town close to endless attractions and restaurants: Bryant Park, Morgan Library, Iconic Public Library, Grand Central, Times Square, Broadway Shows, Fifth Avenue shopping.

title: Very Pleasant
text: The second floor reading room was the answer to a busy day with great coffee,water, snacks, and a glass of wine later if you wish. All employees were cheerful offering assistance as needed. We will return.

title: Comfortable, feel like home hotel in the heart of NY city
text:
Very good hotel. 
Good location, nice size rooms, nice ambience. 
I liked the common room where breakfast (not great but included) and snacks were available all the time. The wine and cheese reception is a nice touch.
I recommend this hotel, it just doesn't come cheap, but considering that you have access to food and drinks and that it has a great feeling, while most NY hotels are just too impersonal, you might consider it worth it

title: Lovely Quaint and Cosy Hotel
text: Had a lovely stay at this hotel. The rooms aren’t the biggest however they are lovely and all have different themes. The turn down service has them turn on some jazz for you with is a nice touch when arriving back at the end of the night. The free wine and cheese each evening is a nice touch although my colleagues told me the wine was pretty cheap tasting although the processco was better. Staff were always very helpful and attentive. I would stay again if there for work.

title: Midtown without the madness
text:
This is a great hotel in a great location for 'doing' Manhattan. It's charming with it being boutique and cool due to the book theme running throughout. And it's pretty good browsing through the books in your own room. 

Although it's located on Madison Avenue it's surprisingly free from all the midtown madness, which you can see as you tuck into your breakfast or snacks in the Reading Room. And you can catch a glimpse of the Empire State Building from the cute roof top terrace.

The only teeny-weeny niggle is that that our room was a bit dark and the TV was a bit too high, which is why I'm giving four and not five stars. Sorry.

Finally, the staff are excellent and we'd just like to give a 'shout-out' to Billy for being so entertaining and helpful.

title: Our NY home away from home!
text: It was our 4th stay at this beautiful boutique hotel & once again we were not disappointed. All the staff are amazing & accommodating & we refer to the Library Hotel as our New York home away from home. The location is fantastic & being around the corner from grand central terminal is helpful when catching the subway everywhere which is quicker than catching a taxi. Breakfast & nightly wine & cheese are great...special thanks to all the lovely ladies that served us throughout our long stay. Madison & Vine restaurant downstairs is also good & consistent as we decided to eat there numerous times. Overall a big thank you to all the wonderful friendly staff who helped make our trip so special. Until next time.. 😉🥰😘

title: Great Service; Very Clean
text: The hotel was very clean, in a great location, quiet, and an overall great experience.  The service was great, too.  The 2nd floor hospitality was great...many cheeses and free wine during the manager's happy hour (3 hours long!).  There's an incredible automatic latte machine there, too, that we used several times throughout our stay.  The concierge, Duke, was incredibly polite and helpful, as well.  He made a great restaurant recommendation on our first day.  We felt that the staff cared about our comfort and happiness.

title: BEST LIBRARY IN TOWN...
text: Ok, the New York Library just up the road is pretty impressive. But the Library Hotel is much more than just a pretty book cover. We wouldn’t go elsewhere. We’ve resided here several times and it continues to impress. The staff are welcoming, incredibly knowledgeable on things to do- and that’s from hotel management to housekeeping personnel, our particular housekeeping person who’s been with the hotel right from the start. Our king-size bedroom was immaculate, spotless with a bathroom likewise ticking ALL the boxes. Others have covered other hotel features which has made our stay (5days) so enjoyable. It’s like coming home again. There’s no better endorsement!

title: Bon rapport qualité/prix
text: Bel hôtel, tranquille et bien tenue. Personnel avenant et courtois. Très bon petit-déjeuner continental et 5 à 7 convivial. Stationnement à 2 pas. Très propre malgré le mobilier un peu vieillot. Je recommande cet endroit.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: We were there for 5 days and the staff were wonderful to us. Got in late for our arrival date and the staff brought us glasses of wine to our room to welcome us since the cocktail hour had ended.  Always asked about our day and wanted to provide anything we needed.  A beautiful hotel

title: Library Hotel est un lieu plein de charme dans le centre de Neyw York
text: Pour notre premier séjour à New York, l'hôtel a été un bon choix car il était proche de Grand Central Terminal, The Public Library, de la 5ème Avenue, Bryant Park... Nous avons été bien accueillis et avons eu une relation sympathique et attentionnée. Séjour de 9 nuits dans la chambre 803 nous ne l'avons pas regretté bien qu'elle soit petite avec vue sur une tour mais c'était calme au 8ème étage avec ascenseur. Nous avons profité de la ville donc peu occupé la chambre. Le petit-déjeuner sucré est servi de 7 heures à 10 heures 30 dans the Reading Room , ce qui est pratique pour visiter. Deux points positifs à l'hôtel, c'est la possibilité de se servir un goûter avec thé, café, ... toute la journée et un wine & cheese à partir de 18 heures très agréable en fin de journée. Il y a un superbe roof-top au 14ème étage. Le jour de notre arrivée, une bouteille de vin rooge nous attendait. Après un problème de ménage dans la salle de bain; nous avons eu une bouteille de rosé. Nous avons également eu la possibilité de quitter la chambre à 15 heures. Pour le transport, possibilité de taxi entre l'hôtel et l'aéroport JFK. De JFK, l'Air Train puis le métro jusqu'au Grand Central Terminal est également envisageable mais long et pas pratique avec des bagages. Un point négatif, au fond de la chambre, le lavabo est séparé de la salle de bain mais proche d'elle. Le mobilier devrait comporter deux chaises quand il y a deux personnes, un crochet pour suspendre , la penderie plus grande pour des longs séjours. Le petit-déjeuner devrait comporter un peu plus de choix en sucré et un peu de salé jambon, poisson.  Je recommande cet hôtel plutôt familial.

title: A Room with a View along Madison Ave
text:
Check in was easy we were in our room within 5 minutes. The hotel is lovely in an older building it’s on the corner of Madison & Library way. Every room has a theme and is filled with books to match. We booked The Love Room, the only room with a small flowered terrace with a breathtaking view along Madison Ave. It’s the best room in the house and we stayed 6 nights.

The room was of a decent size with ample space for a NY hotel we stored two suitcases with no difficulty. The bed was sublime the pillows excellent. There was really no street noise so I’m guessing the windows are double glazed. The bathroom had a bath with overhang shower, which I find a bit slippery to get in and out of. A small but adequate bathroom which included the toilet. Had the usual toiletries. Everything was very clean housekeeping did an excellent job. There is a room safe and plenty of hangers.

Location is everything and this location is first class. There is a continental breakfast and wine and cheese every night included in a $25 daily resort fee, this used to be included in the room rate and the Library Hotel is definitely NOT a resort there is NO pool. It’s a shame they have added this daily “resort fee” to the tariff its a bit of a rip off.

My only complaint would be the room service food from Madison & Vine the restaurant attached but not owned, to the hotel. This food is cafeteria standard at best. Plus the blinds in the room are tatty and need replacing.

There is a roof top bar and the hotel staff are exceptional. Plus there is 24 hours, tea, coffee, fruit and pastries and a heap of books. They have extras like a foot of books which I got, mugs, flowers, chocolates and champagne.

Book the Love room it’s divine.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Five friends spent 6 nights at the Library Hotel in the Manhattan, New York area.  We had two adjoining suites, although not very large, they were excellent for our needs.  The hotel had several complementary amenities including a very nice continental breakfast; wine, cheeses, relishes, etc. every evening; 24 hour coffee, tea, etc. available every day; and an upper outdoor deck to view the area.  The staff were excellent, very pleasant and helpful in so many ways.  The hotel was close to many things we wanted to see and do.  We enjoyed our stay and hated to leave.  We loved this hotel and would recommend this hotel to others.  We hope to visit this collection of hotels in other areas in the future.

title: Fabulous staff
text: Staff at this hotel go above and beyond to make your stay pleasant, from printing boarding passes to the turn down service each night.  The Reading Room is always open for relaxing and the water and ice tea was so welcome during the hot August days that I was there.

title: Nicest Hotel stay we've ever had!
text:
My husband and I can not say enough about how much we enjoyed staying at The Library Hotel. 
 Friendly helpful staff. Rooms clean and so comfortable. Excellent location. Breakfast and wine and cheese in the afternoon exceptional!.Late check out allowed us to enjoy another day in New York. We will defiantly be back!

title: Mid-town gem
text: I had a lovely stay at the Library hotel while in town for business last week. Each staff member I came in contact with was friendly and happy: I though the service was great! My room was comfortable, clean and had a great view. I especially liked that this was a mid-town hotel without the crazed, rush 'em in, rush 'em out, cramped feel. I also liked the guest services that were available. In the morning, I took my [warm and healthy and free] breakfast and freshly ground /brewed coffee up the rooftop lounge and had a wonderfully peaceful breakfast before rushing to meetings. I come to NYC about 4-5 times a year and will definitely be back!

title: Quiet reprieve in a busy city.
text: This was our first stay at The Library but we have stayed at two of their other properties in New York City, The Casablanca and The Giraffe.  We chose The Library because of its proximity to Grand Central Station.  Grand Central is just around the block.  These are excellent hotels, they are small which we prefer instead of the huge busy lobbies at the large hotels.  The staff is excellent, well trained, friendly and accommodating.  The hotel is immaculate from the lobby, elevator, room, bath.  They have the most comfortable beds and soft sheets.  The room were they have breakfast is always well stocked and immaculate.  The staff is willing to help you prepare your meal.  My one pet peeve I wish they had some different offerings each day at breakfast.  We would stay at any of the Library Hotel Collections sites any where with total confidence.

title: Exceptional Midtown Library Hotel
text: Wife and I loved the Library Hotel! Only a 15min walk to many great NY attractions, and only a block from Grand Central. Very clean and courteous staff. The breakfast options, and wine/cheese happy hour, were delicious. 100% would stay again!

title: Reading lights
text: The location is great and I really liked the "Reading Room." The staff were very pleasant and I enjoyed the round-the-clock snacks.  But for a hotel that makes "reading" its theme, the lighting is disappointing.

title: Great Hotel, Friendly Staff, In the Middle of Everything
text: We were in NYC to attend an Iron Maiden Concert - my wife and 19 year old son. I wanted to stay in Brooklyn near the concert venue, but my wife wanted to be in Manhattan. So, I made our reservations for the Library Hotel and am glad I did. The rooms were very nice, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the breakfasts and wine and cheese shindigs were a nice touch. I even made time to read parts from some of the many books on the shelves, as well as get over to the main branch of the NYC Public Library just a couple blocks away. Over three days we walked the length of Manhattan from the Battery to Harlem with the Library Hotel as our base. Will definitely come back.

title: Excellent Hotel in the very center of Manhattan
text: If you like books and comfort : this is the place to be !  And included in the price of the room, continental breakfast, all day refreshments and wine/cheese moment every evening from 5-8 PM...And I almost forgot the roofbar ...

title: Wonderful Hotel in great location
text: We stayed at 4 Library Collection hotels and the one (Library) was fantastic. We love boutique hotels and this did not dissapoint. The staff were lovely, the room great and the hotel facilities perfect. Roof terrace is lovely and the afternoon wine reception was very pleasant. Being boutique, they are not cheap but with breakfast included plus the wine reception, it's not too bad ($600 AUD/$500 USD per night).

title: A great place for a long weekend getaway
text: The Library Hotel was located in walking distance to the theaters, Grand Central Station, Hell's Kitchen.  It was quiet, everyone was very helpful, the continental breakfast and happy hour had variety and great service. The 2nd floor reading room was a wonderful place to take a break.  We were in the Fairy Tale room--each room has a theme.  I've already recommended the hotel to my friends.

title: 素晴らしいホテルです！
text:
スタッフがとても素晴らしく、ホテルでリラックスして過ごす事ができました。
こじんまりしたホテルですが、その分、目が行き届いている気ぐします。
５泊しましたが、掃除がとても行き届いていて、気持ちよかったです。
朝食等の場所では常にその時間に合わせた物が不足なく補充されていて、安心して頂くことができました。
タイムズスクエアや駅等に近く、夜も安心して歩いて帰ることができました。
次回も、是非宿泊したいです。
本当にありがとうございました。

title: Small midtown hotel with outstanding service
text: The Library Hotel rates high marks in all aspects of a desirable stay in NYC. Most notable is the friendliness of the staff - calling me by name from the moment of check-in.  The room was spotless, the amenities innumberable! I will definitely be returning.

title: the best!
text: if you are staying in nyc this is by far the best and only place to stay. the best rooms, service ,breakfast and happy hour. you will definitely leave here happy and come back again and again as we have done.  Enjoy!!

title: Great Place!
text: We love the Library Hotel.  The hotel is very comfortable and convenient, located just steps from Grand Central Station.  Great coffee, nice amenities, beautiful rooftop sitting area.  The rooms are small but clean and cozy with blackout blinds and comfortable bedding.

title: Location, service, comfort: excellent choice of hotel in New York City
text:
We booked at The Library after checking out reviews of the hotel in Trip Advisor with high expectations. Upon our arrival and stay we were pleasantly surprised by the overall experience which exceeded our expectations. 

Room: Even though some reviews mention the reduced size of rooms as an issue, we spent 9 comfortable nights in a Petite Room. It was great, comfortable bed for a recovering rest after walking all around NYC, pleasant decoration-theme and fully equipped bathroom. Size was not an issue at all.

Hotel amenities: We were pleasantly surprised by how much the hotel cares for its guests. The breakfast included in the resort fee has a good variety of options (plus it could mean saving some dollars), the cheese and wine daily reception was a great plus for relaxing after sightseeing, and we were thankful for the 24-7 availability of coffee and refreshments (either for an early cup of coffee or a late night snack).

Service: This was definitely The Library's best, the staff were courteous and professional, they are all focused on making your visit to the hotel and NYC memorable.

Location: Unrivalled location to the heart of NYC, just behind Grand Central and 5 minutes from the 5th Avenue. Easy walking access to basically everywhere.

We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Library on future visits to NYC.

title: Increíble estancia
text: El hotel es toda una experiencia, la decoración increíble y sobre todo muy cómoda y funcional la habitación. El servicio de primer nivel muy amables en front desk, nos apoyaron todo el tiempo para que nuestra experiencia fuera excelente.

title: My most favourite hotel
text:
I love the library hotel.  You can't beat the location.  There is a bathtub in the room (so unusual for New York hotels) and the staff are fabulous.  This trip I arrived traumatised due to delayed planes and missing luggage and the staff were so kind and apologetic (in fact the first apology I got as the airline failed to do so when advising me my luggage would arrive the next day....) which was just what I needed after a long haul flight.  Arriving to my room with the bottle of rose waiting - it doesn't get any better.
I think this is my 3rd visit to this hotel and my 7th visit to New York and for the price, location and facilities it is perfect.

title: Zeer goed hotel en ideale uitvalsbasis nabij de oase van Bryant park/NY public library
text: Ideale uitvalsbasis nabij Bryant park. Hotel is in teken van boeken en... boeken. Je kan er steeds eventjes op rust komen. 24/24h refreshments die je op elk moment kan gebruiken. Elke avond wijn en kaasreceptie. Dit is allemaal inbegrepen. Central Station (ook subway) op 300 m. Heerlijke toproofbar...

title: Perfect place to Stay for Harry Potter Parts 1 & 2
text: Brush up on your Dewey skills. We were upgraded to Astronomy, on the fifth floor of course, which has with a direct view of the NYPL. Which was perfect for this librarian who came to town to see HP parts 1&2. Theaters are just a short walk away so it's a perfect starting point to explore NYC during the day, come freshen up in the room before heading out to the theater. Turn down service with chocolates with literacy quotes, relaxed sitting area, and clean bath rounded out our stay. The staff are all attentive. Bonus: take your breakfast to the roof deck!

title: Birthday Visit
text:
This was our second visit to the hotel, and our daughters first to celebrate a significant birthday.
The location is excellent for a visit to NY. The staff were very welcoming and helpful at all times.
Loved the roof bar for an early evening drink.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Excellent stay with one exception.  Although told by a staff member that I only needed to bring my room key to the New York Athletic Club to use the fitness facility, I was denied access to use it when I could not provide a photo ID.  They told me to walk back to the hotel, get the ID, and then they'd come back. I objected to giving them my driver's license to keep while using the facility, so I didn't return.  But, more importantly, the staff should have known and informed me correctly of the policy.

title: Excellent
text: Great hotel, very close to the main landmarks, the staff was very helpful and nice! We stayed there for a full week and were never disappointed! The room opened for breakfast and snacks is a very relaxing place!!

title: Hidden Gem of New York
