text: Quaint, cozy and sophisticated. There is attention to detail from great food to great staff. Central location close to shopping and theater but not congested with people. Very relaxed abd welcoming environment that is priced just right!

title: Wonderful Stay in the Heart of It All
text: This is my second time staying with a thirteen-year-old granddaughter. The first time was two years ago, and the hotel lived up to my memory of it. This is the place to stay to show off my home town.  The property is interesting and spotless, with a motif perfect for a book lover or anyone interested in an original concept.  Service is fine, personnel helpful and friendly.  The small size does not allow for much in the way of amenities, but the second floor lounge is a special place to have graciously presented breakfasts, all-day coffee/tea and snacks, and pre-dinner wine and cheese.  The upstairs bar with outdoor space is small but appealing, although I did not spend much time there given the age of my companion.  A massive plus is the location -- we were in and out of grand central terminal, a destination in itself, and from there it was an easy ride up and downtown.  Busses provided easy transport across town, and we did not have to use uber once.  A great destination in a great destination city.

title: Wonderful experience!
text: We had a great stay. The staff were so nice and helpful. We enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and the location is fantastic. All of the rooms have books, and the 2nd floor is so relaxing to visit for snacks and to relax with a book. We will definitely visit again.

title: Wonderful experience
text:
The location is excellent,  and even if it is a hectic neighborhood, the hotel is quiet. 
The staff is very kind and helpful, everyone feels welcome upon arrival. The breakfast is good quality, large  and fresh .  The evening wine and cheese reception is a brillant idea that makes the difference.  Rooms are OK, clean, confortable : we were in a small one, near elevators but the insonorisation was fine.

title: Perfect in every way
text: I can’t say enough great things about our stay at the Library Hotel. The service was exceptional - friendly, helping with all of our travel needs, including getting to a wedding on Long Island. The breakfast and roof top bar were fabulous, and the location was perfect for walking to the theatre, landmarks, shops, and restaurants.  The rooms were large, quiet, spotless, and the bed comfortable, Then to top it all off, being surrounded by books made the experience unique. My husband loved reading one of the books in our room at night. I can’t wait to come back.

title: Friends in NYC in July 2019
text: This hotel continues to impress (3rd stay in last couple of years) with a convenient location for dining and “tourist activities”, well kept (for an older building), and an extremely friendly and attentive staff (especially the Ladies who kept serving us the Prosecco each afternoon for wine hour). Our go to place for a Manhattan visit.

title: Library Hotel is a gem
text: Great find in NYC. Charming, clean, and convenient. staff was polite and responsive. Resort fee was a little unexpected. Outstanding rooftop bar. Overall a great value. Have been here before and will be back.

title: A delightful place to stay
text:
We had two rooms, for my wife and myself and for our daughter and granddaughter.  The location on Madison and 41st is very convenient.  The rooms were not large, but were well appointed, spotlessly clean and vey comfortable and quiet.  The front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  The breakfast buffet was good and the complimentary afternoon wine and cheese were most welcome.

All in all, we left very content and feeling we had more than or money's worth.  I plan to stay here whenever I am in New York.

title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: Just checked in .  So far a great experience. Room is lovely. Staff is courteous and cordial. Views are nice . Breakfast is continental and plentiful. Stay tuned ! Check in was quick and pleasant. A quick walk to Times Square and Grand central . All in all very comfortable. A+

title: Barbra Streisand
text:
Came to New York to see this wonderful lady and chose this hotel for proximity to grand central and madison gardens
We are in ancient history room 902 for a week and quite impressed 
Quaint very clean bedrooms very bijou 
Comfy beds dailyaid service 
Included is a very good continental breakfast excellent fruit porridge cereals bagels boiled eggs and pastries 
Coffee is very good and they have takeout containers 
Snacks during the day like biscuits and fruit and pastries all day water and coffee or tea
Haven’t tried the wine and cheese 5-8 but I’m sure will be great 
Toilet broke today and got back all fixed 
All in all a good start

title: Delightful gem
text:
First time here . What a wonderful surprise. It is very walkable from grand Central and although close by 42nd street is on a quieter street that is straight up from the 42nd st Library with the lions .So great location.The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful . My king bed room although small, was perfect. The hotel is a boutique hotel with a theme for the rooms based on the Dewey Decimal system. I stayed in the paranormal room ( 11th floor ) and all the books in the room reflected that subject matter. ( there is a love room , a math room , fairy tales etc ).  Breakfast is included and quite good : a self serve selection of  small pastries , bagels , toast ,cream cheese , nutella , peanut butter  fruit salad as well as fresh fruit, yogurt. There is also a wine and cheese time every afternoon . On the 14th top floor there is an inside bar, a comfortable seating area outside that is covered as well as seating outside of that for wine and snacks.while watching the sunset . 
The restaurant downstairs is quite good and accommodating with food preferences. Yes the elevators are small but this is a first world problem . The lounge on the second floor in which breakfast as well as the wine and cheese is served is lovely, spacious and tranquil . Fabulous coffee. i would go back in a heartbeat . This will be my go to place in NYC. it meets all my criteria ; quiet , good breakfast, comfortable room , restaurant in house and friendly staff.The fact that it has a special appeal for readers is just icing on the cake. We also had a safe as well as a refrigerator in the room.
My stay could not have been better .

title: Oh dear!
text: I have stayed here several times and quite enjoyed it.  One of the good features was the complimentary breakfast and evening wine and cheese.  Only now they have decided to levy a $25 resort fee for this whether you want it or not.  I was out each evening so did not have the wine and cheese.  Worse when the breakfast was FOC it was barely adequate but now you have to pay it is very much sub-standard.  The attached photos show the breakfast.  Worth $25? Not of my money. This feels like a hotel that is trying to gauge prices too much and has over done it.

title: Good and Bad
text:
I had a petite room to myself. The hotel website was clear and transparent about the size of the petite room, so I went in expecting a closet. While the room was small, it was cleverly designed with windows, shelves, lights, mirrors and glass to make the space not feel like a closet. 

That being said, it would still be very crowded for two people, tall people, large people, or people with a lot of luggage. I am 5' 4", and lying on my stomach, my toes were at the end of the bed. There was one small counter that fit my airline carry-on roller bag. That is all the luggage you can fit. If you bring a larger bag, your only option will be to open it on the bed, and then you will have to close it back up at night to put it upright on the floor so you can use the bed. The hotel tries to be clear about the room size on the website, but I'm trying to be a little more blunt about it. If there are two of you, if you are tall, if you are large, or if you come with a big bag or bags, you won't fit in the room.

The bathrooms were small, but very nice. Great hot water. TV small, as others have noted, but I did not use the TV. No problems with WIFI. Breakfast and wine/cheese were great! Of course not like gourmet dining, but awesome that they are provided, and included in the resort fee. I definitely got my $25 resort fee worth of breakfast, water, juice and cookies throughout the day. 

The BIG ding on this place - the elevators. There are only two small, slow elevators that hold a maximum of 7 people (without bags) servicing 14 floors. At check-in at 3pm, there is a long line of people with bags waiting to use the elevators. That can be understandable. But at 5-7 pm, there is a long line of people waiting to use the elevators to go to the roof top bar. The area immediately in front of the two elevators is very small, and I do not appreciate being a paying, staying guest, but having to wait outside in record heat to be able to access the lobby, the elevators and/or the stairs (I was on the 4th floor, and more than good with using the stairs, but the stairs were even hard to reach during peak times) because people on dates are crowding in front of the elevators to get to the bar. I don't know how you remedy that, but maybe have the doorman or someone trying to do some kind of triage to get staying guests priority access to the elevators? I almost went for only a 3 star rating just because of the elevators, but really loved everything else, so went with 4 stars.

As noted by others, staff were great.

title: Perfection
text:
This hotel is absolutely wonderful! Esmerelda, Duke and the entire staff were so welcoming, courteous, helpful and professional. Our room was beautiful,  with a view of the New York library making it extra special.The afternoon wine and cheese reception was lovely, as was the breakfast and the rooftop terrace. The availability of coffee, tea and cookies all day was great! We love books and there are books in the room and in every nook and cranny of this hotel. The only negative was the rather loud ac unit in our room, but that did not impact us too much.There was just something so magical about this hotel and we can't wait to return some day soon.
Thank you to all.

title: Perfect Location
text: The hotel's central midtown location is perfect for exploring the city at any time of day while always having a "home base" to easily return to. With abundant complimentary treats, books, cheeses, wines, and other refreshments throughout the day, this is our perfect spot for making the most of our trips to NYC.

title: Library Hotel - NYC
text: Our stay at the Library Hotel was awesome!! The location is perfect. The staff was wonderful - extremely friendly and helpful. We are already looking forward to our next trip to NYC and are planning on staying at this hotel.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Nice rooms, well appointed and a decent size for city centre. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The wine and cheese each night was a great way to start an evening. The location was perfect for us being so close to Grand Central station, Broadway and Times Sq.

title: Excellent stay
text: We traveled as a family of four, and loved this place. What a difference compared to overcrowded corporate chain hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location, very cozy, room size was good enough for us , with one king bed and one sofa bed. Room faced Madison ave, a little noisy, but quieted down enough at night for us to get a good sleep. Breakfast buffet, and wine and cheese reception was decent. The staff was super helpful and welcoming.  We liked that the beautiful lounge was available at all times with snacks, and coffee, etc. We will stay here again on our next visit.

title: Amazing boutique hotel in the middle of Manhattan
text:
We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed the experience. A personal touch across the hotel and accommodating staff. The room was well appointed and the reading room was a fantastic spot for breakfast, wine and cheese to finish the day and for quiet reading if desired away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. Close to everything.
Thank you for your hospitality throughout our stay.

title: Fantastic
text: I will definitely stay there again, friendly, very clean, and convenient.  Just a wonderful retreat in the city.  We are able to get around so very easily and the staff was always there to help and make suggestions.  The roof top was just as amazing and the  continental breakfast and happy hour was a plus.

title: Quaint Comfort
text:
Our stay at this hotel was both relaxing and enjoyable.  Being in NYC, hotel rooms are characteristically on the smaller size and come at a price.  The hotel itself is a narrow building typical in NYC, so every room has the same street view, and there is no advantage in being higher.  We were located on the fourth floor and regularly took to the stairs for a bit of opportunistic exercise.  (If you do this you will see some clever artistic wall decoration at the lower levels.)

The hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly, and eager to do their best in the circumstances.  They were genuine in their efforts to make our stay as pleasant as possible.

The hotel has some nice innovations - most notably the second floor which was set up as a pleasant space for refreshments and to gather yourself before moving on to the next activity.  This room served as the breakfast venue (continental style - very good) and as a place where you could get yourself simple refreshments at any time of the day (including fruit - how good is that!)  There was also complimentary drinks in the evening, which was also a nice touch.

The room itself had a comfortable bed and all the normal amenities one expects.  It does of course have books in the room as a themed touch - which provides a curiousity if you have some moments to yourself.

Overall I thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good clean room in NYC.  Being near Grand Central Station it is well located mid-town and within easy access to most NYC amenities.

title: Great Location, Wonderful Staff
text: The  Library Hotel has everything! We love the convenient midtown location, the complimentary breakfast and happy hour and the friendly, helpful staff. Only criticism is the rooms are dark, improved lighting would make a big difference.

title: Great central and cosy location
text: Perfect Location with many highlights in walking distance. breakfast, wine & cheese and cookies & drinks all day for free are wonderful to feel fine. Very friendly employees/Service and you can rent books and DVDs for free.

title: Great hotel
text:
We stayed at Library Hotel for 3 nights. It's a smallish hotel 1 block from NYPl. The location is fantastic. Close to times square, 5th ave, theaters, shopping, Bryant park etc. I think we were there during a quiet time, I can see the elevator being slow when full.
Our room was clean and comfortable,  but really small. I've probably stayed in 20 different NYC hotels,  I think it would rate in top 5 smallest. The bed especially,  it was supposed to be a full size bed, but just barely.  It wasnt a particularly comfortable one either, just ok. Trying to watch Wimbledon on the tiny TV was difficult. Lighting in bathroom was dim. That would be easily remedied if the magnified mirror was lighted.
Pet peeve alert....only 1 hook to hang a towel, and it was a hook that was a nob, looks nice, but towels or anything slip right off.
Noise level was typical NYC. We were on 11th floor and noise was light background. If you are particular about street noise,  dont stay here. However we found noise from AC to be really annoying. We had to shut it off, but it got hot real fast as this was july.
Now onto things I loved....
 Free breakfast!! Bread, fruit, cereal, hard boiled eggs. Terrific!!!
Free happy hour...cheese crackers veggies  wine, prosecco, superb!!
Staff very friendly , helpful and attentive
Windows  in rooms open  for fresh  air! I love  that! Good sized fridge in room with complementary water!! Yey!
Adorable rooftop bar... we loved it there...pricey...of course
Location!!! Just cant be beat...and around corner from grand central.
If our bed had been sized to fit 2 people, I would bump up to 5 stars

title: This amazing book nook hotel is a must!
text:
The Library hotel is incredible. Their staff is warm, welcoming and goes above and beyond to meet your every need while staying there. They have snacks for the family all day as well as a wine & cheese hour. Their rooms are spacious and nicely decorated with lots of books. They are not expensive and have so many amenities included in the price.
If they had valet parking, they would be perfect!!

title: Great Experience!
text:
Staff was wonderful and didn’t blink when our arrival was delayed until 1:30 AM. They quickly checked us into our room and helped us with our bags.

While rooms are on the small side, they are well-appointed and include a refrigerator, safe for valuables, bottled water, robes and slippers. Each room is “catalogued” and includes a lovely selection of books related to the room’s subject (ours was Architecture).

The hotel’s lounge was a great setting for breakfast and happy hour every day and water, tea, coffee and snacks were available around the clock.

The New York Public Library is footsteps away and Time Square is a 15 minute stroll. You can’t beat the location of this hidden gem!

title: Charming boutique with personality and excellent service
text: My new favourite hotel in NYC for business or pleasure.  It’s a compact boutique, so no grand lobby or corner spot, but it has everything you could need including a cute and functional ‘Library’ one floor up where round the clock refreshments mean it’s possible to work, have business meetings or relax with newspapers or one of the books from the well stocked shelves etc.  Each room has the quirk of a number in the form of a Dewey Decimal classification - a gimmick you might think, but when coupled with service, quality and cleanliness this good then it works for me.

title: Awesome Boutique Hotel in New York City
text: The staff were amazing! They were so professional and helpful. They went out of their way to make our stay memorable, They are good people who truly care about making their guests feel welcome and at home. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: My new favorite Manhattan hotel
text: Offering comfort and privacy in a prime midtown location (one block from the iconic main branch of the NY Public Library), the Library hotel also has character.  Although the rooms are no bigger than most NYC hotels, they are immaculately designed and appointed, with many thoughtful extras like complimentary Qtips and cotton puffs in the bathroom, a jug of milk for your coffee in the fridge, and, of course, books.  There is a rooftop bar, but more my speed was the wonderful lounge, the Reading Room, free to guests, lined with books, and serving coffee, tea and snacks (think nice cookies and pastries) at all hours, and also offering a continental breakfast in the mornings and a happy hour with wine and cheese in the evenings.  One can picture a group of librarians holding a (very quiet) convention here ;)  Service is exceptional, and prices are reasonable.  I plan to return.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This is my second time to stay at the Library Hotel and it was just as charming as my first visit. I especially appreciate the large lounge area with a delicious breakfast and a place to work and enjoy snacks and beverages throughout the day. A terrific location too.

title: Great visit!
text: Third time to NYC and my favorite hotel by far.   All staff we encountered:  front desk, housekeeping, doormen and attendants in the reading room were friendly and helpful.  We enjoyed the breakfast and cheese/wine reception every day.    Loved the location of the hotel as we were able to easily walk to see two plays in the theater district.  We enjoyed the daily water and chocolates.     It was so quiet we felt like we were the only guests on our floor.      Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Service + Style for Solo Birthday Adventure
text: A gem in the heart of Manhattan. Stylish, practical, and great service from all the staff. Easy to walk to anything and everything. Enjoyed the rooftop bar nightly (not a thumping party scene but a beautiful terrace and view) Nice breakfast with the NY Times (old school paper!) and happy hour was a welcome refuge to look forward to after hot summer days playing tourist. Shout out to Steven (doorman) who was always congenial and offered help to find the unmarked airport express bus stop a block away. Birthday champagne and chocolates were waiting in my room as ordered by a friend. Only improvement worth mentioning is better makeup lighting in bathroom.

title: Short Winter break 2019 in NYC
text:
Apologies for late posting of my stay....  Love this hotel!
Cozy room and nicely decorated.  The library area is a relaxing place to unwind and have a coffee, there are snacks (included in room rate), however it would be nice if there were also gluten free options available (apart from stock standard fruit).  The rooftop area is wonderful too - fireplace on during those cold winter days :)  
Great location, walking distance to many places.
Staff at reception and the door are so welcoming - thank you.
When in NYC, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Perfect
text: Wonderful hotel cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.. everyone was so friendly and helpful could not do enough for you. We stayed in the love room the room with a balcony wow just wow absolutely stunning. Loved having our coffee and cakes on the balcony and watching the world go by. We have stayed at larger hotels in New York and  would come back here over and other hotel..just sorry we did not find this hotel sooner.

title: Stylish Hotel for Book Lovers
text: This hotel is unique! It is conveniently located to the New York Public Library, The Empire State Building and Times Square. The service was excellent. I stayed at the Petite room. It was small but tidy, clean, cozy and modernly furnished.  The only disadvantage was that it was close to the elevator. I spent the afternoon in the Poetry Garden reading a novel because the weather was rainy the first day.

title: Another wonderful visit
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our first visit in February 2019, we decided to come back again.  We booked the same type of room but we were upgraded to a queen room, #702, Paintings.  This room was very nice and just as our first room, the space was utilized very well.  Our only complaint was the mattress seemed to sink or lean in towards the center of the bed.  While it made that nights sleep a bit uncomfortable, the room was clean and wonderfully decorated.  I can’t imagine why, but I found the first rooms books on Economics more interesting that the books on Paintings.  It is is a great location and it is worth money.

title: Always the best time!
text: Once again we had the best time in NYC staying at the Library Hotel which is based in an excellent location. We had family join us from all over - England & South Africa who also stayed at The Library. In the evenings we relaxed with wine, cheese & biscuits and since we were all jet lagged, we loved the fact we could meet at all ours of the night for coffee & biscuits in the library. I love this hotel, it’s my favourite city hotel in the world and we hope to see you all again very soon! Thank you once again for a great stay...your staff are always kind, attentive and very friendly!

title: Liz Bullock
text: Stayed 6 nights in June. Lovely hotel and staff. Ideally situated in midtown Manhattan. The complimentary breakfast and cheese and wine were the icing on the cake. Very close to Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, and Empire State Builiding.

title: Stylish boutique hotel in a great location
text:
A centrally located boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Transport and all the major things to see are all at your door (or close by). 

The front desk staff are the standout here as well as the excellent library theme. It could have turned out to be ‘Disneylandish’ but they have done well to carry the theme throughout the hotel without it being in your face.

We had a great three night stay and would definitely drop our heads here again.

title: Loved the Library Hotel
text:
We had such a wonderful experience at the Library Hotel. Would have loved to have stayed longer. The continental breakfast was perfect as a quick start to the day. And, the 24-hour access to coffee, tea, treats and books was awesome. 
We stayed on the 12th floor in one of the larger rooms. The room was great. Love that they do turn down service. And, just so nice to have free bottled water in addition to the continental breakfast and evening receptions. It was refreshing to not be charged or things every time we turned around.
The staff was fantastic. Always there to help. Everything about our stay was pleasant and uncomplicated. These are qualities that seems to have escaped most hotels these days.
We will definitely stay there again and definitely recommend it.

title: Bibliophiles delight.
text: We spent a night at this small gem of a hotel located in mid town Manhattan. Service couldn’t have been better from check in through the included  breakfast the next morning. Great value, clean and accessible. The only issue is street noise. Located at the corner of 41st and Madison that should come as no real surprise.

title: lovely place-great location
text:
Wonderful staff-clean rooms-great little breakfast in the am and wine/cheese times in the afternoons-
only reason I didnt do a 5 star is that it is quite pricey (and with my  weak Canadian $ even worse)-I know NY is expensive- maybe my mom was right- I should have stayed in school and become a Dr. or Lawyer....

title: Best hotel ever
text: I loved!!!this hotel, from the welcoming and friendly “Libra to the unique and individual rooms.  The bed was awesome and the amenities delightful.  I can’t wait to come back and pick a different room. We especially enjoyed “bookmarks “ the lounge on the 14th floor. Simply lovely and located in the heart of Manhattan.

title: Great place to stay close to everything
text: We received a warm welcome at the Library Hotel and had a great stay. Would definitely go again. Great location, comfortable room, good perks and our room was very quiet which was surprising considering it is in midtown!

title: We love this place
text:
This is the 5th time my family and i have stayed at the library hotel and we love it.  The rooms are spacious, the staff is thoroughly professional and courteous, and the amenities are most welcomed.
The location was ideal and I whoeheartedly Recomend this to anyone who is looking for a terrific NY hotel

title: Great Boutique Hotel and Excellent staff
text: First time in NY, I made a right choice to stay in this hotel. The best location for us, it’s so close to the Grand Central station only a few mins walk from the hotel so it's safe our time to get in and out of NY as the traffic could be quite bad in the city. You can find so many great restaurants nearby and easy to get a cab or Uber. The hotel has a distinctive character, each room has a different name. Our suite was a good size, spotless, bed and pillows were so comfortable. The hotel offered Continental Breakfast which was a good choice of pastries and all day refreshments plus wine and cheese for aperitif. Hotel staff was EXCELLENT, so friendly, efficient and attentive! THANK YOU to everyone (specially Billy) who made our stay in NY so memorable!

title: Wow!!!!!!
text:
Wow!!!!! This place is absolutely amazing!!! from the moment we stepped into it , till the moment we went home. I cant praise this place enough!!
It was our 25th wedding anniversary, and they had a bottle of bubbly in our room for our arrival along with a card....lovely touch, and that was the start of a wonderful experience. 
From the outside, it's small and quaint looking along side all the buildings beside it, but don't be fooled......it has an amazing ambience. We were here for 4 nights, in an executive room, which was reasonably large with views out onto the street and to the national Library. There's no tea or coffee in the room which at the start my husband ( A tea-aholic) thought was awful, but was actually better. There is a Reading room in the hotel, where breakfast is served, and there is tea, coffee, danishes, biscuits, water etc on tap 24 hours a day, and its a beautiful room to sit down and rest those weary legs as they will be very weary from all the walking that you'll be doing in New York City. 
Breakfast is a continental, but they have boiled eggs and toast as well as the usual fruit danishes cereals and even porridge, but it was super and kept us going to well past lunchtime. 
Every day from 5-8pm or was it 4 -7pm they have wine and cheese, white wine, red wine, or Prosecco with nuts, biscuits and again danishes, and you can basically drink as much as you like. We only made it back one afternoon as we were local that day. 
Something that I want to point out is that when we arrived we bought some toiletries on the way, but if you call reception, they have everything that you'll ever need, and it would have saved us about 50 dollars!
If you want something that little bit special for a special occasion, or just a nice romantic place to lay you head, get this booked, as it's simply the best!!

title: Wonderful
text: This place was lovely and clean, staff were great. Comfortable beds with plenty of space in the room. Wifi was good, nice rooftop. Great location over in Midtown. Reasonably priced compared with similar hotels we have stayed at. Hopefully we can return in the future.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: One of my favorite hotels in NY. I come to NYC every year for a solo trip to shop and walk and explore museums. I always choose a different hotel in different neighborhoods. After about 8 years, I've finally found a hotel that makes me want to stay there again! The room was tiny, but perfect for a solo traveler. The bathroom had enough countertop space for everything, unlike many NY hotel bathrooms! The water pressure was a little weak, but good enough. The bed was a little hard, but I was always exhausted at the end of the day anyway. Everyone at the hotel is spectacularly nice and helpful  and sweet. I felt like they were really happy I was staying there. The second floor lounge is absolutely the best. Quiet. Relaxing. Great view. Always something to drink or snack on. The breakfast has more than enough great choices to get you on your way. An easy place to stay. The only real downside was the noise outside on the street in the early morning, which is typical for NY anyway, so I took it in stride.

title: Friends
text: The Hotel was absolutely lovely from the elevators to the Rooftop. The rooms were wonderful The amenities could not be beat The staff were friendly helpful and kind The breakfast was delicious The wine and cheese at 5 were perfect The check out time was 1 pm

title: Top-notch service and convenience
text: We stayed for a week and were ready to move in permanently. The rooms are small but lovely and perfectly appointed. The staff is excellent. The reading room is lovely - for early coffee, breakfast, wine happy hour, and of course, reading. The restaurant (Madison & Vine) is excellent, and weather permitting, a lovely place to eat, sip and watch the world of NY walk by. We will be back!

title: great!
text: Fantastic location in Midtown. Employees of the hotel are very professional and helpful. The room was perfect. Small hotel on a human scale, for New York. Much better than the big international hotels. A lot of small attentions who makes the difference!

title: Wonderful location, terrific hotel, great rates
text: We loved this hotel.  We took the “single” room and it was just fine for two of us. We enjoyed all the books, the great breakfast (in the book filled lounge) the happy hour (delicious and great selection of cheese). We visited the roof top terrace one afternoon and regretted never getting up there after dark.  The location was perfect - one block from NYPL along Library Way. Walked to the theatre, Times Square, MOMA, Central Park.

title: My favorite hotel in Manhattan
text: Staying here is always a delight and something I look forward to every time I am going to NYC. The library theme and all the books add to the special feeling. Great staff, great breakfast, lovely rooms — and the complimentary wine and cheese at night makes me feel lucky to have discovered this little hotel gem.

title: Mark
text:
A most enjoyable stay in a very pleasant hotel
Great location and staff were very nice and concierge most helpful and friendly
Would return again when visiting your beautiful city
Rooms most comfortable and always a pleasure when returning to relax after a busy day
Many thanks

title: BookLover’s Paradise
text: My book club and I spent the night at this amazing hotel and loved every minute. From the moment you check in with employees standing in front of an entire wall of card catalog drawers, you know this is going to be epic. The Reading Room amenities and drinking Tequila Mockingbirds at the rooftop bar Bookmarks were cherries on top of the amazing Dewey Decimal themed rooms that made each member’s stay at the Library Hotel unique. I would definitely come back in a heartbeat!

title: Great hotel in downtown new york
text:
This was my third stay at the Library Hotel. It's a bit on the expensive side for me, but you get what you paid for. I've had a good experience every time I've stayed there.

The rooms are nice (comfortable beds, good sound-proofing). The staff is consistently helpful, and the location is excellent.

title: Perfect hotel for us!
text: We were in NYC for a long weekend and stayed at the Library Hotel on the recommendation of friends. It was wonderful. We don’t usually like staying in midtown but this was an exception. It was an excellent location for Broadway and anywhere else we wanted t9 go with Grand Central right around the corner. Staff was so friendly. Dick at the desk was a delight.

title: A unique hotel on a library theme
text:
The Library Hotel is located in a great location in Mid-Town Manhattan.  The Library is an old hotel with small rooms, but these disadvantages are more than outweighed by its considerable advantages. 

The staff is completely friendly and helpful.  The beds are excellent (which must be small in the small rooms) and the rooms are warm and cozy, with the temperatures easily adjustable.  This is a vertical hotel with 14 floors and six rooms on our 9th floor, which I assume to be representative.  The first floor has reception and the bistro, the second has the pastries (available all day), the continental breakfast and the 5-8 PM wine and cheese event. The top floor has the Bookmarks bar, but we did not check this out.  

This hotel is very special because of its library theme.  Each room is named after a category in the Dewey Decimal Classification system.  Ours was Oceanography.  Others on our floor are Ancient History, Twentieth Century History, Geography and Travel, Asian History, and Biography.  Our room contains five bookshelves with about 20 books each, in which each book is appropriate for the Oceanography theme.  Making these bookshelves up must be a huge task and then ensuring that they don’t get mixed up another huge task.  This must be a labor of love on the part of the management.  I spot checked a few books and found publication dates mostly in the 1990s.  The bed cover reads “Book Lovers Never Go To Bed Alone”.  All of this together makes for an atmosphere of warmth and welcome.

title: Excellent hotel
text: We stayed here for 5 nights in late May, beginning of June and had a brilliant time. Yes the rooms are a bit small but that’s New York. It’s also pretty noisy outside for most of the night. However the staff were amazing, breakfast was lovely and the complimentary cheese and wine is a nice touch. I would certainly recommend this for those looking to visit New York, it’s really close to grand central station for the subway too!

title: I really look forward to staying in this hotel
text: There is something special here that is rarely found in many hotels today. Nothing is overdone, meaning that the staff are courteously diligent, they quickly respond to our needs and even anticipate them. I like the rooms, their cozy feeling, and I will continue to stay with them in the future.

title: Checking Out the Same Book--and It's Still a Great Read!
text:
Several years ago, I stayed at the Library before a cruise, and it was amazing. Nothing's changed since then! Same good continental breakfast, same ultra-clean rooms, same solicitous staff, same comfy bed, same books everywhere, same roof garden, and same wine-and-cheese reception in the evening. Well, I'm sure it's not the same cheese, but it's wonderful.

The hotel, as you've likely read, is based on the Dewey Decimal System. This time, I was on the Religions floor, in the German Religions room. I did find a book to pick in, but I got a free novel when I checked in so divided my time between the books I brought and that one.

You can walk to the New York Public Library, where your room card gets you a discount in their gift shop. The theater district is a healthy walk away as well. 

If I had any complaint (aside from not wanting to leave) is that their address is listed as 299 Madison Avenue but the taxis and the airport shuttle can never find it because  the entrance is on 41st Street! Aside from that, loved the visit!

title: Loved the Library Hotel
text: Read great reviews on Tripadvisor and they did not let me down. We stayed four nights and enjoyed every minute. The room was lovely and it was a perfect central location, but the service was the standout. Everyone we encountered, from front desk to housekeeping to the attendants in the Reading Room, was personable, helpful and friendly (a special thank you to Bill, the concierge, and Duke at the front desk!). I am already planning my next stay with you.

title: Excellent
text: This is a small boutique hotel in a perfect location on Madison Avenue.  Very clean, nice staff, low key but walking distance to theater district, restaurants etc...  plenty of amenities included.  Highly recommended.

title: A fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of New York
text: The Library Hotel is ideal for those who want to be thoroughly indulged whilst exploring New York.  It is very close to Times Square, Grand Central Station and the Chrysler building.  The welcome is absolutely fantastic - nothing is too much trouble - and there are pleasant little extras like complimentary breakfast and 24-hour coffee, hot chocolate and pastries.  The hotel is not very big, so it doesn't suffer from the impersonal feel of some hotels.  Highly recommended!

title: Love the Library!
text: Staying at the Library hotel has been on my bucket list for a long time!  It was an amazing experience, from the Dewey decimal themed rooms to roof top bar!  It exceeded my expectations! Would love to stay here again.

title: Great stay
text:
Hotel is very well located - Nice and comfortable rooms - great roof bar on the top to enjoy New York life. Service very effective and nice staff.  Great breakfast and wine and cheese in the evening.
we will definitely come back

title: Great Location and Excellent Service
text:
We stayed at the Library for four nights. The location is one block from Grand Central Station and withing walking distance to many attractions and excellent restaurants. The room size, at the Library, was satisfactory for New York standards. It was attractive, clean and very well appointed. The second floor lounge area was a nice setting for the complimentary breakfast and evening wine and cheese offering. The lounge was friendly and helpful and did an admirable job of attending to guests and  managing the cleanliness of the area. The breakfast included all types of coffee selections, juice, fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, bagels, toast, and sweet rolls. The wine and cheese offering included a nice choice of good wine, cheeses, crackers, nuts and other assorted goodies. The front desk staff was excellent. they were friendly, professional, and very helpful with directions, how to use the subway, and suggestions for things to do. We had difficulty with the HVAC in our room. Service staff were dispatched quickly but needed to return after repeated concerns to complete the 
repairs. I would definitely return to the Library and will seek out the other hotels in other cities.

title: The best by far
text: what a fabulous hotel, the best I have stayed at. great rooms, excellent staff,  great location. My wife and I spent 10 days at this Hotel and enjoyed their excellent hospitality. This is where I will be staying on my next trip to NY

title: Great service
text: 5 days in a very comfortable Hotel. The personnel of the hotel has been very nice and helpful for a couple who were for the firsta time in New York. The position of the hotel is "strategical" becuase very closed to the public transportation, to Time Square, Broadway, the 5th avenue, the Moma, The Empire State Building…..These are surely most of the reason which made our holidays SUPER

title: A favorite!
text: This was our second stay and they did not disappoint!   The room was exquisite and the service friendly and accommodating.  A great location right near the library.  I am a librarian so of course this place is near and dear to my heart.   The continental breakfast and wine and cheese offerings in the reading room are delicious.   The reading room is a fun place to hang out.    Can’t wait to go back!

title: Library
text: Lovely hotel helpful friendly staff. Well located. Nice room - on the small side but it is Manhattan. Breakfast was a great perk as was the nightly wine and cheese reception. Roof top bar is a nice spot for a drink.

title: Feels like being home in New York!
text: I have always loved this hotel which feels like home and is very well located to walk to many places in New York. It has been one of my favorite hotel since 2002! I have referred it to friends and family, all of whom have also very much liked it. We all continue to return to the Library hotel whenever we are in Manhattan. Great stay!

title: Library excellence
text: We live staying at the Library Hotel. The rooms, though smallish are well laid out and very nice. Complimentary breakfast and happy hour are excellent and rare in this city. Staff are always pleasant and helpful.

title: Great Everything!
text: Excellent accommodations.  Extremely clean.  Very comfortable bed.  Friendly and engaged staff.  All in a great central locations in mid-Manhattan.  Having the second floor lounge always available makes it like staying on a concierge floor.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text:
Reminiscent of European boutique hotes - l tucked away just off Madison but within walking distance of everywhere!
Superlative staff. Cozy rooftop bar.  Rained constantly the week we were there, but complimentary umbrellas kept us dry.  Wonderful recommendations for dinner and day trips. 
I definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Has genuine character and warm service
text: Recommended - breakfast in the reading room over a newspaper is a great way to start the day. Good WiFi speed. As the name suggests, lots of books everywhere but makes it feel very homely with an interesting selection of titles. I just didn’t have time to read them all - maybe next time!

title: Amabilidad y confort
text:
Hay que destacar la extraordinaria amabilidad del personal en todas las funciones: conserjería, sala de desayuno y lectura y servicio de habitaciones.
También hay que reconocer los detalles: vino como bienvenida y degustación de queso y vinos en la sala de lectura.
El hotel respiraba cultura y buen gusto en cada rincón.

La ubicación es inmejorable, en Midtown, junto a la Biblioteca Nacional y la Gran Central.

title: The staff make this a great experience.
text: While the rooms aren’t large the staff are so friendly, professional and knowledgeable you really come to feel you’re part of the family. The location is great if you’re spending lots of time near Times Square. Being near Grand Central Station afford great opportunity to hub and spoke around NYC. The hotel chain itself seems to be near fantastic neighborhood-like bars and restaurants which makes your stay even better.

title: Mother's Day in NY
text:
This was our second time at the Library Hotel in NYC and they remembered us and took such great care of us.
The location is perfect and the breakfast, snacks, and happy hour mean that you don't need to spend a bundle on meals in the city!

title: Wonderful experience
text: In addition to the unbeatable location, the Library Hotel has terrific service (including complementary continental breakfast and evening wine, full turn down service, robes, slippers) and is impeccably clean.  The rooms are a bit small, but they really work and are very comfortable.  And of course, the place is a book lover's dream--the theme is carried throughout and does not disappoint.

title: Beautiful but expensive!
text: I enjoyed this hotel very much. The room was small but very comfortable. The bathroom was nice and included a makeup mirror. The location was great and it was surprisingly quiet. The breakfast and evening wine and cheese room is a nice plus. The only downside was the price, which was high. But I would definitely go back.

title: LOVE!!!!
text: As someone who tries to travel to NYC as much as possible I would hate to stay anywhere else. Everyone is friendly and tries to help in any way they can. The unique nature of the hotel just makes it that much more special.

title: AMAZING!
text: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! Such quaint little hotel with everything you can possibly need. The service is amazing! Free continental breakfast, wine and cheese in the evening and Coffee, Cappuccino, Bottle Water, Latte and pastries all night on the second floor.  Definitely recommend it!  We stayed in a corner suite room 1006.

title: A Great Find
text: New York hotels are expensive and it often seems that you don't get very much for your money. The Library Hotel is good value in an excellent location (mid-town, close to Grand Central but far enough away from Times Square) with excellent and attentive staff. I stayed in a Petite Room which although small (as advertised) was very well laid out and comfortable with two large windows and plenty of natural light. The breakfast is adequate and the 24 hour refreshments are great. The hotel is not the cheapest but it is great value for money in this part of town.

title: Fantastic!
text:
Would thoroughly recommend this gem of a hotel.  Nestled in amongst the busy streets centrally, a stones throw from Grand Central it is a real tranquil and friendly stay with a gorgeous and cosy roof top bar.  The hotel is set out like a library too which gives it a cool quirk.

Also - a rarity for NY - is breakfast / snacks AND cheese and wine...included in the stay!

When they realised it was my birthday they sent a complimentary bottle of Prosecco to our room.  Many thanks for Billy and the team for the great care.  Really positive experience.

title: Library hotel stay
text: This hotel was one of the best hotels we have stayed at. We were there recently for 10 nights and loved every minute of it. From Duke who made us feel so welcome to all the staff they were all wonderful. We looked forward to the complimentary breakfast everyday and the glass of bubbles at night. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else in future. Perfect location, perfect hotel.

title: Wonderful
text:
We stayed for 7 nights in a suite and it was fantastic. Really friendly staff, nothing too much trouble, the cheese and wine each evening is a great way to socialise with other guests, Excellent continental breakfast too. All parts of NYC easily accessible and so close to Grand Central Terminal so great access to metro. The on-site bar and restaurant (Madison and Vine) serve great food.
Would highly recommend, thank you “the library staff”

title: Excellent
text:
Stayed for 3 nights after reading reviews on tripadvisor and not disappointed . Room was very comfortable, good shower, enjoyable breakfast with good choice , free coffee/tea anytime and wine with snacks late afternoon. 
Staff were very helpful. Good central location.

title: Quiet pampering
text: We love the library hotel and have stayed several times, mainly due to location (near enough to Broadway without being in the Broadway District), size (boutique), theme (library books), rooms (comfortable, quiet), and the extras (breakfast, cocktail hour). I understand a resort charge is now being implemented, and I regret that.

title: An excellent choice close to Grand Central
text: We really love the Library Collection hotels on Manhattan. First time at Library Hotel, a very positive experience. Within walking distance to a lot of sights on Manhattan, such as Central Park, 5th avenue, Grand Central, The Rock, and also towards Soho area. Easy to get to Newark with direct bus service from Grand Central. Very clean and nice rooms, a bit small, attentive staff, small but great complementary breakfast, A nice perk is the complementary afternoon wine and cheese from 5-8pm. Quietly located on Madison. Highly recommended. We’ll for sure be back.

title: Great find!
text:
My wife and I recently traveled to NYC for the first time in Feb. for a week of sightseeing.  We found the Library Hotel on the recommendation of friends. It was perfect!

The location in midtown is very convenient. It’s only a short block from the magnificent Midtown branch of the NYC Public Library, Grand Central Station, numerous great restaurants and a 5 minute walk from the theatre district. The hotel was very quiet,  clean and fresh and the staff was professional, helpful and friendly. 

We look forward to returning.

title: Fabulous Location
text: Stayed here with my husband for a long birthday weekend. New York is loud so even up on a high floor you can still hear the buzz of the town below. We loved it though, it was so central being on Madison and tight by Grand Central and a short walk to Times Square and all the shopping. Rooms were spacious and comfortable enough, staff were extremely ready to help as much as they could. The bathroom was nice and clean. Sadly we didn’t manage to have a drink on the rooftop bar but it looked great. They had a wine and cheese time each day in the early evening where they served to all guests, which we thought was a brilliant touch. We also enjoyed the breakfasts, which was more than adequate, great bagels when requested them toasted. Definitely recommend, especially for avid readers.

title: Smarter just for staying there.
text: The Library Hotel is a wonderful, boutique hotel just a block from the New York Public Library (which is worth the trip in itself).  From the moment you check in the staff is wonderful and attentive.  The room was great.  The morning breakfast and evening wine and snacks were a pleasant surprise and after one trip to the rooftop bar, you're a regular.  We can't wait to get back.

title: A wonderful small hotel
text: If you like small charming friendly hotels, then the Library Hotel is for you. From the initial welcome to final farewell, my wife and I were thrilled. The room was small but it was advertised as petite so it was fine. It was cozy which added to the sense of intimacy and charm. The book theme was also charming and appropriate as the hotel is on Library Way one block from the New York Public Library. It is also one block from Grand Central Terminus and Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and MoMa are all within easy walking distance. The breakfast, evening wine and cheese and 24 hour coffee and snacks were great and fit with our busy schedule. The staff were very courteous, friendly and helpful.

title: Ottimo soggiorno
text: L'hotel è in una zona centrale, perfetta per il turismo. La stazione della metropolitana di Grand Central Terminal è vicinissima; Bryant Park e Times Square si raggiungono comodamente a piedi; mete come l'Empire State Building, il Rockefeller Center e Central Park non sono lontane. Albergo confortevole e pulito, ambienti comuni eleganti e accoglienti, servizio accurato: non è un albergo gigantesco e anonimo tipico delle grandi catene. Colazione e wi-fi veloce inclusi nel prezzo. In ogni camera ci sono libri (in inglese) in tema col nome della camera e a disposizione degli ospiti. Ci siamo trovati bene, ci torneremmo e lo consigliamo.

title: Still one of the best
text: It’s perfect.  Quiet.  No crazy nightlife scene. Off the beaten track but still close to things. The staff is terrific.  The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Nice wine hour and breakfast.  I’ll be back.  Wish they didn’t have a two night minimum.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Wonderful hotel, very tasty breakfast (especially for vegetarians: bagels, cream, fresh fruits, porridge etc.), efficient, helpful and very friendly staff, room had very comfortable bed, big bathroom, cosy atmosphere in breakfast room with books and newspapers, cool rooftop bar - amazing both inside and outside, excellent restaurant!
We loved the special extras: bottle of wine in room, books as present at check-in.
Walking distance to Public Library, Grand Central Terminal, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Times Square.
Highly recommendable hotel!

title: I want to live here
text: If I could afford it I would live here. I've stayed in two different sized rooms and while the smallest had what's needed it was somewhat tricky to navigate around doors. The Queen room however, was perfect, a little entry removed logistics problems, the bathroom was a good size, with robe and slippers, the bed comfy. Only a small TV however, in this age of giant screens, but perfect for a hotel that prides itself on books. And there are plenty to choose from, not to mention one block from NYs huge public library on 5th. If you don't read you will not feel the full ambiance. Best of all, if not a huge eater you can do nicely on their excellent morning spread and wine and cheese early evening. Tables to read the NYT while hefty snacking. Since I was on working vacation that convenience was wonderful, and 24 hr coffee, tea, fruit and cookies. So if wake before breakfast can at least drown in coffee. As the title says, if I win the lottery I'm moving in. Not least, the staff is excellent.

title: Easter 2019
text:
Nous avons passé un grand week end de Paques à NYC avec nos amis. Notre séjour au Library Hotel s'est bien déroulé. Nous avions une junior Suite au 9 etage, agréable spacieuse et lumineuse, avec une belle vue sur Madison avenue, un peu bruyante, mais c'est new york ! Le petit dejeuner continental est un peu simple. L'hotel est bien situé (proximité immediate du métro), avec un roof top fort sympathique et la possibilité d'y prendre le fromage et verre de vin (ou un jus de fruit)  proposé de 17 à 20 h (inclus dans le prix de la chambre)
Un bien agréable séjour
A conseiller.

title: Quaint Hotel & Service
text: Hotel was perfect for a quick business trip. Check in process was fast and easy. Front desk provided restaurant suggestion and called ahead for me to make sure I could get in. Bkfst was great! Do over.

title: The extras make it
text:
Just back from a 6 night stay at the Library and I had a great time indeed. We booked the hotel last years so breakfast and the wine evening was included. We had breakfast every morning and it was excellent as was the wine and cheese. All the staff were very helpful. 

The roof terrace is amazing though we didn’t try the bar. 

We stayed in a deluxe room on the 9th floor which was a decent size and the bed was comfortable but small, only a UK double.  The room was very dark due to a small window, so the lights needed to be on all the time.  The wardrobe was very small indeed for two people staying 6 nights and you can hear the street noise constantly as the double glazing was either non-existent or old. I have stayed in Manhattan many times before and have not had an issue anywhere else.   

The whole experience was great but I think there are better value rooms to be had in Manhattan

title: Good location, good service
text: Rooms were rather small (hey, it's New York City) but nice.  Service was good, and the breakfast room is a nice place to start your day.  Good location -- about a 10 minute walk to Times Square/Broadway theaters.

title: A Quiet Oasis
text: My husband and I enjoyed returning to our hotel each day. It was a nice break from the hustle and bustle in the city. Everything was clean and the employees were kind and accommodating. The breakfast and afternoon reception was something we looked forward to each day. We would definitely stay here again if we return to NYC.

title: Wonderful staff
text: The hotel is staffed with attentive, friendly and professional staff from the front desk to the housekeeper.  The 24 hour snacks and coffee is appreciated as well as the wine and cheese afternoons.  The rooms are small but well appointed.

title: Very special
text: This hotel is very sweet and charming. The amenities are wonderful and the service super. There is a rooftop bar with trees and views of the library, and is extremely well located. The service was very attentive.

title: Incredible view, incredible services
text: It is the best hotel I have been to in Manthatan.  It has the luxury of a 5 star hotel, the theme is amazing.  We had a meeting on the terrace of the hotel and the food was very good.  I loved the theme of the time of wine and cheese.

title: A very very good address !!
text: our stay was really pleasant. the room was clean and the bed very comfortable. the service is nice and the wine and cheese at 2nd floor was a very good experience. Perhaps, more smiles from the personal in charge of the breakfast would be a good idea. I strongly recommend this hotel !

title: Deserves its high TA rating! Amazing hotel.
text:
We have stayed in a different hotel every time we visit NY but will definately go back to the Library otel, it is a firm favourite. The staff are all very pleasant, helpful and friendly and go the extra mile to make you welcome and comfortable. We mentioned it was my husbands birthday during our stay and came back to our room to a lovely bottle of red wine and a card from The Librarians, thank you!

We had a petite room, which was so cosy, comfortable and clean (housekeeping do a great job, they are unobtrusive and there is a turn down service). We had two large windows, aircon, tv & dvd, fridge, bath and shower, complimentary toiletries, wardrobe, drawers, a safe, large mirrors, great lighting and a very comfortable bed. We were on the 11th floor (Philosophy!) which was far enough up to not be troubled with street noise, we slept soundly as there were no banging doors, noisy guests or elevator noise.. bliss. 

The complimentary breakfast was plentiful, fresh and there was a great variety to enjoy with your complimentary newspaper in the lovely ambience of the Reading Room, overlooking Library Way, with a view of the NY Public Library. You can make use of the Reading Room and enjoy complimentary drinks and snacks 24 hours, as well as prosecco, wine and cheese every evening from 5-8pm. Things like this make the hotel a comfort you look forward to returning to, rather than just a place to sleep.

There is a business centre with two internet pcs and printer, with free use. The hotel has a very popular restaurant, Madison and Vine and room service is available at a very reasonable cost. There is also a roof terrace, bar and lounge.

The hotel is in a great location, very close to Grand Central, Bryant Park, Fifth Avenue and the subway all within easy walking distance.

Thank you so much to all of the Librarians for making our latest stay in beautiful New York City a memorable one. We will see you again.

title: Book Lovers 13th. birthday
text: Our granddaughter, who was celebrating her 13th. birthday loves to read; this was the perfect hotel!  She loved the library and chose several books to read while there.  We loved the comfort, quiet, and convenience to many locations.

title: Big Birthday Treat
text:
I can only endorse all the positive things already said about this hotel. We were very kindly given an upgraded room (thank you Librarians!). 
We were visiting New York from Scotland to celebrate my 60th birthday. My husband had researched and chosen this hotel and WOW it did not disappoint. From the excellent location to the 2nd floor Reading Room and all of it's amenities. 
We packed a lot into our few days stay in NY but I can honestly say that the Library Hotel is one of the big highlights of our holiday. 
I must also mention the Librarians, without exception everyone we encountered were an absolute credit to the hotel.
I hope to return to this wonderful hotel and I'm recommending to all my friends that they MUST book this hotel should they be planning a trip to NY.

title: Library Hotel
text: Recently stayed here for a few days to see several plays and visit MoMA. We walked every day and evenings to the theatre. Very convenient location. Would not hesitate to return. Good breakfast included in room rate

title: great location
text:
The hotel has a great locationright in the middle of manhattan, but quiet.
I liked the opportunity to have breakfast in the hotel ( incl. The New York Times!) and cheesem and wine in the evening. 
The room (single) was small but the bed was comfortable and it contained everything one needs.
Walls and floors a bit drab
If I come again to NY I will again stay at the Library Hotel

title: Our home away from home
text: From the lovely ladies in the breakfast room who remember I like a full carafe of tea when I come in, to Steven at the door who greets us with a warm welcome to the ladies who clean our room promptly..the best!

title: Great location on Fifth Ave across from NY Public Library
text: We (family of 4, two adults and two teenager children) visited NYC to see two Broadway shows and spent one night at the Library Hotel.  We had always wanted to try the library hotel and we weren't disappointed. We had a junior suite with a view across from the NY Public Library which was modern, clean and relatively spacious.  The staff was excellent.  They stored our luggage before check in and after checkout. There is a reading room on the second floor which offers a complimentary continental breakfast, wine/cheese/hor d'oeuvres from 5 to 8 PM, and snacks 24 hours - even after we checked out.  Because our room window directly overlooked Madison Ave, there was some traffic noise, but it did not bother us.  We chose this hotel because it was close to Broadway, it is across from the NY Public Library, and close to the Morgan Librayr.  It was about a 10 minute walk to Times Square.  There were two excellent restaurants just a few minutes from the hotel (Nirvana Indian and Momosan Japanese.)  Would love to stay here again.

title: weekend in the city
text:
This is our second stay at the Library Hotel.
After a busy day in the city, it is an oasis of hospitality and relaxation. The staff is always very friendly, very helpful; in short, superb. The evening wine and cheese, and the morning breakfast, are well-staffed and excellent. 
Of course the whole idea of being surrounded by all those books is wonderful.

title: Mid-town oasis
text: The reviews of this hotel did not exaggerate.  The hotel is conveniently located in mid-town and easily accessible to the subway, the bus lines, and walking paths.  The hotel is small, elegant, and immensely comfortable.  Our room (deluxe king) was plenty big for the two of us, and the bed was so comfortable!  The room and the bathroom were spotlessly clean, and the room smelled fresh and inviting.  Having worked in libraries most of my life, I loved the theme.  We spent a great deal of time just reading the titles of all the books that lined the shelves in the room and in the lounge.  The second-floor 24-hour lounge was one of the highlights of the stay.  Coffee, tea, snacks, were available at any time and was well-stocked and kept spotlessly clean.  I noticed a few visitors dealing with their jet lag in the early morning hours when I visited the lounge.  I think that this lounge is one of the best features of the hotel.  The top floor garden lounge with the beautiful bar was also a great asset, and a nice place to "get away from it all" during the day, but seriously busy after the bar opens at 4:00 pm.  I highly recommend this hotel for couples or singles.

title: Could not fault this hotel
text: Just got back from a great 5 days in New York.  I wanted it to be really special, as it was a treat for my sister’s 60th birthday.  My brother and sister in law recommended The Library, and I am so glad they did.  I could not fault this hotel.  It was amazing in every way.  The room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable.  The Reading Room was ideal for us, especially the complimentary wine and nibbles between 5pm and 8pm!  It was great to get a wee prosecco and a nibble before we ventured out at night.  So relaxing, especially with the subtle background music.  The breakfast was perfect for us – juices, cereals, bagels and bread (which the staff were happy to toast for you), and the fresh fruit cocktail was delicious.  You could also pop in to the Reading Room at any time for a tea/coffee and a biscuit or a piece of fruit just to chill out.   The staff were also fantastic.  The reception staff (so friendly and helpful with any advice we had), all the girls who worked in the Reading Room (were just lovely and so attentive), the staff in the rooftop bar, the guys who worked on the door and the cleaners.  The location is ideal.  Just round the corner from 2 different subway stations (Bryant Park and Grand Central Terminal).  Also if you are travelling from Newark Airport, there is an express bus that drops you just round the corner from the hotel.  Can you tell that I liked it?

title: Books and the city
text: All you need is here. Perfect location, smiling staff, spotless rooms with new bathrooms, great decor with the library theme and very generous hospitality with 24h coffee and snacks and a free light dinner with cheese and wines. Rooftop bar and another Bar at the street level. Price is reasonable. Difinitely would come back.

title: Hotel magnífico
text: Atención al cliente, situación, comodidad, limpieza, todo está muy bien en este estupendo hotel. Está en Madison Avenue muy cerca de la Estación Central y de la Biblioteca publica. Puedes ir andando al Empire State, al Rockefeller Center, etc...

title: Wonderful place to stay!
text: The room was a great size for just one person and very clean, I loved it. Professional and friendly staff helped my stay here be a pleasure. The rooftop deck was really nice for me to take in a breeze and get a view of the area. There's a nice selection of books of all kinds, I wasn't there long enough to get my little hands on all that I wanted to see. Overall, everything was wonderful, and I plan on staying here again.😃

title: Perfect Hotel!
text: My boyfriend and I recently stayed here for 5 nights and we can’t recommend it enough! It’s a great location with so many places you can walk to nearby - Grand Central Station, Central Park, Times Square, Empire State Building and many more. The hotel itself is perfect - you always feel welcome and very personal. The continetal breakfast, wine & cheese reception and 24hour refreshments are great - it really added to our holiday experience. The room was big enough for two with lots of little extras like chocolates and a daily weather report. The bed was really comfy too. Would highly recommend this hotel - if we come back to New York we will definitely book here again!

title: Friendly jewel of a hotel
text:
I stayed at the Library Hotel for 9 days in March. The hotel is in a great location, a couple of minutes' walk from Grand Central Station. It's got a welcoming lobby full of books, a sort of guest lounge called the Reading Room, also full of books, and each of the rooms is themed after a section of the Dewey Decimal System and is full of books! Book lovers will feel very seen. 
Our room was very comfortable, with a huge bed, plenty of room to move around, and the nicest bath robes I have ever worn. We asked for tea-making facilities, and they made sure there was fresh milk in our fridge.
Breakfast is served in the Reading Room - delicious bagels - and then you can drop into the Reading Room all day for fresh fruit, pastries and tea/coffee. In the evening, they set out wine and cheese. It's a lovely, cosy atmosphere.
Best of all were the staff, who were all very friendly and very helpful, both before and during our stay.

title: First class botique hotel in midtown Manhattan
text: Our second visit, this past March (2019).  Same great hotel, very nice service.  Breakfast and happy hour both included with room, with very drinkable wine for happy hour.  Service by gorgeous young people.  Helpful people at front desk and at the door.  Price commensurate with location.

title: The Library Hotel is FANTASTIC!
text:
Love the Library Hotel!  Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was immaculate. Difficult to find a New York hotel offering continental breakfast.
Library Hotel offers not only breakfast but offers wine/ cheese/ fruit from 5-8 pm. Location can't be beat - only 2 blocks from Grand Central Station. 

I hope to return to New York for another visit and will stay at the Library Hotel. For return guests they offer a nice little discount. 

Thank you Library Hotel for making my first visit to New York memorable!

title: a small oasis in the middle of Manhattan....
text:
This is a perfect hotel for all of them who detest the impersonal and multitudinous hotels.
Fortunately we found this small luxury hotel, warm, confortable and with an excelent staff.
Bravo! for the free wines and cheeses offered in the afternoon.
Our stay was perfect!!!!!

title: Library Hotel
text: Our go-to hotel in NYC.  Friendly, helpful staff, spotless room and common areas, great mid-town location, convenient discounted parking.  Wine tasting every evening, nice breakfast, and a great, always available espresso machine.

title: The Library
text: The Library Hotel was the PERFECT hotel for a New York getaway.  Personal service could not have been better.  We especially found great fun in the Library Book collection we chose.  Great idea.  The Top Floor lounge was also tough to beat.

title: Best Hotel yet
text:
What a ‘find’ of a place.
The hotel has a great central location for transportation and acting as a hub to radiate out from for sightseeing. The facilities offered by the hotel are fabulous ( B’fast, refreshments through the day, wine & cheese early evening ) as are the other aspects such as the roof top terrace, computer room and extensive library of books. 
The ‘icing on the cake’ are the staff which proved not only helpful and very professional but also knowledgable and always at hand if needed.
If we get chance to visit N.Y. again ( and we hope we will) Without question this hotel will be our first choice.

title: European warmth
text: Usually you only find this sort of personal attention in Europe. Great, friendly and helpful staff. The limited number of rooms makes the environment seem very personal and makes you feel even more special. The 24/7 hospitality area on the second floor is very well stocked and inviting. We always stay at the Library when in NYC.

title: Great Location and Value
text: The location is perfect for us to get to all the NYC places we want to visit. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit small, but very adequate, with comfortable beds and nicely equipped bathrooms. The Reading Room is a nice space for relaxing and enjoying breakfast, plus the evening wine and snacks, with coffee and tea available all day. This was our second stay, and we'll come again.

title: Could Not Image a Better Place to Stay Close to Perfection (not kidding)
text:
First, the staff.  Truly warm greeting upon arrival. They continually remembered us the 3 nights we were there.  Very engaging.  We were celebrating our 10,000 th day together.  They knew it and provided a a very nice gilt.
The facility...small hotel which we love.  Rooftop bar and 2nd floor common room very comfortable.  Evening wine/cheese/etc were higher quality than any other hotel ever provided.  Not the "cheap" stuff at all.
Room, not huge, but big enough (this is NYC).  Very comfortable, QUIET, and spotlessly clean.  Though small hotel they had 2 elevators so short wait.
Location was perfect...if you want mid-town.  one block from Grand Central, Madison has buses north to museums.  One block to 5th Ave for buses south.  So close to LGA only took hire car less than 15 minutes. Even Penn Station less than 10 minute cab. Kept our bags last day after we checked out and less us rest on 2nd floor.
100% would stay there again.

title: super
text:
suis cliente du Giraffe hôtel depuis pas mal d'années, j'avais envie de tester un de leurs autres hôtel, et ce fut celui-ci
le charme opère également , les chambres , le petit déjeuner et le wine & cheese sont super , tout comme le Giraffe
la clientèle est un peu plus âgée 
ravissante terrasse et lobby très agréable
l'emplacement est idéal également et le personnel est très disponible
j'y retournerai

title: Fabulous Midtown Hotel
text: Have to agree with the reviews on the Library Hotel. It’s a fabulous boutique hotel in a great location for Midtown. Very comfortable rooms, warm welcome and lots of nice touches (breakfast, wine and cheese, good amenities, etc). Both the lounge and rooftop bar are good places to relax. Location is 2 mins from Grand Central, 10 mins from Empire State, and walkable to Time Square, Central Park, the High Line, etc. It’s on a relatively quiet street (for NY!), so we got a good night’s sleep. And you’ll never be short of something to read...!

title: Love this hotel!
text: The Library Hotel is my favorite place to stay in NYC.  Great location for easy walking to many sites and the subway, but not in the bustle of Time Square.  Excellent, attentive staff.  Love breakfast and happy hour each day.  There is an attention to detail here that you don't see so much anymore, especially at this price point.

title: keep the 2nd floor services officialy free!
text:
Nice stay as usual.
But you made a very important psychological rmistake!! You show now on you invoice an additional fee; which I have been told is for the  2nd fl service. If you had increased your rooms price by 20 USD no one would have noticed and clients would continue to love the idea you give this service for free.....D.de Blanchard

title: ideal venue
text: The hotel was recommended to me and fully lived up to expectations - comfortable, quiet and friendly. The location was perfect for a short stay, within easy walking distance of the key galleries. I would happily stay there again.

title: Recent Trip
text: Hotel continues to be excellent. My issue is that service seems to be declining and prices are going up. Was informed that a surcharge will now be added to participate in what was previously included in the room rate. Needless to say, given the already higher than average room rates at the Library Hotel, to now start charging for items previously included seems a bit greedy. Will have to reconsider whether to return in the future.

title: Never disappoints
text: I've stayed at the Library Hotel 3-4 time/year for more than a decade, and most recently late last month.  As always, it was a real delight. Unfailingly terrific-- from staff (friendly, helpful), to room (nicely appointed, squeaky clean), to breakfast (fruit, pastries, bagels, yogurt, juices, fancy coffee, cereals, etc), to 24/7 snacks of fresh fruit, cookies, coffee, tea) to a truly gracious wine/cheese time each afternoon, to a cozy top-floor bar (without outside seating during the warmer months) the Library Hotel never disappoints.

title: Library Hotel In March
text: Great location, close to Times Square and Grand Central Station.    Great service.   The continental breakfast is very good and wine and cheese in the evenings is over the top. Staff is very courteous and helpful.

title: A genuinely bookish hotel
text: We loved everything about our stay.  The staff were charming and helpful, and knew a lot about books.  The room was very comfortable and well kept. There were many unexpected extra treats, and the Library area had a lovely atmosphere.  Excellent bagels too.  We were sad to leave.

title: Incredible location
text: This was our first time visiting NYC, so our goal was to find a hotel that was within walking distance of all the usual sight seeing destinations (central park, the Met, Time Square, etc), and included breakfast at a relatively reasonable price. Library Hotel was just that. It was within a mile of just about everything we wanted to do and see, wonderful customer service, wonderful food; thus an overall wonderful experience.

title: Lovely stay
text: Great location right by grand central and the library.  Room was cute and smallish (but it’s NY so that’s expected). Front desk was friendly and helpful.  The bar upstairs was nice for a predinner drink.

title: First time was a winner
text:
Great location, very quiet- we are on a high floor- ask for the corner rooms-- those are bigger than the small places we saw by accident- so small you stayed outside to change your mind. 
Pleasant and knowledgeable staff, bathrooms are small and have not been renovated to the proper heights of sinks and toilets- should be at these prices.

title: Wow, what a fab hotel
text:
From the minute we arrived to the minute we left, we loved this hotel. The gentleman on reception was great & knew us by name every time we saw him, which was pretty amazing.
The room was small, as expected, it is New York City! But it was very comfortable & had everything you needed. Bottles of water replaced every day at no extra charge too.
Breakfasts were excellent & being able to come back to such a relaxing hotel after a busy day in the city was so good - the reading room always had refreshments & the cheese & wine few hours were so good - much more than cheese & wine.
If we ever come back to New York, we will definitely stay here again.

title: Exceptionnel
text:
Quel bel hôtel ! L'accueil et l'attention qui nous a été porté a grandement participé à la réussite de notre voyage. 
Une ambiance cosy et reposante, appréciable après de longues journées à déambuler dans la ville, un personnel sympathique et serviable. 
Idéalement situé, à 2 pas de Grand Central, proche des lieux mythiques de la ville. Nous recommandons fortement cet hôtel.

title: Great hotel in great location
text:
Enjoyed our stay at the Library hotel in January 2019.
Very welcoming staff and always eager to help out. The concierge staff were able to assist with requests before the trip to make the stay a special one.
Great breakfast, a small but well appointed room and proximity to the tourist traps made it well worth the money.

title: Lovely Hotel
