text: This hotel was a great find recommended by a friend, it has a fabulous continental breakfast with everything you need, and  an afternoon cheese and wine reception with free flowing wine! The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly, and the hotel is very central for all sight seeing activities.

title: Book lover
text: It was an amazing hotel ( especially if you are a reader) the rooms are sooo cute and very generous with snacks and breakfast and has a cute reading room. Great view and very close to the New York Library.

title: Beautiful friendly hotel in great location
text: Just returned from the Library Hotel and I could not have been more impressed. The greatest asset of the hotel are the staff who are super friendly and cannot do enough to make you feel that you are at home rather than in a hotel. The rooms were beautiful and clean. The bed and pillows were super comfy and the bathrooms were modern and well appointed. The breakfast and the afternoon cheese and wine make a huge difference and make you feel that you just want to relax and enjoy a bit of downtime as a break from the city. The location is also perfect. Only five minutes walk into Times Square but also far enough out to enable you to avoid the hustle and bustle when you need to. It also allows you to explore some of the more out the way bars etc around Grand Central. I will definitely be visiting again and cannot overstate how friendly all the staff were from the restaurant staff to the super friendly reception staff. A real find.

title: Beautiful Accommodations
text: This Hotel was just the ticket!  Friendly staff, wine, cheese, pastries, breakfast!  These amenities were wonderful but the most important part was the room!  It was fantastic!  Exceptionally clean with enough space to truly stretch our legs out.  Our room had a great view of the New York Public Library! They were also prompt with providing a ride to the Airport.  We will be staying here again!

title: Perfection
text: We have stayed at The Library Hotel many times and always enjoyed great service from the staff.  The hotel is very well located within walking distance of shopping and the theatre.  Rooms are quiet and comfortable.  Breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese are included and are very well done.  All around this hotel is a 10.

title: Bookworm in the Library Hotel
text:
One of my bucket-list items is to "read the books I always wanted to read" and another is to scale the awe-inspiring landmarks of NYC. To accomplish these assignments,                                                                                                                             I decided to book a stay at the Library Hotel, Madison Ave., NYC. 

You don't have to be a librarian to stay here; but, floors and rooms are organized by book content. The Library Hotel is sort of a "Book a Book" hotel and the room will follow. I selected a room on the 10th, the General Knowledge floor. I didn't expect to find Marie Kondo's "The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up" book here; but the laden shelves "sparked joy" to a bookworms heart, none the less.

The Library Hotel is the strongest knowledge-based hotel I have encountered. The rooms are elegant; a bit tight, but bookworm friendly. Nothing is more comfortable than to curl up with your blanket before you start reading. Staff are prepared for service and amped up to satisfy the needs of the guests.

After a taxi cab kamikaze tried to run me over at an intersection, it was refreshing to escape the hullaballoo of the NYC treadmill as I entered the Library's peaceful surroundings. War and Peace comes to mind.

What better way to start the day than to enjoy the complimentary breakfast and what better way to finish the day than to enjoy the complimentary managers wine and cheese.
Reading books and practicing your library skills makes you hungry.

Throw in a few NYC landmarks and this was a great clothbound, mental vacation.............
.........Life is good when you're a Bookworm in the Library Hotel.

title: 4th wonderful visit!
text: This was our 4th visit over the past 10 years and we were happy that the Library was as great this time as on our previous visits. We now don't bother to look at any other hotels as we know that the Library is just perfect. We like to walk everywhere so the location is perfectly in the middle of everything that you could possibly need to do uptown and downtown. The breakfast and cheese and wine are an added bonus and so convenient and well looked after by the friendly kind young ladies working in this area. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms very pleasant. We sleep with the window open despite the cold outside and I really am not bothered by much noise even though I am a relatively light sleeper. The bar upstairs is nice for a late night cosy nightcap and sadly we have never been in the summer so not sat outside on the roof but I'm sure this is amazing with the Empire State Building lit up between the buildings. We usuallly always eat in Madison and vine on the first evening when we arrive and are tired and this is always good, great burger and a good glass of wine to prepare us for our busy few days ahead.   A special mention goes to bubbly friendly Duke on reception concierge who was extremely helpful with numerous questions from running routes to help with the subway and restaurant recommendations, he did this happily and enthusiastically and all of his tips were perfect.  We look forward already to our next trip as soon as possible.

title: Great 50th birthday weekend
text: Me & my wife spent a weekend at The Library during our first trip to New York to celebrate my 50th birthday and can honestly say this hotel is fantastic. It was an absolutely perfect base for our break - the room was excellent, the location was great and the coffee lounge & rooftop bar are a real bonus. The thing that makes The Library so special, and feel like a cosy home from home is the great staff - from the front desk to the doorman they are all so genuinely friendly & helpful, we really couldn’t have asked for more. Suffice to say we are already planning our return visit.

title: Great location.
text: A real quality hotel and a great location , just a short walk from Grand Central Station. One of the bonuses of staying here is the complimentary breakfast( unusual in Manhattan hotels) and the evening cheese and wine between 5pm and 8pm. A number of bars and restaurants close by. Buying a weekly metro card is great if you want to use local buses or subways . The subway shuttle between Grand Central Station and Times Square is good for those who wish to experience Broadway theatre- using this shuttle can let you leave the hotel 30 minutes before curtain up in most theatres.Staff at Library hotel very helpful and personable. Extremely easy check in and check out . Not the cheapest but if you include the free breakfast, all day coffee and biscuits along with the nightly cheese and wine , not as expensive as it may seem. Petite room really not big enough for 2 people so upgrade if possible. My wife and I travel to Manhattan every couple of years and this is our hotel of choice every time.

title: Love The Library
text: My wife and I stayed only one night at this gem of a hotel, but we nearly cancelled our flight that day so we could stay over the weekend. What a charming--and reasonably priced (for mid-town)--place to rest once you've stepped out of the hustle, bustle, noise and general craziness of NYC streets. It's quiet, peaceful and very comfortable, and the service is outstanding. The attention guests are given rivals any other hotel in which I've stayed. Breakfast (included with your room) and a wine-and-cheese reception every afternoon (also included) plus thousands of books from which to choose make this a must-stay, in my opinion.

title: Birthday Weekend in New York
text: The perfect boutique hotel for book lovers!!! In the best location to take in all the major sites. The hotel staff was amazing and always willing to assist with their recommendations. We will definitely return.

title: A wonderful stay!
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Library Hotel for four nights.  It was wonderful!  We had reserved a junior suite and it was perfect for us.  The room was large, quiet and spotless.  We enjoyed the breakfast and the cocktail hour in the lounge.  Staff was friendly and welcoming.  We enjoyed the location but I must say the outside noise was loud especially the constant honking.  Other than that, the hotel is perfect and I would definitely stay here again.

title: Another Nice stay at the Library Hotel
text: As always I enjoyed my stay - better than any other hotel - not that the room is that much better - actually smaller than most but the combination of the interesting book selection and the well thought out personal items (Q-tips, etc.) make it much more comfortable.

title: Exceptional Stay in Midtown
text:
Exceptional all around: cozy, clean, up to date rooms; friendly staff; welcoming environment; little touches throughout the lobby, lounge, rooftop terrace and rooms that were imaginative, clever and charming. The location is excellent: one block from the NY Public Library, Bryant Park, and Grand Central Station.  A short walk to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, theaters, and shopping.  This is a special place that will make your trip to NYC memorable.

Ia block from the NY Public Library, Bryant Park, and Grand Central Station.

title: NY visit for daughters 18th
text: This hotel is amazing. Perfect location. Very friendly small hotel. Rooms not huge but the use of the second floor facility serving drinks and snacks 24hrs made up for this. I would highly recommend the hotel when visiting New York

title: One of the Best Boutique Hotels in New York
text: We have traveled to New York regularly for over 25 years and stayed in a lot of hotels -- but we always come back to The Library.  It is cozy, quaint and centrally located.  The entire staff is amazing -- so friendly and helpful.  The 2nd floor coffee/snack area and the 14th floor terrace bar are what make this hotel very special.  Both are intimate places to gather with family and friends -- and the women that serve in the 2nd floor coffee/snack area are some of the hardest working and kindest women I have ever met.  Can't beat the wine and cheese/snack service every afternoon.  Great boutique hotel.

title: Definitely A Place To Come Back To
text: Location+friendly and first class staff all round+amenities make this a 5+ experience. The Reading Room on the 2nd floor offers a variety of news papers that arrive daily and in time for early risers along with a fresh and healthy continental breakfast buffet. Large windows In the Reading Room pprovide views of both the bustle on Madison Ave and a commanding view of the New York Public Library on 5th Avenue. The wine and cheese served by cordial staff in the late afternoon along with 24hr coffee and tea and cookies make the stay that much more enjoyable. The rooftop space is simply poetic amongst towering buildings of steel and glass. The rooms are immaculate. The doormen don’t just open doors, they welcome you each time with cordial greetings and ask how your day is going.The concierge, exceptional.

title: Great Hotel
text: We were very impressed.  Small lobby but rooms were quite good, and the second floor gathering area (continental breakfast and evening appetizers/wine) was terrific.  Great quality drinks and food; and service was tops.  People very friendly.

title: Grand Central Gem
text: If you are looking for a nice comfy hotel boutique hotel this is the place.  Easy friendly check-in, always a doorman greeting you.  Rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable.  The 24 hour  reading room has free breakfast, (expresso, hard boiled eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc) and nightly wine, etc..), there is always something there.  This is invaluable.  I've stayed four times now and it is my go to midtown hotel when staying in the city on business.  There is a bumping restaurant on the first floor as well as Pera which is great around the corner on Madison.  Each room has interesting books so it does carry the library feel.

title: a lovely staycation
text: I recently treated my wife to a one-night "staycation" at the Library Hotel, for her birthday. We've stayed at other properties in the Library Collection, and were excited to have a chance to visit the flagship. It didn't disappoint - at all. From our first contact with the welcoming front-desk staff, to a charming and cozy room, to a lovely relaxed continental breakfast the next morning, every moment was a pleasure. We'll be back whenever possible, and we'll certainly recommend the property to our friends and family.

title: Best boutique hotel in New York
text: This was my 4th stay at the Library Hotel. I love the relaxing feel of the place. All of the rooms are very unique and quirky. I also love the relaxed cheese and wine every evening. Nothing is ever too much trouble for the staff. The rooftop bar is also very special both in summer and winter

title: AMAZING!
text:
Short and sweet but we stayed here for a weekend in February for my girlfriends 30th birthday, who's a huge book fan. Let's just say we were blown away, this place is simply incredible. Great location, amazing breakfasts and great staff.

I think we had the smallest room and while small it was fine for two of us for the weekend. We were travelling the East Coast of the US and this hotel was by far the best one we stayed in.

Thank you for making our stay in NYC amazing!

title: New York Trip
text: This was our first visit to New York, after lots of research we chose stay at the Library Hotel and we were both so pleased that we did. The location is great, our room was clean, very comfortable, we woke each morning feeling refreshed after a good night's sleep, the complimentary breakfast set us up for the day and when we arrived back at the hotel after seeing all the sights New York has to offer the complimentary wine & cheese offered by the hotel each evening was very much appreciated. By far the biggest asset at the Library are all the staff, we had a couple of small issues that were sorted out for us immediately, service in every area of the hotel was just fantastic, advice from the staff on reception was much appreciated, we pretty much walked everywhere during our stay in New York, we can't wait to come to come back again one day and would love to come back and stay with you again at the Library.

title: Quaint wonderful hotel in the middle of it all!
text:
We arrived early and the front desk staff held our bags for us.  We stayed in room 303, on social sciences floor, our rooms theme was economic theory.  There were at least 125 books In the room and even for a somewhat sleepy subject of economics there has to be something of interest to everyone who stays in this room.  I picked out at least one book from each reachable shelf to leaf through.  This small but very quaint room has a full sized bed with two types of pillows one down and the other poly filled.  While I would have preferred a memory foam pillow, again the Hotel chose the pillows well.  The television is small.  The storage space is good sized closet and drawers.  The bath room was good sized, smaller lip rise on the tub making it easier to get in and out of.  During the day, the 2nd floor library sitting room has snacks (nice cookies, some danishes, and fruit).  At 5pm the wine and cheese items come out.  The only negative here is my lack of willpower so I over ate the snacks.  They have a continental breakfast, with real fresh hard boiled eggs vs store bought from weeks ago. Fresh orange and grapefruit juices, little cereals I had fruit loops some 40 years after the last time I had it.  They also have coffee and tea, hot cereal packages more danishes, bagels, croissants, bread for toasting, etc.  The hotel has a bar and sitting room on the 14 floor with very nice views.  It was chilly on Feb 14th but very nice and very comfortable.  The view out the windows of 303 was to Madison and 41st streets.  When the room got too warm after showers in the morning, it was nice to be able to crack the window open for some fresh air.  

I am a picky traveler and I appreciate all the finer touches this hotel offers.  I looked for something to knick pick on but could not find anything.  I will stay again at the Library Hotel in Manhattan.  This hotel has exceeded my expectations.

title: Excellent
text: Absolutely loved this boutique hotel in a great position.....everything about it first class. From the welcome with smiles to the cleanliness overall to the delicious food and drink on offer at no extra cost - brilliant.

title: Lovely hotel in a superb location
text: My husband & I stayed here for 3 nights.  This was our first visit to New York & were recommended to stay here & were so pleased we did as the location is excellent with all major attractions an easy walk away.   As others have mentioned, the 24hr tea/coffee/pastries etc were wonderful & very welcome after several hours sightseeing & also loved the complimentary wine & nibbles in the evening.   Despite the room being a bit on the small side (deluxe double) the bed was extremely comfortable & overall perfect for our short stay - very limited wardrobe space though which could be an issue for a longer stay (may just have been our particular rooms layout).  Staff all very friendly and would definitely consider staying here again.

title: Second Visit Didn't Disappoint
text:
This was our second time staying at the Library Hotel. As we've gotten to know the city and area a little better, we still find this hotel to be our top choice - central location, fast elevators, quiet, clean rooms, helpful staff etc. 

Two minor incidents occurred this trip but definitely not deal breakers.

I did find it interesting that one night we had leftover dinner (fish) and we kept it in the mini fridge. The next day, we couldn't leave it out for the cleaning staff to throw out because it smelled awful. I left a $5 tip, with a note on the nightstand, asking to remove the bag from the fridge and please discard. When we returned later that day, the tip and note were gone, room was clean, but the bag of day old fish was still in the fridge. That evening I was lucky enough to catch the cleaning woman who came to turn down the bed. I asked her if she could throw away the bag, which I had in my hand. She said, "I don't understand English". I was surprised that she didn't know what I meant. Luckily, I knew Spanish and told her it was "basura" and she was more than happy to remove it from the room. I suppose she didn't understand my note. If the cleaning crew doesn't understand English, it might be helpful for the hotel staff to teach them basic words or to instruct them to show another employee a note clearly left for them and ask them to translate if they don't understand. 

On our last day, we checked out and had time to spare before leaving for the airport. We left our four bags, and two winter coats in their storage room. We returned and picked up our belongings with the help of hotel staff. We were about 40 minutes into our ride to JFK when we realized we left our two winter coats in the storage room. Too late to turn back. It's our fault that we forgot our coats although I'd like to say it would have been nice for the hotel staff to have given us everything when he handed us our belongings. Again, our fault. They were kind enough to ship us our coats after I forwarded a prepaid FEDEX label to them and they packed and shipped it immediately.

All in all, we still love the Library Hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

title: Expectations not met
text: How is it possible that a room doesn’t get cleaned? We put in a request in the morning for our room to be cleaned while we were out. We wanted to come back to a straightened room but was so disappointed when we came back to discover our room was still a mess. The check in time is at 3 so why aren’t the rooms cleaned before this? The staff had lame excuses for why our very reasonable request wasn’t completed.

title: Excellent Hotel! The staff is amazing, it is by far our favorite place in the city.
text: We have stayed at the Library every visit to New York.  They are just amazing.  This year was our 4th trip and we were surprising my son for his 18th birthday.  They went above and beyond to make this trip perfect for us.  I love being downtown and feeling close to everything, yet the noise of the city is barely heard at this hotel.  We walk almost everywhere from this hotel, but Grand Central Terminal is 1 block around the corner if you need the Subway.

title: Lovely hotel, great location.
text:
As the name indicates, its located not far from the majestic NYC Public Library. Its very appropriate, as well as lovely,  that this hotel is full of bookcases and lined top to bottom with books.  Readers will be delighted. 
LOCATION is ideal for spending time in the city. The hotel is situated quite near Fifth, Madison, & 41st. Great walkabilty to many prime areas including Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and the Empire State Building just to name a few. Plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. 
RECEPTION area is located at street level. The staff is welcoming and very helpful. There are elevators. 
BREAKFAST ROOM  is on the 2nd floor. Continental with fruit, cereal, breads and more.   Coffee is available all day, as is the use of the room for work or reading.  In the evening, wine and cheese is offered in the same space. Staff is excellent. 
HOTEL ROOM Ours was on the 5th floor. Featured plenty of books, comfortable bed and bedding, nicely appointed with TV & small fridge. Window darkening shades. Turn down each night with chocolates. Bathroom has plenty of amenities and towels. We visited during a cold spell (13 degrees), and found our room chilly overnight. An extra blanket was needed and is provided in the closet along with an electric heater which we also used. 
(TIP - as a light sleeper,  I found using ear plugs helpful to get a good nights sleep. There is much activity on the street after dark (trash collection, road work, etc).

title: pas de service
text:
est-ce que le personnel pense que le service n'a pas importance?
on est dans un hotel de luxe avec des prix hors normes et l'on est traité pire que dans un ibis
il faudrait que la clientèle arrête de venir le temps d'un avertissement 
quelle honte 
dommage car le reste est res correct mais ne donne pas envi de revenir

title: Lovely stay !
text:
We stopped for three nights at the Library Hotel. It Was wonderful on all aspects: location (in between Grand Central and 5th avenue), service is lovely (there are free drinks between 5pm and 8pm), and the rooms are very clean and well decorated. 

This is definitely a great place to stay in New York !

title: Wonderful Staff
text: I came here for business last week and stayed a night at Library (wish I had another night!). The hotel was very clean and had great decor, but the staff was even more amazing! They are all so accommodating, friendly and helpful. The happy hour and breakfast are wonderful touches and make this a great place to stay! Thanks for a wonderful stay, can't wait to book my next business trip with another night at Library!

title: Excellent location, wonderful service, fabulous experience!
text: The hotel has a wonderful location for visitors - within walking distance to midtown attractions and located by several trains. The second floor lounge with snacks and cheese + wine is a highlight. Any book lover will be more than pleased!

title: Midtown Gem
text: Peaceful, friendly, book-filled common and individual rooms. Lovely staff. Breakfast, tea, and evening wine and cheese tasy and comfortable. Clever use of the Dewey Decimal system for room and floor identification. Charming!

title: Another Fabulous Stay at The Library!
text: This was our third time staying here and it did not disappoint.  All the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The breakfast, snacks and wine and cheese in the second floor lounge are a great extra! A couple of times we went up to the rooftop bar and enjoyed a few cocktails at the end of a long day of shopping and sightseeing. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. We will be back!

title: Lovely hotel / great spot in NYC
text: Nice room / bed; small but it is NYC afterall...amazing breakfast and the wine / cheese spread at night is enough to fill you up for a light dinner if desired. the hostess did not stop refilling my glass so don't think of this as just one cup! Beautiful décor and friendly staff. Only suggestion is the 5th floor was a bit noisy / could hear the trucks and street noise which made it hard to sleep (again probably same across NYC hotels) - should have just put some white noise on my phone to help.  Otherwise great stay and would definitely stay again, hopefully on a higher floor.

title: Great Stay in an Interesting Hotel
text:
I always wanted to stay in this hotel after seeing it on TV sometime ago.

It is in a great location just around the corner from Grand Central Station.

The room I had was slightly small but I was not hanging around in the room all day so it did not matter.

The staff were fantastic and eager to help with any queries I had or just ask me how my day had been.

A great hotel in a great location with fabulous staff and a great theme. Highly recommended.

title: Library Hotel never a disappointment!
text: Top notch Hotel in a great location with the best staff!  We have stayed here numerous time when in NYC - no reason to look anywhere else.  The Hotel staff are the best part - no problem is ever an issue - accommodating - simply pleasant!

title: Love this boutique hotel
text: The Library Hotel wa a quaint, beautifully decorated hotel. The staff was especially accommodating, The location was perfect, rooms very pretty and very clean, comp. breakfast was very good, also. The only negative was no parking and no valet, we had to park at a lot a few blocks away. I would gladly go back to this hotel in the future.

title: Everything was excellent
text:
Just spent 2 nights in the hotel. What a superb find. 

Great location, 2 mins from NY Central Library and the same from Grand Central Station and evrn closer to 5th Avenue. 15 mins walk to Times Square. Very central but without the madness of Manhattan. 

Lots of great places for dinner nearby. 

Staff were all excellent. 

Room size was very reasonable fir NY standards and especially so the bathroom which was very well equipped with shelves, accessories etc. Quick tip - for the shower, press the small difficult to find button under  the tap/lever!

The 7-8pm wine, olives and cheeses were great. 

Breakfast a bit lacking - I recommend going into Grand Central Station for breakfast. There are some superb eating places in there as well ss in Grsnd Central Market in the Station. 

I will definitely return to this lovely oasis.

title: Library Home
text: This petite hotel has all that a solo traveler could want. It was so nice to return each day to a cozy room, plus afternoon wine and nibbles in their reading room. Tea and coffee were always available, making the room a relaxing spot to read one of the many books available. The staff was superb, always welcoming when I returned. I stayed here for a week and would love to plan another visit!

title: Great stay at The Library Hotel
text: Lovely small hotel. Excellent service. Staff was very helpful and accomodating. Breakfast, happy hour and all day snacks & beverages a real treat. Sheets were wonderful! Room was on the small side but well appointed. Opt for the king room if you want more space. Only negative was the room was quite dark and not enough lighting.

title: Relaxed stay, great location
text:
We stayed here for a few days to enjoy New Year's Eve in New York with friends, and I think we all agreed it's probably the nicest hotel we've stayed in while in NYC to date. Staff are friendly and helpful, and rooms are well tended and clean with an evening turn-down service.

The reading room is an excellent place to relax of an evening, enjoying wine, cheese and other nibbles at leisure, and breakfasts are also well presented in here - they're continental only, but there's an abundance of nearby eateries if you're after something more substantial. The hotel is in a great location for the sights and sounds of NYC. This is quite a bespoke hotel and not your run-of-the-mill chain affair, with quirks aplenty adding to a unique character.

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Loved our stay at the Library Hotel over Christmas (2018). The staff are helpful and friendly, always eager to help. The continental breakfast was a lovely bonus, and more than I expected. The afternoon wine and cheese was also a wonderful bonus. Would definitely recommend the Library Hotel

title: Great!
text: This is a really wonderful hotel. The location is great, there’s plenty to see within only a few blocks, and the rooms are very nice. I would highly recommend staying here. It’s a unique place that stands out among all of the other options.

title: Enjoyed my stay
text:
I really liked the Library hotel. I go to nyc 3-4 times a year on business and had never stayed here. It will be in the rotation from now on. 

This hotel just has good energy. Checked a lot of boxes for me. The staff is genuinely friendly and warm. The location is perfect and convenient and everything I want close is close. Free books. Nice bed. I had an early wake up for my flight home and was able to get a complementary cappuccino and a croissant in their breakfast room at 4am - that’s hard to do. 

High five. Good job.

title: Cozy, comfortable, great location
text: This was my second stay at the Library Hotel, and it did not disappoint. My review will second what others have written: this hotel has a great location and a stellar staff. Yes--the rooms are small, but they are designed to make efficient use of space. Instead of feeling cramped, you feel comfortable. In fact, comfort is the defining aspect of this hotel. The intimate feeling of the place, enhanced by staff who make you feel at home, to the continental breakfast and happy hour (both included in the price of the room) are comforts I have rarely found together in a mid-price NYC hotel. One reviewer described this hotel as a "haven," and I agree. For example, it rained solidly on one of the days we were staying there, and if NYC did not beckon from outside, I would have been content to stay in our room all day and read. Those books are not just there for decoration; they are part and parcel of the hotel stay. I have only one recommendation: install a grab bar in the shower/tub. I am getting older, and since I plan to ALWAYS stay in the Library Hotel when I go to NYC, I will probably need that grab bar in a few years!

title: Vacation Haven
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Library with the family. Great location, excellent services and amenities, very nice breakfasts and wine at happy hour, loved the rooftop bar and views. We'll be back soon.

title: A pleasure to stay once again
text: I have stayed in (and reviewed) the Library Hotel before, but just wanted to give an extremely positive review after my most recent stay. I really like this hotel when I'm traveling solo - the petite room is just right, and the complimentary breakfast and early evening cheese and wine are both really nice for the solo traveler to relax in the hotel. I also appreciated the hot drinks and biscuits available in the lounge at all hours - it was nice to come in at night and pick up a cup of tea before retiring to bed. Most of all though I would like to praise the quality of the service on this trip. The friendly reception when I checked in on the 6th was exceptional and made me feel welcome and at home. All the other staff were friendly and helpful too throughout my short stay.

title: A book lovers dream
text: Great location, ambiance and books!!! Our second visit to this hotel for two different events. Both times we have enjoyed ourselves immensely. The continental breakfast is convenient and satisfying. Highly recommend!

title: Lovely Christmas in NYC!
text: Wonderful return stay to the Library Hotel for Christmas! Staff were excellent, our room was a bit small for a "wheelchair accessible room" but comfortable and clean. Will stay here again next time we are in NYC!

title: また泊まりたいホテル
text:
年末年始、娘と2人でクイーンベッドのデラックスルームに3泊宿泊しました。
ツアー旅行ではなく個人手配のため、ホテル選びのポイントは
団体旅行客がいなさそうで、立地が良く、口コミ評価が高いホテルということで
こちらのサイトで選びました。

宿泊前にホテルにメールしましたが、レスポンスも迅速で安心できました。

宿泊当日は朝9時頃NYに到着し、ホテルに午前中に着きました。
ロケーションは市立図書館から約徒歩3分、グランドセントラル駅にも
ほど近い場所に位置しています。

お部屋には15時からしか入れませんでしたが、チェックイン前にもかかわず、
２FのReading Room を利用させてもらえました。
Reading Roomにはコーヒー、紅茶、オレンジジュースやクッキーなどがあり、
宿泊者は無料で利用できます。（アルコール以外？）
おかげで時差ボケで体調が芳しくない娘は一休みでき、大変助かりました。

お部屋はデラックスルームのため、娘2人で十分の広さでした。
ベッドも寝心地良かったです。
お部屋のエアコンの調整は温度設定ではなく、Hi　Lowの調整でした。
日本人の私たちでも十分なほど清潔に保たれていました。

スタッフの方々も優しく接してくれ、英語が流暢ではない私にも親切に
していただきました。

また次回もここに泊まります。

title: Birthday Getaway
text: I surprised my wife with a quick overnight getaway to NYC and stayed at the Library Hotel. Beautiful hotel with extremely friendly and hospitable staff. Very relaxing atmosphere in the heart of the city, and definitely a must for book lovers - I recommend the Guilty Pleasure package if you want to completely impress your bibliophile significant other!

title: Best hotel ever!
text: Es espectacular. La amabilidad de todo (¡todo!) el personal es increíble, especialmente Duke en la recepción. El hotel está ubicado mejor imposible: Madison y la 41, a 1 cuadra de la 5ta avenida, a una cuadra de la biblioteca pública. Increíble. Las vistas son para emocionarse. La cama es muy cómoda y la ducha... ay! No te dan ganas de salir nunca más de ese baño, es maravilloso. Todas las amenities que te puedas imaginar y aún más. En el segundo piso está el barcito donde todos los días, de 17 a 20, hay queso, frutas secas, cruasanes, vino blanco/tinto, prosecco, galletitas... todo lo que puedas imaginar, completamente gratis (ver fotos). No hay suficientes palabras de elogio para este hotel, y eso que yo me he hospedado en los mejores hoteles de todo el mundo. Estoy impresionada con este hotel. Estoy escribiendo desde la cama, sintiéndome en la gloria absoluta. Y ni hablar de las bibliotecas que hay en todas partes, y en la habitación, una maravilla.¡Gracias, Library collection!

title: Perfect spot for book lovers.
text: First time at the Library Hotel, and we'll be back.  Great staff.  Wonderful room.  Perfect location.  The breakfast/ cocktail room is a very nice addition.  We're very happy we found this place.  Don't change a thing!

title: One of the best Hotels ever
text: Every year, we take a pre-holiday trip. This year we decided on NYC to coincide with a Giants game. I did a quick search and stumbled upon this delightful hotel. I loved the concept and reviews, so I booked three rooms right away (six of us). Upon arrival, they handled our entourage with ease. Throughout our stay, the rooms were beautifully maintained. The morning continental breakfast was plentiful and the service was impeccable Afternoon wine and cheese was exceptional, also with attentive service. We loved the boutique aspect and concierge-level service. Also, it was very quiet. In a loud city, that is a plus. Our previous visits to NYC always had us at the Waldorf-Astoria. For obvious reasons, that is no longer an option... and I am grateful for that. We found an absolute gem that will be our go-to place from now on.

title: The Library Hotel Experience.
text: We thoroughly enjoy staying at The Library Hotel.  From the moment we check in until the moment we check out we feel welcome.   The breakfast and 24 hour lounge is just perfect for our needs.  Whether we need a hot drink or an extra snack to get us through our busy day, something is always available.    The rooms are comfortable and there is, of course, lots to read.  We always learn something new.  The location works for us and a visit to the New York City library is just up the street.  The in-house restaurant is convenient and the food is delicious.  This  hotel is highly recommmrnded.

title: Christmas New York
text: This was our second stay at the Library Hotel, prime location in mid town walking distance to Empire State, Time Sqare, Grand Central and 5th Avenue etc. Really genuinely friendly staff who can’t do enough to please. The breakfast and cheese and wine reception is a brilliant extra. Also a very cozy roof bar.No hesitation in recommending and would definitely stay again next time in NYC.

title: Excellent location, very clean, friendly staff
text: I travelled to NYC with my sister in December 2018 and stayed in the Library for the first time. The hotel location is excellent with a view of the public library from the front door. The rooms were very clean, toiletries were fab and our rate included a turn down service each evening. A weather report for the following day and some chocolates were left each evening too. The reception and door staff were very friendly and helpful. I've stayed numerous times in Manhattan in all types of accommodation and I'll definitely stay at the Library hotel again.

title: Little Gem
text: great hotel very central staff second to none friendly, approachable and efficient breakfast, and evening cheese and wine was a lovely touch could not fault this hotel will definitely stay again does not disappoint give it a try and see for yourselfe

title: Even Better Than I Remembered
text: This was our second stay at the Library Hotel, and although my memories were fond ones, I was impressed again by the care that the staff gives over the smallest of details. Upon check-in I was welcomed back, reminded that we'd stayed here 4 years ago: now that's attention to detail! What a relaxing place to return to after a day of (in our case) art gallery viewing! Thoughtful, bookishly quirky, comfortable: this is our go-to New York hotel.

title: Back Again!
text: We have stayed at the Library Hotel every Christmas holI day since 2005.  This hotel I the epitome of service and comfort.  We will never stay anywhere else. Make sure you check this hotel out, you will not be disappointed.

title: Quiet, Relaxing, Well-Appointed
text: There's nothing I would change about the hotel. The amenities were satisfying, the staff was very helpful. The rooms are a bit larger than most in New York City. Once inside the hotel, quiet prevails.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in Midtown
text:
We very much enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Our mini-room was a bit crowded, so we had to spend time in the second floor sitting room, where coffee and snacks were always available. 
Pluses: location, ambiance, books, DVD selection, fast WiFi. 
Minuses: Poor WiFi reception in room, mini-room a bit small for extended stay. 
Conclusion: Will revisit.

title: 위치 매우 굿!
text: 우선 다른 거 생각안하고 위치만 생각하고 예약했는데 다른 점도 다 마음에 들었습니다. 직원분들도 매우 친절하셨고 질문을 하면 친절하게 하나하나 다 설명해주셔서 너무 만족했습니다. 먼지 알러지가 있어서 청소 상태가 별로면 바로 기침하고 재채기 하고 피부 트러블이 생기는 데 이곳은 먼지가 없었는지, 청소상태가 좋아서 그런지 알러지가 일어나지 않아서 좋았습니다. 아침식사가 매우 뛰어났습니다. 전체적으로 매우 만족!

title: Fantastic Hotel and Staff!
text:
We came to NYC for our 20th anniversary, and I did a ton of research on where to stay. Based on the the reviews here, I chose the Library Hotel. So glad I did! The concierge called me before we arrived and arranged our transportation from the hotel at our request (plus the return trip). You can see the pics of how they prepared our room for our arrival (along with a nice note)!  Very sweet!
The continental breakfast is great along with the staff who worked during breakfast. We didn’t get a chance to take advantage of the wine and cheese reception because we were always out. 
The beds were super comfortable, and the rooms are so nice. 
The location is awesome because it was 10-15 minutes to walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building...5-10 minutes to Bryant Park...Grand Central was right around the corner so easy to get anywhere by subway. 

All of the staff was phenomenal. I would definitely stay here again!!

title: Library or Casablanca…Same Recipe, Different Flavors
text:
Rather than simply reiterate Library’s well earned plaudits memorialized here, some thoughts instead on choosing between these two highly rated properties, peas from the same pod. As might be expected between two related siblings, the service, accommodations, amenities and intrinsic fit up quality are cast from the same mold. The rooms are smallish but with ample baths, well turned out, each in its own style, each offering comfortable common rooms providing Continental breakfast, snacks and non-alcoholic beverages 24/7, with wine and cheese each evening, all presented with well-oiled precision by equally accommodating hostesses.  Garages available at most attractive rates-Casablanca’s literally attached. No grand gathering lobbies, rather perfunctory and efficient, absent any glitter.

So, with costs generally the same, location and flavor perhaps the basis for a choice. On the one hand, Library in a less vibrant neighborhood, near to Grand Central Station, with seasonal attractions of the skating  rink and tree at Rockefeller Center, the lights of Fifth Avenue, along with shopping along Fifth and Madison, as well as the pot pourri of shops at Bryant Park, all within easy walking distance. In general, the scope and density of attractions close at hand a fair bit less here than five blocks to the West in the Casablanca neighborhood. 

At Casablanca, just around the corner from Times Square, a decidedly more vibrant neighborhood, with the bustling theater district with associated restaurants and multiple visitor venues all near at hand.
As to flavor, the chosen names pretty much say it all. 

Library decidedly almost institutional-a hotel theme perhaps not unexpected with location just steps away from the majestic New York Public Library- but sensual delight limited here by legions of neatly shelved books central to the décor. Rooms are solid and substantial, reflecting a quiet, simple modernity-although hallways somewhat dark and claustrophobic-arms outstretched almost reaching wall to wall-with stark industrial metal door frames punctuating the path. Common room continuing the theme-orderly tables lined up regimental style, with perimeter seating, all well done, but all presented with just a touch of monotony painting a picture-dare I say- bland. Room TV’s an afterthought-screens of many laptops larger. Complimentary computers in a typical chain hotel cubicle. 

Casablanca, within a similar shell, has hit upon a theme conjuring a faraway escape, setting the tone with an expansive Moroccan cityscape ascending the entry stairway wall, promising adventure just above. Rooms here benefit from a wide range of outfitting options to reinforce its theme. Wooden shades, rattan and other trappings with Northern African motifs, wood moldings reminiscent. Hallways with tigers standing guard, wall coverings and trim in style, common room with niche areas large and small, large screen TV’s, computer area tucked in, seating areas enveloped in the theme in multiple configurations- more living room than Library cafeteria /reading room rendition.

While both of these hotels have earned their ratings, there is always room for improvement. At Library, the coffee maker requested with our reservation was nowhere to be seen. While two robes were found, as usual, just one pair of slippers found. At Casablanca, there were some shower hardware issues and tile maintenance was not up to the standards highest ratings demand. A hint of wear around the edges.

All in all, irrespective of the inherent characteristics of bricks and mortar and location, each of these hotels offer a level of service likely to accommodate the most demanding traveler.

title: Great location and staff
text: My daughter and I stayed at The Library Hotel part of this past week. We both enjoyed our stay and the staff are what really makes this a charming hotel. Dominika and Billy both gave us great restaurant recommendations. Billy really took the time to find a restaurant for us in the theatre district by the theatre where Mean Girls was playing. He suggested Victors Cafe and it was very good. I really appreciated that he took the time to  find a place that suited us. All of the employees are super friendly and helpful. As others have said, the rooms are tiny but we were  in our room only to sleep. The bathrooms are bigger than many in NYC hotels so that was a bonus. We enjoyed the proximity to the subway and also the convenience of being able to walk to many places. It is a little bit quieter in this area so that you can actually sleep at night. The breakfast and the wine and cheese are a nice bonus that you don’t find in New York often. I did think the rooms are a little worn but they were very clean and housekeeping was very nice and kept our room clean. I called down for an iron and ironing board and they said it would be up in five minutes and it was! Some places would have taken 30 minutes for that to happen so great service. I would stay here again.

title: Unique hotel experience
text: Hotel staff re the most helpful and most positive we met in New York.  They are upbeat and thoroughly dedicated to ensuring you have an excellent stay.Staying at the Library entitles you to free books (real and online),all ady access to tea, coffee, cold drinks and snacks in the Reading Room, free delicious breakfast and wine and cheese and snacks 5-8pm each night. Each room is themed like a category in the library- ours, 804, was dramatic plays. We had a micro room which true to name is small but everything was scrupulously clean.  Position is SO good- so close to Grand Central station, walking distance to 30 rock and many other iconic NYC landmarks.There's a lovely restaurant next door- Madison and Vine, so convenient.  A stay at the library is not cheap but an amazing experience for a special occasion!

title: Sophisticated, boutiquey, leathery stay. Its in the name.
text: I like this hotel. A nice rooftop terrace. A good restaurant. Good drinks. Rooms are small but nice. Cozy, comfortable, and yet sophisticated. Like visiting a rich uncles library in his Manhattan brownstone. If you are looking for trendy swank, look elsewhere. If you are looking for a hip, classy, somewhat booky boutique hotel that will make you want to come back torelax with a 18 year old whiskey, this hotel's for you.

title: Return Visit
text: It is always a pleasure to be welcomed back to The Library Hotel.  Staff is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.  The rooms are well-appointed and we always enjoy Madison & Vine for a drink or dinner.  The second floor Reading Room is a wonderful amenity for a continental breakfast or light snack any time, day or night.

title: Problem with air conditioning
text: The treatment of the very friendly staff and the cleaning service very well. The location of the hotel.But....You can not have an air conditioner, so noisy, you have to turn it off to sleep.It is the second year that the same thing happens, and he had communicated it in the reserve.The previous year we had to request a room change for the noise, even annoying during the day.Surely next time we will look for a new option.

title: Perfect hotel for a New York stay
text:
As a teacher librarian this hotel had been on my wishlist for a while. We finally got to stay here and it was certainly worth the wait. All of the staff were really friendly and incredibly helpful. I felt like part of the family after staying here for a week.
The location was fantastic. I could see the NYPL from the hotel. I loved walking up Library Way each day and reading all of the plaques on the sidewalk. It was close to Grand Central Station and a short walk to everything we wanted to see. We loved it.
The breakfast each morning on level 2 was adequate and helped us start our day well. The drinks and cheese in the afternoons were a lovely treat and a great way to catch up with what the other guests were doing if you felt like talking.
Upstairs the writers den was a lovely place to end the day in front of the fire on the cold New York nights that we experienced.
The only downside was that the wifi was very slow and sometimes would drop out altogether in our room, however it was very strong in the reading room and wirters den areas. While somewhat frustrating it wasn't the end of the world and didn't ruin our stay.
It was certainly a treat to have drinks and snacks available all day and were quite welcome to warm up with after being out in the rain all day.
I loved the free books that were available at the front desk and the guys at the desk were kind enough to let me bring a few extra back to Australia for gifts.
I loved everything about this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

title: Like coming home.
text: Very pleasant and relaxed ambience, helpful and efficient staff. Particularly enjoyed the second floor lounge to wind down after a day on the go. Also the evening drinks and nibbles. Will be our first choice for our next NYC visit

title: Another good visit
text: I have stayed at The Library 5 times over the years and always enjoy it. I wrote a detailed reviewlast year and it still holds. Essentially, if you do not need a lot of space, the hotel's location is where you want to be, and the price is right for you, I think you will be well satisfied with your stay  - andprobably hard-pressed to find a better choice.In addition to what I said then, there is an additional reason to commend The Library - it does notcurrently charge a resort or destination fee. Many New York hotels, including a couple I like, nowhave these. They are controversial, maybe illegal, and hurt both the city, and the  hotel helpdependent on tips. For those unfamiliar with them, they are a bait and switch - like tactic that makes price comparisons harder; and they sometimes force the purchase of unwanted features. The Library's not having succumbed to their temptation is appreciated by this out of town loverof NYC.

title: Warm and Inviting
text: First visit to The Library hotel and our stay was wonderful. Everything from door greeting, front desk, complimentary breakfast and cocktails, and comfortable and clean room made us a fan. Will definitely stay here again.

title: comfortable accommodation in convenient location
text: This is an expensive hotel for me, and a treat worth every penny. The location is great, near the main NYPL, Union Station, and the Morgan. My friends were happy to meet me at the evening happy hour in the "library." Staff is wonderful. The room was lovely and comfortable. I hope to return.

title: Great Experience
text: The location was close to everything and the doormen were very helpful.  The breakfast room was a lovely place to hang out and the rooftop bar had an electric atmosphere.  My daughter and I loved the breakfast and evening wine & cheese.

title: Will definitely come back !
text: Lovely boutik hotel beautifully decorated with books  , very central in NYC , breakfast not impressive at first sight but pretty complete in fact , cheese and wine offered at the end of the day are very nice ! I booked a small room which was very well organised and comfortable.

title: Library Hotel NYC
text: The library Hotel is a lovely boutique hotel just a short walk from Grand Central Station.  It is a very cozy hotel with amenities that include a plentiful continental breakfast and evening wine and cheese gathering.  Each room is full of books based on the room number as it applies to the Dewey decimal system.  We have stayed there a few times and will continue to when we plan to be in Manhattan.

title: A peaceful haven
text: Small but very comfortable rooms. The staff is welcoming & responsive. Great restaurant on site and a roof top bar which has a great terrace in summer. I particularly appreciate the 24 hour tea,coffee and snacks available their “library”.

title: Excellent hotel, perfect location with perfect staff !
text: We have recently returned from a 5 night stay in The Library Hotel. We searched long and hard before choosing our New York City hotel. Many fantastic reviews helped us decide on the Library and we are SO very glad we did.The location on Madison Avenue is perfect, so central for absolutely everything. There are many things that make this hotel stand out, one of those being the staff. So friendly , helpful and welcoming. From the moment of check in right through until departure, they could not have been better. The concierges and reception staff, doormen and the lovely girls who were there at breakfast and during 'Happy Hour' (3 hours lol) were just lovely.Breakfast was provided free of charge and it was a perfect start to our day. Wonderful selection and the girls so willing to toast bagels etcCoffee is very good and is available 24/7....along with cookies and fresh fruit etcI do not know of any other hotel in NYC who provides as much as this Library Hotel Group doThe evening reception between 5pm - 8pm EVERY night is exceptional.   Cheese, crackers, crudités & dips and other snacks along with free flowing Prosecco, wines.... hard to beat.  Our bedroom was large, by NYC standards, kept spotlessly clean by the staff. It was very tasteful indeed and we immediately felt right at home from the minute we arrived. Fresh bottled water continually topped up twice a day. There was even a fridge in the room which would be wonderful in warmer weather. All in all this hotel is wonderful. Staff are a real asset, the complimentary tea/coffee and cookies and pastries are most welcome after a day spent out walking around. The hotel even provides take away cups so you can bring a coffee up to your bedroom. We would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again or any of the hotels in this group. We have previously stayed in the Lotte New York Palace, a 5* hotel close by and it doesn't compare to The Library in respect of staff and service.Many thanks to everyone for a wonderful holiday.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel in perfect midtown loccation!
text: The receptionist desk “librarians” are so friendly and gracious. They welcome friends and family to join you for their breakfast and wine and cheese afternoon reception. This is so lovely for meeting up with family or friends before going out on the town!

title: A Gem in Manhattan
text: I almost hesitate to write how much my husband and I loved our stay at the Library Hotel because we would love to keep it our secret.  I have to say, though, that it is a wonderful hotel and we will never stay anywhere else when we come to New York.  This is a beautiful, quiet, boutique hotel that is in a fantastic location - only a block away from Bryant Park and Grand Central.  The rooms are very well laid out and the bed was very comfortable.  There appear to be only six rooms on each floor, it is truly a boutique hotel.  The employees are friendly and very helpful.  They serve a continental breakfast in the library that is very good.  We also spent a very fun evening having cocktails by a fireplace in the rooftop bar.  There is nothing I would change about the Library Hotel, it is perfect!

title: Charming & Quiet
text: We were surprised how quiet and charming can be a spot in Midtown. The staff was very attentive and ready to help us even with some rather ridiculous requests. Very decent restaurant and nice bar on the rooftop, which can be used during the day as office place of sorts with excellent view.

title: Great Visit
text: Nice room, great service and responsiveness.  Front desk was helpful, informative about the area.  Concierge was helpful and energetic.  Convenient that the Madison & Vine restaurant is connected to the hotel. Good food and servicw.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: Convenient location and walkable to everything I wanted to do.  I prefer boutique hotels to big brand names and like the atmosphere of this hotel with the individualized rooms based on books. Service is top notch and the 2nd floor library room is a comfortable place for breakfast, the evening wine and cheese reception and anytime during the day to have a coffee, tea or snack.  Rooms aren’t large, but they are comfortable and include robe, slippers, bottled water, WiFi and in room safe.   It’s also nice that they knew I was a repeat guest even though it had been 4 or 5 years since I’ve stayed at the property.

title: Mid town gem
text:
We have just returned from a fabulous 10 night stay at this wonderful hotel ! This was our fourth stay and it was every bit as good as ever . Wonderful location, extremely attentive and friendly staff, and brilliant second floor reading room which doubles as a breakfast room , and also happy hour (in fact 3 hours) evening venue for generous cheese,nibbles and drinks .
We will be back - this hotel feels very much like a home away from home for us !!

title: Lovely boutique-y stay, understated excellence
text:
Having stayed at the sister Giraffe Hotel 2 years ago, we wanted to try another Library Collection hotel further towards Central Park. The location is perfect on Madison Avenue with the Empire State and Grand Central, Times Square, Rockefeller centre and 5th Avenue shopping all in easy walking distance.

Rooms are not huge but well appointed and the bed is enormous and so comfortable!

Breakfast in the Reading Room was lovely, a combination of pastries, fruit, hard boiled eggs and cereals with a great coffee machine.

All interactions with the staff were great, highly recommend this place.

title: fantastic
text: Excellent small hotel, not quite as good as casablanca but that is probably because it is bigger, room was small but perfectly formed, the breakfast, snacks and wine reception all excellent. Good location too, just round the corner from grand central station

title: 非常棒！会再来~
text: 非常喜欢这里的环境！太棒了~和家人一起来的，服务、环境那都是一级的~值得一提的是，服务员POR给我的服务也是五颗星，每次还没有走到附近，已经跑过来帮我们整理沙滩椅了~大爱！！

title: 2nd visit
text: This was the 2nd time my sister and I had stopped here, the 1st being 5 years ago when we were really impressed by everything about the Library Hotel, and this visit was no different.  We had a smaller room this time but it was fine, the shower was really good.  Every hotel should have a Reading Room it was lovely to just have a cup of tea and some cookies after a busy day.  The wine and cheese was very tasty in the early evening, and there is a good choice of DVDs if you just want to relax in your room.

title: Love
text: I love this unique hotel with its attentive service and attention to detail. Rooms are small but it's so lovely, I return again and again. For book lovers, each room has its theme. You can also borrow books from the lovely breakfast room --which serves complimentary breakfast, including great coffee and capuccinos-- and has a grand piano. Details that count.

title: Fantastic Stay
text:
This is an exceptional, well situated hotel. The staff are impeccable: polite, friendly, and always helpful without being too obtrusive; those on the front desk were knowledgeable about transportation and the sights. We were celebrating our tenth wedding anniversary, received a lovely card and bottle of Prosecco on arrival, and were made to feel very welcome.

The breakfasts were enjoyable and substantial, as were the cheese-and-wine evenings. These were both served in the congenial library on the second floor. Our room, albeit a junior suite, was spacious by New York standards and cleaned to a high standard. The whole concept of the hotel is fun and quirky.

I would not hesitate to recommend this delightful hotel.

title: Adorables
text: Endroit typique d'époque, propre, central. Personnel attentionné, disponible, ambiance paisible, restaurant au rez-de-chaussée possible appartenant à l'hôtel. Au 2ème possibilité de café thé encat toute la journée

title: This Hotel Is A Literary Gem
text: Perfect boutique hotel close to the NYC Public Library. Great central location for enjoying and exploring the city. We were seeing Wicked and The Library is close enough so you can walk to Broadway, but far enough from the lights and crowds of Times Square. Each room features a Literary Theme, as does each floor. Our room was wonderful, and quiet! The almost rooftop garden bar was the perfect place to cap the evening. Very creative cocktails. The staff, extraordinary! Pleasant, super nice. I almost want to erase this review as I want to keep The Library a secret!

title: Lovely Hotel In The Heart of Manhattan
text:
I recently stayed at the Library Hotel with my husband and really enjoyed this gem right in the heart of Manhattan!

One of the things we enjoyed the most was the 24/7 cookies, tea, and books in the Reading Room. Most hotels don’t really have a cozy room open to hang out in at all hours of the day/night, so this was such a great perk. During the cocktail hours at night and breakfast in the morning, we were also surprised to see what a wide range of snacks, food, and drinks they had. The wine was great, and the view of the historic NYPL library from our table made for a perfect experience.

 We were also able to check out the beautiful 14th floor with its sweeping rooftop views and garden terraces. We felt right at home, and unlike most rooftops or bars in NYC on a Saturday night, it wasn’t overly crowded or loud, so we were able to relax on a comfy couch by the cracking fire enjoying our wine as we chatted away. All the details were lovely, and I found myself thinking how beautiful the rooftop area must be for weddings or even bridal showers. 

As a complete bibliophile, I loved seeing the sheer amount of books covering almost every wall throughout the hotel, and I loved how our room had countless library books neatly organized in every nook and cranny. The room itself was very spacious (a rarity for other hotels in Manhattan which are notoriously tiny). Even though I went with my husband, I would definitely recommend it to friends and family and can’t wait to come back!

title: Great location hotel with plusses and minuses
text:
The Good
The Library Hotel on 41 St and Madison Ave is in a great location, with walking to Grand Central Station, NY Public Library, Central Park, Museum of Modern Art, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, many excellent restaurants, etc.  They have free wine and cheese and cookies every day from 5-8PM.  Also free cold breakfast with pastries, fruit, juice, coffee, tea, hard boiled eggs.  No meat.  This is held in a nice "hang out" room, with a piano that nobody plays.  There is also a bar in the 14th floor.  Everyone on the staff is friendly and helpful, but there is no professional concierge.

The not so good
The room we had was quite small, but adequate.  No large comfortable chair - no room for one.  The t.v. was small also, and cut off some of the sides of the picture. Annoying when watching football because it cut of info on down and yards to go.  Temperature control was difficult, but staff provided a heater.  The restaurant connected to the hotel does not seem to serve breakfast and the food they do serve is only adequate

title: Still wonderful in every way!
text: It was my pleasure to return to the Library Hotel and find that it really is as wonderful as I remembered! The staff is beyond helpful and friendly, and they seem genuinely glad to see their guests. Duke at the front desk is a rock star! The midtown location makes the hotel a great home base for most attractions. The evening reception and breakfast are just what you need to start the day or evening. The rooftop bar is a nice place to enjoy a drink. Drinks are pricey but no more than anywhere else in Manhattan. We had a deluxe king room which offered plenty of space for 2 people, and it was clean and comfortable. So - if you are considering a stay at the Library Hotel, just go ahead and book it! It really is that good!

title: Lovely return to the Library Hotel!
text: I returned to LH after a seven-year hiatus. During that time I've stayed in Nolita/Soho, but decided on a change for a visit to the city this past weekend. I stayed in a petite room (the Poetry room, my first choice!) and just as the other reviewers said, enjoyed the amenities and the convenient location. The weather was chilly, and I enjoyed getting a hot drink on the 2nd floor when I returned to the hotel in between appointments and visits with family. I arrived early for breakfast each morning and was impressed by the freshness and variety of the options. The espresso machine made incredible coffee, and the room itself was full of light, mellow music, and a respite from the busy-ness of the city outside. All in all, a wonderful visit, and I look forward to a return trip this spring.

title: Hard to be beat
text:
We decided to head to NYC for our 10th wedding anniversary. We took a chance & stayed in a hotel we hadn’t chosen before. It’s a little off the beaten path - not right in the middle of Times Square where some of the competing hotels were located (and where we usually stay). I thought this would be a problem but it wasn’t - it was PERFECT! Walking distance from Grand Central & an easy walk to Times Square. But since it’s set back, the side streets are quiet & the hotel is peaceful. The customer service is phenomenal. They had a special box of chocolates & a card to congratulate us & welcome us in. We did choose a few upgrades like the romance package but the coziest white noise head phones, down pillow topping for the bed & others amenities were at no additional charge.
The breakfast was wonderful - nice spread of fresh NY bagels, fruit, eggs etc. Cocktail hour included a nice wine selection, fruit & cheese. The beautiful outdoor rooftop bar with city views was a gorgeous & peaceful place to unwind. WiFi & business center with internet and printing all included and although no gym on site - a pass to the local gym was included.  The rooms were a decent size for this part of NY, comfortable & beautifully furnished. Our room was an Asian theme - but each room has a different theme & style which would allow every stay to have a different experience - that is a unique approach. 
Ultimately - it was hands down the nicest hotel I’ve stayed in for NYC (and we’ve visited the Top 5 trip advisor rated hotels at this point in addition to several other 5 star hotels - this one is #1 in our book). Not just the beauty, cleanliness & originality of the theme but the warmth and genuine kindness of the workers and the included amenities - for NY this is truly special and hard to beat. We will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: The front desk personnel and doormen were top notch. Friendly and helpful. For example, my wife and I were not having much success with getting a ride to airport. The doorman jumped in, ran down the street where he saw a person getting out of a cab and directed the cab to us.  This is just one example of their helpfulness and friendliness. We would definitely return when we visit NYC again.

title: LOVE this place!
text:
I have stayed all over the city, from the chain hotels, boutique hotels and ultra luxury hotels. The Library Hotel was a wonderful surprise! Cozy hotel with breakfast, 24 hour snacks like cappuccino with pastries and fruit as well as happy hour wine and cheese all included Roof top bar with lots of comfy seating as well as in front of the fireplace. Great location is just a short walk to Bryant Park and the main library as well as Grand Central and all the restaurants and shops in between. 
The staff was especially great to deal with in the booking process to the actual stay and every instance in between. The overall vibe was easy going and comfortable and it's easy to feel right at home! I can't wait to go back!

title: Good, not great
text: Second visit and the service was not as good this time. Good location but attention to detail in the rooms seemed a bit lacking. Missed some of the luxury feel from other hotels. Enjoyed the breakfast room and afternoon wine and snacks.

title: Perfect stay
text: I have been to NYC many times as I live in CT however I have never stayed overnight. I’m so glad wechose the Library Hotel. This was the best hotel I have ever stayed in and I’ve traveled many places. The service was wonderful and the decor was classic. Continental breakfast was very filling and the wine and cheese offerings in the afternoon was a welcome treat. If I ever decide to stay in NYC again it will most definitely be at the Library Hotel. Added bonus that it is a block from GCT!

title: We love this hotel
text: Our 4th trip to NYC and we stayed here everytime. Best hotel!! Great location! Minutes to grand central, Bryant park, subways to the city. Staff is so nice and welcoming. Andres was especially friendly, nice and accommodating. Breakfast, wine and cheese and all day water, tea pastries, fruit was wonderful to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. Beautiful property! complimentary umbrellas were very nice. Definitely will stay here next time, could not imagine staying anywhere else!!

title: A great central location!
text: From the time we walked in the front door we were meet by a very friendly door man, we enjoyed the wine/ snack bar on the second floor and to the roof top bar, the great restaurant and the very comfy and quiet room! We would recommend this hotel to anyone. Grand Central Terminal was a block away too!

title: An absolute delight!
text: We spent a week at the Library Hotel and haven’t a negative experience to report. The staff was helpful and friendly, the morning breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese reception was lovely. We will return!

title: Cozy and professional staff
text: Stayed in the love room for 7 nights. So cozy, quiet and clean! Perfect walking distance to NY public library, 5th ave and Times Square, etc. Everything exceeded expectations. Perfect hotel to stay while celebrating our 5th anniversary.

title: Don't overlook this little gem!
text: Again, The Library Hotel did not disappoint.  This is our 5th stay at this hotel and I cannot stop telling friends and family how wonderful it is.  The staff that makes you feel like special, from Duke and Billy at the front desk, to Winnie in the hospitality room, even the front door greeter makes you feel important and welcome.  The room is clean and modern in decor.  We especially like/appreciate in complimentary breakfast in the AM and the wine/hors d'oevres each evening from 5-8 pm.  And, the location is perfect, just a short walk to Grand Central Station, the NY Public Library and Bryant Park.  This hotel is a winner.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: Very attentive staff at this lovely boutique hotel.  Always willing to answer any question.  Complimentary breakfast and wine and cheese were very well done.  The queen room was a bit small but comfortable.  Great location for getting around on the Subway.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Worth the repeat visit!
text: My husband and I stayed at the Library Hotel again this November.  Of all the times we’ve been to NYC, this is the only time we’ve stayed in the same hotel again.  Elegant, unique, wonderful amenities and location is PERFECT for subway/bus transportation or a quick walk to Bryant Park.  You can book a cheaper hotel, but you won’t regret the money you spent on this fabulous hotel.

title: Best boutique hotel I have stayed in
text: The Library hotel in New York is perfectly situated close to shopping and theatres. Although the rooms are small, they are perfectly appointed and comfortable. The second floor library is large and comfortable and open for an expansive breakfast and afternoon cocktails, all included in the room rate. This will be my New York hotel from here on. Do give it a try.

title: Library Hotel visit - fall 2018
text: We had stayed at the Library once previously and had liked it very much. This time was the same. The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel was well-maintained. The room was comfortable. The only complaint I had, and it is minor, is that the room was a typical smallish Manhattan hotel room, and there was more furniture than was wise (i.e., a small table and two lounging chairs). The breakfast was good, as was the wine and cheese hour in the afternoon.

title: NYC getaway
text: My first time in NYC and I chose my accommodations well! The Library Hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan so it’s close to shopping and entertainment. My room was clean and comfortable with appealing decor. I was on the third floor but I did not hear traffic noise during the night and I am it a deep sleeper. p Unlike many other downtown hotels, The Library offered a free breakfast with a nice assortment of foods. The adjoining restaurant had a delicious menu as well. Most importantly the hospitality was first rate. The Library staff were cordial and attentive. I would absolutely stay here again!

title: Sleeping in a Library
text:
I am not sure how to review this hotel.  Maybe it just didn't suit my tastes, but after reading the reviews and paying a pretty high amount for the room, I was disappointed.

I travel a lot and think I have a pretty good feel for hotel standards in NYC (I also really appreciate a great hotel at any price range).  I stayed for two nights for business and was hoping for a nice boutique hotel experience in midtown.  I booked a larger room on the 12th floor (the highest floor with rooms - I think the 13th floor is a rooftop bar that I did not have time to visit).  There is not a lot of privacy in the room unless you close the window shades (the surrounding buildings are a lot taller and it felt like I was in the middle of an office complex conference room panopticon) and although I could see the actual library down the street from my room, I had to keep the shades closed at night. It's definitely not a view property.

There were a lot of positives: nice size room for NYC, great location, excellent service, awesome roomservice food from the restaurant on the first floor, and great coffee in the breakfast room (I didn't have time in the morning for a continental breakfast but it looked like a nice spread of fruits, juices and pastries).

That said, I was a disappointed with the place.  The hotel was not super clean (the carpets in the elevator were not vacuumed and the bathroom had lots of little corners that have been left to collect dirt and grime).  The decor is pretty worn and showing it's age, and the finishes - cabinetry, tiles, tub, taps, etc - are pretty utilitarian and somewhat banged up.  It's a 3-4 star hotel by global standards (4 star amenities, 3 star rooms), and it literally looks and feels as if you were to put a bed in the middle of an older (and not very charming) university library. That may be the appeal of the place, but to me it felt like the hotel just needs a facelift.

title: Some Things You'll Love About The Library Hotel
text: An incredibly comfortable and elegant hotel. So many great things but tops would be The Reading Room where the breakfast and happy hour happen. It's a second floor lounge with a piano, small tables, chairs and banquette seating. A nook with a fabulous coffee machine keeps everyone coming up for their favorite beverage-- there's a spigot for coffee, hot milk, espresso, decaf espresso and more! The complimentary continental breakfast includes pastries, scones, fresh fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs. The happy hour is available for three hours every evening.  There were interesting wines and always Prosecco. The Reading Room is open all day for coffee, tea,  cookies and a quiet place to read the books that are found throughout the hotel.  Also very accommodating was the small bistro and wine bar Madison and Vine connected to the Hotel. Although the King room was not large, it was well-designed with lovely dark wood built-in furniture and ample counters and drawers, plugs, mirrors and light. The linens were as would be expected in a fine hotel and the bath had good light and shelving..On each of our four days there, housekeeping had completed service by the time we returned in the afternoon. Also the turndown service was always done after we had left for the evening so it was very unobtrusive. The location around the corner from Grand Central was ideal for taking the subway all over town. For taxis and Uber we found that walking a few steps to Madison was better than waiting on Library Way. Finally, a real pleasure was returning after a fun night and having a night- cap at the Roof Top Bar on the 14th floor. The music can be  a little loud sometimes but there were several quieter rooms with seating and even the outdoor area weather permitting.

title: Books and a wonderful hotel
text: This is such a wonderful place down the street from the New York Public Library. This is  the place to stay for book lovers.  All of the staff was so helpful, professional and friendly. In the business center they have books where you can take or give and the food was delicious  and the reading room where the food is served has many books with wonderful view.

title: Acogedor y con clase
text: Hotel que mima al viajero, con detalles de cortesía difíciles de encontrar en NY. Un café a cualquier hora, un vino por las tardes, en un ambiente relajado y culto. Duke, en recepción, siempre dispuesto a ayudar y hacer la estancia más agradable (Thanks so much , Duke). Las habitaciones son pequeñas, como suele pasar en NY, y al estar en el centro, muy cerca de la Biblioteca, hay ruido del tráfico, a pesar de que los cerramientos son bastante buenos. Pero el hotel lo compensa con un estilo de atención en la mejor tradición de la hostelería de calidad.

title: Wonderful Cozy Hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed in the Library Hotel for four nights in October 2018 on vacation.  We had stayed there in 2011 and were not disappointed on our return.

All of the staff were very helpful regarding questions about getting around NY and made suggestions in addition to the plans we had made, and we saw so much in the four days we were there.  We stayed in a king size room which was a corner room, making it extra roomy and light.  The bathroom was light with all amenities.  We appreciated a tub/shower combination and took advantage of a relaxing soaking in the tub after a long day walking all over the city.

We took advantage of their second floor lounge with complimentary continental breakfast and evening wine and appetizers.  The lounge was open all day with tea and coffee, cookies, fruit, etc.  We like a coffee/tea service in our room, which was not part of the standard room amenities, but was available upon request, and we appreciated the separate coffee service and tea kettle, along with coffee and tea served on a large tray. The Library Hotel also offered a listing of additional amenities available upon request at no extra charge.  And WiFi was free.

We look forward to staying at The Library Hotel again the next time we plan a visit to NY City.

title: Peaceful Oasis
text: Well located, peaceful hotel.  Wish it had on-site fitness but love the ambiance--the rooms, the breakfast and the roof deck. I make a point of staying there as it "balances out" the intensity of NY for me.

title: New York mini vacay
text: The location of this hotel is excellent.  located right next to the New York Library and Grand Central Station.  The décor is lovely, think old time library with books everywhere.  Andres at the door was extremely welcoming and made us feel at home.  slight tweeking needs to be done on room plumbing, electrical outlets, etc.
