title: Location, amenities are great but it's the staff that takes it over the top
text: I stayed here twice in Sep/Oct, the Oct visit was for six days.The desk staff (shout out to Luis, Arman, Dominika and Duke) solved my booking goof swiftly and with courtesy. When I needed recommendations for restaurants in Howard Beach, NY they found a staff member who had lived there recently to give me his take on where to eat. The staff at the evening wine and cheese reception remembered my preferences after just one visit. Housekeeping staff went out of their way to get my room ready when I had to change rooms. Just a few examples of the professional and helpful attitude I encountered.   The only negative had to do with the 14th floor bar where the music was so loud that I didn't want to use it to entertain friends who were visiting me. It looked so pleasant (fireplace, comfy seating) but I couldn't hear myself think, let alone hear the friends I was with.

title: A NYC Gem
text: On our daughter's recommendation we booked the Library Hotel and upgraded to a corner room.  We loved this property!  The room was really lovely and the view directly up to the New York Public Library on 5th Ave was beautiful.  We found the location excellent as we walked everywhere we wanted to go.  The staff also recommended a lunch and a dinner restaurant and booked reservations for us.  We are readers so we loved the book theme and the books were everywhere!  The breakfast room was sunny and delightful and the included breakfast was very nice.  All in all it was a perfect stay and thanks so much to the great staff!

title: Great Boutique Hotel in Ideal Location
text: This is the second time we've stayed at the Library Hotel - and not the last. We like the Midtown location close to Grand Central Station and walking distance from the theatre district. The living room on the second floor is the heart of the property. Here we enjoyed breakfast daily and wine and cheese 5-8pm, as well as tea, coffee, and snacks throughout the day. (Fingers crossed that before our next visit a not-boxed granola is added to the breakfast buffet.)The staff is unusually personable and helpful.

title: A cozy nook in midtown Manhattan
text: I really enjoyed staying at the Library the last time I was in New York.  The room, though small, was extremely clean and comfortable.  I felt extremely comfortable in the Reading Room, just quietly settling in one evening with some reading - and the breakfast the next morning was good.  The staff was friendly and competent.  This will likely become my regular stop in NYC for my business trips.

title: Short break
text: Lovely hotel which v central. Concierges are superb and lounge area ver well staffed with very attentive staff. We didn’t use the rooftop bar but we also heard that was very good. Overall and lovely stay made all the more enjoyable by the Library Hotel stafff!!

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text: Great location for Rockerfeller Plaza, Empire State, Central library etc. Forty minute walk to The Met. Very stylish and comfortable place. The reception staff are excellent. Roof top terrace for cocktails and a lounge with free snacks and free wine and cheese. We booked a King size room - it was well appointed and a good size, with a view of Madison Avenue and Library Walk. Not likely we'll visit New York again, but if we did this would definitely be on our list of places to stay.

title: a great place to stay in new york city
text: hotel staff are so friendly and helpful-----hotel location is perfect to explore manhattan----- the library reading room is such a restful sanctuary after a busy day----- breakfast and happy hour in the library are something we all look forward to----the fourteenth floor cocktail bar has great ambience and an outside table in good weather is such a treat

title: Never disappoints
text: I just stayed again at The Library Hotel (I have taken to calling it my home away from  home) for the first time in 5-6 months. And the thing is: this hotel, its staff, its amenities, etc NEVER disappoints. The location, near Grand Central and Bryant Park, can't be beat for getting anywhere in the city; the 5th Ave and Madison Ave shopping is only steps away; yet the Library Hotel is quiet, calm, friendly, and very accommodating. The petit rooms are small but very comfortable and well appointed. And the "common room" is spacious, with coffee, tea, and snacks at all hours of the day and night.  The whole atmosphere is warm, friendly, and eager to help with anything you might need.

title: A jewel in Manhattan
text: We returned to this hotel for the third time, which shows that we like it. It’ s not too big and makes us feel at home. From the moment we arrived with our friends and were greeted so enthusiastically by Duke, we felt comfortable. Plus points are that everyone appears to be genuinely friendly, the inclusive breakfast, and the wine and cheese pre-dinner. Service at breakfast and drinks was excellent. Another plus was that Cristina got us a table at Peter Luger Steakhouse, which we hadn’t managed before. The bar on 14 was most enjoyable on the barmy evenings with temperatures over 20C. The only real negative is that even the better rooms (Queen) are still rather small. It’s not cheap but just about acceptable for Big Apple. Location is .

title: Wonderful Hotel in good location.
text:
Loved this hotel. Warm and friendly staff to greet you plus an excellent breakfast in a lovely room with books and the current day newspapers.
The pastries, fruit and tea / coffee available 24 hours was a bonus.
Wine, cheese, nuts and vegetable pieces were offered between 5 to 8 p.m was always a delight to return to after a big day out.
The restaurant on the premises has a varied menu and delicious food, A little noisy as it gets quite busy but worth a visit. Many other choices of eateries close by.
I would definitely stay at The Library Hotel again.

title: Get out of LA trip
text: The hotel was conveniently located. The staff was courteous and helpful. The bar tender on the roof top lounge was a great guy originally from Philly and made a special martini for me. Duke the concierge was informative, friendly with a cheerful sense of humor. The room was smaller than we expected but adequate. We were comfortable. Excellent housekeeping and turndown service. We will stay there again & highly recommend the Library. Overall top notch experience.

title: New York Gem
text: From the courtesy call before our visit to the helpful and professional way the staff dealt with our mishaps and shenanigans (all our fault!) at the end - we were beyond impressed! The room itself is spacious, welcoming and tastefully decorated. Drinks and bites available at all hours of the day. The location is central (sandwiched between grand central Terminal, Times Square and NY Public Library). But above all the staff are the best we’ve encountered. Always warm and engaging and willing to go the extra mile with a smile! Would highly recommend- don’t go anywhere else - stay at the library hotel !

title: Great place to stay in New York
text: Great location (41st on Madison). Very friendly staff. Great lounge on second floor for breakfast, tea or coffee throughout the day, a glass of wine with cheese in the evening or just to relax after a busy day.

title: Fantastic hotel with great people
text: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights recently and cannot find any fault with the hotel itself, the staff or the location. Just around the corner from Grand Central and a short walk from the public library and Fifth Avenue.  Nothing was too much trouble, and we loved the theme of the hotel - we stayed in the Paintings room on the Arts floor.  Cocktails and champagne on the rooftop bar, the happy hour in the Reading Room and complimentary breakfast all contributed to a fabulous holiday.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful stay near theater district
text: This was a second stay at the Library Hotel. Everyone is friendly and helpful. They called 2 days before the trip and welcomed me back. I had a single room which is quite small, but still has a full bathtub and shower. Turndown service every night complete with chocolate and the next day's weather. In addition there are some very nice restaurants in the area. The continental breakfast and the happy hour are included in their standard package. We were coming to see a couple of shows and the theaters were within 15 to 20 minutes walking time. It was a great stay.

title: Beautiful ambience for book lovers
text: The Library Hotel has a book motif.  The rooms are on the small side, but are perfectly comfortable and are a good deal for midtown Manhattan.  The bathroom was fantastic.  Everything was meticulously clean and the staff were very helpful.  Inside the room was utter peace.  No street noises reached us and the curtains allowed us to control the light.  Overall, this is a wonderful and classy hotel with a strikingly pleasing concept and execution.  Although they could not guarantee a room, I had suggested we would like a room in the Literature section of the hotel and there we were - in Classics, right next to the poetry room!  Very happy.

title: Outstanding
text: Stayed for a long weekend.  Made to feel at home as soon as we arrived - all the staff are friendly and ready to help with anything - the hotel has almost a family feel.  Complimentary wine and cheese in the evening from 5 until 8, coffee and cakes 24 hours a day and a really excellent continental breakfast compliment well furnished rooms with a surprising amount of space.  The book theme is great and used to great advantage.  Add an excellent location, one block from the Central Library, 5th Avenue, and Grand Central station and this really was a great find.  We most definitely want to go back.

title: Wonderful Hotel With Great Staff and Location
text: The Library Hotel is a wonderful hotel that delivers on every promise.  It's just a couple blocks away from Grand Central Station (we took the subway everywhere) and a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and broadway shows.  Our room, with a king-sized bed, was comfortable and well designed to make the best use of somewhat limited space (it is New York City, after all).  The continental breakfast was very good, particularly the fresh fruit salad and first-rate coffee machine, which produced lattes and cappuccinos on demand.  The wine and cheese happy hour (from 5 to 8 pm) was a very relaxing way to end a long day of sightseeing before we went out to dinner.  Most importantly, all of the staff were courteous, professional, friendly, and knowledgeable.  Of most help to us was Duke Perkins, the chief concierge.  Duke's enthusiasm for New York was contagious; he wanted to share with us all that NYC has to offer and made great recommendations to us based on our interests.  We are definitely returning soon to NYC and will stay at the Library Hotel.

title: Un séjour inoubliable à New York.
text: Nous avons choisi cet hôtel pour fêter 2 anniversaires dont celui de notre mariage. Cet hôtel face à la Library de New York et sur Madison Avenue a beaucoup de charme. La littérature est leur thème à tel point qu’ils se nomment « Librarians » et non hôteliers. Le personnel a été parfait pour que notre séjour soit inoubliable, ils ont atteint leur objectif. Nous avons boudé notre diner préféré pour avoir le plaisir du breakfast au 2e étage. Nous avions pris une suite avec canapé et non balcon, super. Le couchage merveilleux nous a bercés toute cette semaine. Un grand merci aux librarians : nous reviendrons.

title: Beautiful place
text: Magnifique hôtel.. on se croirait dans une vraie bibliothèque..Et que de belles prestations au quotidien.. service au top!Par ailleurs bien situé à côté de Grand station de central park et des principaux musées..

title: Been waiting for this
text: I had read about the Library Hotel years ago and it had been on my list to stay when in NYC. I just had a quick solo trip and finally booked a room. It was all I had hoped for. The library theme was consistent but not obnoxious. The second floor lounge was convenient and the staff was gracious.

title: My 50th birthday
text: This hotel is amazing in every way.Warm greeting lovely staff so accommodating its unreal and BOOKS!If you are a book lover like myself it's a must to stay here.Beautiful rooms pretty views rooftop bar wine while you are eating for your room to be readied.Lovley restaurant next door excellent location for walking. I bbn loved every minute!Cant wait to stay again!

title: I love this hotel
text: This is the second time I've stayed here and I know I will stay here again next time I visit New York. Small, friendly, comfortable, clean and perfectly located - what more can I say? The staff on reception and the door are especially kind and will always try to help you. Strongly recommended!

title: 20th anniversary trip
text: Loved loved loved this hotel. It was so quaint, yet fancy. Loved how comfortable the bed was! Stayed in room 401 (queen) and never heard another person. And the staff could not be friendlier! They go above and beyond. Each member I encountered:) The breakfast was Perfect to start the day, and the happy hour was just what was needed after long days of walking/sightseeing. Hope to come back one day soon!!!

title: Birthday trip
text:
I had booked us a room at The Library Hotel as a surprise birthday present for my wife, who happens to be a librarian. The hotel exceeded our already lofty expectations. For book lovers, librarians or people who simply want a high-class hotel experience, this is really worth it. From the warm greeting in the lobby, and a front desk with a faux card catalog set-up behind it, every staff member we encountered was helpful and friendly. We were able to check in a little early and they also gave us a discount on a room upgrade. (Later they even sent up a bottle of prosecco for our celebration.) 
Each room has a book theme. There are even free books in the lobby (publishers' advance copies)  and books in all rooms and elsewhere to borrow.
We appreciated the free breakfast and evening wine-and-cheese gathering on the second floor. That room is also open 24 hours a day and stocked with other snacks, a great place to duck in to relax and enjoy the comfy environs. There's also the rooftop "Bookmarks" bar that's worth checking out.
Appropriately, the hotel is just a couple blocks from the NY Public Library. It's also around the corner from Grand Central Station and an easy walk to the theater district. We wanted to treat ourselves to a special hotel, and the Library Hotel delivered in style. What can I say -- Book it.

title: Perfection
text:
We decided to stay at the Library Hotel to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. This was our first visit to New York so we booked this hotel for 4 nights in one of the petite rooms. The room was great and ideal for our stay. We enjoyed the breakfast with plenty of choice and the wine and cheese evening snacks were fantastic.
We had lovely bottle of prosecco  waiting for us when we arrived in our room, which was a really nice touch.
The staff on reception and around the hotel were very friendly and helpful in advising us where to visit and how to get there.
Overall I would highly recommend this Hotel for those staying in New York.
Thank you for a memorable trip and are planning visits to return in the near future.

title: A haven in New York
text: A fabulous hotel with excellent service. The included breakfast is an enjoyable start to the day. And the evening wine and buffet is a good start to the evening. A lovely peaceful haven to return to after a busy day in New York.

title: Excellent place to stay in the NYC!!
text: I really enjoyed my stay at The Library.  It was very chic, excellent service, convenient for shopping, restaurants and my job location. I highly recommend this hotel for couples and business stay. The service is always professional, hotel amenities is up to date, rooms are spacious and excellent toiletries if you need any.

title: Consistently the BEST!!!
text: As always, we are greeted with enthusiasm and warmth by every member of the staff.  They are generous with their time and information to make your stay perfect.   Our room is clean and de-feathered before our arrival.  No waiting!  The wine and cheese in the evening and the continental breakfast are delectable.  The chief concierge, Duke, is AMAZING!!

title: Recent trip to New York
text: If you want to feel like a valued customer; be greeted warmly; and discover charm and comfort in the heart of Midtown - this is the hotel for you!  Continental breakfast and cocktails in the evening included!

title: My hotel of choice while staying in NY
text: I have stayed at the Library Hotel many time. The rooms are alway comfortable and clean. The service is excellent with a smile. The library room is great, it's a quite place to work if you don't want to stay in your room. Breakfast and afternoon wine amenities are fantastic.  Check out the Library 14th floor roof deck.

title: Awesome NY Experience
text: Staying at the Library Hotel was one of the best decisions we’ve ever made. The location is perfect and the staff members were great! They went over and above what was expected of them. Simple breakfast and cocktails were a bonus. I’d highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a memorable NY experience.

title: Wonderful cozy hotel close to everything
text: Such a beautiful hotel and I loved the Bookmarks Lounge and evening wine & cheese. I am planning a trip back for my birthday. The location of The Library Hotel is so convenient however it is not loud in the room at night.

title: Great location and breakfast is provided too!
text:
Great rooftop bar popular with New Yorkers, this hotel is consistently good and they provide a great breakfast too! Which is unusual, in that most New York hotels do not provide breakfast.
Most rooms are themed and there is actually a room entitled "Pornography", Yes, really!

This hotel is very near Grand Central station, an absolute must to visit, it's an iconic building and you are sure to get some great photography.

title: Excellent
text: In central Manhattan, next to Central Station and the shops of 5th and Madison Ave and the Broadway theaters I can definitly recommend this small Boutique hotel. The rooms as usual in NYC are nit very large but there is nothing missing. the beds are really comfortable, you get a complementary breakfast in the morning and "Wine and Cheese" in the afternoon.   Remember these extras when you compare prices, so it's a good deal. If you want more, there is an excellant restaurant first floor. A very friendly young staff makes your stay unforgetable.

title: Outstanding service
text: We would like to particularly mention Billy and his co-worker at the desk on the night of 5th August (his name temporarily escapes me! Maybe Josh...). The hotel itself is lovely, in a great spot and we had everything we needed and more. However Billy and his colleague were friendly and professional, their attitude and care made a real difference to our stay. We hugely appreciated their friendliness and attention, I wished that they were my colleagues actually! Keep up the good work and stay classy, library hotel.

title: Eccellente
text:
L'albergo è molto bello, pulitissimo, con colazione inclusa, vicino a Briant Park e a due passi dalla Grand Central Station, con accesso alla Metro.
Sulla Madison Avenue, appena usciti dall'albergo, passano anche gli autobus per risalire Manhattan.
Il servizio è eccellente, la colazione è inclusa ed è ottima, le stanze sono ben curate e con ogni comfort.
C'è anche un roof-top bar.
Ho avuto qualche disguido causato dal mio agente di viaggio e il personale mi è venuto incontro supplendo a carenze altrui anche se non tenuti e senza esborsi, con un comportamento molto professionale.
Direi, in sintesi, perfetto.
Ovviamente non aspettatevi di dormire bene: a Midtown Manhattan di notte vi sono spessissimo lavori stradali ed è sempre rumoroso per cui la qualità del sonno dipende solo dal piano della camera, mai dall'albergo che avete scelto.

title: Great position and excellent service
text: Really centrally located. Friendly and professional staff. Good restaurant right there. Free wifi and beautiful breakfast were much appreciated.  The provision of free drinks and nibbles in the evening were completely unexpected and so wonderful.  The opportunity to mix with other travellers was unique.

title: Lots of love for the Library Hotel!
text:
e recently stayed 6 nights at the Library hotel and had a great experience.
The location is fantastic just a stones throw from Grand Central Station and the wonderful Bryant Park. It’s also a short walk to Broadway and there are plenty of shops and restaurants close by.
 
The room itself was lovely with a fabulously comfy bed. We slept very soundly each night.
As a book and library lover I  enjoyed the concept of having a theme around the Dewey decimal system. I had requested a specific room based on my interests and the team were able to fulfill that request. The room was filled with books and images on the topic which was a  really nice touch.
 
There was a complimentary breakfast each day in the Reading Room and cookies/coffee and tea available throughout the day.
Each evening there is a 3-hour complimentary wine and cheese reception which was wonderful. It was a good opportunity to meet fellow guests and we enjoyed popping in for a drink before heading off to dinner or the theatre in the evening.
 
On the top floor is a beautiful rooftop terrace which turns into the Bookmark lounge at night. They have a good selection of cocktails and we really enjoyed the atmosphere. The staff were always very friendly and attentive.
 
We also had a lunch at the hotel restaurant Madison & Vine. The menu was good and it seemed to be quite a buzzing place in the evenings.
 
All the staff we met at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful but I must make special mention of Duke who was always happy and enthusiastic and making suggestions of places for us to go and things to see. He would always take time to ask about our day and plans which made us feel special and well taken care of
 
I would definitely stay at the Library on future trips to New York and would have no qualms in recommending it to potential visitors.

title: Lovely stay!
text: The staff, hotel, and amenities were amazing. We truly enjoyed our stay! We had lots of good reading time, good food, and the room was cozy and very clean. The rooftop reading area was our favorite, it was such a little oasis!

title: Awesome boutique hotel
text:
I have stayed in New York at various hotels but any future trip I will be sure to stay here. The rooms are great, the staff are awesome and it is surprisingly quiet. The theme of being a library and books in each room based on the rooms theme just adds to the hotels character. Great rooftop bar as well.
I highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure.

title: Amazing stay!!!
text: I had the treat of my life staying at the Library hotel. I am a teacher and avid reader on a super limited budget. I decided to splurge for a night here for my summer vacation. Totally impressed and had a wonderful night! Staff was incredible. RoomSo comfy and location amazing.

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text: Great location, iconic building, wonderful staff,  perfect rooms with unique themes,  excellent breakfast and evening reception. Cozy adjoining restaurant and roof top bar that's constantly used for special events.  I won't stay anywhere else - unless they're sold out!

title: Wedding
text: We came to NYC for the first time and stayed at The Library Hotel to attend a wedding at this hotel. EverYone was great I mean everyone from the reps on the phone to the front door employee to the front desknto the cleaning employees.  They all made our first trip to NYC wonderful. What a great place for a wedding.  The breakfast was perfect too. The front door employee helped us flag taxis.  Conciage was wonderful.  We would stay there.  Again.  We stayed in the Petite and it was just right.

title: Vacanza a New York!!
text:
Io e mia moglie abbiamo soggiornato in questo Hotel dal 16 al 22 agosto.
Esperienza Top!! Albergo in posizione centrale, camera deluxe al 10’ piano bellissima e pulitissima, colazione buona, accoglienza e servizio ai massimi livelli.
Da consigliare vivamente!! Se ritorneremo a New York saremo di nuovo Vostri ospiti senza  dubbio!!! Thanks for the beautiful experience.... 
Hotel Library THE BEST!!!

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Cozy, perfect location, large bathroom with lush fittings, warm hospitality, great on site rooftop bar, and restaurant.Comfortable bed, blinds and shades to block light and sound for sleeping.Care in ownership was on display and obvious.

title: New York anniversary getaway made extra special
text: This was one of the best hotel stays we have ever had.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The rooms were comfortable, clean and well appointed.  Breakfast every morning was great and wine and cheese in the evening was an excellent start to the evening.  We enjoyed the rooftop patio during the day and for cocktails in the evening.  The staff was very helpful and made us feel like their guests from the minute we arrived.  The hotel is ideally located for an easy walk to many attractions.  We will certainly be back!  Many thanks for a special anniversary trip!

title: Friendly staff in an excellent location
text: Stayed for 6 nights and would recommend, rooms are small but clean and have everything you need.  Continental breakfast was included so no hot food but had a good enough range.  staff were all friendly and helpful.

title: Great Midtown location and tons of perks
text: Great location near theater district but not too close where it’s crazy busy.  Block to grand central and lots of cute coffee, healthy food options.  They offer day pass to near by gym and lots of great books!!!!

title: Fabulous service
text: Great service breakfast lovely and good location.  Staff were great and nothing was too much trouble. Helped us with a cancelled flight and supported with us booking next available flight.  Excellent service

title: Great concept hotel in fantastic location!
text: This is one of the most interesting hotels I have stayed in my extensive worldwide travels. The library concept is felt throughout the entire property. The room was small but very comfortable. The breakfast room/library were quite good with access to refreshments and finger foods, around the clock, which were included in the room rate. The location couldn't be more perfect with a short walk to Times Square and the surrounding areas. The service was impeccable and the beds, which are the most important to me, were comfortable. I was also surprised how peaceful and quiet it was in the rooms besides the inconsiderate guests who would slam their doors. The only recommendation for improvement would be to put some type of closing mechanisms on the doors that would prevent slamming doors. Kudos to this property for a job well done!

title: Very friendly unique hotel
text: Stayed here a number of times and never lets us down. The breakfast is adequate and the girls are very helpful. The fact that you can pop in anytime and help yourself to tea, coffee, and snacks is very welcome. The cheese and wine between 5pm and 8pm is a great way to mingle with other guests. There is a turndown service and a chocolate to welcome you back to your room. The hotel is very central, a few minutes from Grand Central Station and Bryant Park. The staff are friendly and welcoming. It is just off Madison Avenue so can be noisy, so suggest a high room. The rooms, like most in NY, are on the petite side so would suggest a deluxe room for more space.

title: Relaxing mid-week getaway
text: I must start with how comfortable the room was. It was hellishly hot this past week in NYC, and the air conditioning was top notch. Comfortable bed, adequate water pressure, and enough electric outlets all made room 1201 a perfect place to return to after trekking through Manhattan.  I had drinks at the rooftop bar, the blood orange cocktail was quite tasty. There was some construction noise, but I had no difficulty sleeping. I found the continental breakfast sufficient, I tend not to expect a feast when it is free. Cereal, fruit, bagels, and pastries provided plenty of options. It was lovely to walk one block from Grand Central rather than taking a cab or hauling luggage around the city. Great location, so many books, and a nice attention to detail on the part of the staff made for a great stay.

title: Great stay again but a few things need ironing out!
text:
This was my second stay at The Library Hotel and again it didn’t disappoint - up to a point. 
Pros: Excellent, friendly staff, only a few minutes walk from Grand Central Station, complimentary breakfast (although not large), nice cheese and wine hour or hours
Cons: My key card failed to work on half a dozen occasions which meant going back to the reception desk from the eighth floor to get a new card. I think it might have been a nice touch by the hotel to offer a complimentary drink in the bar. They didn’t. I also asked a couple of times for the hotel’s ‘sleep-phones’ as the noise from Madison Avenue (roadworks until midnight and again at 5.30 in the morning) was horrendous. The reception desk promised on two occasions to send these to our room but I had to remind them twice as nothing was sent to our room. 
We had cocktails in the bar but these were probably the worst we have ever had.
So, many positives about this lovely hotel but also a few tweaks need to be made to avoid over complacency.

title: A comfortable place to stay
text: We stayed at the Library hotel for about 8 nights. It felt very comfortable and clean. Very convenient being within walking distance of Grand Central Terminal and many other interesting places. The complimentary biscuits and hot chocolate was a great treat before heading to bed. It was a peaceful place to be even though it was Central New York.

title: Cosy, well situated hotel with excellent service
text: The location and service provided in this hotel were excellent. The staff were all very friendly, helpful and were genuinely interested in ensuring the guests enjoyed their stay. The complimentary buffet breakfast was very nice and the evening drinks were an unexpected bonus. Our room was very small but the hotel contacted us about this after we had booked so we knew that it would be very compact like many hotels in Europe so we were prepared for this. We would definitely stay at the hotel again and also recommend it to our friends.

title: Fabulous anniversary stay!!!!!
text: I do not even know where to begin!  This hotel is beyond what I could've ever expected.  My husband scheduled an anniversary getaway.  He ordered the book package.  When we arrived in our beautiful room, there was a stack of personally chosen books, a lovely personalized note and a complimentary bottle of wine for our anniversary! The staff sent my husband a list of vegan restaurants for us to try.  They gave us chocolates in our room along with a note about the following days weather.  We had breakfast and evening wine and snacks in their  beautiful reading room.  We had cocktails that night at the Bookmarks lounge on their rooftop.  This rooftop is a great place to sit and read during the day, as well.  Our trip showed us the peaceful side of NYC.  The staff at the hotel were professional and friendly.  There is nothing about this hotel that is not perfect.  We cannot wait to go back!

title: As Good As It Gets
text: While this is definitely an upscale boutique hotel, the very professional yet non-stuffy staff make it a pleasure to stay here. Glad to see that the "Librarians" still know how to keep it real. Celebrated my boyfriend's birthday here in March 2016 and made it back to celebrate my own in August 2018.  Happy to experience the same great junior suite (8th floor-MYSTERY), impeccable service, and plenty of included perks. While some hotels are reducing amenities, the Library Hotel Collection offers its guests MORE rather than LESS. While this hotel is always a great value in NYC, you can turn it into an exceptional value if you take advantage of their promotional offers throughout the year. The location is perfect - a very short walk from Grand Central Terminal even for a person like me with a very cranky knee. The included breakfast is more than satisfying, a three hour wine/cheese happy hour pleases everyone each evening, and use of their reading room 24/7 offers a welcome retreat whenever you need it. There's also a rooftop bar with a great view. We dined in one night and received fabulous room service from Madison & Vine in the hotel - the best shrimp cocktail you can imagine!! Absolutely loved staying at this hotel and will certainly return.

title: Exceeded expectation
text: Just one night at this splendid hotel.  Wonderful greeting when we arrived from the staff on front desk. We were early so our room wasn't ready, however, we were able to leave our bags and when we returned at 2 pm we went to our lovely room.  Very clean, comfortable bed with crisp white linen, spacious bathroom with good products.  Not an especially spacious bedroom, one armchair provided that restricted movement around the bed, a small issue. Good to have a window that opens, too.  Airconditioning over the bed was rather annoying.........bit cold on our heads, mind you, better than being suffocated by the heat.  Offering refreshments on the second floor is a nice touch as is the cheese and wine that we didn't get to sample! We enjoyed the breakfast. Would definitely book here again when in town. One more thing our room was very quiet, so rare in NYC, well done to all at this wonderful hotel!

title: Great Service, great hotel
text:
We've loved staying here at the Library hotel. The staff have been superb, so friendly and helpful at every stage on every day - from the welcome when we arrived to the time we left. 
It's clean, well maintained, and relaxing in the middle of Midtown - an ideal location allowing an easy walk to most sites or just 3mins to Grand Central.
The Continental breakfast is more than adequate, and the included cheese and wine presentation in the early evening is great. Having spent long days sightseeing, a glass or too afterwards often meant we didn't need to go out for a meal in the evening.

It would be out first choice of a place to stay the next time we visit New York.

title: Meet what I expected!
text: I booked Library Hotel NY for the last night stay in this time.I am so satisfied with everything from this Hotel. And every 'librarian' was kind enough to accommodate me with pleasure. I'm definitely sure, will come back to stay in Library Hotel very soon.

title: The Most Perfect Boutique Hotel in New York
text:
My partner 'discovered' this hotel for our four night stay in the City this August and it was perfect. From the mid-town Manhattan location, quiet yet central, the beautifully appointed, uniquely individual rooms, the little 'personal touches' like the welcome letter, the delicious complimentary breakfast and cheese and wine evenings, the charming roof terrace bar, to the shelves and shelves of books everywhere.
 Above all, the staff make this place special - and I mean ALL the staff - from the charming concierge team, efficient and friendly housekeepers and janitors, to the lovely lounge team who cheerfully organised breakfast, happy hours and general all-day grazing! They all made our holiday special.

title: Genuinely great customer service from a small, but perfectly formed, hotel...
text: I don’t find the need to write many reviews, if somewhere does the job or is, well, ‘average’, I often think I have little to say.  The Library Hotel is one of those rare establishments where your expectations are pleasantly exceeded. It isn’t the biggest hotel in town, neither does it have the most facilities; what it does have are brilliant staff who know how to go the extra mile to make your stay special. For example, the Concierge who made the effort to go upstairs to get us a complementary farewell drink on our day of departure or Christina on reception who managed our onward travel arrangements a week after we had departed (on two occasions).  These little touches complemented the engaged and polite staff we encountered throughout our three night stay. The hotel is in a fabulous location to walk the sights of NY and has a lovely communal lounge and roof terrace.  I would have. O hesitation to recommend staying there.

title: A "novel" retreat
text: A unpretentious retreat in midtown Manhattan, filled with books to choose from, and offering charming continental breakfasts and delightful cocktail times in a room resembling the reading room of a library.  A quiet place for a retreat but close to all the hoopla, theater and museums a tourist might want.

title: A wonderful place to stay -- close to everything but not too close
text: We love books, so when we saw there was a library-themed hotel near-ish to Broadway we jumped at it. The Library Hotel was even better than we hoped. The staff are very nice and thoughtful, from the front desk to housekeeping to the engineer who came to our room to replace a lightbulb. I let slip that it was our anniversary and they gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne. We were also allowed to pick out free pre-release copies of books to take home. Add that the hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and all the action nearby, but far enough away that you can take an easier walk around the hotel's neighborhood, and we would stay here again in a heartbeat. Oh, and the rooms are charming! Each has its own library of books around a theme, like literature, history, math, and so on.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: We usually stay at the Elyssee, sister hotel, but decided to try thiis properrty.  It was wonderful.  Book the ‘Mystery Room’ for a real treat.  Hotel appears to have been remodeled and is immaculate. Hotel personnel were so welcoming and helpful.  We had two adjoining rooms and couldn’t have been happier.  There is a terrific bar and outdoor patio/lounge on the 14th floor - be sure to check it out. The included breakfast is excellent and we all love the pre theater wine and appetizers, too.  Hoping to return next year.

title: Everything I’d hoped it would be!
text: Having heard about this hotel, I was eager to stay here.   We loved it - it is located near the theatres, shopping, the train stations - and the library!  We enjoyed the books in our room.  The concierge was extremely helpful with dinner reservations.  The rooftop bar was very popular but the lounge on the seconnd floor was especially lovely as we could get our hot cocoa or tea for reading at any time!

title: A gem in the heart of Manhattan
text: Beautiful boutique hotel with unique themed rooms filled with books to enjoy. A great continental breakfast, wine and cheese every evening and a fun 14th floor terrace and bar. My new favorite NYC Hotel. The employees were terrific as well.

title: Visit
text: Great stay.Breakfast v good.Also free afternoon coffee and pastries and evening wine and cheeses.Room was fine and on the larger size compared with other NY hotels.Good upper midtown location.Helpful staff directed us to some v fine restaurants.Coudnt be more helpful.Ambience - the library theme quite unique.Just one prob one of our room  phones went haywire and wasn’t fixed..

title: Great experience
text: Library Hotel is a very famous hotel in center of NYC. When I entered the room, I found it was small, but everything you needed was there and more books were placed according to the theme of each floor. In the room, i could see the bust street of NYC, but the noise of the traffic hardly penetrated through the wall, so I could sleep really well. The breakfast was located on the second floor. Buffet style. Simple but could fulfil my hunger. The service was great. Love it.

title: Favorite Little Place in NYC
text: This is by far my favorite place to venture to and stay and have a drink on the rooftop. The food isn't that wonderful, but the experience and drinks outweigh. The rooftop view is simply incredible, with twinkle lights and quiet places to sit and chat with friends.

title: Great boutique hotel - with a great library!
text:
Great location, small intimate boutique hotel, with themed rooms (well themed library - - most popular would seem to be the room filled with erotic books....)
Great roof top bar - allround a great find, and reasonable pricing compared to some of the big chains

title: Wonderful stay for our special birthdays. Perfect location. Superb hotel expereince.
text:
My daughter and I stayed at The Library Hotel for a week in July. We were in NYC to celebrate her 16th birthday and my approaching 50th birthday. 
We booked directly, and the hotel had a thoughtful card and chocolates as a gift for Olivia on our arrival. We loved our 'Music' Room on the 7th Floor, which is The Arts floor. Perfect for my daughter, who is a performing arts study, who loves musical theater and sings!
The room was big in NYC standards and beautifully decorated. We loved the books in the room to browse. Daily water bottle replentished and chocolates on turn down were great.
Daily breakfast is inlcuded in the room rate, and you can enjoy it in the Library.  There were plenty of options and the bagels were excellent! We don't eat a cooked breakfast, so the 'continental' spread of cereal, fruit, yoghurt, pastries, bagels and toast were ample for us. Along with juice, tea and coffee. Tea and cofee are available throughout the day too.
We had friends also staying at the hotel and on a number of afternoons we met up at 'wine and cheese' after our busy days out. Even though my daughter doesn't eat cheese, and is far too young for wone, she loved the afternoon ritual and meeting other people. She would take a book or journal down and reflect on the day, enjoying the social experience and snacks.
The staff were warm and friendly and very helpful. We are low maintenance, so dindn't need to interact often.
We loved the Roof Top bar and had New Yorkers meet us there for drink and they loved the venue too!
We also had dinner at Madison and Vine prior to the theatre one evening, and the food and service was very good.
On departure we both selected a book to take home which was a part of the special arrangement the hotel had with Simon and Schuster. Very generous and a lovely perk.
The Library Hotel is so located - Central Station, New York Library and Bryant Park are all within two blocks walk. You can also walk to Times Square in 15 minutes, or take the Shuttle direct from Grand Central. Being on the corner of Madison Ave & 41st Street, it feels like it is just one block away from the true 'hustle' of Midtown, which was lovely. 
We even found good coffee at Blue Bottle opposite Grand Central.
I was so delighted with our choice of The Library Hotel. It was perfect in every way. We will definately be back, and have already recommended it to friends.

title: Pre and post-cruise stay
text:
We recently stayed at the Library hotel both before and following a cruise to New England and Bermuda.  We have previously stayed at the Elysee, also in the Library Group, which was also excellent.  This boutique hotel has everything you would wish for, the staff are very helpful and friendly, and the hotel in both public areas and rooms is clean with tasteful decor.  As indicated by the name it has a Library theme and books are in abundance everywhere if you have time to read whilst on a visit to New York! We had a petite room which as expected was compact but perfectly adequate and  the standard of decor and cleanliness was high. So everything you hope for in a hotel but don't always get; however what makes this hotel stand out are the extras they provide.  Namely a complimentary breakfast of various cereals, juices, bagels, pastries, eggs, fresh fruit & yoghurt.  Coffee is available in the breakfast room all day as are pastries, fruit and biscuits.  Then each evening they serve cheese and wine with various nibbles.  These finishing touches really do make a difference and we enjoyed coming back to the hotel to relax with a coffee or wine between our explorations of New York. In addition there is a very fashionable roof bar full of ambience on a warm July evening however prices were expensive.

Situated close to Grand Central Station we found it the perfect location.  Having enjoyed fantastic food on our cruise, eating out wasn't our priority whilst in New York, however we ate at twice at Pershing Square which is just a few steps away and had enjoyable, if not cheap (but what is in New York?) meals.  We had a bit of a wait on one occasion and although we didn't make a fuss they insisted on free drinks and desserts as an apology.  We also ate at the restaurant attached to the hotel, The Madison and Vine and although we just had burgers and fries, these were good and service friendly if not the fastest but they were very busy. 

Overall I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a stay in New York.

title: Top Lage, sympathisch klein mitten in der Grossstadt
text: Freundliches bis sehr freundliches und hilfreiches Personal. Gutes Bett, für amerikanische Verhältnisse gute Qualität im Zimmer mit sämtlichen Installationen, Badezimmer etc. Rooftop Bar ist nicht gross aber sehr schön, kann gelegentlich sehr voll werden, da sie auch nicht Hotel-Gästen offen steht. Das ganze Hotel ist von seiner Grösse her sehr gemütlich und setzt sich sehr positiv von den grossen Hotel Ketten ab. Unser Zimmer war klein aber gut und gemütlich eingerichtet. Für die Lage des Hotels ist es ruhig. Die Betten sind gut. Die Lage ist sensationell. Hat fast ein bisschne "ruhige Insel" Charakter mitten in Manhatten.

title: Ballade en gyropode
text: Equipe très sympa et pro! Une première pour nous et après quelques minutes d'appréhension, le gyropode est très facile à utiliser. La ballade emprunte un chemin très sympa dans les rues puis sur le quais, ponctuée de quelques arrêts commentés. Le tout dans la bonne humeur. C'est vraiment une expérience sympa que nous referons ailleurs maintenant sans appréhension. Mention spéciale pour l'équipe gentille accueillante et à l'écoute. Continuez comme ça c'est super

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Amazing hotel to stay in. Staff were fantastic and the roof top bar is a hidden gem in the middle of New York.  I was in a petite room which was very spacious and although opposite the lift, you couldn't hear anything.  The breakfast was fantastic with plenty to choose from. The evening cheese and wine was a huge bonus if just needing a snack pre evening meal or filling up post large lunch. Staff helped me via email even before i arrived by arranging transport to and from the airport, which helped alleviate the stress post and pre flight. They also helped with information to get on the day tickets for Broadway show. The DVD and books were an added bonus when I wanted to just chill in my room after a long day. Wil definitely use this hotel for any future stay in New York.

title: The perfection
text: If you want the perfection do not hesitate to visit the hotel with the best services ever. The rooms were the best and the sleep quality waz our best experience. I would like to thank the front desk team who were very helpful and very professional.

title: Our Manhattan escape
text: We love the Library.  The rooms are comfortable, we love the Dewey Decimal System theme.  We also love the books, which are given away as pre-publications at the reception desk.  Staff are friendly and accommodating.  Madison & Vine is a fun bistro, conveniently located just next door.  And the prosecco reception and generous breakfasts are special touches.   Can't wait to escape back.  Susan U

title: Très bien
text:
Son emplacement est parfait à deux pas de Grand Central (Metro, gare ...), de Times Square et de la 5ème avenue ... Top ! 
Le wine and cheese est vraiment très agréable après une journée de visite et la salle est aussi toujours disponible le reste de la journée pour se servir café, thé, eau fraîche, biscuits et fruits. Un vrai plus ! 
Le petit déjeuner est très correct mais il y a très peu de salé (œufs dur et fromage Philadelphie seulement... dommage) 
Nous avons eu la chance de tomber sur une personne de l’hôtel qui était française et très sympathique ! Un plus quand on maîtrise mal la langue ...

Seul petit bémol la chambre un peu petite mais nous sommes à New York !

title: Very comfortable stay and excellent location
text:
stayed 1 week in junior suite - good size very comfortable and worth upgrade from King Size room 
simple but sufficient continental breakfast - good choice self-service
Great roof top bar
very helpful staff
liked use of sitting room with 24/7 tea coffee and cakes and biscuits

title: Excellent place
text: A beautiful hotel filled woth atmosphere. Book lovers have Edrn on earth. The staff is warm and very friendly. The rooms are a bit small but very comfortable. Everyday there is a happy hour of two hours 😉 of wine and cheese for free. And in a walking distance of many places (Times Square, the MoMa). I found my place in NYC

title: Great location
text:
Don’t think we could have chosen a better location for our hotel. Just around the corner from Central Station and good routes walking to most other locations when not using the the Metro. 
Small hotel with the added bonus of cheese and wine every night from 5-8pm. Bar located on the top floor with an outdoor terrace that was really nice to sit out in and relax.
Buffet style breakfast which meant for one week only healthy living. Service from all staff brilliant. 
Bedrooms not oversize but perfectly adequate. Nice surprise of a bottle of fizz to help celebrate my birthday and our 32nd wedding anniversary, nice touch.
If you are book person definitely worth a stay, although we did so much during our stay we never had time to take advantage of the books, the cheese and wine yes but the books, no. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did

title: A friendly and charming hotel
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Library Hotel last week to celebrate her birthday. We loved the friendly people and charming library book themed property. Our room w/ king bed and pull-out bed was plenty spacious enough for the two of us. Room was immaculate and beds comfortable. We were on a high floor overlooking Madison Avenue and as one would expect, there is street noise at all hours from sirens and horns. This did not bother me, but some may want to bring ear plugs. The hotel itself is very quiet. Simple but effective continental breakfast - which may be gathered and taken to the utterly gorgeous rooftop terrace! No one else was up there with us each morning and it is stunning!!! Also wine and cheese every afternoon for a few hours which was welcome during the busy days there. Easy access to public transport and the theater district. Would definitely stay again!

title: A night in a hotel for 52 years of marriage.
text: Everyone was extremely helpful and  friendly.  The personal note left in our room was so touching.  Breakfast was lovely and the books are such a nice treat.  The hotel was quiet and peaceful.  We could not have had a lovelier stay.

title: The Library Hotel, New York
text: An intimate and friendly boutique hotel, handily located in the centre of Manhattan. Rooms are well appointed and themed individually with books. A nice touch for any bibliophile. i will stay here again.

title: what i like most is staff
text: location is quite convenience. room is good and everything is at good standard but what exceptional is hotel staff.  they r so friendly and helpful and thier attitude is exceptional and i mean every single staff i made contact with

title: Wonderful stay
text: The library hotel is fantastic. Great room and facilities. Breakfast included along with a great drinks & snacks option each day. Great roof top bar. Excellent location. Highly recommended as an excellent base for NY.

title: Library Hotel - Picture Book Perfect
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at the Library Hotel last month. We had a great room looking up Madison Ave. The hotel is perfect for a NY stay, we were there for 7 days. We were close -walking distance - to most tourist sites, the subways and Central Station. We caught buses as well, not a problem.
Breakfast was very nice and the late afternoon drinks were a real pick me at the end of the day.
staff were very nice and helpful

title: NYC trip
text: Lovely hotel. We usually stay at the Giraffe, but it was booked. Staff was wonderful. Hotel is centrally located in Manhattan. The room was a bit on the small side but we enjoyed being on the upper floors. We definitely will be staying at the Library on our next NYC stay

title: Nice Hotel
text: Overall a very nice hotel with very helpful folks.  They would even help read a map, give suggestions on how to go, and even flag down a taxi for you if you needed one.  Very clean throughout the entire place.  Enjoyed the 14th floor bar area, but it was a bit stuffy.

title: JLF
text: A fabulous hotel in the perfect midtown location with the added benefit of a continental breakfast and happy hour. Loved all the books and the roof top bar is so charming. The staff was helpful and friendly, the rooms were clean and immaculate, and the service was excellent. We have stayed in many NYC hotels over the years but this will be our go to first choice hotel for all future trips.

title: Spectacular
text: I visited NYC with a friend for a mom’s getaway. The Library was the perfect hotel for us. Two blocks from Grand Central Station, it was very convenient to the subway, but also easy walking distance to so much. The rooms were comfortable and cozy and just perfect for a single traveler. We loved the breakfast each morning, coffee and snacks available all day, and the wine and cheese in the late afternoon. The rooftop bar was charming and lovely and we only wished we’d had more time to spend there. The hotel truly is for book lovers...one block from the N.Y. Public Library and Bryant Park, and filled with books everywhere you look. And finally, the staff. The staff was amazing! Friendly, attentive, thoughtful, interested...I could go on and on. I will definitely be back!

title: Great customer service and location
text:
I am a customer service champion and let me tell you...the customer service at this property to me is their greatest asset and to me that is paramount.  Never had one bad or even slightly bad experience from your arrival to exit the staff are extremely professional. 

The location is very very convenient as it pertains to walking or simply close proximity to several places of interest.

Seemingly very clean and sanitary.

The water pressure was good.very hot to very cold however you need it.

Bed was very comfy.

However the room did not have a fresh scent, somewhat musty at times I suggeat investmeny in scent techmology the commercial ones you place on the AC vents...since windows cant be open.

The rooms are not 100% sound proof from outside traffic i.e. vehicle horns etc. But I didnt here anything in my room from inside the hotel.

The hotel is limited in regards to no on site restaurant so no real room service and the rooms are very small. Yes its NYC and it seems to be the norm but for what you pay I feel like fixing those two things or even one of those two things would warrant a 5 star rating.  But as is its very good because the service and location were significantly good to me.

title: Excells
text: I agree with all the reviews, we just stayed in the live room and it is the one to get, that small balcony 11 floors up overlooking Madison with small flower boxes is beautiful. I’ve stayed in many New York hotels over the last 20 years and this is probably the most memorable. Thanks Billy.

title: Charming Hotel in a Fast Paced City
text: My adult daughter and I planned a celebration getaway to New York City and wanted to stay in a boutique hotel - The Library Hotel fit the bill!  Even before arriving, we heard from staff to see if we needed anything or had any questions.  They were extremely helpful.  The hotel is full of charm and character and has a “home away from home” feel.  The book theme is really well done - in no way kitschy.  The rooms are well appointed and clean.  The breakfast in the library is perfect and the opportunity to drop into the library and have refreshments throughout the day and wine and cheese in early evening is fantastic!  The rooftop lounge was a real treat.  The staff are courteous and friendly at all times and very helpful to guests - that includes everyone from housekeeping, desk clerks, door persons or serving staff.  The locations is great - as others have said but for us, the feeling of being in this little jewel in NYC was a bit of a respite after full, hurried days.  We highly recommend and we will always stay at here when we come to NYC.  Thank you to everyone at The Library Hotel for making our stay so special!

title: Like we never left
text: We have been staying at the Library for the past several years.  When we are not in NYC we rave about it and it definitely was just like we remembered.  It is in a fantastic location and the reading room that features breakfast is fantastic.  The wine and cheese hour in the evening, is great to experience.  We do not drink but they do have sodas that can be requested. We enjoy going up there and nibbling on the cheese and snacks, while catching a rest from the activities.  Something that we just discovered the last time we stayed at the hotel is the Advanced Readers Copies that are complimentary to guests.  I am about to start reading one of them and I can not wait.  Also the Madison and Vine restaurant is also very good and we have dated there several times.  Turn down service is another touch that is very appreciated.  You are left with two pieces of chocolates and also a weather forecast.  We will be back and when we do we will be staying here again.

title: Book Lover’s Paradise
text: I love the Library Hotel Collection and the namesake hotel did not disappoint.  It is a small, boutique hotel, conveniently located in midtown Manhattan near the NY Public Library with a libriary theme.  As with the other hotels in this group, it offers an evening wine and cheese reception and free continental breakfast in the 2nd floor lounge, where coffee, water and snacks are available 24/7.  The rooms are modern and well-appointed and each floor has a collection category and each room has a Dewey decimal number.  The room contains a variety of books bearing that Dewey decimal number - ours was communications, so there was a book on American Sign Langauge, a book about advertising and 2 bookshelves of others.  The room has a mini fridge and bottles of water are provided nightly,  The staff us extremely friendly band accomdating and, as a bonus, Simon & Schuster provides advance copies of not-yet-released books that are free for the taking.  Definitely worth a stay.  Note: on weekends, you must book at least 2 nights.

title: Amazing
text:
Worth the money. All the freebies are so lovely and means we could always relax in the morning and evening because of cheese and wine nights and free breakfast. The room was lovely - a little small but clean and perfect for us. 
The terrace on the roof and bar was a bonus nice to have a free coffee and maybe read a book. 
I will be recommending to anyone that goes to new york.

title: Excellent hotel
text: We loved our stay at the Library Hotel. Fantastic Hotel! The staff was helpful and friendly, and the room was cosy. The cheese & wine in the evenings and the breakfast in the mornings was great! And what a good place to start exploring The City:).

title: Wonderful hotel
text: My husband and I recently stayed here and we truly loved it!  The rooms are lovely and the staff is wonderful!  The best part was the free books!  There is a delightful wine and cheese reception every evening and the hotel is down the street from the NYC public library.  We will definitely recommend this hotel to others and be back ourselves!

title: Great Hotel
text: Stayed for 7 Nights in a petite room in July and loved every minute, The breakfast was great and the complimentary cheese and wine in the evening was a great way to relax after a busy day shopping and site seeing. Wouldn't stay anywhere else and hope to return soon.

title: Books, breakfast, and a great location
text: My partner and I make about two trips a year to NYC and used to stay at the Avalon. Since its untimely demise, we've been shopping around for a hotel in midtown and have finally found a home away from home at the Library Hotel. The book theme is more than a surface gimmick; the hotel uses it to organize the rooms by Dewey decimal number, and each room has the appropriate books for its number inside. We stayed in the "fine arts room," on the seventh floor. Though the bedroom was tight, especially with our two large suitcases, the appointments were all very nice, as was the bathroom. Further, the hotel features a large library (naturally) with a selection of books, complimentary coffee and tea in real cups (these little things matter) all day, pastries, and free breakfast in the morning. It also is attached to a restaurant, Madison and Vine,  which--bucking the trend of hotel/restaurant combinations-- had delicious food and drinks on the evening when we were too tired to wander far from home. In addition, the staff is friendly, the location is central to everything (and literally around the corner from Grand Central). We'll be back on our next trip.

title: My new favourite place to stay in NYC!!
text: Loved the Library Hotel!  The location (very walkable) was great and we enjoyed stopping in Bryant Park for coffee every day just to take in the beauty and character.  Our room was lovely and very clean.  The library theme was what caught my attention years ago, and I was grateful our dates lined up so we could finally check it out!  Yes, it is as great as all the reviews say it is!  Wonderful staff that go above and beyond to make your stay memorable (a shout out to our doorman, Stephen, who was just super and always ran down the road to find a cab for me - I’m disabled so this was a huge help. Thanks again, Stephen!), twenty-four hour tea, coffee and snacks available, and you’re surrounded by books if you can find some time for a break to read them!  I look forward to staying at the Library Hotel again the next time I’m in New York.

title: Charming hotel in a fabulous location
text: I had high expectations having read all the amazing reviews. I was not disappointed! We loved everything about the hotel. The location was perfect for us right next to Grand Central Station and a comfortable running distance from Central Park. The bed was particularly comfortable and we appreciated all the books surrounding us. The staff bent over backwards to make our stay perfect - we were able to request a coffee-maker and relaxing sleep mask to help fight off the jet-lag. They also have a large range of DVDs available to borrow. We loved the breakfast. It's simple (vegetarian) but high quality with a selection of pastries, cereals, breads, spreads, coffees, teas, juices and fruit. Our highlight was the evening wine and cheese reception - a great way to relax in a serene environment and enough delicious bites that we didn't need to dine. All-in-all a great experience.

title: Perfect Hotel for an NYC Visit!
text: We recently stayed for a week at the Library Hotel. Billy checked us in and was super friendly, welcoming and helpful! There was a thoughtful personalized note and chocolates in the room waiting for us! The room was very nice, neat and clean. Loved the comfy robes and slippers that were offered. During our stay, the A/C functioned wonderfully and was a welcomed relief in NYC in July! One of the reasons we chose this hotel was for the complimentary continental breakfast. We were so pleased that not only was there a generous breakfast selection, there was also snacks, veggies, cookies and pastries available during the day and wine, cheese, crackers and quite a few other things in the evening!  It was so helpful and much appreciated to be able to grab a bite right there at the hotel! (My only suggestion would be to offer a toaster and microwave for guests to use themselves at breakfast.) We found the location of this hotel to be absolutely perfect! A block from subway access at Grand Central station and walking distance to many attractions. Loved the proximity to the beautiful, historic library and beautiful Bryant Park too! We were also able to walk to Times Square and the New Amsterdam theater for a play! The hotel also has a beautiful rooftop bar and deck!  All of the staff we encountered from Billy at the front desk to the doormen, food service, engineering and housekeeping, everyone was friendly and professional. Cannot say enough great things about this hotel! Loved it and would definitely stay again!

title: Exquisite Stay and Service
text: My favorite hotel in NY. Service is excellent, the Reading Room is a magnificent bonus. Views of Madison Ave. are invigorating. Access to Manhattan is perfect. Surrounding stores and restaurants (including the wonderful Madison and Vine downstairs) will make this hotel the nucleus of your stay in New York City.

title: Consigliatissimo!
text:
Delizioso hotel in posizione ottima a Manhattan. Circa 15 minuti a piedi per raggiungere Times Square, vicino al Crysler Building, a pochi passi dalla biblioteca pubblica e da Bryant Park nonché ben servita dalla metro.
Le stanze sono molto curate e, ovviamente, piene di libri come anche il resto dell'hotel.
Colazione molto buona come anche l'aperitivo dalle 17 alle 20 totalmente gratuito per gli ospiti. 
È presente un bar al 14^ piano ed un ristorante al piano terra.
Impeccabile pulizia della camera. Davvero estremamente consigliato. 
Personale sempre cordiale e disponibile!

title: Tres bien
text: L hôtel est très bien situé près de Bryan Park à 15 minutes à pieds de l Empire state Building, à dix minutes de Time square et 5 minutes de Bryan Park et de grand central Station. Pour central Park compter une bonne demi heure mais en remontant la 5ieme avenue et ses magasins on ne voit pas le temps passer. Le métro est tout proche et on peut se rendre presque partout sans changer de ligne. L hôtel est très bien et le personnel est sympathique. La chambre est propre et le ménage impeccable. La nôtre était un peu petite.  Le petit déjeuner est très bien dans une salle très agréable. Pour les amateurs de charcuterie, de saucisses et bacon ils seront déçus. Il y a un restaurant en bas de l hôtel nous ne l avons pas essayé mais il est souvent plein et les mets semblent bons. Comme son nom l indique l hôtel est dédié aux livres et on peut en profiter à loisir. Voilà nous y avons passer.un très bon séjour.

title: There's something special about being welcomed by a book
text:
Usually when you book a hotel you don't expect to be welcomed by a book. But then the Library Hotel isn't your usual hotel. 

On this, my umpteenth visit, a novel prominently placed on a table in my room awaited my arrival, as if to say: "Of course there's a world of things to do in New York, but surely you can find time to put up your feet and enjoy a book? After all, this IS the Library Hotel, which is only a block away from the New York Public Library."

And that's indeed what I did, making time to read a book during my week-long sightseeing and working stay here - achieving the perfect life-leisure/literary-work balance.

As so many other reviewers have written, this hotel continues to combine the perfect mid-town location - central to everything you want to see and do in the city - with helpful, willing service plus all the amenities and more you could wish for in a home away from home.

Small wonder, then, that the Library Hotel continues to jostle its three sister hotels in New York City for the top TripAdvisor spot - the four of them taking as I write this four of the top five spots in the honours list with more than 20,000 guest reviews in total. 

Read my literary lips: The Library Hotel is definitely the place to "book" a room when you come to New York.

title: Reading Paradise
text: My wife and stayed at Library Hotel for the week of our 1st Anniversary. We entered the hotel and received the warmest and friendliest welcome from bellman Bastian. He directed us to the check-in counter were Duke greeted us as if we were his long lost family that he'd been missing for years. We can truly say that Bastian and Duke gave us the friendliest welcome we've ever received at a hotel. And we've stayed in a lot of them. Duke served as concierge as well. He gave us a city map and pointed out points of interest such as restaurants, entertainment, and transportation. He explained how to use the subway which can be intimidating to tourists but his directions were on point and we used the subway for most of our sightseeing. It is the most efficient and economical way to travel in New York.  Our room was small but most adequate. The bed was very comfortable. One of the highlights of the hotel is snacks are served on the second floor throughout the day so you can get coffee, fruit, and danishes. From 5-8PM, wine and cheese assortments are available. The continental breakfast served every morning is spectacular. The lounge staff is simply amazing. They poor your drinks, remove you used dishes, and they make sure food, drinks, and snacks are replenished. They all are very friendly and professional. As we were celebrating  our Anniversary, the hotel sent up a complimentary bottle of wine and a very nice greeting card congratulating us. Unfortunately, we are both non-drinkers. As we didn't want the wine to go to waste, I asked Bastian to return it to the front desk with thanks. Bastian, brought back an array of non-alcoholic drinks to accommodate us. He went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure our stay was amazing. He is such an engaging personality that we took to time to converse with him for awhile each time we met him while entering or leaving the hotel. Library Hotel is fortunate to have him on their staff. He is a rising star! Thanks Library Hotel for making our 1st Anniversary so amazing. If we ever return to NYC, there is no doubt were we will be staying.

title: Comfortable midtown hotel with great service
text: We had a great week-long stay at the Library hotel, and really appreciated all the free amenities - breakfast, all-day coffee and cookies/fruits, and the evening wine and cheese service. Also the room was nice, with a comfortable bed. However it was a bit noisy with the airconditioning and traffic outside, so had to wear earplugs for sleeping. All in all, would recommend this hotel!

title: Excellent location and service.....
text:
So nearly excellent. We stayed for three nights in a Junior Suite which overlooked Madison and the NY Library in the distance. It was spacious, comfortable and spotlessly clean. The bed was big and so comfortable with loads of pillows. The bathroom was a reasonable size with a bath/shower. My only criticism of the room was the noisy air conditioning which was abruptly loud when it kicked in, waking us up overnight. The road outside was fairly noisy as well but this is to be expected in the city. 
The second floor lounge with complimentary drinks and snacks all day was great, along with the happy (three) hours at 5pm. Our friends who were staying in another hotel were allowed to join us free or charge for this. Breakfast was light but served its purpose. 
The rooftop is delightful and relaxing. Service throughout the hotel was excellent.  Its location right by Bryant Park and Grand Central is perfect.

title: Fantastic Hotel with a real family friendly atmosphere
text: Fantastic hotel, perfectly located just round from Grand Central Terminal. The staff are so friendly and helpful, nothing is too much trouble, hence this being our second stay. Great facilities with added bonus of continental breakfast and afternoon cheese and wine. The Reading Room is open all day for a tea, coffee etc.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Perfect location (on Madison Ave, smack in between Grand Central and the NYC Public Library); Friendly, helpful staff; Lovely room with an absolutely perfect view of Madison Ave disappearing into the distance;  Breakfasts were very nice and the free evening cheese and wine 'soiree' was a much welcome feature of each day.  Also, we're both librarians, so the library theme was ideal for us.  Five stars - couldn't have been better.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: The Library Hotel really is a wonderful place. It is in a great location in Midtown Manhattan just round the corner from the central library and Bryant Park. The room was nice, clean and spacious and we  slept well. The provision of breakfast, day long coffee and early evening drinks was a real treat and we used it well! The staff were friendly and courteous. What's not to like!

title: Superb hotel with excellent amenities in great location!
text: We had a wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel conveniently located one block south of Grand Central Station. The staff was very helpful & accomodating, whether at the door, front desk, lounge, or rooftop bar. Our music room (the rooms are themed by the Dewey Decimal system) was quiet & comfortable.  Breakfast, evening wine, & all-day snacks are included, tasty, & generous. The view from the rooftop bar/patio is spectacular. And, although you can’t keep the books from the room, the front desk has free books to read & keep!

title: Excellent hotel
text: We had a very comfortable stay here. Hotel staff are very welcoming and helpful. The room (although quite small was very clean and well appointed. There is a lovely roof terrace and fantastic breakfast and tea served in the 2nd floor dining room

title: Marvelous gem of a hotel!
text: This charming hotel exceeded our expectations. We had the pull out couch and king sized bed and found the room very clean,comfortable and nicely furnished. Every floor has a theme as well as the rooms. Many books are available to read and at the front desk complimentary advanced copy books to keep. There is a nice breakfast every morning with light snacks and wine in the evening. Also a cash bar upstairs and a cute rooftop. We didn’t eat there, but there’s an attached restaurant downstair which seemed popular. The staff was friendly and helpful. Boshtin (not sure spelled correctly) went above and beyond to get us a taxi during rush hour. It is very close to the gorgeous NYC public library which I would also recommend their free tour. It was a great location for us and a wonderful stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Non-glitzy Graciousness
text: Comfortable, clean, well-located, friendly staff. If we had the money we'd never stay on a friend's blow-up bed again when visiting New York. Loved the rooftop lounge and breakfast/reading/coffee all day/wine in the afternoon room.

title: Awrsome place
text: Everything was just fantastic from the library oriented rooms, to the reading room to the great service. if you are a book oriented person and have to be in Manhattan this is the place to be.  Right down the block from the Manhattan main branch  can't be a better location

title: The Library Hotel—Our stay
text: Loved the old building and the location. Very convenient to our plans. Room was nice and bright. Great view up Madison Avenue. The roof top bar was a terrific way to end an evening. Great service. We loved the restaurant Madison and Vine. If management is listening I would turn the TV’s in the rooms to HD. Why they are still analog is a mystery to me when HD is now required viewing everywhere. The coffee in the second floor dining area was sub par. And, there was no Half and Half in a container. Why? Had to go to Starbucks. Overall, I would return.

title: Lots to love
text: We greatly enjoyed our stay here.  We had a junior suite for a group of three and it was very pleasant, comfortable and clean.  We even enjoyed the fact that the thermostat allowed us to run the fan continuously at low, medium or high.  This really made a difference for us, as it was a constant soothing sound to block out other sounds and help us sleep better.  We appreciated the breakfast provided and the availablity of water and snacks at all times.  The 3 hour afternoon appetizers and drinks were also nice.  And who isn't soothed by the presence of so many books?  The location is very convenient;  close to Grand Central Terminal, library, broadway shows...  The staff is friendly and we won't forget doorman Boshton (Sorry--I'm sure I'm spelling his name incorrectly!), who made an amazing, Herculean effort to secure a cab for us when we checked out during rush hour.   I would be pleased to stay here again.

title: Well located with excellent staff
text: This turned out to be the perfect place to stay. Mid-town so we felt well placed for everything we wanted to see. All of the staff were very helpful, which we really appreciated as first time visitors to the city. The complimentary early evening wine and cheese (and a good selection) and 24 hour snacks and hot drinks were really nice touches that we used every day!

title: Close to Everything
text: This is the third time we have stayed at the Library Hotel. It is a hidden gem when staying in NY.  Just around the corner from Grand Central Station. One block from Bryant Park and Within  walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Broadway.  But you will want to be back by 5pm to take a break and enjoy their happy hour with great appetizers of cheeses, fruits and wine. Breakfast is great also.  The rooms are unique with the Library theme.  We will be back.

title: Wonderful
text:
We’ve just returned from an 8 night stay at the Library. 

Not a big hotel, it’s relatively small but this is probably one of the reasons the service feels so personal, the other will be the absolutely excellent staff they employ; all friendly, all helpful. 

The room was comfortable, clean and modern and although not huge was fine and didn’t feel at all claustrophobic. The turn down service, chocolates and weather forecast were lovely thoughtful touches. 

The free breakfast and evening cheese and wine were great, if you wanted to save money on eating out you could probably pretty much survive on the food at the Library. (Truffle fries and cheesecake from room service were delicious). 

The location is perfect, with Grand Central around the corner and the delightful Bryant Park very close. 

We hope very much to come back to The Library and will be recommending it to everyone, thank you for helping make our stay in NYC so fabulous.

title: Great Basecamp for a Broadway Binge
text: This beautiful hotel is around the corner from Grand Central Station, which means you can take the Shuttle - the express train that runs between GCS and Times Square and takes 3 minutes tops (caution! it stops running at midnight.) We recently spent a week at the Library and we enjoyed our stay very much.
