To mention just a few of the reasons why: attractive and quiet room in tip-top shape and sparkling clean, excellent mattress on the bed with primo bed linens, decent shower with thoughtful touches in the bathroom like a stool to sit on and a magnifying mirror, cute bar on the rooftop with a lively crowd, prosecco and brie every afternoon as you gaze out the windows at Midtown Manhattan, friendly helpful staff ready to bring you a movie or hail you a cab or point you to a restaurant. We'll be back!

title: Fabulous Hotel, Great Location, Excellent ‘Extras’!
text:
Six of us stayed at the Library Hotel in June 2018.  We had three rooms, and all enjoyed the themes (ours was Mysteries) and related books in the rooms.  Our junior suites were well appointed, and the size was very comfortable.
The location was a big draw for us.  Located in Midtown, we were two short blocks away from Grand Central Station, a only a few blocks away from Rockefeller Plaza and shopping on Fifth Avenue.  We were even able to walk home from the theatre district one evening after a show.
What sets this hotel apart from all the others is not just the themed rooms, but all of the delightful ‘extras’.  A substantial Continental breakfast is included with the rate, and coffee and light refreshments are available throughout the day (also included).  In the late afternoon (3-6, 4-7 or 5-8), substantial snacks (vegetables, cheese, crackers, olives) and wine are available to guests, also included in the room rate.  They even give you a free book upon checkout!
The rooftop is a lovely retreat, and the staff is personable and helpful.
I highly recommend the Library Hotel if you a looking for a unique, well appointed hotel in Midtown!

title: Perfect Holiday in NYC
text:
The warmest of welcomes greeted us when arriving at the Library Hotel. We were offered cold refreshments on arrival, while a very friendly and helpful gentleman called Duke, checked us in and gave some great advice on what to do while we waited for our room (Didn't wait very long once we had ventured out - roughly 1hour).
All of the staff at the Library Hotel are very accommodating - especially the ladies on the breakfast shift over the last 5 days. 
Upon booking this hotel, we always like to check previous reviews and are pleased to say we were not disappointment! This building has so much character, a roof top bar (not inc. with hotel room), a wine and cheese hour (5pm-8pm) and over all a great atmosphere. It's in a perfect location to walk to NYC Library, Grand Central, 5th avenue and Time Square. Our room was cleaned daily, and in the evenings the maids would pop in and make the room comfortable - this included a little weather report note on the bedside table - the little things that make this place so perfect! 
We must give special thanks to Billy on reception. We went out for a lovely date night - dinner and a show - and he recommended an amazing steak place just 5mins walk from the hotel. We can honestly say it was one of THE best meals we have ever had - not just in NYC - Benjamins Steak House Prime. It made our evening that extra special  as he called ahead to book us in and made the restaurant aware of our evening plans. 
Once again we can't thank the staff enough for a warm welcome, brilliant knowledge and a truly lovely stay. I have no doubt we shall stay again in the future.

title: A Wonderful Treat
text: One of my all time favorites. Can't wait to go back!  The beautiful comfortable rooms, the breakfast/lounge room, the convenient location and the nice people that work there all make the experience extremely special.

title: Spot on!
text: We loved the understated and relaxed atmosphere in this small, very well located hotel.  The perfect place for a school librarian to spend an anniversary! We didn’t let the hotel know as there was no need - everyone was treated in a kind, calm, respectful way and having a glass of wine and cheese early evening was fabulous.  Just round the corner from Grand Central and easy to walk to Broadway, MoMA, Empire State, UN.  We ate in the restaurant, attached to the hotel on our last evening and enjoyed our meal there too.  I had wondered if the petite room might be too small but it was fine - I think that the bed size is similar to a UK double but it was incredibly comfortable and quiet.  One of those hotels you will hold in your memory.

title: Great NYC base
text: Excellent location, helpful polite staff and availability of tea/coffee, snacks all day a real bonus. Wine & Cheese available early evening a very welcome touch. Rooms small as expected in NYC but very clean and serviced everyday. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Outstanding Boutique Hotel
text: Great service and accommodations .  Excellent location in midtown.  Short walk to many places.  Enjoy a mid-day or early evening snack break and relaxation at the second floor lounge. Also, little known fact that pre-published book copies are available free at the front desk.
